post_body: Thinking about a SPN x Teen Wolf xover as I am wont to do like a Noah Stilinski is Dean Winchester type of thing. Claudia is basically Lisa Braeden and Stiles is Ben except he doesnâ€™t remember the changelings and Stiles is Deanâ€™s bio son. And I have no idea where to go with that idea in general and just started worldbuilding instead of coming up with a plot as I am also wont to do.   Anyway putting a rant about diff kind of Hunters and maybe class divisions under the cut  <!-- more --> So I imagine long established families like the Argents and maybe even the Campbells with more money and resources versus people like the Winchesters and the Harvelles and the type of Hunters you see more in Supernatural. Thereâ€™s definitely some resentment from the Hunters that are more motivated by revenge than the ones motivated by duty and familial obligation because it often comes with class differences. And when Gerard is recruiting Hunters he pulls more from the independent Hunters than Hunting Families offering more knowledge and money. But even the Argents have heard of the Winchesters.   Hunting Families are more likely to specialize or have one kind of monster theyâ€™re known to Hunt. But they are also more stationary and more willing to just kill whatever they find because they have larger repositories of knowledge. Independent Hunters might therefore hyper specialize since they are more mobile.   The Winchester brothers became rather infamous because of their willingness to fight demons. I mean early on in SPN season 1 Dean talks about how demons are out of their wheelhouse or whatever metaphor was used. Bobby sort of specializes in demons because his wife was possessed but I imagine most Hunters especially independent ones were either unwilling or unable to fight demons. Might also be true of Hunting Families they just donâ€™t want to because of high risks. Especially since for a long time default was exorcisig demons which meant they could come back and take revenge on the whole family. Although maybe that was the Campbellâ€™s specialization?? But like for most Hunting Families I imagine they did not usually fight demons. Maybe why Chris Argent was more unprepared for a Nogitsune.   During the apocalypse I imagine that Hunting Families mainly focused on protecting their immediate area probably focusing more on warding them out that killing demons and/or outright fighting them. Independent Hunters were more likely to fight demons and therefore those that survived had a lot more knowledge on demon tactics than the Hunting Families. For the first time they had the lever up on the info against Hunting Families.   This plus the apocalypse could also be what prompted Gerard Argent to 1.) have such extreme views that led to his extreme dehumanization of â€œmonstersâ€ 2.) start outsourcing to independent Hunters for help more who are also more likely to share these extreme views and not follow the Code.

Dean Winchester x Fem!reader  Summary: An avenging spirit is killing married couples so the Winchesters think itâ€™s a good idea to use you to pretend to be one and take down the ghost. But the act becomes all too real before you know it.  Words: 18k.  Warnings & Tags: mentions of murder death violence. so much teasing. a little of angst with happy ending. dean from the early seasons but soft and chaotic (a bit simp). sam being cupid and forgotten lol.english isnâ€™t my first language (sorry for my mistakes be kind please).    Note: Iâ€™ve always been a Dean girl and Iâ€™m so excited about this. I love the concept of â€œFrenemies to Loversâ€ with its more playful and cutie version from the earlier seasons I hope I described it well.  This is my second time ever writing here iâ€™m still new.  <!-- more --> You took another look in the mirror and walked a few laps around the dingy motel room trying to swallow the act. It seemed ironic to wear such a fancy dress and high heels in a place like this but it was all so you could solve the case and prevent more deaths. After all it was your job to catch the ghosts and put them to rest.  It had been a long time since youâ€™d been out on a date or worn anything other than your usual jeans and leather jacket. Buying yourself a cute dress and wedding rings with one of your fake cards had been entertaining the closest thing to a normal life youâ€™d had in years.  â€œCome in I need help with the zipper on my dress.â€ You said after hearing a couple of knocks on your door.  You were still standing in front of the bathroom mirror waiting for Sam to show up to help you so the two of you could leave soon for the restaurant where you both had reserved a table. The strange thing was that the cold hands you felt running down your back and zipping you up were not his but those of his older brother.  â€œWhat are you doing here? Where is Sam?â€ You turned around to look at Dean once your dress was closed. It was then that you noticed he was wearing a suit and the ring.  â€œIn the room.â€ He replied moving closer to you so he could look at himself in the mirror and adjusting his tie with difficulty he was not used to wearing one at all and felt suffocated.  â€œWhy are you dressed like that?â€ You asked him after looking him over from head to toe and inevitably biting your lower lip. He looked good all dressed up and dapper you could even smell the scent of cologne wafting off him.   â€œIâ€™ll be your husband for tonight.â€ Dean smiled at you.  You frowned when you heard that the younger Winchester would no longer be your fake husband because that was not what you had all agreed upon. Sam had always been more husband material and you trusted him enough to have some physical contact if necessary. On the other hand you saw Dean as someone who was far from the prototypical perfect partner and you could barely talk to him without arguing about your differences never having touched him except for sparring practice or taking away the gun he kept stealing from you. You couldnâ€™t deny that both brothers were attractive but they were almost equally far from meaning anything romantic to you.  â€œWe flipped a coin and I got the job.â€ He added to the explanation noticing the confusion on your face.  Finally you nodded realizing that once again they had not been able to reach an agreement and had had to put luck in the middle for the choice of roles. You didnâ€™t mind going with Dean you had already been on several hunts with him and trusted his skills but having to impersonate his wife was weird.  â€œCan youâ€¦?â€ He tried to ask you pointing at his tie and all the trouble it caused him.  You let out a small laugh at seeing him so confused over a simple tie and went over to him to take it off. You had to tie it all over again because of how badly he had done it before.  â€œThis looks very wife.â€ He commented as he saw the delicacy with which you were trying to fix his mess.  â€œI hope the spirit feels the same and is looking forward to slaughtering us.â€ You replied taking a step away from him as you finished.  You two said a quick goodbye to Sam and then hopped into the Impala which took you to a shiny restaurant near the road where the ghost appeared.  â€œDonâ€™t embarrass me please.â€ You said to him as soon as you both sat down at the table and placed your order.  â€œHow could I darling?â€ He smiled innocently at you and took your hand on the table caressing the ring on your finger.  You didnâ€™t say anything just smiled back and kept your thoughts to yourself. You couldnâ€™t believe he actually called you that sounding almost like a husband even though you knew it was because of the acting it gave you a funny feeling in your stomach. The most youâ€™d gotten from Dean Winchester in all the years youâ€™d known him was a â€œgood jobâ€ and a strange smile followed by a lot of questions about your careless decisions. You alone were far enough away from marriage let alone someone like him.  â€œYou look very handsome tonight.â€ You told him as you saw he was drinking water causing him to almost spit it out in surprise.  Usually you never complimented him barely looked him in the eye talked about anything other than hunting or even laughed at his jokes. It seemed that his presence didnâ€™t matter much to you because your interests were more aligned with Samâ€™s and you got along better with him. That bothered Dean a lot he hated being so invisible in your eyes.  Now however you didnâ€™t take your eyes off him and even gave him compliments that left him speechless to continue the performance.   â€œAt least the food is good.â€ You said absentmindedly as the waiter brought the plates.  â€œAnd the company?â€  You looked into his eyes trying to understand if he was playing with you or if he was really hurt by your lack of emotion. The strange thing was that you didnâ€™t know if it was one or the other his greenish gaze was a mystery.  â€œThe best company of course.â€ You gave him a smile and picked up your glass of wine to make a small toast.  â€œHow affectionate you are now.â€  â€œYes I feel almost as if today is the last day of my life.â€ You said with irony.   Dinner went off without a hitch in a quiet and strangely pleasant atmosphere. You couldnâ€™t help but be surprised by Deanâ€™s friendliness it was the first time you had a civilized conversation with him. The first time he held your hand and you noticed how green his eyes were.   Suddenly everything he said silly or not made you smile. The only rational thing to do was to attribute it to the glass of wine he had decided to drink. In general you didnâ€™t allow yourself to drink alcohol let alone in the middle of a hunt. But now for some reason you thought it would help your nerves and relax you a bit.  â€œWhere did you leave the car?â€ You asked once they left the site and the time to travel the road of death was approaching.   â€œIn the corner over thereâ€¦I hope.â€ He answered without really being sure. For him it had all happened so fast when you two arrived.  â€œMy feet hurt. Donâ€™t play with me now.â€ You said hating the high heels you were wearing.  At that moment the hunter stopped and motioned for you to sit on the bench by the exit. Unsure you obeyed and frowned as he knelt down to gently remove your shoes.  â€œHappy now?â€ He asked he asked holding your heels in his hands.  â€œI canâ€™t walk barefoot.â€ You claimed putting on a fake sad face and lowering your gaze to his arms.  Dean shook his head instantly.  â€œNo donâ€™t even think that Iâ€™ll carry you.â€ He warned confidently folding his arms.  A few minutes later he was silently leading you to the car snorting at every opportunity to give in so easily to your wishes.  â€œThis looks very husband.â€ You pointed out with a smile and a teasing tone.  â€œI would offer you to the spirit right now.â€ He replied looking at you with narrowed eyes.  â€œHow lovely you are my dear.â€  The two finally got into the car and headed for the exit. Dean had received a message from his brother telling him that he had found the name of the ghost woman and her grave with her husband who was the cause of all his resentment against happily married couples and to top it off he was buried on top of her.  â€œSam is going to burn the grave and everything will be fine.â€ He said trying to comfort you as he saw the concern on your face. â€œMaybe the woman doesnâ€™t want to kill anyone today.â€  â€œYou have too much faith in a murderous spirit.â€ You sighed and tried to remove the ring from your finger but it stuck. â€œAnd you should take the ring off.â€  â€œAre we getting divorced so soon?â€ He replied in a joking tone with his eyes on the road.  You looked at him seriously this was no time for jokes because everything was going wrong. If Sam didnâ€™t dig up those bones soon they were probably going to kill you both and the plan was going to fail completely. It was supposed to be easy and you were terrified that it wasnâ€™t anymore.  â€œCome on donâ€™t be like that. You were laughing so hard with me.â€ He smiled at you.  Before you could respond a pale woman in a blood-stained wedding dress appeared in the back seat. You could barely say Deanâ€™s name when the ghostâ€™s hand came around your neck and began to choke you. After a few moments you couldnâ€™t even breathe and everything became a blur.  You didnâ€™t want to die at least not at that moment. Not without having lived a life as good as the night before everything went to hell. You still had too many things to do to go like that let alone in front of him you couldnâ€™t let that happen.  â€œDonâ€™t move.â€ The hunter said to you before drawing his gun and disputing you to the back seat.  The ghost disappeared for a few seconds and then reappeared just ahead of the road. A braking maneuver as the woman was beginning to burn in front of the two of you almost made you jump out of your seat.   Sam had succeeded.  â€œAre you okay?â€ Dean asks looking at you with concern.  â€œYeah.â€ You said still trying to catch your breath and process everything that had happened.   â€œAnd my thanks for saving you and not letting death part us?â€  At any other time you would have simply made a sarcastic comment and emphasized that it was all thanks to her brother. However the recent experience had changed something in you and made you kiss his cheek.  Before you could completely pull your face away from his he put his hand on your cheek and pulled you close. You felt his lips move over yours and responded without hesitation. A big part of you had been thinking about this moment all night and was more than happy it was happening. It was like the perfect ending to a fake marriage date minus the killer ghost part and it made you smile in the middle of it.  â€œYou didnâ€™t flip any coin did you?â€ You asked as you broke away from the kiss for a second.  â€œNo I didnâ€™t.â€ He admitted leaving a kiss on your head and making you smile even more.

post_body: â€œIt was as if the hands continued on their own I was paralyzed. It was as if what I was doing to their bodies was tearing my soul apart I felt their pain folding over me so hard that I vomited.â€  Lachelle placed a hand on his knee while continuing to stare into the void so that he would not feel the pressure; in this they were very similar and she acted as she wished they had done to her. Dean was able to pull out much more than he thought he remembered reliving things he only dreamed about at night or saw as soon as he closed his eyes.  â€œThe fact that you dream about them is good if you think about it.â€ she told him when he stopped talking. â€œWe canâ€™t change the past but the fact that when youâ€™re awake that doesnâ€™t happen confirms that itâ€™s no longer part of your life that you can let it go. Kind of like when you have a panic attack I know Iâ€™m downplaying but itâ€™s to try to get into the conversation; you feel bad because you focus on the worst-case scenarios that invade your brain but all you have to do is resign yourself to the worst and come up with a plan to solve it even if you realize as you go along that itâ€™s not all as you had thought. Around us we have people who love us they are relatively well and life in one way or another is going on. Again we canâ€™t change what happened the only thing we can do is focus on the here and now and make a difference.â€  She did not know what more pertinent to say to him but he appreciated those words. post_body: im not seeing this from a completely unbiased point of view but i think an interesting thing about castiel is that up until his introduction any character near dean or sams age who made any sort of impact on the narrative was either a female love interest evil or both (usually both with the exception of gordon). every time i can think of that someone their age joined the team somehow it was a woman with whom they established some sort of romantic or sexual connection with (jo meg ruby bella basically every woman they come across in seasons 1-3â€¦) even if its subtext so its strange almost to see these interactions between dean and another man (appearing to be) his age. yet it doesnt seem entirely uncomfortable either.   dean speaks to and acts with castiel similarly to many of the women. ive seen a whole lot of mlm shows/stories where it feels as though one of the men was written to be a woman and they just changed the pronouns last second and i wouldnâ€™t say this feels the same butâ€¦â€¦i know if castiel was a woman the only difference in any part of their relationship is that theyâ€™d be making out sloppy style with sexually charged scenes of hands clasped together on the sheets. oh and also castiel would probably have died and stayed dead a million times over.   all im saying is the writers accidentally started them off with crazy gay subtext realized it too late and were too cowardly to make cas do a body switch into a woman so dean could get over internalized homophobia. in fact i refuse to believe cas wasnt ever considered as being some kind of love interest for dean at SOME point during his creation. the first time we see him hes giving puppy eyes and frowning about deans lack of faith and belief in himself. the second time we see him hes leaning back sexy against the kitchen counter and praising dean for his hunting skills. this is more than subtext the writers just scrapped the love story before it played out. i will hold eric kripke and robert singer in a strangle hold until they give me all the homoerotically charged content they scrapped. i hate men.

post_body: Thinking about a SPN x Teen Wolf xover as I am wont to do like a Noah Stilinski is Dean Winchester type of thing. Claudia is basically Lisa Braeden and Stiles is Ben except he doesnâ€™t remember the changelings and Stiles is Deanâ€™s bio son. And I have no idea where to go with that idea in general and just started worldbuilding instead of coming up with a plot as I am also wont to do.   Anyway putting a rant about diff kind of Hunters and maybe class divisions under the cut  <!-- more --> So I imagine long established families like the Argents and maybe even the Campbells with more money and resources versus people like the Winchesters and the Harvelles and the type of Hunters you see more in Supernatural. Thereâ€™s definitely some resentment from the Hunters that are more motivated by revenge than the ones motivated by duty and familial obligation because it often comes with class differences. And when Gerard is recruiting Hunters he pulls more from the independent Hunters than Hunting Families offering more knowledge and money. But even the Argents have heard of the Winchesters.   Hunting Families are more likely to specialize or have one kind of monster theyâ€™re known to Hunt. But they are also more stationary and more willing to just kill whatever they find because they have larger repositories of knowledge. Independent Hunters might therefore hyper specialize since they are more mobile.   The Winchester brothers became rather infamous because of their willingness to fight demons. I mean early on in SPN season 1 Dean talks about how demons are out of their wheelhouse or whatever metaphor was used. Bobby sort of specializes in demons because his wife was possessed but I imagine most Hunters especially independent ones were either unwilling or unable to fight demons. Might also be true of Hunting Families they just donâ€™t want to because of high risks. Especially since for a long time default was exorcisig demons which meant they could come back and take revenge on the whole family. Although maybe that was the Campbellâ€™s specialization?? But like for most Hunting Families I imagine they did not usually fight demons. Maybe why Chris Argent was more unprepared for a Nogitsune.   During the apocalypse I imagine that Hunting Families mainly focused on protecting their immediate area probably focusing more on warding them out that killing demons and/or outright fighting them. Independent Hunters were more likely to fight demons and therefore those that survived had a lot more knowledge on demon tactics than the Hunting Families. For the first time they had the lever up on the info against Hunting Families.   This plus the apocalypse could also be what prompted Gerard Argent to 1.) have such extreme views that led to his extreme dehumanization of â€œmonstersâ€ 2.) start outsourcing to independent Hunters for help more who are also more likely to share these extreme views and not follow the Code.

Dean Winchester x Fem!reader  Summary: An avenging spirit is killing married couples so the Winchesters think itâ€™s a good idea to use you to pretend to be one and take down the ghost. But the act becomes all too real before you know it.  Words: 18k.  Warnings & Tags: mentions of murder death violence. so much teasing. a little of angst with happy ending. dean from the early seasons but soft and chaotic (a bit simp). sam being cupid and forgotten lol.english isnâ€™t my first language (sorry for my mistakes be kind please).    Note: Iâ€™ve always been a Dean girl and Iâ€™m so excited about this. I love the concept of â€œFrenemies to Loversâ€ with its more playful and cutie version from the earlier seasons I hope I described it well.  This is my second time ever writing here iâ€™m still new.  <!-- more --> You took another look in the mirror and walked a few laps around the dingy motel room trying to swallow the act. It seemed ironic to wear such a fancy dress and high heels in a place like this but it was all so you could solve the case and prevent more deaths. After all it was your job to catch the ghosts and put them to rest.  It had been a long time since youâ€™d been out on a date or worn anything other than your usual jeans and leather jacket. Buying yourself a cute dress and wedding rings with one of your fake cards had been entertaining the closest thing to a normal life youâ€™d had in years.  â€œCome in I need help with the zipper on my dress.â€ You said after hearing a couple of knocks on your door.  You were still standing in front of the bathroom mirror waiting for Sam to show up to help you so the two of you could leave soon for the restaurant where you both had reserved a table. The strange thing was that the cold hands you felt running down your back and zipping you up were not his but those of his older brother.  â€œWhat are you doing here? Where is Sam?â€ You turned around to look at Dean once your dress was closed. It was then that you noticed he was wearing a suit and the ring.  â€œIn the room.â€ He replied moving closer to you so he could look at himself in the mirror and adjusting his tie with difficulty he was not used to wearing one at all and felt suffocated.  â€œWhy are you dressed like that?â€ You asked him after looking him over from head to toe and inevitably biting your lower lip. He looked good all dressed up and dapper you could even smell the scent of cologne wafting off him.   â€œIâ€™ll be your husband for tonight.â€ Dean smiled at you.  You frowned when you heard that the younger Winchester would no longer be your fake husband because that was not what you had all agreed upon. Sam had always been more husband material and you trusted him enough to have some physical contact if necessary. On the other hand you saw Dean as someone who was far from the prototypical perfect partner and you could barely talk to him without arguing about your differences never having touched him except for sparring practice or taking away the gun he kept stealing from you. You couldnâ€™t deny that both brothers were attractive but they were almost equally far from meaning anything romantic to you.  â€œWe flipped a coin and I got the job.â€ He added to the explanation noticing the confusion on your face.  Finally you nodded realizing that once again they had not been able to reach an agreement and had had to put luck in the middle for the choice of roles. You didnâ€™t mind going with Dean you had already been on several hunts with him and trusted his skills but having to impersonate his wife was weird.  â€œCan youâ€¦?â€ He tried to ask you pointing at his tie and all the trouble it caused him.  You let out a small laugh at seeing him so confused over a simple tie and went over to him to take it off. You had to tie it all over again because of how badly he had done it before.  â€œThis looks very wife.â€ He commented as he saw the delicacy with which you were trying to fix his mess.  â€œI hope the spirit feels the same and is looking forward to slaughtering us.â€ You replied taking a step away from him as you finished.  You two said a quick goodbye to Sam and then hopped into the Impala which took you to a shiny restaurant near the road where the ghost appeared.  â€œDonâ€™t embarrass me please.â€ You said to him as soon as you both sat down at the table and placed your order.  â€œHow could I darling?â€ He smiled innocently at you and took your hand on the table caressing the ring on your finger.  You didnâ€™t say anything just smiled back and kept your thoughts to yourself. You couldnâ€™t believe he actually called you that sounding almost like a husband even though you knew it was because of the acting it gave you a funny feeling in your stomach. The most youâ€™d gotten from Dean Winchester in all the years youâ€™d known him was a â€œgood jobâ€ and a strange smile followed by a lot of questions about your careless decisions. You alone were far enough away from marriage let alone someone like him.  â€œYou look very handsome tonight.â€ You told him as you saw he was drinking water causing him to almost spit it out in surprise.  Usually you never complimented him barely looked him in the eye talked about anything other than hunting or even laughed at his jokes. It seemed that his presence didnâ€™t matter much to you because your interests were more aligned with Samâ€™s and you got along better with him. That bothered Dean a lot he hated being so invisible in your eyes.  Now however you didnâ€™t take your eyes off him and even gave him compliments that left him speechless to continue the performance.   â€œAt least the food is good.â€ You said absentmindedly as the waiter brought the plates.  â€œAnd the company?â€  You looked into his eyes trying to understand if he was playing with you or if he was really hurt by your lack of emotion. The strange thing was that you didnâ€™t know if it was one or the other his greenish gaze was a mystery.  â€œThe best company of course.â€ You gave him a smile and picked up your glass of wine to make a small toast.  â€œHow affectionate you are now.â€  â€œYes I feel almost as if today is the last day of my life.â€ You said with irony.   Dinner went off without a hitch in a quiet and strangely pleasant atmosphere. You couldnâ€™t help but be surprised by Deanâ€™s friendliness it was the first time you had a civilized conversation with him. The first time he held your hand and you noticed how green his eyes were.   Suddenly everything he said silly or not made you smile. The only rational thing to do was to attribute it to the glass of wine he had decided to drink. In general you didnâ€™t allow yourself to drink alcohol let alone in the middle of a hunt. But now for some reason you thought it would help your nerves and relax you a bit.  â€œWhere did you leave the car?â€ You asked once they left the site and the time to travel the road of death was approaching.   â€œIn the corner over thereâ€¦I hope.â€ He answered without really being sure. For him it had all happened so fast when you two arrived.  â€œMy feet hurt. Donâ€™t play with me now.â€ You said hating the high heels you were wearing.  At that moment the hunter stopped and motioned for you to sit on the bench by the exit. Unsure you obeyed and frowned as he knelt down to gently remove your shoes.  â€œHappy now?â€ He asked he asked holding your heels in his hands.  â€œI canâ€™t walk barefoot.â€ You claimed putting on a fake sad face and lowering your gaze to his arms.  Dean shook his head instantly.  â€œNo donâ€™t even think that Iâ€™ll carry you.â€ He warned confidently folding his arms.  A few minutes later he was silently leading you to the car snorting at every opportunity to give in so easily to your wishes.  â€œThis looks very husband.â€ You pointed out with a smile and a teasing tone.  â€œI would offer you to the spirit right now.â€ He replied looking at you with narrowed eyes.  â€œHow lovely you are my dear.â€  The two finally got into the car and headed for the exit. Dean had received a message from his brother telling him that he had found the name of the ghost woman and her grave with her husband who was the cause of all his resentment against happily married couples and to top it off he was buried on top of her.  â€œSam is going to burn the grave and everything will be fine.â€ He said trying to comfort you as he saw the concern on your face. â€œMaybe the woman doesnâ€™t want to kill anyone today.â€  â€œYou have too much faith in a murderous spirit.â€ You sighed and tried to remove the ring from your finger but it stuck. â€œAnd you should take the ring off.â€  â€œAre we getting divorced so soon?â€ He replied in a joking tone with his eyes on the road.  You looked at him seriously this was no time for jokes because everything was going wrong. If Sam didnâ€™t dig up those bones soon they were probably going to kill you both and the plan was going to fail completely. It was supposed to be easy and you were terrified that it wasnâ€™t anymore.  â€œCome on donâ€™t be like that. You were laughing so hard with me.â€ He smiled at you.  Before you could respond a pale woman in a blood-stained wedding dress appeared in the back seat. You could barely say Deanâ€™s name when the ghostâ€™s hand came around your neck and began to choke you. After a few moments you couldnâ€™t even breathe and everything became a blur.  You didnâ€™t want to die at least not at that moment. Not without having lived a life as good as the night before everything went to hell. You still had too many things to do to go like that let alone in front of him you couldnâ€™t let that happen.  â€œDonâ€™t move.â€ The hunter said to you before drawing his gun and disputing you to the back seat.  The ghost disappeared for a few seconds and then reappeared just ahead of the road. A braking maneuver as the woman was beginning to burn in front of the two of you almost made you jump out of your seat.   Sam had succeeded.  â€œAre you okay?â€ Dean asks looking at you with concern.  â€œYeah.â€ You said still trying to catch your breath and process everything that had happened.   â€œAnd my thanks for saving you and not letting death part us?â€  At any other time you would have simply made a sarcastic comment and emphasized that it was all thanks to her brother. However the recent experience had changed something in you and made you kiss his cheek.  Before you could completely pull your face away from his he put his hand on your cheek and pulled you close. You felt his lips move over yours and responded without hesitation. A big part of you had been thinking about this moment all night and was more than happy it was happening. It was like the perfect ending to a fake marriage date minus the killer ghost part and it made you smile in the middle of it.  â€œYou didnâ€™t flip any coin did you?â€ You asked as you broke away from the kiss for a second.  â€œNo I didnâ€™t.â€ He admitted leaving a kiss on your head and making you smile even more.

post_body: â€œIt was as if the hands continued on their own I was paralyzed. It was as if what I was doing to their bodies was tearing my soul apart I felt their pain folding over me so hard that I vomited.â€  Lachelle placed a hand on his knee while continuing to stare into the void so that he would not feel the pressure; in this they were very similar and she acted as she wished they had done to her. Dean was able to pull out much more than he thought he remembered reliving things he only dreamed about at night or saw as soon as he closed his eyes.  â€œThe fact that you dream about them is good if you think about it.â€ she told him when he stopped talking. â€œWe canâ€™t change the past but the fact that when youâ€™re awake that doesnâ€™t happen confirms that itâ€™s no longer part of your life that you can let it go. Kind of like when you have a panic attack I know Iâ€™m downplaying but itâ€™s to try to get into the conversation; you feel bad because you focus on the worst-case scenarios that invade your brain but all you have to do is resign yourself to the worst and come up with a plan to solve it even if you realize as you go along that itâ€™s not all as you had thought. Around us we have people who love us they are relatively well and life in one way or another is going on. Again we canâ€™t change what happened the only thing we can do is focus on the here and now and make a difference.â€  She did not know what more pertinent to say to him but he appreciated those words. By the time I fully woke up whoever saved me was long gone. The only person I had left was some grumpy old dude who sat with me a few days and then had to leave town.â€  â€œWhat was his name?â€  â€œBobbyâ€ I started to answer but was rudely cut off.  â€œBobby? Bobby Singer was the volunteer?â€  â€œHow do you know his last name?â€  â€œHeâ€™s myâ€ Dean paused â€œheâ€™s like a father to me.â€  â€œSo you know where he lives?â€ I asked hopefully.  â€œYeah in fact can you help me get out of here? If you do Iâ€™ll take you to him.â€  Distrust began seeping back in and I asked â€œwhatâ€™s the thing Bobbyâ€™s known for?â€  Dean gaped at me for a moment â€œkilling demons and wearing trucker caps.â€  I just sat there thinking â€˜did this dude just say Bobby kills demons?!â€  â€œYes sweetheart you heard me right. Bobby Singer started as a demon hunter and now he hunts all manner of evil.â€  â€œOk so if demons and Rougarous are real what about like vampires and mermaids?â€  â€œIâ€™ve never seen a mermaid â€“ yet so donâ€™t rule that one out but yeah vamps are real so are werewolves shapeshifters anything thatâ€™s nasty and haunts the dark corners.â€  â€œBigfoot?â€  â€œNope heâ€™s not real.â€  â€œYou seem certain.â€  â€œTrust me sweetheart. I know a thing or two.â€  I wasnâ€™t sure what to think sure Bobby had been secretive and told me to protect my apartment â€“ a practice I still kept all these years later but was he really some monster hunting badass?  A doctor walked in to check Dean but as I stepped out of the room I heard him whisper â€œDean Winchester â€“ tearing you apart is going to make my damn day.â€  Somehow while they were struggling I had the wherewithal to grab Deanâ€™s boots and my bag and scoot out the door soon to be joined by Dean limping along by my side. We made it to a supply closet and Dean grabbed something and started drawing on the ceiling with it. He had me press my back against the far corner of the closet and somehow when the doctor stepped through the threshold he couldnâ€™t move.  Dean began chanting in Latin â€“ â€˜is that an exorcism?â€™ I wondered. â€˜I gotta remember this so I can write a book!â€™  Once the black cloud of smoke cleared the manâ€™s body Dean grabbed him pulled on his scrubs and we took off.  â€œTake me to your house so I can get my gear and get the eff outta here.â€  â€œI kinda donâ€™t want you at my houseâ€ I admitted.  â€œI donâ€™t wanna do that either but this is life and death so letâ€™s goâ€ he implored me. â€œI need my weapons from the trunk.â€  â€œFineâ€ I grumbled as we made our way to my car. â€œYou better not kill me. I have friends who will help prosecute you.â€  â€œIâ€™m trying to save you not kill youâ€ he assured.  As we rushed into the house he began barking orders â€œtell me where your laundry is and get your stuff packed. We gotta hide you for a few days.â€  â€œYou canâ€™t just march in my house and start bossing me around!â€  â€œThe hell I canâ€™t!â€ he barked as he began undressing â€œwe need to change clothes and get the heck out of here!â€  â€œWhat?! NO!â€  â€œYou can either do as youâ€™re told or I can make youâ€ he threatened.  â€œYouâ€™re turning out to be quite insufferable!â€ I shouted as I walked toward my room. â€œThe laundry is at the back of the kitchen.â€  Ten minutes later I met him in the kitchen with two bags â€“ one my backpack with my laptop and some work essentials and the other was a duffel of clothing Iâ€™d attempted to put a variety of things in the bag so I was prepared for everything â€“ Iâ€™d find out later that I wasnâ€™t ready for any of this.  â€œTwo bags?â€  â€œYeah I need my gear and some clothes. Gah youâ€™re such a manâ€ I rolled my eyes at his implication that I was bringing too much stuff.  â€œGood do you have a gun?â€  I huffed â€œdo I look like a girl with a gun? And furthermore you have plenty in that car of yours.â€  â€œSpeaking of my Baby where is she?â€  â€œBaby?â€ I giggled â€œok so the word baby meant the car and not a baby?â€  â€œI donâ€™t have a babyâ€ he assured â€œnow letâ€™s go before something bad happens.â€  â€œI wanna grab one thing â€“ in case we end up not coming back for a whileâ€ the last part of my sentence came out quieter because I was kind of hoping I didnâ€™t have to leave my home for good. I had a great thing going here â€“ yet there was this pull to follow this man no matter the cost so I grabbed my tiny photo album and stuffed it in my bag with my laptop.  â€œDo you have first aid stuff?â€ he asked and I realized his stitches on the side must have popped.  â€œIâ€™ll grab itâ€ as I came back with every possible first aid item I owned he asked a question that terrified me.  â€œDo you smell smoke?â€  We got out of the house and into the garage in time to see flames and smoke coming from the back of the house.  â€œGet in the car now!â€ he roared.  â€œYouâ€™re bleedingâ€ I attempted to argue.  â€œNow!â€  I all but dove into the car and we backed straight through the garage door before peeling down the street.  â€œYou broke my door!â€  â€œIâ€™ll buy you a new oneâ€ he chuckled darkly and I once again wondered why I had just followed this man so blindly.  â€œYou need your side patched up.â€  â€œIâ€™ll live.â€  I crossed my arms and pouted a bit but I couldnâ€™t stay mad at him â€“ a fact I was beginning to hate.  â€œWhere are we going?â€  â€œBobbyâ€™sâ€ he replied curtly.  Four hours later I was being shaken awake â€œIâ€™m hungry and we need fuel.â€  â€œYou need patched upâ€ I murmured.  â€œIt stopped bleeding but yeahâ€ he admitted â€œI do need bandaged up.â€  A few minutes later we pulled into a little clearing and Dean dragged himself from the car.  I scurried out my side to meet him at the trunk and clean his side up. We chatted as I checked the damage â€“ every brush of my fingertips against his skin sent lightening bolts through my body â€˜why was I reacting like this?â€™  â€œIt looks like two stitches are brokenâ€ I told him â€œI think we can keep the bleeding down with thisâ€ I pulled some liquid bandage out and painted a bit on the spot between the stitches making sure to keep it on his skin only and not to make contact with the stitches themselves.  He winced â€œI know that probably stings but youâ€™ll be better off.â€  â€œYeah yeah whatever just get it done.â€  â€œSo Bobbyâ€™s huh?â€ I asked as we made our way back onto the road.  â€œYep.â€  â€œWhere is that?â€  â€œSioux Fallsâ€ he answered.  â€œReally?â€  â€œYeah whereâ€™d you think he lived?â€  â€œNo clue. post_body: â€œIt was as if the hands continued on their own I was paralyzed. It was as if what I was doing to their bodies was tearing my soul apart I felt their pain folding over me so hard that I vomited.â€  Lachelle placed a hand on his knee while continuing to stare into the void so that he would not feel the pressure; in this they were very similar and she acted as she wished they had done to her. Dean was able to pull out much more than he thought he remembered reliving things he only dreamed about at night or saw as soon as he closed his eyes.  â€œThe fact that you dream about them is good if you think about it.â€ she told him when he stopped talking. â€œWe canâ€™t change the past but the fact that when youâ€™re awake that doesnâ€™t happen confirms that itâ€™s no longer part of your life that you can let it go. Kind of like when you have a panic attack I know Iâ€™m downplaying but itâ€™s to try to get into the conversation; you feel bad because you focus on the worst-case scenarios that invade your brain but all you have to do is resign yourself to the worst and come up with a plan to solve it even if you realize as you go along that itâ€™s not all as you had thought. Around us we have people who love us they are relatively well and life in one way or another is going on. Again we canâ€™t change what happened the only thing we can do is focus on the here and now and make a difference.â€  She did not know what more pertinent to say to him but he appreciated those words. post_body: â€œIt was as if the hands continued on their own I was paralyzed. It was as if what I was doing to their bodies was tearing my soul apart I felt their pain folding over me so hard that I vomited.â€  Lachelle placed a hand on his knee while continuing to stare into the void so that he would not feel the pressure; in this they were very similar and she acted as she wished they had done to her. Dean was able to pull out much more than he thought he remembered reliving things he only dreamed about at night or saw as soon as he closed his eyes.  â€œThe fact that you dream about them is good if you think about it.â€ she told him when he stopped talking. â€œWe canâ€™t change the past but the fact that when youâ€™re awake that doesnâ€™t happen confirms that itâ€™s no longer part of your life that you can let it go. Kind of like when you have a panic attack I know Iâ€™m downplaying but itâ€™s to try to get into the conversation; you feel bad because you focus on the worst-case scenarios that invade your brain but all you have to do is resign yourself to the worst and come up with a plan to solve it even if you realize as you go along that itâ€™s not all as you had thought. Around us we have people who love us they are relatively well and life in one way or another is going on. Again we canâ€™t change what happened the only thing we can do is focus on the here and now and make a difference.â€  She did not know what more pertinent to say to him but he appreciated those words. A very beautiful man found alone and dying in an abandoned warehouse. After being asked to sit with him and see if your presence causes him to wake or at least respond you do but that choice may change you in ways you could never have imagined.   Characters: Dean Winchester Sam Winchester Bobby Singer Marla (OFC) You/Reader  Warnings: hospital stay mentions of death both in the hospital setting and the readerâ€™s past show level violence/ gore angst fluff. Expect more/ new warnings as each chapter requires.   Chapter Warnings: reader learns that Bobby never told her the full truth demons try to smoke Dean and reader out of her house   A/N: this whole fic came from this one image  Word Count: 1337  Divider and Cover Image by me  Masterlist | Series Masterlist  â€œOnly way to stop a Rougarou is to light them on fire so either you or some hunter put him down?â€  â€œHow did you know that?â€  â€œI told you that was a monster and the man who saved you was probably a hunter maybe even the guy you said came and sat with you in the hospital.â€  â€œWell why didnâ€™t he tell me the truth then?â€  â€œHow old were you?â€  <!-- more --> â€œJust shy of my fifteenth birthdayâ€ I answered.  â€œHe might have been trying to save you from being permanently scarred.â€  â€œWhat was his name?â€  â€œNo clueâ€ I replied â€œI was in and out of consciousness for a couple days. By the time I fully woke up whoever saved me was long gone. The only person I had left was some grumpy old dude who sat with me a few days and then had to leave town.â€  â€œWhat was his name?â€  â€œBobbyâ€ I started to answer but was rudely cut off.  â€œBobby? Bobby Singer was the volunteer?â€  â€œHow do you know his last name?â€  â€œHeâ€™s myâ€ Dean paused â€œheâ€™s like a father to me.â€  â€œSo you know where he lives?â€ I asked hopefully.  â€œYeah in fact can you help me get out of here? If you do Iâ€™ll take you to him.â€  Distrust began seeping back in and I asked â€œwhatâ€™s the thing Bobbyâ€™s known for?â€  Dean gaped at me for a moment â€œkilling demons and wearing trucker caps.â€  I just sat there thinking â€˜did this dude just say Bobby kills demons?!â€  â€œYes sweetheart you heard me right. Bobby Singer started as a demon hunter and now he hunts all manner of evil.â€  â€œOk so if demons and Rougarous are real what about like vampires and mermaids?â€  â€œIâ€™ve never seen a mermaid â€“ yet so donâ€™t rule that one out but yeah vamps are real so are werewolves shapeshifters anything thatâ€™s nasty and haunts the dark corners.â€  â€œBigfoot?â€  â€œNope heâ€™s not real.â€  â€œYou seem certain.â€  â€œTrust me sweetheart. I know a thing or two.â€  I wasnâ€™t sure what to think sure Bobby had been secretive and told me to protect my apartment â€“ a practice I still kept all these years later but was he really some monster hunting badass?  A doctor walked in to check Dean but as I stepped out of the room I heard him whisper â€œDean Winchester â€“ tearing you apart is going to make my damn day.â€  Somehow while they were struggling I had the wherewithal to grab Deanâ€™s boots and my bag and scoot out the door soon to be joined by Dean limping along by my side. We made it to a supply closet and Dean grabbed something and started drawing on the ceiling with it. He had me press my back against the far corner of the closet and somehow when the doctor stepped through the threshold he couldnâ€™t move.  Dean began chanting in Latin â€“ â€˜is that an exorcism?â€™ I wondered. â€˜I gotta remember this so I can write a book!â€™  Once the black cloud of smoke cleared the manâ€™s body Dean grabbed him pulled on his scrubs and we took off.  â€œTake me to your house so I can get my gear and get the eff outta here.â€  â€œI kinda donâ€™t want you at my houseâ€ I admitted.  â€œI donâ€™t wanna do that either but this is life and death so letâ€™s goâ€ he implored me. â€œI need my weapons from the trunk.â€  â€œFineâ€ I grumbled as we made our way to my car. â€œYou better not kill me. I have friends who will help prosecute you.â€  â€œIâ€™m trying to save you not kill youâ€ he assured.  As we rushed into the house he began barking orders â€œtell me where your laundry is and get your stuff packed. We gotta hide you for a few days.â€  â€œYou canâ€™t just march in my house and start bossing me around!â€  â€œThe hell I canâ€™t!â€ he barked as he began undressing â€œwe need to change clothes and get the heck out of here!â€  â€œWhat?! NO!â€  â€œYou can either do as youâ€™re told or I can make youâ€ he threatened.  â€œYouâ€™re turning out to be quite insufferable!â€ I shouted as I walked toward my room. â€œThe laundry is at the back of the kitchen.â€  Ten minutes later I met him in the kitchen with two bags â€“ one my backpack with my laptop and some work essentials and the other was a duffel of clothing Iâ€™d attempted to put a variety of things in the bag so I was prepared for everything â€“ Iâ€™d find out later that I wasnâ€™t ready for any of this.  â€œTwo bags?â€  â€œYeah I need my gear and some clothes. Gah youâ€™re such a manâ€ I rolled my eyes at his implication that I was bringing too much stuff.  â€œGood do you have a gun?â€  I huffed â€œdo I look like a girl with a gun? And furthermore you have plenty in that car of yours.â€  â€œSpeaking of my Baby where is she?â€  â€œBaby?â€ I giggled â€œok so the word baby meant the car and not a baby?â€  â€œI donâ€™t have a babyâ€ he assured â€œnow letâ€™s go before something bad happens.â€  â€œI wanna grab one thing â€“ in case we end up not coming back for a whileâ€ the last part of my sentence came out quieter because I was kind of hoping I didnâ€™t have to leave my home for good. I had a great thing going here â€“ yet there was this pull to follow this man no matter the cost so I grabbed my tiny photo album and stuffed it in my bag with my laptop.  â€œDo you have first aid stuff?â€ he asked and I realized his stitches on the side must have popped.  â€œIâ€™ll grab itâ€ as I came back with every possible first aid item I owned he asked a question that terrified me.  â€œDo you smell smoke?â€  We got out of the house and into the garage in time to see flames and smoke coming from the back of the house.  â€œGet in the car now!â€ he roared.  â€œYouâ€™re bleedingâ€ I attempted to argue.  â€œNow!â€  I all but dove into the car and we backed straight through the garage door before peeling down the street.  â€œYou broke my door!â€  â€œIâ€™ll buy you a new oneâ€ he chuckled darkly and I once again wondered why I had just followed this man so blindly.  â€œYou need your side patched up.â€  â€œIâ€™ll live.â€  I crossed my arms and pouted a bit but I couldnâ€™t stay mad at him â€“ a fact I was beginning to hate.  â€œWhere are we going?â€  â€œBobbyâ€™sâ€ he replied curtly.  Four hours later I was being shaken awake â€œIâ€™m hungry and we need fuel.â€  â€œYou need patched upâ€ I murmured.  â€œIt stopped bleeding but yeahâ€ he admitted â€œI do need bandaged up.â€  A few minutes later we pulled into a little clearing and Dean dragged himself from the car.  I scurried out my side to meet him at the trunk and clean his side up. We chatted as I checked the damage â€“ every brush of my fingertips against his skin sent lightening bolts through my body â€˜why was I reacting like this?â€™  â€œIt looks like two stitches are brokenâ€ I told him â€œI think we can keep the bleeding down with thisâ€ I pulled some liquid bandage out and painted a bit on the spot between the stitches making sure to keep it on his skin only and not to make contact with the stitches themselves.  He winced â€œI know that probably stings but youâ€™ll be better off.â€  â€œYeah yeah whatever just get it done.â€  â€œSo Bobbyâ€™s huh?â€ I asked as we made our way back onto the road.  â€œYep.â€  â€œWhere is that?â€  â€œSioux Fallsâ€ he answered.  â€œReally?â€  â€œYeah whereâ€™d you think he lived?â€  â€œNo clue. I didnâ€™t think he actually had a homeâ€ I chuckled. â€œWe donâ€™t exactly do Sunday dinner but heâ€™s the one person I could rely on since I was 15â€ I explained â€œSo I keep his contact info in my phone.â€  SPN Fam:  @all-alone-he-turns-to-stone | @lyarr24    @dean-winchester-is-a-warrior | @nancymcl    @deans-baby-momma     @squirrelnotsam | @leigh70 | @impalaslytherin  @mishkatelwarriorgoddess | @deans-spinster-witch     @perpetualabsurdity | @bumbleb10 | @mrswhozeewhatsis | @123passwort     @roseblue373 | @jackles010378 | @hobby27  Mr. Green-eyes Tags:  @akshi8278 | @mrsjenniferwinchester | @k-slla | @jackles010378 | @jamerlynn     M.Late 20s. By the time I fully woke up whoever saved me was long gone. The only person I had left was some grumpy old dude who sat with me a few days and then had to leave town.â€  â€œWhat was his name?â€  â€œBobbyâ€ I started to answer but was rudely cut off.  â€œBobby? Bobby Singer was the volunteer?â€  â€œHow do you know his last name?â€  â€œHeâ€™s myâ€ Dean paused â€œheâ€™s like a father to me.â€  â€œSo you know where he lives?â€ I asked hopefully.  â€œYeah in fact can you help me get out of here? If you do Iâ€™ll take you to him.â€  Distrust began seeping back in and I asked â€œwhatâ€™s the thing Bobbyâ€™s known for?â€  Dean gaped at me for a moment â€œkilling demons and wearing trucker caps.â€  I just sat there thinking â€˜did this dude just say Bobby kills demons?!â€  â€œYes sweetheart you heard me right. Bobby Singer started as a demon hunter and now he hunts all manner of evil.â€  â€œOk so if demons and Rougarous are real what about like vampires and mermaids?â€  â€œIâ€™ve never seen a mermaid â€“ yet so donâ€™t rule that one out but yeah vamps are real so are werewolves shapeshifters anything thatâ€™s nasty and haunts the dark corners.â€  â€œBigfoot?â€  â€œNope heâ€™s not real.â€  â€œYou seem certain.â€  â€œTrust me sweetheart. I know a thing or two.â€  I wasnâ€™t sure what to think sure Bobby had been secretive and told me to protect my apartment â€“ a practice I still kept all these years later but was he really some monster hunting badass?  A doctor walked in to check Dean but as I stepped out of the room I heard him whisper â€œDean Winchester â€“ tearing you apart is going to make my damn day.â€  Somehow while they were struggling I had the wherewithal to grab Deanâ€™s boots and my bag and scoot out the door soon to be joined by Dean limping along by my side. We made it to a supply closet and Dean grabbed something and started drawing on the ceiling with it. He had me press my back against the far corner of the closet and somehow when the doctor stepped through the threshold he couldnâ€™t move.  Dean began chanting in Latin â€“ â€˜is that an exorcism?â€™ I wondered. â€˜I gotta remember this so I can write a book!â€™  Once the black cloud of smoke cleared the manâ€™s body Dean grabbed him pulled on his scrubs and we took off.  â€œTake me to your house so I can get my gear and get the eff outta here.â€  â€œI kinda donâ€™t want you at my houseâ€ I admitted.  â€œI donâ€™t wanna do that either but this is life and death so letâ€™s goâ€ he implored me. â€œI need my weapons from the trunk.â€  â€œFineâ€ I grumbled as we made our way to my car. â€œYou better not kill me. I have friends who will help prosecute you.â€  â€œIâ€™m trying to save you not kill youâ€ he assured.  As we rushed into the house he began barking orders â€œtell me where your laundry is and get your stuff packed. We gotta hide you for a few days.â€  â€œYou canâ€™t just march in my house and start bossing me around!â€  â€œThe hell I canâ€™t!â€ he barked as he began undressing â€œwe need to change clothes and get the heck out of here!â€  â€œWhat?! NO!â€  â€œYou can either do as youâ€™re told or I can make youâ€ he threatened.  â€œYouâ€™re turning out to be quite insufferable!â€ I shouted as I walked toward my room. â€œThe laundry is at the back of the kitchen.â€  Ten minutes later I met him in the kitchen with two bags â€“ one my backpack with my laptop and some work essentials and the other was a duffel of clothing Iâ€™d attempted to put a variety of things in the bag so I was prepared for everything â€“ Iâ€™d find out later that I wasnâ€™t ready for any of this.  â€œTwo bags?â€  â€œYeah I need my gear and some clothes. Gah youâ€™re such a manâ€ I rolled my eyes at his implication that I was bringing too much stuff.  â€œGood do you have a gun?â€  I huffed â€œdo I look like a girl with a gun? And furthermore you have plenty in that car of yours.â€  â€œSpeaking of my Baby where is she?â€  â€œBaby?â€ I giggled â€œok so the word baby meant the car and not a baby?â€  â€œI donâ€™t have a babyâ€ he assured â€œnow letâ€™s go before something bad happens.â€  â€œI wanna grab one thing â€“ in case we end up not coming back for a whileâ€ the last part of my sentence came out quieter because I was kind of hoping I didnâ€™t have to leave my home for good. I had a great thing going here â€“ yet there was this pull to follow this man no matter the cost so I grabbed my tiny photo album and stuffed it in my bag with my laptop.  â€œDo you have first aid stuff?â€ he asked and I realized his stitches on the side must have popped.  â€œIâ€™ll grab itâ€ as I came back with every possible first aid item I owned he asked a question that terrified me.  â€œDo you smell smoke?â€  We got out of the house and into the garage in time to see flames and smoke coming from the back of the house.  â€œGet in the car now!â€ he roared.  â€œYouâ€™re bleedingâ€ I attempted to argue.  â€œNow!â€  I all but dove into the car and we backed straight through the garage door before peeling down the street.  â€œYou broke my door!â€  â€œIâ€™ll buy you a new oneâ€ he chuckled darkly and I once again wondered why I had just followed this man so blindly.  â€œYou need your side patched up.â€  â€œIâ€™ll live.â€  I crossed my arms and pouted a bit but I couldnâ€™t stay mad at him â€“ a fact I was beginning to hate.  â€œWhere are we going?â€  â€œBobbyâ€™sâ€ he replied curtly.  Four hours later I was being shaken awake â€œIâ€™m hungry and we need fuel.â€  â€œYou need patched upâ€ I murmured.  â€œIt stopped bleeding but yeahâ€ he admitted â€œI do need bandaged up.â€  A few minutes later we pulled into a little clearing and Dean dragged himself from the car.  I scurried out my side to meet him at the trunk and clean his side up. We chatted as I checked the damage â€“ every brush of my fingertips against his skin sent lightening bolts through my body â€˜why was I reacting like this?â€™  â€œIt looks like two stitches are brokenâ€ I told him â€œI think we can keep the bleeding down with thisâ€ I pulled some liquid bandage out and painted a bit on the spot between the stitches making sure to keep it on his skin only and not to make contact with the stitches themselves.  He winced â€œI know that probably stings but youâ€™ll be better off.â€  â€œYeah yeah whatever just get it done.â€  â€œSo Bobbyâ€™s huh?â€ I asked as we made our way back onto the road.  â€œYep.â€  â€œWhere is that?â€  â€œSioux Fallsâ€ he answered.  â€œReally?â€  â€œYeah whereâ€™d you think he lived?â€  â€œNo clue. secondary_tags: ['spn2.09'  'spn2.13'  "i've been thinking about this since yesterday but i only just now got a chance to write it down"  "every time i look back at my episode notes i'm like yooooooo what the fuck is happening in this show"  'spn posting'  'spn2'  '.txt']
post_body: there are moments in both croatoan and houses of the holy i want to compare because i think the show is doing something kind of fascinating and fairly subtle.  the allegorical conflict in croatoan centers around whether dean will kill duane or not (and by extension whether dean will be willing to kill sam). in the end dean lets him live which is an act of devotion and deference to sam. duane ends up not being infected with the virus and so dean made the right decision. this is the general framing of the conflictâ€”dean unlocks the good end by deferring to samâ€™s judgment.  the ideological conflict in houses of the holy centers around the concept through fate taken through a christian lens: is god real? does god have a plan? sam is faithful and dean is faithless and their beliefs butt heads throughout the episode. in the end dean was right and the â€œangelâ€ was just a ghost and sam acquiesces to deanâ€™s beliefs and accepts god isnâ€™t real. this too is the general framing of the conflictâ€”sam arrives at truth by listening and believing in dean.  but both of these episodes end ambiguously.  as it turns out duane was possessed by a demon which means that deanâ€™s instinctual distrust was right on the money and killing (or attempting to kill) duane would actually have been the right choiceâ€”dean correctly assessed the danger and took steps to stop it and it was sam who got in the way and persuaded him to stand down which allowed the demon to escape.  and also as it turns out a bigass rebar killed that would-be killer sam was sent after and it was such an outrageous death that it throws dean off balance and makes him reconsider whether fate and god are actually realâ€”which as we come to discover later is true and sam and dean are cosmically destined to assume the roles of cain and abel in the coming apocalypse. sam was actually the correct one here and the beliefs he was operating under were given ample support literally throughout the episode; it was dean who clouded samâ€™s judgment and directed him away from the actual truth of the divine plan for them.  i donâ€™t think thereâ€™s a grand revelation in comparing these two episodes this way but i do enjoy how the show keeps them spinning on an axis and how the seemingly correct decision is actually much more nuanced than it seems on the surface. when dean is right heâ€™s still wrong; when sam is wrong heâ€™s still rightâ€”and vice versa. black and white answers simply canâ€™t exist in this world because there is nothing wholly good and nothing wholly bad. dean had to let duane live because to do otherwise would be to succumb to his fate even if letting duane symbolizes that dean will allow sam to succumb to his. sam had to defer to deanâ€™s ideology because to do otherwise would be to spiral further down the path to his destiny even if that destiny is real and itâ€™s coming for them both anyway and they can do nothing to stop it. theyâ€™re the best decisions they can make in those situations but theyâ€™re still not unambiguously perfect.  itâ€™s just another layer to the complexity of these seasons and the plot theyâ€™ve been born into. right is wrong and wrong is right and family trumps fate but family will lead to ruin. and the gods are absent fathers pulling strings they donâ€™t even know are there.

post_body: Im on s8 of supernatural and im so surprised that im still enjoying the show so much. Genuinly thought id start hating it after s5 but nope!   Yeah sure the story ending at s5 wud have made so much sense considering all the build up throughout the seasons and the current villain of the season plotline isnt the best. But i honestly dont care!! I love these characters soo much and im greedy for more of them and that is what these seasons r providing me with.   I fear they are writing the characters slightly ooc but its alrightttttt im ignoring it and just reading tons of fanfic to mediate the discrepancies in their behaviour (like sam and deans whole argument abt betrayal/amelia is so weird. Why would sam not look for dean? Why is dean so pissy abt everyone betraying him?)   I think the only thing i hate abt the show is how they killed off bobby ğŸ™„ like why was that necessary. Gosh. Bc of the whole â€˜bringing ppl back frm the deadâ€™ thing i didnt even grieve him properly bc i genuinly thought theyd revive him somehow. Which i guess happened w the ghost thing but still. Jeez.  Also i think i prefer destiels dynamic now cus before that theres wayyy too much going on plotwise for me to see them together. As well as like. The fact that dean didnt consider cas that close during s4-5 imo so. Yaa It was nice to get the confirmation of him considering cas family in s6 as well as his determination to save cas during purgatory. I can sufficiently see the potential for their romance now

post_body: there are moments in both croatoan and houses of the holy i want to compare because i think the show is doing something kind of fascinating and fairly subtle.  the allegorical conflict in croatoan centers around whether dean will kill duane or not (and by extension whether dean will be willing to kill sam). in the end dean lets him live which is an act of devotion and deference to sam. duane ends up not being infected with the virus and so dean made the right decision. this is the general framing of the conflictâ€”dean unlocks the good end by deferring to samâ€™s judgment.  the ideological conflict in houses of the holy centers around the concept through fate taken through a christian lens: is god real? does god have a plan? sam is faithful and dean is faithless and their beliefs butt heads throughout the episode. in the end dean was right and the â€œangelâ€ was just a ghost and sam acquiesces to deanâ€™s beliefs and accepts god isnâ€™t real. this too is the general framing of the conflictâ€”sam arrives at truth by listening and believing in dean.  but both of these episodes end ambiguously.  as it turns out duane was possessed by a demon which means that deanâ€™s instinctual distrust was right on the money and killing (or attempting to kill) duane would actually have been the right choiceâ€”dean correctly assessed the danger and took steps to stop it and it was sam who got in the way and persuaded him to stand down which allowed the demon to escape.  and also as it turns out a bigass rebar killed that would-be killer sam was sent after and it was such an outrageous death that it throws dean off balance and makes him reconsider whether fate and god are actually realâ€”which as we come to discover later is true and sam and dean are cosmically destined to assume the roles of cain and abel in the coming apocalypse. sam was actually the correct one here and the beliefs he was operating under were given ample support literally throughout the episode; it was dean who clouded samâ€™s judgment and directed him away from the actual truth of the divine plan for them.  i donâ€™t think thereâ€™s a grand revelation in comparing these two episodes this way but i do enjoy how the show keeps them spinning on an axis and how the seemingly correct decision is actually much more nuanced than it seems on the surface. when dean is right heâ€™s still wrong; when sam is wrong heâ€™s still rightâ€”and vice versa. black and white answers simply canâ€™t exist in this world because there is nothing wholly good and nothing wholly bad. dean had to let duane live because to do otherwise would be to succumb to his fate even if letting duane symbolizes that dean will allow sam to succumb to his. sam had to defer to deanâ€™s ideology because to do otherwise would be to spiral further down the path to his destiny even if that destiny is real and itâ€™s coming for them both anyway and they can do nothing to stop it. theyâ€™re the best decisions they can make in those situations but theyâ€™re still not unambiguously perfect.  itâ€™s just another layer to the complexity of these seasons and the plot theyâ€™ve been born into. right is wrong and wrong is right and family trumps fate but family will lead to ruin. and the gods are absent fathers pulling strings they donâ€™t even know are there.

post_body: Im on s8 of supernatural and im so surprised that im still enjoying the show so much. Genuinly thought id start hating it after s5 but nope!   Yeah sure the story ending at s5 wud have made so much sense considering all the build up throughout the seasons and the current villain of the season plotline isnt the best. But i honestly dont care!! I love these characters soo much and im greedy for more of them and that is what these seasons r providing me with.   I fear they are writing the characters slightly ooc but its alrightttttt im ignoring it and just reading tons of fanfic to mediate the discrepancies in their behaviour (like sam and deans whole argument abt betrayal/amelia is so weird. Why would sam not look for dean? Why is dean so pissy abt everyone betraying him?)   I think the only thing i hate abt the show is how they killed off bobby ğŸ™„ like why was that necessary. Gosh. Bc of the whole â€˜bringing ppl back frm the deadâ€™ thing i didnt even grieve him properly bc i genuinly thought theyd revive him somehow. Which i guess happened w the ghost thing but still. Jeez.  Also i think i prefer destiels dynamic now cus before that theres wayyy too much going on plotwise for me to see them together. As well as like. The fact that dean didnt consider cas that close during s4-5 imo so. Yaa It was nice to get the confirmation of him considering cas family in s6 as well as his determination to save cas during purgatory. I can sufficiently see the potential for their romance now

post_body: So I just made a post defending/appreciating Sam so I want to make one about Dean too because while yes I obviously have some strong feelings about Sam I also have strong feelings about Dean and Sam stans who hate him. Because again Sam loves Dean more than like anyone else. And because Iâ€™m a Sam-coded Dean girl. (Yes I know I said it the other way on the other post. Iâ€™m both okay. Shut up. Iâ€™m a middle child. It doesnâ€™t have to make sense.)   I relate so much to Dean. Okay. He gave up so much of his childhood so his brother could have some of one. He always gave Sam more than he got and made sure Sam was safe.   Dean went through hell (literally!) for his little brother. And heâ€™d do it again. Of course Sam deserves the world but so does Dean. And theyâ€™d both die before taking it from the other. And they have.   I mentioned in my Sam defense post that Sam always tried to respect Deanâ€™s autonomy and that Dean tries to fix his grief by taking his brotherâ€™s autonomy. And thatâ€™s still true but itâ€™s because Dean canâ€™t see how a life without a brother by your side is worth living. He doesnâ€™t see how Sam could possibly be happy living in his memories memories of someone elseâ€™s thanksgiving or being in hell. And Sam doesnâ€™t get how Dean could possibly want to leave heaven just to be with him. They both have crippling self esteem issues and neither knows how to communicate their needs with the other because they werenâ€™t raised in that kind of environment and arenâ€™t the most receptive to that kind of communication. No matter how much they try to be.  I see so much of myself in Dean. Always trying to stop the arguing when tensions get to high being the peacemaker and a parentâ€™s shoulder to cry on from a young age. Rarely being recognized for sacrifices sacrifices going unnoticed growing up and being bad at sharing feelings because you never had the chance to truly talk about them growing up and because you are tired of feeling judged for having feelings. He always did his best with what he had and he was never really given enough.   So yeah youâ€™re allowed to hate Sam or Dean. Thatâ€™s your right your prerogative and your choice. But neither Sam nor Dean could ever hate the other. They are intertwined bound together. Two sides of the same coin. And they love each other too much to hate the other.   Sam said it best when he said â€œand what do you think my job is? You saved my life. Over and over. I mean you sacrifice everything for me. Donâ€™t you think Iâ€™d do the same for you? Youâ€™re my big brother thereâ€™s nothing I wouldnâ€™t do for you.â€  And sure Sam didnâ€™t always do it the way Dean would have liked but theyâ€™re not the same person and Sam has his own way of showing his love for Dean. But they both deserve that love.

post_body: I keep seeing stuff about Dean and how he deserved better or blamed himself for everything. And I have to keep myself from defending Sam because Dean isnâ€™t the only one. (If you canâ€™t tell Iâ€™m a very Dean-coded Samgirl and I have to remind myself that most of the time the creators of the edit or post know this and theyâ€™re just highlighting Deanâ€™s experience. And I can appreciate that.) so this is my Sam appreciation/defense post because I have feelings.   Sam deserved everything and more he wasnâ€™t always the best brother but neither was Dean and the ways both brothers struggle are with things they superimpose on themselves because they donâ€™t know how to handle their grief or how to live without the other. Dean tries to fix it by taking his brotherâ€™s autonomy Sam tries to respect Deanâ€™s autonomy when he dies or something happens itâ€™s why he didnâ€™t just go call an ambulance like he wanted to in the finale (I know I usually say non-existent finale but Iâ€™m making a point.) itâ€™s why he didnâ€™t look for Dean while he was in purgatory he figured Dean was probably in heaven and he couldnâ€™t imagine a world where taking that away from him was good. (Also he was traumatized and tired of losing people.)   He went through so much crap and itâ€™s so overlooked by the writers directors and a majority of the fandom. And as someone who was overlooked growing up (even now frankly I mean my parents were doing steak dinners for our birthdays now since weâ€™re all adults and they did for both my brotherâ€™s previous birthdays and my birthday we did burgers and hotdogs with the whole family which was fine but also still left me out. Anyway) because they hid what they were feeling and going through and hid it well itâ€™s so obvious to me when someone else is hurting and it just bothers me so much to see it ignored in the fandom. Claiming to be a Dean Stan and hating Sam is outrageous to me because Sam is someone Dean loves so much. How you can hate someone he loves just confuses me.   I see so much of myself in Sam a tired burnt out gifted kid who gave everything his all until it was taken away. Who had his hopes and dreams and interests shunned and criticized by the people who were supposed to encourage him and when he finally got out of that situation he got dragged back in. (I know itâ€™s more complicated but Iâ€™m focusing on specific aspects.)  Now you donâ€™t have to like Sam or even some or most of his choices but to hate Sam in Deanâ€™s name is wrong. Dean loved Sam more than anyone else (yes this includes Cas it may have been different but he still loved Sam more.)   Dean himself said it best â€œthatâ€™s my job right. Look out for my pain in the ass little brother.â€ And â€œI had to look out for you. Thats my job.â€ And â€œthatâ€™s my job right. Show my little brother the ropes.â€   No one loves Sam more than Dean and the fact that someone could love Dean and hate Sam just doesnâ€™t compute in my brain. And again I know thatâ€™s not usually whatâ€™s going through these creatorsâ€™ minds but it still irks me ğŸ˜‚   post defending/appreciating dean
