Summer love Weecest  <!-- more -->   In the small sleepy town of Lawrence Kansas the Winchester brothers found themselves often left to their own devices now that school was out. Sam already taller at 15 years old than his older brother Dean; who decided to drop out and just get his GED.      Their father John was a relentless hunter always on the trail of supernatural creatures that lurked in the shadows. His long absences meant that Sam and Dean had to grow up fast learning to take care of each other in a world filled with danger and uncertainty.     One warm summer afternoon the brothers decided to escape the confines of their motel room and head to the park. They found a secluded spot under an ancient oak tree its branches stretching wide and providing a cool respite from the blaring sun. They lay on the grass their legs intertwined staring up at the sky. The leaves rustled gently in the breeze casting playful shadows over their faces. It was one of those rare moments of tranquility where the world seemed to pause just for them. Dean pulled off his Led Zeppelin t-shirt to reveal a white tank top underneath.      â€œRemember that time we snuck out to the drive-in?â€ Dean asked a smirk playing on his lips balling up his shirt to throw at Sam.      Sam chuckled â€œYeah and you got us caught because you insisted on honking the horn during the jump scares.â€     Dean laughed the sound rich and warm â€œWorth it. That was a great night.â€     Their laughter faded into comfortable silence each lost in their thoughts. It was in these moments that they found solace a brief escape from the relentless hunt.     â€”â€”â€”     As the days passed they shared everythingâ€”secrets fears and the burdens of their family legacy. Sam had finally opened up to his brother about wanting to go to college and Dean decided at that point that he would secretly do whatever it took to get Sammy there.      Dean decided to take Sam out after eating the same thing for the last three nights they walked down the dirt path towards the diner.      As the pair walked into the slightly run down building a soft chime introduced them to the rest of the patrons. Sam picked the booth all the way in the back still not totally comfortable with how tall and standoutish we was.      A cheerful waitress with a beehive hairstyle approached their table her name tag reading â€œBetty.â€ She greeted them with a warm smile. â€œWhat can I get for you boys today?â€     Dean grinned his eyes lighting up. â€œWeâ€™ll take a large vanilla milkshake two straws please.â€     Betty winked and jotted down their order. â€œComing right up.â€     The brothers settled into a comfortable silence the low hum of conversation and clinking dishes around them creating a soothing backdrop. A few minutes later Betty returned balancing a tall glass filled with creamy vanilla goodness topped with a generous swirl of whipped cream and a cherry on top. She placed it in the center of the table sliding two straws into the thick shake.     â€œEnjoy boysâ€ she said with a smile before bustling off to tend to other customers.     Dean leaned forward taking a long sip from his straw. His eyes closed in bliss as the cold sweet flavor washed over his tongue. â€œMan thatâ€™s good. Just what we needed.â€     Sam followed suit savoring the nostalgic taste of their shared treat. He couldnâ€™t help but smile a genuine expression of happiness that had become rare in their line of work. â€œItâ€™s been a while since weâ€™ve done thisâ€ he admitted his voice soft.     Deanâ€™s eyes met his brotherâ€™s a glint of warmth and understanding in his gaze. â€œYeah too long.â€      They sat there sipping their milkshake and sharing quiet conversation reminiscing about simpler times and laughing at old memories. The weight of their responsibilities and the darkness they faced daily seemed to lift if only for a moment. The milkshake a simple indulgence became a symbol of their bondâ€”an unspoken promise that no matter what they would always find their way back to each other.     As the last of the milkshake disappeared through their straws Dean leaned back with a satisfied sigh. â€œWe should do this more often Sammy.â€     Sam nodded a small smile playing on his lips. â€œYeah we should.â€     In that moment surrounded by the comforting hum of the diner and the fading light of day the Winchester brothers found a rare sense of peace. It was a fleeting respite but it was enough to remind them that no matter how dark their path became they would always have each other. And sometimes that was all they needed.     â€”â€”     One night after a particularly grueling hunt they returned to their motel room. The air was thick with unspoken words the silence between them heavy with emotion. Dean could see the exhaustion and pain in Samâ€™s eyes and he felt a fierce protectiveness surge within him. He reached into his duffel bag and pulled out a pack of cigarettes. Lighting one he took a long drag the smoke curling around him before handing it to Sam.     Sam hesitated for a moment before taking the cigarette inhaling deeply. The nicotine hit his system providing a momentary escape from the stress. They sat on the edge of the bed passing the cigarette back and forth in silence. Dean reached for a couple of beers they had snagged from a local convince store earlier. He popped the caps off and handed one to Sam.     â€œTo surviving another dayâ€ Dean toasted clinking his bottle against Samâ€™s.     Sam smiled faintly taking a swig â€œTo us.â€     They drank in silence the beer a bitter but welcome relief. The cigarettes and alcohol created a hazy cloud that momentarily shielded them from their harsh reality. As they finished their drinks Dean put his arm around Sam pulling him close.     â€œDeanâ€ Sam whispered his voice raw with emotion â€œI donâ€™t know how much longer I can do this.â€     Dean tightened his grip his thumb gently caressing the nape of Samâ€™s neck â€œWeâ€™ll get through it Sammy. We always do.â€     Their bond was unlike anything else. It was deeper than friendship stronger than blood. In the quiet moments when the world faded away it was just the two of them. They knew their relationship was unconventional a secret they kept fiercely guarded. But in those stolen moments they found a love that transcended the boundaries of brotherhood.     The nights were often the hardest. The weight of their fatherâ€™s expectations the endless hunt and the constant threat of danger took its toll. But in the darkness they found light in each other. They would lie in bed tangled in each otherâ€™s arms finding solace in the warmth of their bodies. Dean would press soft kisses to Samâ€™s forehead murmuring words of comfort and reassurance.     Their love was a refuge a sanctuary from the chaos of their lives. It was in those quiet intimate moments that they found the strength to keep going. They knew that no matter what they would always have each otherâ€”two souls intertwined forever bound by love and destiny.     â€”â€”â€”     The day had been perfect one of those rare summer days when the sun was warm but not too hot and the sky was a clear endless blue. Sam and Dean had decided to take a break from their relentless hunting to enjoy a bit of normalcy something that had been missing from their lives for far too long.     They found a secluded lake hidden away from the main road and surrounded by thick lush forest. The water was crystal clear reflecting the sky and the trees like a mirror. It was the kind of place that seemed almost too perfect to be real a hidden paradise just for them.     Dean parked the Impala under the shade of a large oak tree and they both got out feeling the soft grass under their boots. Sam was the first to break the silence a rare genuine smile lighting up his face.     â€œCome on Dean. Last one in is a rotten eggâ€ he called out already pulling off his shirt and kicking off his boots.     Dean laughed shaking his head as he watched his brother sprint towards the water. â€œOh youâ€™re on little brother.â€     In moments both of them were stripped down to their boxers racing towards the edge of the lake. Sam reached the water first diving in with a splash that sent ripples across the surface. Dean followed close behind his own entry just as enthusiastic. The water was cool and refreshing a welcome relief from the summer heat.     They swam and splashed around their laughter echoing through the trees. It was a carefree joyous moment a rare escape from their usual lives filled with danger and darkness. After a while they floated on their backs side by side looking up at the sky.     â€œThis is perfectâ€ Sam said softly his voice filled with contentment.     Dean turned his head to look at his brother a smile tugging at his lips. â€œYeah it really is.â€     After a few more moments of floating they swam back to the shallower part of the lake where they could stand. Dean splashed Sam playfully grinning as his brother retaliated with a laugh.     â€œCome on letâ€™s see if you can catch meâ€ Dean teased swimming a bit further out.     Sam determined chased after him the two of them moving through the water with ease. When he finally caught up he grabbed Dean by the arm pulling him close. They were both breathless from laughing their faces inches apart.     For a moment time seemed to stand still. The laughter faded replaced by a different kind of intensity. Samâ€™s hand still held Deanâ€™s arm their wet skin slick against each other. Deanâ€™s eyes searched Samâ€™s face and what he saw there made his heart race.     With a soft smile staring into his eyes Sam leaned in his lips brushing against Deanâ€™s in a soft gentle kiss. Dean didnâ€™t pull away; instead he kissed back his arms wrapping around Samâ€™s waist to pull him even closer. The kiss deepened as Sam wrapped just arms around Deanâ€™s neck.     When they finally broke apart Dean rested his forehead against Samâ€™s forehead. â€œHoly shit Sammy.â€ Dean murmured his voice filled with a mix of awe and affection.     Samâ€™s face turned a deep shade of red his usual confidence momentarily giving way to shyness. He hid his face in the crook of Deanâ€™s neck his voice a soft whine. â€œDeanâ€¦â€     Dean chuckled the sound vibrating through both of them. He tilted Samâ€™s chin up gently with his hand forcing his brother to meet his gaze. â€œGive me another kissâ€ Dean whispered his eyes dark with desire and affection.     Sam blushed madly but he couldnâ€™t hide the smile that tugged at his lips. He leaned in again closing the distance between them. This time their kiss was deeper more certain. Deanâ€™s hands found their way to the back of Samâ€™s head fingers threading through his damp hair.      The world around them seemed to disappear leaving only the two of them in their own little universe. The water lapped gently at their bodies the coolness a stark contrast to the heat building between them.     Dean broke the kiss just enough to murmur against Samâ€™s lips â€œI love you Sammy.â€     Samâ€™s heart skipped a beat. He pulled back and smiled widely at his bother. â€œI love you Dean.â€      They swam back to shore ready to go back to the motel and kiss more.
â€œThank you for your time.â€ â†³ 1.01 - PILOT

post_body: fucking crazy how destiel is a ship with so many canon/non canon variants and dynamics which revolve around the same premise of a faithless man and a fallen angel which constantly create a compelling and alluring story. it definitely helps that jensen and misha share a very delicate chemistry which is rare on screen because itâ€™s usually passed off as awkward but because they had the time to expand it and build upon the relationship between dean and castiel it creates a very unique and recognisable dynamic between them which can be then applied to other pieces in media even when breaking the fourth wall or with metanarratives such as in â€˜the endâ€™ episode. itâ€™s such a genius and hypnotic relationship in media even crazier when you account that the entire premise of their story is accidental and wasnâ€™t planned by kripke but was instead acknowledged very eventually by misha collins and writers who were able to push past the cw and incorporate subtext and queercoding only for them to fuck it up in one episode at the end of season 15. itâ€™s even crazier when you just pick apart the end (season 5 episode 3) because just days after castiel rebels in canon dean is thrown against the narrative in an alternative universe where casâ€™ rebellion was so prominent that he followed dean to the literal end from croatoan virus to blindly following orders when he knows itâ€™s a suicide mission. and then they apply that principle and dynamic to their relationship consistently in the show from season 8 with naomiâ€™s capture and to seasons 12+ after casâ€™ deal and when co parenting jack they definitely have their flaws and their bumps but they are a rare unparalleled ship amongst media.

If I had to choose between being lit on fire and then monkeys eating me alive or forgeting and then re-watching the whole of supernatural just to see deans and castiel death I would choose being lit on fire and being eaten alive by monkeys.

actually so typical of me to finally create a tumblr linked to my AO3 info so I can interact with the fandoms I write in but then be immediately dragged down a supernatural rabbit hole. in some ways i truly am the person i was at fourteen (with an additional bachelorâ€™s degree in English that allows me to dig even deeper into how in love that hunter is with his gay angel (and vice versa))

post_body: houses of the holy makes me totally crazy so here have more thoughts on this episode. when dean suggests a seance to confirm whether the angel is real or not he says this:  it feels startlingly similar to gordonâ€™s words way back in 2x03:  this strikes me as thematically odd because by the time houses of the holy comes around dean has seemingly denied his father (represented by gordon) and refused his fate (also represented by gordon) in favor of his complete devotion to sam. since croatoan dean has been working on samâ€™s behalf and only samâ€™s behalf; everything else is unimportant to him now. he made his decision and his decision was sam.  but for him to be echoing gordonâ€™s words would indicate quite the opposite. to me it sounds like heâ€™s internalized gordonâ€™s mindset and even if heâ€™s not conscious of it he is walking in the footsteps of his fate through gordonâ€™s influence. gorden is an allegory of deanâ€™s fate: if dean is mirroring him in any way that should set off alarms. it means heâ€™s not as directly opposed to destiny as he claims to be.  (a side note: this actually fits very well with samâ€™s character arc throughout the season because heâ€™s doing the same thing. he claims heâ€™s chosen dean and refused his fate (or is trying to at least) but he is also the one who keeps pursuing it by chasing after john (a symbol for their fate) and continuing to hunt (which is what azazel wants him to do). he thinks he is opposing fate while dancing right in the palm of azazelâ€™s hand. so cool parallel here.)  this line also pops up in the midst of a pretty wide ideological gap between themâ€”theyâ€™re opposed on the grounds of faith and the very existence of a god and this conflict drives the story forward. interesting then that a line that is so similar to what gordon told dean is nestled so neatly within this conflictâ€”it seems to prove the point that whenever sam and dean are in conflict whenever theyâ€™re not choosing each other they are inevitably choosing their destinies. they canâ€™t fight because it will drive them apart and the only other direction they can go other than toward their brother is toward their fate.  but what dean is doing with this line functionally is making an attempt to comfort sam.  donâ€™t you want to know for sure? dean isnâ€™t saying that sam is wrong anymore; heâ€™s giving a concession by way of offering a solution to their conflict. heâ€™s offering sam something real whatever that reality may turn out to be and heâ€™s letting sam be the one who decides whether he wants to cling to faith or know whatâ€™s really going on. this gets through to sam and they go through with the seance.  and sam does see that dean was right. at the end of the episode he adopts deanâ€™s pessimistic view of god and admits he was wrong. thereâ€™s a slight theme here too: when samâ€™s worldview is shaken and he is given evidence that he can go dark side he assimilates to deanâ€™s worldview.  this happens in season 1 also. dean is the one who originally asserts the idea of â€œsaving peopleâ€ as part of their job. dean is the one who looks for hunts and advocates for saving as many people as they can even while sam is rather content to leave people to die to the monsters they know are out there (the most illustrative examples of this being 1x01 1x02 and 1x11). this only changes after 1x14 when sam is shown a mirror version of himself in max and has to confront the reality that he might be going down the path to evil. the demon wants something from him and from max and now he canâ€™t ignore it anymore. and for the next several episodes itâ€™s suddenly sam who is seeking out hunts sam who is trying to save people even when dean is reluctant to take a case.  what happened here? itâ€™s a sudden and stark change and itâ€™s reminiscent of what dean told sam back in wendigo; itâ€™s reminiscent of how dean carries himself. sam is perhaps modeling himself after deanâ€”he sees dean as someone to look up to as someone who is worthy where he is not as someone good where he is not. to sam if he can become more like dean he can be saved. he can avoid the fate that fell upon max.  and so we see this again in 2x13: sam has been presented with evidence that there is no god that no one is going to save him that heâ€™s damned and forsaken. and he copes with this by admitting he was wrong and immediately adopting deanâ€™s ideology as his own.  dean is good dean is right and if sam can just be a little bit more like his brother he can avoid the horrific fate lying in wait for him.  and he all but confirms this pattern in 3x07 too:  but herein lies a danger which brings me back to my original point. if deanâ€™s line here parallels gordon if dean is voicing the echo of a man who embodies his fate then what does this mean for sam? if sam is so quick to change his beliefs and behaviors based on his admiration for dean that puts dean in a difficult and tenuous situation. because now at a time when dean is supposed to be solidly dragging sam away from his doom heâ€™s backsliding toward his ownâ€”and heâ€™s taking sam with him.  y'know like:
NewJeans - Supernatural

post_body: phantom traveler pairing: suguru getou x reader suguru getou & reader & satoru gojo.  warnings: mature language spn x jjk crossover so yk there is some canon typical violence satoru is an idiot but he is our idiot tiny bit of angst.  valentine speaks! okay here we are! a good chunk of people actually wanted to see this so i am VERY excited about this one :3 please let me hear your thoughts  series masterlist read it on ao3.  it starts with a call â€” well not really it starts way before that but this hunt starts with a call.   the situation reminds you awfully a lot of the early 2000s horror movie final destination. with death still trying to take whoever is left alive on the plane that crashed is too similar of a scenario it gives you chills.  unlike the basic salt-and-burn ghosts who are occasionally a bit too trigger-happy urban legends that are a pain in the ass to actually get through or cursed objects that sucks to get a hold of demons are not a very often sight for the three of you.   they are awful creatures coming from the depths of hell to torture and mess for fun in extreme measures.   and hey itâ€™s not that you guys havenâ€™t faced with them before itâ€™s more of a not-our-specialty type of thing.   (oh how young and naive all three of you are not knowing that the future only holds more of them in the inventory for you.)  but who is suguru to turn down a hunt like this? when there are innocent peopleâ€™s lives at the end of it he is pretty much ready to do almost anything.  and thatâ€™s how you find yourself in the back seat of the impala arranging what little you can take on the plane to save your asses in case of actually having to get on the flight. satoru is speeding up as much as he can for the sake of catching the flight attendant suguru has been trying to reach for the last fifteen minutes.   (you are pretty sure he is also enjoying the crisp afternoon air hitting against his skin and the adrenaline but itâ€™s not like you can prove it.)  â€œyeah i understandâ€” well thank you have a good afternoon ma'am.â€ suguruâ€™s silky voice is coated with customer service politeness as he hangs up the phone with a sigh.   â€œthe flight is about to board in an hour.â€ suguru informs the two of you making the snow-haired boy click his tongue and drawing a sigh from you as equally tired as his one.   â€œcall her cellphone again see if we canâ€™t head her off in the pass.â€ unlike his usual self satoru gets quite serious at times like this; when he is unsure if he can make it or not.  suguru shakes his head in disappointment. â€œi already left her three voice messages. she mustâ€™ve turned her phone off."   he drops his head back and closes his eyes at the motion his free dark locks spread over wherever they can. your teeth sink into your lower lip you arenâ€™t sure if you guys can pull this one off.  "god we are not going to make it.â€ you whisper under your breath definitely not the best encouragement at the moment.  satoru clenches his jaw crystal blue eyes focused on the road in front of him. â€œweâ€™ll make it.â€ he sounds so confident that it almost gives you hope.  you do in fact make it to the airport. it only takes about forty minutes and a soon-to-be-coming fine for speeding.   your hands feel sweaty no matter how much you keep wiping them on your pants as satoru talks over the phone with the flight attendant. with his attempts of trying to change her mind about getting on the flight awfully failing there is no other choice than actually getting on this flight.  you let out a groan when the flight attendant shuts the phone to satoruâ€™s face. â€œgod damn it.â€ one of suguruâ€™s big callused hand sits on your shoulder comfortingly.   there was only one option; getting on this doomed-to-crash plane.   â€œokay plan b. we are getting on the plane.â€ suguruâ€™s serious tone leaves no room for debate but with satoru looking at him wide eyed you knew something was about to go wrong.  â€œwoah woah! hold on now!â€ crystal-blue eyes locked themselves with suguruâ€™s dark purple ones. when the comforting warmth of his hand leaves your shoulder a sting forms on your chest.  â€œsatoru that plane is leaving with over a hundred passengers on board.â€ you knew this tone of suguru it was his â€˜i am in charge right nowâ€™ tone.  â€œand if we are right.. that plane is going to crash. you know that.â€ you add solemnly. satoru looks between the two of you there is an unexplained worry in his eyes.  â€œi know that.â€ he clicks his tongue.  â€œokay. so we are getting on the plane we need to find that demon and exorcise it.â€ you bit inside your cheek a nervous habit you picked up years ago.  â€œiâ€™ll get the tickets you guys get whatever you can out of the trunk. whatever that will make through the security. meet me back here in five.â€ suguru points at the two of you eager to get through this as fast as possible.  â€œi already have some stuff ready thought it would be good to be prepared.â€ you show the dark brown bag filled with various items for this mission not the best preparation but it would help for sure.  â€œgood thatâ€™s good. still check the trunk though.â€ suguru nods flashing a small smile. in the meantime satoru was looking at the two of you anxiously.   â€œare you okay?â€ you ask him softly he looks tenser than before. â€œnot really.â€ his reply comes immediately after your question making suguru raise his eyebrows at him.   â€œwhat? whatâ€™s wrong?â€ you take a step next to him placing a hand on his arm. he looks away while huffing.  â€œi might have a small problem with.. uh..â€ suguru presses his lips together while you caress satoruâ€™s arm soothingly.  â€œflying? you are scared of flying?â€ if it wasnâ€™t such a serious moment you are sure both of you would be laughing at satoru.   â€œit wasnâ€™t an issue until now!â€ satoru whines dropping his head on your shoulder and burying his face away from suguru.  â€œyou are joking right?â€ suguru eyes him skeptically. satoru groans into your skin before meeting the dark purples directed at him.   â€œdo i look like iâ€™m joking? why do you think we drive everywhere suguru?â€ the dark haired boy lets out a huff you can already see the headache forming on his head as he becomes less impatient.  â€œall right weâ€™ll go. you stay in the car and wait for us how about that?â€ an uneasy feeling fills you. you want to solve this case as much as suguru does but leaving satoru behind and getting on a plane doomed to crash is not on your bingo list. â€œwait what?â€ your questioning gets completely ignored by both of them.  â€œdude are you nuts? that plane is going to crush!â€ satoru protests his lips forming into a frown.  â€œsatoru either we do this all of us together or you wait while we wrap up the hunt. i am not seeing a third option here.â€ suguru states becoming more impatient as the seconds fly by.   satoruâ€™s frown turns into a childish pout. â€œsuguru come on! really? oh man..â€  itâ€™s safe to say that all three of you got on the plane before it boarded. satoru was already fidgeting with your hands while suguru was looking over the journal. you are seated between them mostly for satoruâ€™s comfort but itâ€™s also nothing surprising. a quiet humming of a familiar hip-hop song is audible enough for you and suguru.   you bite inside your cheeks to not snort while stealing a glance from suguru who is in the exact same condition. as he leans in the familiar musk of cigarettes and a faint of vanilla fills your nostrils. god it was unfair how the two of them smelled so good all the time.  â€œareâ€”â€ suguru canâ€™t stop the small snort escaping from him â€œare you humming megan thee stallion?â€ you look away as you try your hardest to not laugh at your best friend.  â€œshut up it calms me down!â€ satoru glares at the silky haired man his big hand slightly pushing his head back. â€œyeah i would guess so..â€ you murmur under your breath and a sound suspiciously close to suguruâ€™s snicker hits against your ear drums. you canâ€™t help the tiniest smile forming on your lips.  â€œi canâ€™t believe i am getting bullied like this! bullies both of you!â€ satoru huffs dramatically but it simply makes your smile grow more. at least he isnâ€™t as anxious as before.  â€œlook i know this isnâ€™t the best situation to be in for any of us but we have to focus.â€ you pointedly look at the two of them bringing the conversation on the hunt once more.   â€œwe got..â€ suguru checks his watch â€œthirty-two minutes and counting to track this damn thing down or whoever itâ€™s possessing at the moment and perform a full-on exorcism."   satoruâ€™s hold on your hand tightens. post_body: Thinking about older Jack.  He would have some facial hair he likes the look although Dean told him the soulpatch looks like he is about to pull a guitar out of his ass and play wonderwall.   Jack has ear tuffs like Castiel after having the power of gods at the defeat of Chuck. He didnt need or want all of that so he gave it back to the universe and let it settle where ever it pleased once everything had been set right. He never cared much for rules anyway.   He styles his mutton spikes upwards with his mane for a neat and tidy look. Jack still loves the library and spends hours with Sam going over lore and theories on magic and monsters and in his free time he volunteers at shelters or community centers. Jack is unnaturally good at playing string instruments the fiddle being a favorite of his (he knows how to play horror music really well)   His life isnt always happy and its still far from normal but he has peace and a place in the world with his family and friends

post_body: Next To You pairing: sam winchester x reader  summary: waking up next to sam was your favorite thing in the world.  genre: fluff  word count: 1.4k  authorâ€™s notes: i would very much love to wake up next to sam donâ€™t y'all think so? i literally wrote this because i think tâ€™d feel so good to be hugged by him the entire night and wake up to him first thing in the morning.  <!-- more --> WAKING UP NEXT TO SAM WAS PROBABLY YOUR FAVORITE THING IN THE WORLD. IT WAS YOUR REFUGE A SANCTUARY FROM THE WORLDâ€™S HARSH EDGES. It was a reminder that each day is another day you get to spend the rest of your life with the love of your life.  You loved waking up next to Sam because his warmth radiated like your favorite hoodie chasing away the remnants of a cool summer night. Tucked into the space between his jaw and chest you could feel the steady rise and fall of his breath his arms encasing you.  Slowly you untangled yourself from his embrace careful not to disturb his sleep. The light of dawn peeked through the window painting a golden sheen across Samâ€™s face. His brow furrowed slightly a crease etched between his eyes usually reserved for facing down monsters but right now it softened with sleep replaced by the slight ajar of his lips.   Watching Sam sleep had you going through your memories in a flashâ€”the way he surprised you with your favorite flowers after being gone from a hunt a shy smile gracing his features as he laid a gentle kiss on your reddened cheeks. You smiled wistfully when you recalled how Sam confessed to you his feelings the night he had gotten home from a hunt that went on too long and couldâ€™ve gone sideways.  The motel room door creaked open revealing a battered Sam Winchester. Dried blood stained the sleeve of his jacket and he was sporting a nasty gash on his right cheek a grim souvenir from the hunt gone south.  Exhaustion hung heavy around him a storm cloud threatening to unleash the floodgates of aches and pains. He wanted to go to sleep as soon as he stepped inside the dank motel room but the tiny flicker of light beneath the door held him captive.  There you were bathed in the warm glow of a lamp hands wringing together and brows crimped in worry. Sam seemed to forget all about sleep when he saw you. He has never yearned for anything the way he has right now with the sight of you his relic of normalcy in his chaotic world. He pushed the door open further the sound jarring in the silence.  You looked up surprise giving way to relief. â€œSam! Thank goodness youâ€™re alright. I was worried sick after youâ€™ve been gone for so long.â€  A weak smile formed on his lips. â€œWe got them. Nasty ghouls took longer than expected.â€ He shuffled closer the weight of the hunt pulling at him. He could feel the warmth radiating from the room a stark contrast to the bone-chilling night heâ€™d endured.  You stood up and reached out your hand brushing against his cheek. The touch even through the grime sent a jolt through him. It was a simple gesture yet it held the power to ground him to remind him of what he was fighting forâ€”what he was going home to.  â€œYou look like hellâ€ you said your voice laced with concern. â€œGo wash up then Iâ€™ll get you something to eat. Thereâ€™s a diner near here open 24/7 apparently Bobby told me on the phone earlier bless his gruff soul.â€  He allowed himself to be ushered towards the bathroom crumpling onto the tub with a groan. As the hot water washed away the grime and fatigue something else started to wash over him. It was the weight of his unspoken feelings a truth he could no longer keep buried.  He emerged from the bathroom a fresh towel wrapped around his hair. You were already by the table a steaming cup of coffee and grub waiting for him. He caught your gaze the way your eyes held a warmth that chased away the chills of the hunt.  â€œListenâ€ Sam began his voice thick with emotion. You tilted your head in confusion as to what he was trying to say. â€œThis lifeâ€¦ itâ€™s not easy. Itâ€™s dangerous messy and frankly it terrifies me sometimes.â€  He took a deep breath his eyes locking with yours. â€œBut then I come back here see youâ€¦ and suddenly facing it all over again well it doesnâ€™t seem so bad. It feelsâ€¦ bearable.â€  A blush crept up your neck mirroring the heat rising in his own. You opened your mouth to speak but he pressed on.  â€œI know this is crazyâ€ he said his voice barely a whisper. â€œBut I canâ€™t keep it in anymore. Iâ€¦ I care about you. A lot more than a friend.â€  The silence stretched heavy with anticipation. He braced himself for a rejection the fear of a cold fist squeezing his heart. Then you reached out your hand gently cupping his cheek.  â€œSamâ€ you said your voice soft â€œyouâ€™re not the only one who feels that way.â€  Relief flooded him warm and exhilarating. A hesitant smile spread across his face. â€œReally?â€  You nodded your eyes sparkling. â€œFor a long time actually.â€  He leaned in the space between them collapsing in a rush. The kiss was soft a tentative exploration of your unspoken feelings toward each other. But within it there was a spark a promise of something deeper. He pulled back his forehead resting against yours a newfound warmth radiating from within.  â€œSoâ€ he whispered a grin tugging at his lips â€œdoes this mean I get to keep bothering you for a while longer?â€  You chuckled a sound that filled the room with a melody of hope. â€œLooks like youâ€™re stuck with me Winchester. Now about that coffeeâ€¦â€  He pulled you close the scent of coffee and the lingering warmth from the confession clinging to the air.   Yes in the face of whatever darkness awaited this peaceful moment with Sam was a treasure. You leaned in brushing a kiss against his cheek a silent promise whispered against his lips â€œIâ€™ll wake you soon pretty boy.â€  The sunlight bolder now sliced through the gap in the curtains landing right on Samâ€™s eyelids. He let out a soft groan sleep fading as he blinked the light away. Unlike you mornings werenâ€™t exactly his best friend. For a moment his eyes fluttered closed again then snapped open a glimmer of surprise crossing his face when he realized you werenâ€™t there.  â€œMorning babyâ€ he mumbled his voice rough with sleep. He reached out instinctively his hand brushing against the empty space where youâ€™d been. A frown tugged at his lips for a brief moment before it softened into a smile as he spotted you by the window.  You were turned away from him busy reading a paperback. The rising sun cast an ethereal glow around you highlighting the way your hair seemed to catch fire with golden light. A shiver danced down Samâ€™s spine a mix of the cool morning air and the unexpected sight before him.  â€œHey there Sleepyheadâ€ you said over your shoulder your voice laced with amusement as you turned back to face him. â€œYou look like you could use some more shut-eye.â€  He stretched languidly the movement sending a groan escaping his lips. â€œNah Iâ€™m good. Just gotta get the lead out before Bobby gets impatient.â€ He winced slightly a reminder of the recent hunt probably still clinging to his muscles.  A playful glint lit up your eyes. â€œLead out huh? Sounds fancy. Did you polish your shoes too Mr. Winchester?â€  He chuckled a low rumble that sent a warmth radiating through you. â€œOnly the finest demon-blood repellent for this hunter sweetheart.â€ He reached for you his hand warm and strong as he pulled you close grinning at how easily he could make you laugh with his comebacks.  As you snuggled into his embrace a comfortable silence settled between you. However a shadow lingered in the back of your mind. The thought of Bobby calling usually meant trouble brewing. You decided to break the comfortable silence.  â€œAny whispers about what Bobby wants this time?â€ you asked your voice soft.  Sam shook his head his expression turning serious. â€œNot a peep. Knowing Bobby itâ€™ll involve something nasty a whole lot of rotgut and probably a cryptic message scribbled on some random book.â€ He paused his gaze softening on you.  â€œBut whatever it isâ€ he continued his voice low and reassuring â€œweâ€™ll face it together. Like always.â€  You leaned in your lips brushing against his cheek. â€œAlwaysâ€ you whispered the unspoken words hanging heavy in the airâ€”together no matter what the coming day brought.

post_body: houses of the holy makes me totally crazy so here have more thoughts on this episode. when dean suggests a seance to confirm whether the angel is real or not he says this:  it feels startlingly similar to gordonâ€™s words way back in 2x03:  this strikes me as thematically odd because by the time houses of the holy comes around dean has seemingly denied his father (represented by gordon) and refused his fate (also represented by gordon) in favor of his complete devotion to sam. since croatoan dean has been working on samâ€™s behalf and only samâ€™s behalf; everything else is unimportant to him now. he made his decision and his decision was sam.  but for him to be echoing gordonâ€™s words would indicate quite the opposite. to me it sounds like heâ€™s internalized gordonâ€™s mindset and even if heâ€™s not conscious of it he is walking in the footsteps of his fate through gordonâ€™s influence. gorden is an allegory of deanâ€™s fate: if dean is mirroring him in any way that should set off alarms. it means heâ€™s not as directly opposed to destiny as he claims to be.  (a side note: this actually fits very well with samâ€™s character arc throughout the season because heâ€™s doing the same thing. he claims heâ€™s chosen dean and refused his fate (or is trying to at least) but he is also the one who keeps pursuing it by chasing after john (a symbol for their fate) and continuing to hunt (which is what azazel wants him to do). he thinks he is opposing fate while dancing right in the palm of azazelâ€™s hand. so cool parallel here.)  this line also pops up in the midst of a pretty wide ideological gap between themâ€”theyâ€™re opposed on the grounds of faith and the very existence of a god and this conflict drives the story forward. interesting then that a line that is so similar to what gordon told dean is nestled so neatly within this conflictâ€”it seems to prove the point that whenever sam and dean are in conflict whenever theyâ€™re not choosing each other they are inevitably choosing their destinies. they canâ€™t fight because it will drive them apart and the only other direction they can go other than toward their brother is toward their fate.  but what dean is doing with this line functionally is making an attempt to comfort sam.  donâ€™t you want to know for sure? dean isnâ€™t saying that sam is wrong anymore; heâ€™s giving a concession by way of offering a solution to their conflict. heâ€™s offering sam something real whatever that reality may turn out to be and heâ€™s letting sam be the one who decides whether he wants to cling to faith or know whatâ€™s really going on. this gets through to sam and they go through with the seance.  and sam does see that dean was right. at the end of the episode he adopts deanâ€™s pessimistic view of god and admits he was wrong. thereâ€™s a slight theme here too: when samâ€™s worldview is shaken and he is given evidence that he can go dark side he assimilates to deanâ€™s worldview.  this happens in season 1 also. dean is the one who originally asserts the idea of â€œsaving peopleâ€ as part of their job. dean is the one who looks for hunts and advocates for saving as many people as they can even while sam is rather content to leave people to die to the monsters they know are out there (the most illustrative examples of this being 1x01 1x02 and 1x11). this only changes after 1x14 when sam is shown a mirror version of himself in max and has to confront the reality that he might be going down the path to evil. the demon wants something from him and from max and now he canâ€™t ignore it anymore. and for the next several episodes itâ€™s suddenly sam who is seeking out hunts sam who is trying to save people even when dean is reluctant to take a case.  what happened here? itâ€™s a sudden and stark change and itâ€™s reminiscent of what dean told sam back in wendigo; itâ€™s reminiscent of how dean carries himself. sam is perhaps modeling himself after deanâ€”he sees dean as someone to look up to as someone who is worthy where he is not as someone good where he is not. to sam if he can become more like dean he can be saved. he can avoid the fate that fell upon max.  and so we see this again in 2x13: sam has been presented with evidence that there is no god that no one is going to save him that heâ€™s damned and forsaken. and he copes with this by admitting he was wrong and immediately adopting deanâ€™s ideology as his own.  dean is good dean is right and if sam can just be a little bit more like his brother he can avoid the horrific fate lying in wait for him.  and he all but confirms this pattern in 3x07 too:  but herein lies a danger which brings me back to my original point. if deanâ€™s line here parallels gordon if dean is voicing the echo of a man who embodies his fate then what does this mean for sam? if sam is so quick to change his beliefs and behaviors based on his admiration for dean that puts dean in a difficult and tenuous situation. because now at a time when dean is supposed to be solidly dragging sam away from his doom heâ€™s backsliding toward his ownâ€”and heâ€™s taking sam with him.  y'know like:
NewJeans - Supernatural

post_body: i am genuinely obsessed with how gordon stole the keys to the impala in bloodlust because he simply had no logical support for that action. even eavesdropping on sam and deanâ€™s argument he could hear dean defending him taking his side and before that point too gordonâ€™s ideology was definitely winning over samâ€™s. gordon taking the keys then displays a paranoia that really wonâ€™t even fully actualize itself until croatoan.  because taking the keys means that gordon believes dean will side with sam. within the context of this episode that is exactly what happens when gordon reveals he killed his sister and dean decides Fuck That but on a larger scale it predicts how the rest of the season will go too. at this point in the season dean is still caught between two ideologies and he doesnâ€™t make his choice until croatoan when his abstract duty vs sam conflict becomes real and he can no longer ponder it and must instead act. gordon knows who dean will side with before even dean knows himselfâ€”because dean spends the entire first half of the season desperately clinging to john (to his duty) trying to shove down his devotion to sam so that he can prepare himself to carry out his obligations and kill his brother.  and gordon alone knows what a futile effort it all is. he recognizes deanâ€™s devotion because heâ€™s an allegory for duty and so he understands too intimately all the ways dean is failing: duty or sam gordon or sam fate or sam. and gordon took the keys so that destiny can play out even when dean inevitably failsâ€”so that theyâ€™re too late to stop gordon and so that theyâ€™re too late to stop fate.

post_body: Supernatural S01E05 Bloody Mary This was a scary good episode. I miss the older seasons that were shot to make it more horror friendly (if that makes sense) by adding subtle piano notes playing music that crescendoed glimpse of ghost out of the corner of the eye and that blue/gray filter (that I like to call The Twilight filter)  Sam talking to Lily (daughter of the first victim) in a soft gentle way. He can see no one believes her or takes her seriously so he does. Aww Sam! Why did they stop using night vision cams and black lights?! This was cool! Iâ€™m gonna go out on a limb and say Sam smashed more mirrors than Dean (assuming he kept smashing a couple of more while Dean was talking to the cops) Speaking of mirrors Sam mentions that mirrors are a true reflection of soul which is why smashing them brings bad luck. Now adding points 4 and 5 I have a theory. Theory of Samâ€™s true reflection being smashed over and over again in the show. For starters Samâ€™s desire to live a safe and normal life is crushed with Jessicaâ€™s death. Him thinking that he was using his powers for good goes out of the window when killing Lilith starts the apocalypse. Sam fights against being Luciferâ€™s vessel only to willingly agree to it. Gosh!  Bloody Mary crawling out of the mirror on all fours Sam bleeding his eyes out almost dying but managing to throw sass when Dean calls him Sammy. â€œItâ€™s Samâ€ And finally my favourite part of this episode: towards the end when Dean asks him what he secret was he draws a line asking for his right to privacy!

post_body: Season 2 Episode 8 - Crossroad Blues  Series Masterlist   Third Person POV        Greenwood Mississippi  â€¢August 1938        Legendary blues musician Robert Johnson is performing in a bar filled of onlookers. The guitar is cradled in his lap the instrument almost like an extension of his body. His fingers dance over the strings in a flurry of movement each note and chord drawn from the strings. The music is mournful and soulful the sound of the blues seeping into the very air around him. He closes his eyes as he plays a cigarette tucked between his lips.     The crowd is captivated watching with rapt attention as the man plays. Some are nodding along to the music their eyes closed as they take in the sound. Others are tapping their feet or clapping along to the beat. There is a hushed atmosphere a kind of stillness that comes over the room as the music washes over everyone. The crowd is completely enthralled drawn in by the raw emotion and skill of the manâ€™s guitar playing.     <!-- more --> Then out of the sudden Robert begins to hear the an animalistic growling. Almost as if it was a rabid dog his strumming holted his face contort with confusion. The crowd mimicked his expression before he started again the melody from the strings ringing through the bar. But the barking in the distance didnâ€™t subside Robert began to fear for his life. Trying to carry on his performance but they crowd could sense his fear.     The shadows of the large animals casted from the front door of the bar Robert caught a glimpse of it but he was the only one who saw it. His cigarette fell from him lips onto the hard ground. The crowd murmured amongst themselves as to why he stopped and why he looked so terrified. The barking grew more angry more aggressive as Robert got up from the chair on the stage.     Breathing heavily before padding quickly out of the bar. His wife ran behind him concerned for her husband. Robert ran back through the dark bushy area guitar in his hand. But the barking and growling surrounded him he loosened his grip on his guitar. Abandoning it before running to his barn he locked the door behind him. Panting heavily it didnâ€™t take long before the barn door received a harsh bang against the wall the dogs barking furiously.     Robert screamed his back pressed against the door before grabbing a chair to barricade it. He watched in fear praying for mercy as the dogs bangs harshly against the door. Knowing that he couldnâ€™t escape this. He fell to his knees tears in his eyes fear in his chest. Soon after the door carved in and in came his two of his friends and his wife. Stumbling upon Robert seizing on the floor     â€œWhatâ€™s going on?â€ One of the men asked concerned. â€œOh my godâ€ Sadie gasped at the sight of their friend rushing to Robertsâ€™ side. He grunted and gasped for air pain coursing through his body. â€œGet a doctor! Run!!!â€ She screamed at one of the man. â€œWhat happened? Talk to meâ€ She pleaded with Robert cradling his face in her hands. â€œDogs.â€ He weakly responded. â€œStay with us baby!â€ Sadie cried.      â€œDogs. Black dogsâ€ Robert grunts as he seized. â€œBob? Robert donâ€™t you die on meâ€ Sadie pleaded shaking her husband his eyes went wide before finally taking his last breath. His wife being the last person to see or hear him alive.         _____________________________        â€¢Present Time        The trio was sat in a diner eating breakfast as Sam was checking through the St. Louis Police Department records. A mugshot of Dean on his screen sifting through his criminal record. â€œSo much for a low profile. You got a warrant in St. Louis. And now youâ€™re officially in the Fedsâ€™ databaseâ€ Sam shook his head in frustration. â€œDude Iâ€™m like Dillinger of somethingâ€ Dean smirks proudly sipping his water.     â€œDean itâ€™s not funny. It makes the job harder we gotta be more careful nowâ€ Y/N lectures. â€œWell what do they got on you two?â€ Dean asks. Sam rolls his eyes â€œIâ€™m sure they just havenâ€™t posted it yet.â€ Sam grumbles clicking in the laptop. â€œNevermind theyâ€™ve got y/nâ€™s juvie records from 2000 for assaultâ€ Sam grumbled. Y/N snorted at the memory â€œOh right I got booted for three months when I clocked that perky cheerleader bitch for dumping chocolate milk on my leather jacketâ€ She snickered.     â€œCome to think of it. Iâ€™m surprised Ballard never brought it up when she was listing out our livesâ€ She says her and Sam share a look before both shrugging just brushing off the fact. â€œI thought you were a cheerleader? And wasnâ€™t she your friend?â€ Dean cocked an eyebrow â€œI was and she was anything but a friend. She was captain of the squad and made my life even more of a living hell. It was like a bad chick-flickâ€ Y/N huffed stabbing her fork into her fries.     Both boys chuckled at the memory amused by the petty girl problems. â€œDidnâ€™t she try to steal your boyfriend after that too?â€ Sam perked up earning a glare from Y/N. â€œOh yeaahhhhâ€ Dean cackled while Sam snickered at Y/Nâ€™s expression. â€œWhat was his name again? Albert?â€ Dean questioned rubbing his finger in his finger. â€œXander. Alexanderâ€ Y/N corrected letting out a snort at his guess.      â€œAlbert? You think Iâ€™d date a guy named Albert?â€ She laughed earning a chuckle from Sam. Dean joined in on the laughter letting out a hearty chuckle trying to mask his jealousy shaking his head as he sipped from his own drink. â€œAlexander. What a stupid name.â€ He said through his laughter taking another sip from his mug. â€œXander was not stupid. He was the sweetestâ€ Y/N defended sipping her coffee.     â€œHeâ€™s a cop now. Remember when you got arrested in 02â€™ for that bar fight and he helped me bail you outâ€ She reminded him of the memory nudging Dean with her elbow. Dean rolls his eyes letting out a scoff as heâ€™s elbowed. â€œYeah yeah yeah. The boy scout.â€ He scoffed. â€œI didnâ€™t know Alex was a cop nowâ€ Sam said surprised having been in the same class as them witnessing most of their short relationship.     â€œYep. Joined the academy straight outta high school right after you left for collegeâ€ Y/N nodded. Sam nodded and hummed through a mouthful of food swallowing it before speaking. â€œHow come you never dated him again? You guys seemed good togetherâ€ Sam asked feigning innocence shooting his brother a sly side eye. Dean rolled his eyes knowing his brother is only asking to get on his nerves.      Y/N shrugged sipping on her coffee. â€œI donâ€™t know. Just lost touch with each other I guess. I havenâ€™t spoken to him in years.â€ She said casually setting down her mug. â€œPlus Heâ€™s a cop and Iâ€™m a hunter. It wouldnâ€™t have worked out and I wasnâ€™t looking for anything seriousâ€ She explained taking a bite out of her pancakes. A memory flashed across y/nâ€™s mind and she couldnâ€™t help but chuckle at it.     â€œWhen I went out of my first date with him I remember coming home to Dean sitting on Bobbyâ€™s porch with a baseball batâ€ She snorted. Dean choked on his drink. He hadnâ€™t expected her to bring that up. Sam burst into laughter almost spitting out his food from trying to hold it back. The three hunters reminisced on their teenage years â€œXander was terrified for his lifeâ€ Y/N laughed.     Sam continued to laugh while Dean set down his mug and wiped his mouth. â€œYou did what?!â€ Sam exclaimed in hysterics at his brother. â€œI was just making sure he was in for the right reasonsâ€ he said feigning innocence. Sam chuckled wiping at his shirt with his napkin. â€œOh right. You were just being a big brotherâ€ he said through laughter not buying his excuse one bit.     Y/N grimaced at that â€œWe were what? 18? We were kids whatâ€™d you expect?â€ She snorted. â€œThatâ€™s my point. You were kids. I was just a protective older brotherâ€ Dean defended looking away as he took another sip from his mug. Y/N grimaced again at Dean calling himself her older brother. She huffed rolling her eyes as Sam snorted and shook his head.     Muttering â€œBiggest lie of the century.â€ Under his breath as he finished off his food. They didnâ€™t quite catch what Sam said. â€œHuh?â€ They questioned in unison. â€œWhat?â€ Sam said in an innocent voice pretending to not have said anything. Dean eyed Sam while Y/N cocked her eyebrow at his sudden change in mood. Dean and Y/N shared a look before shrugging it off.     â€œGod being a teenager was such a pain in the assâ€ Dean shook his head with a sigh his eyes focused on his mug. â€œYou sound like an old manâ€ Y/N teased. â€œHey! Iâ€™m only 27 thank you very muchâ€ Dean scowled crossing his arms. Sam snickered enjoying their bickering. â€œYeah ancient. Youâ€™re basically a senior citizenâ€ He commented. â€œWatch it or Iâ€™ll kick your ass!â€ Dean threatened playfully pointing a finger at Sam.     He snorted in return â€œYeah right I bet youâ€™d throw your back out doing that grandpaâ€ Sam smirked. Y/N bursted out laughing at this. Throwing her head back caught off guard by Samâ€™s comeback. Reaching over to give Sam a high-five. â€œBurn!â€ She exclaimed in hysterics as Sam chuckled proudly giving Y/N a high-five in return as Dean scowled at both of them.      â€œYouâ€™re both assholesâ€ He grumbled rolling his eyes in defeat. â€œWhatever what do you got on the case?â€ Dean changes the subject while dipping his fries in ketchup. His arm draped around the back of y/nâ€™s side of the booth as she propped her elbows on the table leaning forward sipping her soda. â€œArchitect Sean Boyden plummeted to his death for the roof of his home a condominium he designedâ€ Sam read from the newspaper.     â€œHmm build a high rise and jump off the top of it. Classyâ€ Y/N commented. Sam snorts at her rebuttal. â€œWhen did he call Animal Control?â€ Dean asks. â€œTwo days earlierâ€ Sam responds. â€œDid he actually say black dog?â€ Y/N asks before Sam nods. â€œYeah. Vicious wild black dog. The authorities couldnâ€™t find it no one else saw itâ€ Sam quotes from the report.      â€œIn fact the authorities are a little confused as to how a wild dog could get past the doorman take the elevator up and roam the halls of the cushiest joint in townâ€ Sam mumbles with sass. Dean and Y/Nâ€™s eyebrows knitted. â€œAfter that he doesnâ€™t show up for work. Two days later he takes a swan diveâ€ Sam informs them. â€œYou guys think weâ€™re dealing with an actual black dog?â€ Dean asks.     â€œWell maybeâ€ Sam shrugs handing y/n the papers he printed of his research. â€œWhatâ€™s the lore in it?â€ Y/N chimes in taking the papers. â€œItâ€™s all pretty vague. I mean thereâ€™s spectral black dogs all over the world. But some say theyâ€™re animal spirits others say death omensâ€ Sam explains to them. Dean peers over y/n shoulder leaning in to take a look at the picture of the black dog along reading some of the information.     â€œBut anyways whatever they are theyâ€™re big nasty-â€ Sam continues but Dean cuts him off â€œYeah I bet they can jump the crap out of your leg. Look at that one. Huh?â€ Dean chuckles taking the picture from y/n to turn it to Sam while wiggling his eyebrows suggestively. Y/N snickers at his joke as Sam shoots Dean an unamused dry look. â€œWhat? They could?â€ Dean mumbles his face dropping. â€œIs sex all you ever think about?â€ Y/N snorts rolling her eyes.     Y/N soon realized what she said as a wicked smirk creeps onto Deans face. His mouth was already open to shot her a comeback but Sam and Y/N interrupt him. â€œDonâ€™t answer that!â€ They shoot back in unison making Deans mouth snap shut but the smirk still played on his lips as he eyed y/n up and down.        ________________________________        â€œSo you and Sean Boyden were business partners for almost 10 years now right?â€ Y/N asks Mr. Disalvo they were now over at his house interviewing him posing as journalists. Dressed in pressed shirts and ties while y/n sported her favorite white blouse and pencil skirt. â€œThatâ€™s right. One more time me this is forâ€”?â€ Disalvo responds confirming their reasoning for the interview. â€œA tribute for Mr. Boyden. Architectural Digestâ€ Dean responds fluidly with a smile.     Disalvo laughs at this earning confused looks from the three hunters. â€œThis funny to you?â€â€™ Dean asks. â€œNo. Itâ€™s just a- Tribute. Yeahâ€ He shakes his head sounding a bit bitter. He leaned against his kitchen island arms cross over his chest. â€œSee. Sean always got the tributes. He kills himself leaves me and his family behind but he gets another tributeâ€ Disalvo scoffs.     The three share a look â€œRight. Any idea why heâ€™d do such a thing?â€ Sam asks. â€œI have no clue. I mean he lived the charmed life.â€ Disalvo shrugs. â€œHow so?â€ Y/N asks her eyebrows furrowed as Sam looked down at his notepad while Dean stuffed his hands into his pockets. â€œHe was a flat-out genius. I mean Iâ€™m capable but next to himâ€¦uh..â€ Disalvo sighs shaking his head. â€œIt wasnâ€™t always that way either.â€ He added.     â€œNo?â€ Dean questions. â€œWanna know the truth?â€ Disalvo begins before taking a breath. â€œThere was time when he couldnâ€™t even design a pup tent. Hell 10 years ago he worked as a bartender at this place called Lloyds. Complete diveâ€ Disalvo explained a bit of disgust on his face. â€œRight. So what changed?â€ Sam asks. Disalvo scoffs â€œYou got me. But overnight he gets this huge commission and he starts designingâ€¦â€ He continues as they listen intently.     â€œHe starts designing the most ingenious buildings anyone has ever seen. It was like the level of Van Gogh and Mozart-â€ Disalvo says exasperatedly stopping abruptly â€œWhat?â€ Dean asks. â€œItâ€™s funny. True geniuses they seem to die young donâ€™t they?â€ Disalvo comments as Deans eyes glance over at Sam and Y/N who seem to be indulged in what heâ€™s saying.     â€œTo have that kind of talent. Why? Why just throw it away?â€ He scoffs shaking his head in disbelief. The three share a look at this revelation.        ________________________________        Later that day y/n exits the Animal Control Agency Shelter with a file in her hands while the boys waited in the Impala. She hopped in the backseat shutting the door as Sam asks â€œSo?â€ He queries about what she found out. Y/N smirks â€œThe secretaryâ€™s name is Carly. Sheâ€™s 23 she kayaks and sheâ€™sâ€¦â€ She lets out a low wolf whistles chuckling as she shook her head thinking back to the brief flirtation she had with the secretary.     Dean rolls his eyes that burning feeling in his chest raising as she shakes her head cockily her cheeks a tinge of pink. Sam snorts amused by this â€œYou didnâ€™t happen to ask her if sheâ€™d seen any black dogs lately? Did ya?â€ Dean scoffs â€œIâ€™m a professional charmingâ€ She counters with a sly smile leaning forward between the boys to show them the file in her hands.     â€œEvery complaint called in this week about big black or dog-like. Thereâ€™s 19 calls in allâ€ She tells them as Sam opens the file. â€œAnd uhâ€¦.I donâ€™t know what this thing isâ€ Y/N mutters pulling out the yellow sticky note that was stuck to the inside of the file. Sam takes it from her letting out an amused chuckle â€œYou mean Carlyâ€™s MySpace address?â€ Sam chuckles ironically earning confused looks from Dean and Y/N.     â€œMySpace?â€ They ask in unison completely in the dark both eyebrows knitted together. She took a shaky drag from her cigarette exhaling a plume of smoke. She looked over at Dean as the silence pierced the car. He braced his hand on the window of his door bringing the bud to his lips. He took a deep drag holding it for a couple of seconds allowing the nicotine and tobacco to course through his hot veins and into his lungs before watching the smoke curl into the air. Through his mouth and nose.     â€œYou know the thought of themâ€¦â€ Dean began passing the cigarette back to y/n which she accepted as Sam looked down at his hands with sorrow. â€œâ€¦wherever they are right now. I mean they spent their whole lives chasing that yellow-eyed son of a bitch. They shouldâ€™ve gone out fighting it. That was supposed to be their legacy you know?â€ Dean stated honestly his tone filled with anguish.     â€œNot bargaining with the damn thing. Not some random fucking vampire on a milk run. Ran down her right cheek â€œHow maybe people do you think they saved? Total?â€ Sam attempted to assure them again.     â€œThatâ€™s not the point Samâ€ Y/N huffed passing Dean the cigarette again both wallowing in self pity and guilt. â€œGuys Evan Hudson is safe because of what our dads thought usâ€ Sam states firmly leaning forward in the back seat. â€œThatâ€™s their legacyâ€ He added as the two kept their eyes on the road not daring to look at him.     â€œNow weâ€™re still here. So we gotta keep going. For them.â€ Sam stated again. The two didnâ€™t answer that was until a thought popped into Deans head remembering y/nâ€™s hesitation at the crossroad. â€œHey Princess?â€ Dean drew her attention to him blowing the smoke out from the corner of his lips. â€œYeah?â€ She answered her eyes flickering over to him as he passed the almost finished bud back to her.     â€œWhen you were trapping that demon you werenâ€™t-â€ He began taking a breath as she took the last drag. She exhaled the last bit of her smoke before flicking the bud out the window. Before reaching over to Babyâ€™s glove compartment she took out the mixtape Dean made for her before sliding it in.     The rock music drowned the silence out but not the tension as they drove down the dark road.        ________________________________        Authors Note: Hi beauties! He wishes that the family theyâ€™ve lost could join them in their fun if just for a night. He knows that Bobby would beat all their asses at poker John would lose miserably to everyone in a game of Sorry and Mary would grow insanely competitive over Uno. post_body: samâ€™s uni timeline is really interesting not just for the inconsistencies but for the way those inconsistencies can be interpreted â€“ sam has been at university for four years. thatâ€™s not a question. heâ€™s 22 years old heâ€™s taken the lsat heâ€™s applying to grad schools. but when dean references the â€˜almost two yearsâ€™ since heâ€™s seen sam that can mean one of two things â€“ either deanâ€™s forgotten how long itâ€™s been since sam left or somewhere around the beginning of samâ€™s junior year something happened that stopped them talking to each other.  both are fun to think about â€“ in the case of the former to me it has less to do with deanâ€™s memory and more to do with the diminished importance of samâ€™s college experience to the show itself. the show isnâ€™t interested in accurately tracking samâ€™s university timeline because thatâ€™s not what the show is about. in fact the more time the show spends on samâ€™s uni the more legitimacy they lend that period of time the more time they spend on something that is in direct conflict with what the show WANTS to say. the show wants to emphasize how the inevitable choice (and debatably perhaps the correct choice) for sam to make is to abandon all hope of a normal life and to embrace hunting once again and spending time carefully and consistently referencing samâ€™s university experience undermines that by presenting it as an equally real equally valid period of his life that he could plausibly return to.  but if the show muddies the waters â€“ if dean confuses the timeline if john didnâ€™t really mean all that about staying gone and in fact welcomes sam back into the family in 1x16 shadow â€“ then the fever dream of samâ€™s time at stanford diminishes in realness and in plausibility. itâ€™s more of a vaguely remembered farce than a real place he can return to; whereas the Family and Hunting and Hunting With the Family â€“ those are real and they are current and they are carefully and meticulously portrayed as the only real place sam has ever been or will ever be.

post_body: i am genuinely obsessed with how gordon stole the keys to the impala in bloodlust because he simply had no logical support for that action. even eavesdropping on sam and deanâ€™s argument he could hear dean defending him taking his side and before that point too gordonâ€™s ideology was definitely winning over samâ€™s. gordon taking the keys then displays a paranoia that really wonâ€™t even fully actualize itself until croatoan.  because taking the keys means that gordon believes dean will side with sam. within the context of this episode that is exactly what happens when gordon reveals he killed his sister and dean decides Fuck That but on a larger scale it predicts how the rest of the season will go too. at this point in the season dean is still caught between two ideologies and he doesnâ€™t make his choice until croatoan when his abstract duty vs sam conflict becomes real and he can no longer ponder it and must instead act. gordon knows who dean will side with before even dean knows himselfâ€”because dean spends the entire first half of the season desperately clinging to john (to his duty) trying to shove down his devotion to sam so that he can prepare himself to carry out his obligations and kill his brother.  and gordon alone knows what a futile effort it all is. he recognizes deanâ€™s devotion because heâ€™s an allegory for duty and so he understands too intimately all the ways dean is failing: duty or sam gordon or sam fate or sam. and gordon took the keys so that destiny can play out even when dean inevitably failsâ€”so that theyâ€™re too late to stop gordon and so that theyâ€™re too late to stop fate.

post_body: loml - d.w Paring; dean x reader  Prompt; â€˜I wish I could un-recall how we almost had it all.â€™  Requested; @kaydallas21  Notes; finally out of my slump thank god  Masterlist | Taylor Swift masterlist  â€œYou not gonna say anything?â€   Dean shifted slightly his gaze set firmly on his hands. You watched him scoff leaving you at his silence. â€œDean seriously?â€   <!-- more --> The silence dragged on. Your mind raced a multitude of thoughts all fighting for the centre as you stared at him in complete disbelief.   Had any of it actually been true? Had he been lying to you the whole time just so you would stick around? You really wanted it to all be a horrible dream. The idea of him having the nerve sent white-hot rage through you.   â€œSay something.â€ You bit out. He flexed his hands as he finally raised his head. His eyes seemed to go everywhere but you as he looked around the room. â€œNothing I say is going to fix this.â€   He knew heâ€™d fucked up. At the time heâ€™d barely noticed it the lies seemed too small so inconsequential that heâ€™d let them fall from his lips. Heâ€™d been so desperate to keep you around that heâ€™d played into all your hopes and dreams in order to keep you.  It was bound to all come crashing down. He knew this yet the reality was worse than heâ€™d imagined. The look in your eye left a pit in his stomach. Gone was any semblance of the warmth heâ€™d grown used to replaced with a coldness which seemed so unnatural on you.  â€œYou looked me in the eyes and told me you wanted to get married you wanted kids you wanted a white picket fence.â€ Your voice raised slightly as you spoke. â€œYou told me you wanted out. That you would get out.â€ You trailed off.  Your anger seemed to disperse as he finally met your eyes. â€œYou lied to me.â€   â€œYou lied to me and yetâ€¦â€ Your voice broke slightly as you sucked in a breath. â€œI still love you.â€  A brief look of shock crossed his face as he leaned forward. His heart lurched at the words. You still loved him.  â€œWe can figure this outâ€ He reached over taking your hand in his. â€œWe always do.â€  For a moment you considered it. Forgiving him and going back to how things always were. Going back to a place where you were safe and comfortable both of you.  â€œNo.â€ Your voice was quiet as you shook your head. You squeezed his hand. â€œWe canâ€™t.â€  Tears pricked at your eyes as you watched him falter - that spark of hope in his eyes dying.  â€œSweetheartâ€¦â€ He swallowed thickly feeling his words catch in his throat. â€œI want those things I want a family I justâ€¦I canâ€™t leave this behind - at least not yet.â€  Not yet. The words hung heavy.  You nodded. â€œWill you ever be ready?â€  He paused. His eyes flashed with something unrecognisable as he averted his gaze. â€œI donâ€™t know.â€ He whispered after a moment.  The breath seemed to leave your lungs. Every word seemed to break your heart over and over again. You loved him you really did. Dean Winchester truly was the love of your life.  â€œI canâ€™t keep waiting. Youâ€™re pulling me along with promises we both know are only partly true.â€ Pulling yourself to your feet you walked around the table coming to stand in front of him. He looked up his eyes glassy with unleashed tears.  Placing a hand on his cheek you took a minute your eyes traced his face for a moment - taking note of every one of his features.  â€œItâ€™s over Dean.â€  Your words stabbed through his heart. He shook his head.   â€œPlease.â€ You whispered. â€œDonâ€™t make this harder.â€ Your thumb rubbed his cheek. â€œI love you I always will but we donâ€™t work. We both want different things.â€  â€œI want a life with you.â€ He placed a hand over yours. â€œI only want a life with you.â€  â€œI want that too. I want that more than anything but I donâ€™t want to do this forever.â€ You gestured around you. â€œI want a home Dean a proper one.â€  His eyes searched yours for a moment looking for any sign that your words were a lie. â€œOkay.â€ He nodded after a moment. â€œI love you.â€ Dean leaned up his lips meeting yours for a moment before he pulled back.   â€œI love you too.â€ A weak smile crossed your face for a moment before you pulled back.   You stood in silence for a moment longer as you tried to work up the courage to leave. The knife in your heart only continued to twist as you watched him stand. He paused in front of you for a moment his eyes taking you in for one last time before he brushed past you one of his hands wiping at his eyes.  You watched him go your heart finally shattering as he disappeared around the corner taking your heart with him.

post_body: The Celebrity Next Door: Chapter 17- Defending Love Pairings: Jensen Ackles x Reader  Chapter Summary: Y/N will do anything for her new family even if it means cutting off those who wonâ€™t support them.  Warnings: Angst panic attack sadness super sad.  Series Masterlist here!! & Main masterlist here!  <!-- more --> â€œTheyâ€™re not your family.â€ â€œThe only reason Jensen is here is for his flavour of the month.â€  â€œIt wonâ€™t last. You two wonâ€™t last.â€  Every time someone doubted Jensen and I those thoughts echoed in my head. I hated feeling this anxious and overwhelmed. Normally I could handle my tough days but now everything felt fragile.  My anxiety only amplified when I had something real to lose. Jensen and I had something strong and deep. Just the idea of messing it all up made me nervous and scared.   I had mixed feelings about ow Jensen affected me. I hated how much I loved him and how I felt like I was never good enough. Instead of being happy he chose me over everyone else I kept feeling like I wasnâ€™t worth it.   I donâ€™t know how long I walked but it was late. The city was lit up but the sky was dark. I ended up at the park by the water where I used to go to find some peace and quiet surrounding myself with alone time. But now I didnâ€™t want to be alone. I wanted Jensen with me. I really did but the words that tortured my mind were still there constantly. It wasnâ€™t fair for him to do this to be with somebody like me.   My phone buzzed over and over. I pulled it out and sighed when I saw many missed messages-some from friends some from family and most from Jensen.   I knew I couldnâ€™t ignore him. He was probably at my parents house worried sick just like when I cut my foot and he wouldnâ€™t leave-heâ€™s always dramatic but caring.  It didnâ€™t take long before I heard him rushing toward me. He came running out of breath and hugged me tightly to his chest.  I tried to keep it together. It was hard enough to have his conversation with him and only became more difficult the more he comforted me. But I couldnâ€™t hold back anymore. Jensenâ€™s comforting smell and touch made me break down in tears. The sobs wracked through my body it was painful and earth shattering I felt like this feeling was going to kill me.  He held me close kissing my head over and over trying to pull me back to him. Eventually my tears slowed and he lifted my chin to look at him worried and loving.  â€œJensen we canâ€™t keep doing this.â€ I asked shaking my head.  He flinched hurt by my words. â€œWhat? Move to Texas? I told you we can take it slow.â€  I pulled away and walked towards the river. â€œNo this. Us.â€  He looked heartbroken as he came closer touching my arm gently. â€œPlease.. Donâ€™t say that. I love you.â€  I turned to face him feeling guilty and ashamed. â€œYou think you love me but maybe I just took advantage when you were vulnerable I entered at a really tough time in your life.â€  He reached out to hold me again. â€œPlease honey Thatâ€™s not true. You know how much I love you I wanted this I want you. Your mind is just beating you up please you have to trust me.â€  I held back a sob and winced at the look on his face so hurt and vulnerable. I wanted to hold him to hug him tight but I knew it wasnâ€™t right-I wasnâ€™t right.  I put on a fake smile and gently pushed him back. â€œItâ€™s okay Jensen we got caught up in the feeling of having somebody there but Iâ€™m not right for you. This isnâ€™t right.â€  He stood there quietly as I walked away my heart shattering as I felt like it might be really over. This was for the bestâ€¦ Right?  Wrong.  Jensenâ€™s arm wrapped around mine as he spun me to face him his eyes filled with hurt and anger. â€œNo. NO! Youâ€™re wrong. I love you so much but come on. You know us! Just for one moment forget everything thatâ€™s been said. Forget about my stupid titles or how our relationship started. When itâ€™s just us you know how I feel about you. You know itâ€™s real. Pleaseâ€¦â€  I listened carefully as his words swirled in my mind. Closing my eyes I visualized exactly what he meant. The moments in bed the kisses the tight embraces. The way he looked at me as if I were a priceless work of art. His deep care his unwavering fight for us. He was right. This was real. My doubts were tearing us apart and I couldnâ€™t let that happen anymore.  Taking a step closer I noticed him swallow hard struggling to contain his emotions. Tears filled my eyes as I smiled reaching for his hand. â€œJensen when I met you I expected the stars and maybe some planets. I never imagined youâ€™d give me the whole galaxy. Youâ€™ve given me everything. You are everything. Iâ€™m just scared youâ€™ll regret this or realize iâ€™m too much that Iâ€™m falling apart.â€  He pulled me close his voice cracking body trembling. â€œYou are everything and more. Youâ€™re too good for me but here you are-mine. I could never regret this or walk away from you. You saved me.â€  I nodded resting my head against his chest finding comfort in his warmth. Wrapping my arms around him I sighed. â€œIâ€™m sorry. Iâ€™m so sorry Jensen.â€  He kissed my head deeply. â€œDonâ€™t apologize. I love you baby forever.â€  â€œI love you too Jensen.â€  He stood upright wiping his tears with a smile. â€œShould we go back? Youâ€™re familyâ€™s probably worried.â€  I sighed and nodded. â€œYeah we should. Iâ€™m not ready but we should.â€  â€œIâ€™ve got your back honey. Youâ€™re not alone.â€  Not alone. Never again.  Returning to the house filled me with dread. After talking with Jensen and calming down I realized how wrong they really were. They didnâ€™t know me anymore know us. I had changed Jensen had changed me and this family had changed me. If they couldnâ€™t support that I was ready to say goodbye right then and there.  I held Jensenâ€™s hand tightly as we entered the home instantly my family rushed towards me one by one. Christina was first tears streaking her cheeks. She had always been a sweetheart craving love and acceptance. So when Stephanie and our parents yelled at one of us she sided with them out of fear of rejection or being different. I could tell she was genuinely sorry as she hugged me tightly.   â€œIâ€™m so so sorry.â€  Returning her hug I sighed. â€œI know. But what you all said was harsh and untrue. Do you understand that?â€  She nodded firmly tears still flowing. â€œI do. We were out of line completely.â€  My mom and dad approached Jensen and I â€œWe support whatever you two decide. Weâ€™ll be there for you okay?â€  I nodded wiping away a tear from my face. I glanced at Stephanie scoffing internally. The thing I learned about Stephanie was that sometimes she could be a very bitter opinionated and stubborn person. She always believed she was right needing to be taught why her words or actions hurt others.  Turning away I began to climb the stairs. â€œI forgive you guys of course. Youâ€™re my family. But Jensen is my family too. His kids are my family. I wonâ€™t choose which family to be with.â€  Stephanie finally spoke up anger in her voice. â€œBecause youâ€™ll chose them?â€  Glaring at her I smirked. â€œYes Iâ€™ll chose them. And unlike you Stephanie choosing them doesnâ€™t mean excluding those who want to be included. But those who donâ€™t support us or arenâ€™t a good influence on MY family? I wonâ€™t hesitate to cut them out. Donâ€™t test me.â€  With that I walked upstairs heading to the childrenâ€™s room upstairs. Leaning against the doorway I watched them play engaged in their silly games and conversations and I couldnâ€™t help but smile.  They might not be mine but I was going to treat them like they were. Iâ€™d do anything for them thatâ€™s what family did.  And they were mine.  Thank you for reading I hope you enjoyed it! Chapter 18 coming soon stay tuned!
