Actually a lot of stuff happened then that year was wild.â€  â€œLucifer will have an army of Demons.â€ Dean said because if he didnâ€™t stay focused he was going to end up following Dannyâ€™s rabbit trails till the world ended.  â€œYeah thatâ€™s not ideal. Freeing a lot of possessed people is a lot harder than wack-a-mole skeleton edition.â€  â€œIâ€™m not going to ask.â€ Sam returns to the table. He probably came to the same conclusion about Dannyâ€™s stories a few months ago. â€œThat was Travis he wants us to look into something.â€  â€œNow?â€ Danny asks.  â€œYeah thereâ€™s this guy Jack Montgomery has something going on with him.â€  â€œOkay 1 problem.â€ Danny continues.  â€œWhat kind of problem?â€  â€œOh not a problem for you Dean. But I have a sister who has this friend see. And she spent all of yesterday warding off marked spirits and he hasnâ€™t called her back after playing phone tag all day.  Sam swore. Fumbling to get his phone back out of his pocket. His brother had been a mess yesterday. Heâ€™d leave a voicemail but be in a situation while she called back. Heâ€™d gotten a voicemail after the witnesses were released heâ€™d left a voice-mail then too. Apparently the loverbirds hadnâ€™t actually spoken yet.  "Oooh Sammyâ€™s in the doghouse huh?â€  â€œNot yet Iâ€™m supposed to drag him home first.â€  Dean grinned â€œDo I get to meet the lovely Lady?"   "I think youâ€™ll have too though seriously sheâ€™ll understand it if this is time sensitive. Mind if I tag along?â€  â€œNot at all Sammyâ€™s a trouble magnet. He could use all the help he could get.â€  â€”  â€œDonâ€™t you love when this stuff mean spying on a man in his own home.â€ Danny deadpans. Heâ€™s not using the binoculars holding them like theyâ€™re personally offensive.   â€œThere are worse parts of the job.â€ Dean reminds him Jack Montgomery is rummaging through his fridge. â€œThis guy? I mean this guyâ€™s boringâ€  â€œI donâ€™t know Dean. Travis seemed pretty sure.â€  â€œDid he give any indication of what weâ€™re supposed to beâ€” oh.â€  Oh was correct. Dean watched Montgomery just abandon the leftovers and start in on a pack of ground beef. Raw ground beef.  â€œIâ€™d say that qualifies as weird.â€ Sam notes. Like that needed to be said.  â€”  â€œThanks for helping out an old man. Iâ€™m a little uh shorthanded.â€ Travis lifts his cast covered atm and They laugh politely at the bad joke. Then he gets straight to the point and Deanâ€™s glad theyâ€™re done pretending to catch up. Itâ€™s awkward with Danny lurking behind them. â€œYou track down Montgomery?â€  â€œYeah we found him at his home.â€ Sam tells him.  â€œAnd?â€  â€œWell he had a hell of a case of the munchies topped off with a burger he forgot to cook.â€  â€œThatâ€™s him alright.â€  â€œWhatâ€™s him?â€  â€œBoys we got a rougarou on our hands.â€  â€œA rougarou?â€ Dean looks to Sam for a convenient monster summary(or movie title that would work too.). Sam gives him nothing. â€œIs that made up? That sounds made up.â€  â€œTheyâ€™re mean nasty little suckers. Rotted teeth wormy skin the works.â€ Travis tells them.  â€œWell that ainâ€™t this guy. I mean he was wearing a cellphone on his belt.â€  â€œHeâ€™ll turn ugly soon enough. They start out human for all intents and purposes.â€  â€œSo what?â€ Sam asks â€œThey go through some kind of metamorphosis?â€  â€œYep like a maggot turning into a bull fly.â€  â€œNo need to be cruel.â€ Danny chides. Travis pauses looks at Danny with an expression thats not quite a sneer. Dean really hopes thatâ€™s not gonna become a problem.  â€œTheyâ€™re hungry things.â€ Trevor continues ignoring the kidâ€™s glare. â€œFirst for everything until they get a taste for human flesh. Once they get a taste they transform. One biteâ€™s all it takes. Eyes teeth skin; all turns. No going back either. They feed once theyâ€™re a monster forever. And our man Jackâ€™s headed there on a bullet train.â€  â€œWell howâ€™d you find this guy if heâ€™s a walking talking human?â€ Dean demands.  â€œLets just say it runs in his family.â€  â€œYou mean uhâ€¦â€ Sam trails off.  â€œKilled his daddy back in '78. Son of a bitch mangled 8 bodies before I put him down. Guy used to be a dentist. Cadillac trophy wifeâ€¦ Little did I know pregnant trophy wife. She put the boy up for adoption. By the time I found out he was long gone lost in the system.â€  The air in the room changes this time in a way thatâ€™s familiar. The unspoken threat loomsâ€¦   â€œYou mean to tell me you couldnâ€™t find someone?â€ Sam asks undeterred. Sam doesnâ€™t feel it.  Travis sighs. â€œIâ€™m not sure I wanted to. The idea of hunting down some poor kidâ€¦ I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d have the heart. No. I wanted to wait make damn sure I had the right man. Apparently I do.â€  The air itself has teeth and breathing takes effort. Travis doesnâ€™t notice either. He takes a swig of his beer.  â€”  Travis might not notice that Danny is friggen weird but after the comment earlier he does notice that the kid is incredibly uncomfortable. He singles the kid out to prep the flame throwers not letting him escape with Sam.   Dean took a chance and elbowed the kid in his side hard enough to hurt but not hard enough to bruise. Made a face at him and the kid had quit messing with the roomâ€™sâ€¦ well the roomâ€™s vibes .   Travis seemed under the impression that Danny was just new to this life and Dean would prefer to keep it that way.  â€œSo fire huh?â€ Theyâ€™d been subjected to a few stories of past hunts and the kid had withdrawn more with each of them. Dean wants to change the subject but canâ€™t find a natural way to do so. Better they stay focused on this.  â€œThe only way I found to kill these bastards; deep-fry 'em.â€  â€œWell thatâ€™s gonna beâ€¦â€ He glanced at the kid. â€œhorrible. Is that what you did to Jackâ€™s dad?â€  â€œUh-huhâ€ Travis starts and Dean realizes he's being an idiot. Thatâ€™s just gonna get a more on topic gruesome story but Sam best baby brother in the world saves them.   He walks through the door with an accusation. â€œNot wasting any time are you?"   "None to waste.â€ Travis informs them. â€œThe guy hulks out we wonâ€™t be finding bodies just remains.â€  Sam sits down next to the table in a controlled movement. Heâ€™s forcing himself to act calm. â€œWhat if he doesnâ€™t hulk out? I did a little homework. Uh Iâ€™ve been checking out the lore on rougarous.â€  Dannyâ€™s head shoots up. It reminds Dean of caged animal seeing possible freedom.  â€œWhat? My 30 years of experience not good enough for you?â€ Travis demands.  â€œWhat? No. No I-I- I just wanted to be prepared. I mean not that you didnâ€™tâ€¦â€  â€œSam loves research. He does. He keeps it under his mattress right next to his KY. Itâ€™s a sickness.â€ He looks over at Sam hiding the rescue with some teasing. â€œIt is.â€  â€œLook everything you said checked out of course but uh. I found a couple of interesting stories about people who have this rougarou gene or whatever. See they start to turn but they never take the final step.â€  â€œReally?â€  â€œSee if they never eat human flesh they donâ€™t fully transform.â€ Well no wonder their monster-adjacent friend is freaked. Maybe heâ€™s something similar hanging onto his humanity with everything he can?   â€œSo what? Go vegan stay human?â€  â€œBasically. Or in this case eat a lot of raw meat just notâ€¦â€  â€œRight.â€  â€œGood on you for the due diligence Sam.â€ Travis gets up to pace the room. Its unnecessarily dramatic. â€œBut those are fairy tales. Fact is every rougarou I ever saw or heard ofâ€¦ took that bite.â€  â€œOkay well that doesnâ€™t mean that Jack will.â€ Sam stands too.   â€œSo what do we do? Sit and hope and wait for a body count?â€  â€œNo we talk to him. Explain whatâ€™s happening. That way he can fight it.â€  â€œFight it?â€ Travis laughs. â€œAre you kidding me? You ever been really hungry? I mean havenâ€™t-eaten-in-days hungry?â€  â€œYeah.â€ Dean answers Danny nods too.   â€œYeah. Right then. So somebody slaps a big juicy sirloin in front of you you walking away?â€  â€œNoâ€ Dean mutters because he wouldnâ€™t.  â€œDepends.â€ Danny challenges.â€ You know what happens if you eat that big hearty meal? If you havenâ€™t eaten in days ?â€  â€œUh no.â€ Dean was never been allowed to eat what he wants after the few times heâ€™d been starving.   â€œYou get sick.â€ Sam answers. Ok that was probably explained to him he just remembers being hungry and grouchy about it.   Danny nods â€œIf you havenâ€™t eaten in days and you have the right information you eat something small and light that seems unsatisfying until youâ€™ve gotten it all down. You donâ€™t risk tearing open your stomach lining. And besides! How would you know about rougarouâ€™s who donâ€™t turn?! People arenâ€™t going to announce their fantasies of eating people! Theyâ€™re could be generations who resist and theyâ€™d look just like everyone else!â€  â€œAnd you donâ€™t know that theyâ€™re are.â€ He looks between the two of them. â€œIâ€™m sorry. Iâ€™m sure heâ€™s a stand-up guy but itâ€™s pure base instinct. Everything in natureâ€™s gotta eat. You think he can stop himself 'cause heâ€™s nice?â€  â€œCoconut milk.â€ Danny declares and Dean almost laughs. He lets the absurd statement sink in for a moment before he continues. â€œCoconut milk can be used as a substitute for blood. There are vampires who live off it. They get night jobs and exist exactly like everyone else. Youâ€™ve had what twenty years? Youâ€™ve just been waiting for this guy to crack did you bother to look? Did you ask why a rougarou might crave human flesh?   â€œBecause when we crave salt or red meat or whatever itâ€™s usually because the body is lacking in the nutrients it needs! This all might get solved by giving him a vitamin supplement!â€  â€œWe try to help him.â€ Sam declares. â€œAnd weâ€™re not gonna kill him unless he does something to get killed for."   â€”  Danny didnâ€™t make jokes when talking to Jack Montgomery. The seriousness was almost as jarring as the conversation.  See Deanâ€™s plan had gone something like this:   1.)Tell the guy what he is.   2.)Convince him they arenâ€™t insane.  3.)Tell him not to eat people or theyâ€™d be back.  Repeat step 2 as needed.  Danny started similarly steps 1 and 2 are the same but step 3â€¦  "Youâ€™re not alone. There are people I can put you in contact if you want. They might not be the same species but theyâ€™ll have similar experiences. They might have other suggestions that will help.â€  Danny has a list of substitutes advice a food journal to track what works better or worse. That conversation leads into another and another of things that might alleviate that hunger. Then how they leaveâ€¦  â€œI donâ€™t need to tell you why you shouldnâ€™t eat human flesh. You obviously already know. But I will warn you about the change. 'A tasteâ€™ is what the stories say and I donâ€™t know if that means a bite or mearly a drop of blood But if the change happens it cannot be undone.â€  And Jack nods solemn. He makes his promise and he thanks them.  â€”  Itâ€™s Mrs. Montgomery who finds them hours later. She finds them by asking the dinerâ€™s patrons â€œWho owns that awful van?!â€  And Danny the only one in town with a van that awful raises his hand.   Sheâ€™s confused and frantic but she knows her husband thought they could help withâ€¦ itâ€™s unclear what Jack told her whether half truth or blatant lie but now everything has fallen apart.   â€”  Travisâ€™ car is in the driveway.  They donâ€™t have to break into the house. Even if they hadnâ€™t had the keys the back door is already broken in.   Itâ€™s not a surprise when they find a body. Itâ€™s a carved up corpse not a charcoaled one.   â€œWhat happened?â€ Danny isnâ€™t asking them.   â€”  â€œHeâ€™s not a hunter is he?â€ Dean asks his brother. They watch from a room away as Jack Montgomery and Danny Fenton speak in hushed urgent tones. When Jack had turned into the livingroom Sam had flinched and Dean had curled his lip in disgust. Danny hadnâ€™t reactioned and Jack had noticed. So now Danny was the only one worthy of whatever this conversation was.  â€œHe calls himself an electrician that knows too much.â€ Sam answers.   â€œHow much do you know about how he works?â€  â€œâ€¦enough.â€  "Samâ€¦ I donâ€™t think heâ€™s human.â€  Sam looks at him watches his face as he asks â€œand if heâ€™s not?â€  â€œI donâ€™t know Sammy. I wouldnâ€™t say heâ€™s hurting anybody.â€  â€œDean I think thereâ€™s some things we need to talk aboutâ€¦â€  â€œWhat?â€  â€œNot here not now. â€ Sam gestured to the bloody mess on the ground and the still blood covered man in the kitchen. â€œWhen this is sorted we need to talk about what happened while you were dead.â€  â€”  â€œHeâ€™s going to clean himself up and pack.â€ Danny tells them. â€œThen weâ€™re going to pick up his wife see what she wants to do then weâ€™re going. Iâ€™ll meet you at Jazzâ€™s.â€  â€œYouâ€™re taking him to the Coconut Vampires.â€ Dean predicted.   â€œYeah.â€ Danny didnâ€™t elaborate further.   â€œHow does that work? What if one of 'em falls off the rails or something?â€  â€œThey deal with their own.â€  â€œRightâ€¦ Sam you still have Lenoreâ€™s number?â€  â€œYeahâ€  Dean nods to him and steps back out of earshot. Lenore the leader of the Cattle-Blood-Instead-of-Human-Blood Vampires probably needed to be in touch with the Coconut Vampires. Dean never asked Sam where they went didnâ€™t need to know. Dean knew then if heâ€™d known where heâ€™d be compelled to check in person and they didnâ€™t need him poking through all their business. Sam kept track of the missing persons numbers where they stayed and they hadnâ€™t needed to follow up.  He doesnâ€™t have high hopes for Jack not really but those two do and others do. Castiel was right he doesnâ€™t have much faith and the least he can do to avoid spreading his doubt all over the place. Maybe theyâ€™ll prove him wrong.  He hopes they prove him wrong.

Years of mutual longing and angst culminate in a passionate steamy and drunken first kiss and Cas and Dean are on the way to the restroom to truly make this a night to remember when they are interrupted by a bone-chilling scream. post_body: Darwinâ€™s Theory Summary: In an attempt to climb ranks Crowley contracts an ex-hunter to aid in his ambition but manages to go through more than he bargained for  Word count: 9.7k  Rating: Teens and up  Warnings: descriptions of violence  Triggers: none  Characters: Crowley Y/n mentions of Lilith Oc Issac  Relationships: Reader/Crowley Crowley/OC (3rd person POV)  Tags: lemon Mild injury Reader-Insert  A/n: Iâ€™m thankful @crowleybigbang for letting me participate. Iâ€™ve never actively participated on tumblr before so it was a nice change. The stress I had writing this was unbelievable but as a fanatic Iâ€™d take any excuse to write about my favorites     <!-- more --> Bars were always familiar comforting even but this bar was fancier than the ones Y/n grew up with. A very different crowd and a lot cleaner. She could practically see her face on every surface. The view might have been enjoyable had she not been working.  â€If I looked that good I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d stop looking either.â€  Her eyes shifted to the manâ€™s reflection before finally looking up and locking eyes. She ran her finger around the rim of her glass.  â€Maybeâ€ He clears his throat. â€œItâ€™s the design. Countertopâ€™s made from granite. Makes it durable wonâ€™t scratch easy hard to stain and-â€œ His eyes search hers nervously. "Iâ€™m sorry I just canâ€™t think of an excuse good enough to talk to someone like you.â€  â€œWell Iâ€™ll give you an opening thenâ€ She smiles leaning forward with her hands intertwined as she jokingly whispers. â€œIâ€™ve never really been here before so I only picked what I know. You could help recommend a drink.â€  Immediately he nodded to the bartender hoisting his glass. â€œGet her what Iâ€™m having will you?â€ He smiles at her. â€œYouâ€™ll love it.â€  "I usually just drink Craig"   They turned to the new voice. The accent noticeable rolling off the tongue smoothly nice black suit. His entirety demanded attention. "The old stuff is really the only drink worth taking. 30 years aged at least if you want perfection.â€  â€œYour opinion Iâ€™m sure. My recommendation is more than pleasant for a first drink.â€  â€œYes well you also thought going after a woman with that wedding ring imprint still present was a good idea.â€ He smiles at his drink amused before looking at Y/n. â€œIâ€™d be hesitant to approach him for that if I was you love. Clearly just took it off for the night hoping someone like yourself would come along.â€œ  Y/n gaps at the strangerâ€™s uncalled outing. The married man too embarrassed to come up with a defense decided to stumble away. She didnâ€™t make an effort to call after him she couldnâ€™t afford to. A whole monthâ€™s worth of tracking and taking behavioral notes all flushed down the drain just like that. The only thing working as planned was the free drink the bartender barely managed to place in front of her. Improvising wasnâ€™t a foreign concept but nonetheless she was willing. "Thanks for that.â€ She started softly glancing at him.  â€œNo worries.â€œ He dismissed. "Doubt he would have made good company anyway.â€  â€œI guess itâ€™s just bad luck on my part.â€ Resting her chin on her palm she looked around before settling her eyes back to her drink.   â€œPerhaps.â€ He looks at her smiling. â€œNonetheless if Iâ€™m not pushing luck of my own I was wondering if I can buy you another round?â€  It surprised her a rather bold move scaring a man away only to move in himself. At least she was subtle about it. Then again him showing interest first helps. She smiles knitting her brows slightly. She admits the other man although shady had a good taste. She liked the evenness of the bittersweet taste on her tongue. â€œThank you but I just got this drink.â€  â€œI mean the next one is on me. If youâ€™re willing to stick around after that mishap. Besides Iâ€™d be more at ease if you did itâ€™s not really safe to drink alone. Unless of courseâ€ His brows went up as she naturally crossed her legs taking the bait. His eyes trailed from her heels to her eyes slowly. â€œYouâ€™re one of those women who can hold her own?â€  â€œIs that such a bad thing?â€ She laughs lightly.  â€œItâ€™s dangerousâ€ His grin widens as he hears her laugh. â€œA girl better said a girl as pretty as you not afraid of getting herself in trouble? Itâ€™s a recipe for disaster.â€  â€œWhatâ€™s the point of living if you have to be afraid all the time? Looking over your shoulder like that?â€  â€Hardly a life at all.â€ He agrees.  â€œAre you gonna give me a name or are you just a passing stranger giving advice?â€ Y/n scoffs a smile. She needed a false sense of trust a name could be just as powerful as anything. How you use it. How you say it.  â€œCrowleyâ€ he answered bluntly. â€œMay I know yours?â€  â€Y/nâ€ she gives her hand despite the late introduction.  â€Y/nâ€ He repeats taking her hand in his in a more gentlemanly manner bringing it up to his lips for a light kiss on her knuckles never breaking his gaze. â€œSeems like a perfect fit.â€ He grins.  There was a small tightness in her stomach. She found herself forgetting her job for a second. When was the last time she actually enjoyed a guy rather than screwing him over for his money?  â€œThank you Mr.Crowley.â€ Then again she was barely grazing the top with this guy.  â€œYouâ€™re very welcome.â€ Dark eyes such a deep brown looking back into hers. Thereâ€™s just a few things I have to do first before I can fully grant such a thing. Even we have people we need to answer to.â€  â€What like the devil?â€  â€She-devil more like. Hell works like an office there are bosses workers and some that are just considered dispensable.â€ he huffs amused. â€œLilith the first demon in existence was meant to continue his work of corruption so she created a system. Itâ€™s sales darling if anything think of it as us doing a favor. One last big hurrah where the most certainly already dammed can ask for anything indulge themselves in their most craved dreams before their lightâ€™s snuffed out.â€  â€œMy soul-â€œ  â€Would be completely untouchable weâ€™ll add it to your little list of demands. Only as long as youâ€™re employed under me.â€ He says seriously. â€œSo?â€  She looks around. People still very lively enjoying their evenings. â€œIâ€¦Iâ€™ll sleep on it.â€  Crowley doesnâ€™t remember the last time a deal caused him so much frustration let alone a human. Usually the common go-to rule when it came to forced deals with hunters was to use someone or something they cared about as leverage but this particular deal was important. He needed her to willingly surrender to him. It was all he could think about nowadays. Though he didnâ€™t have the patience for it he endures giving her a smile in response. â€œOf course You do that.â€              She couldnâ€™t sleep she didnâ€™t even bother changing. The most effort she made getting home was taking off her heels and placing Crowleyâ€™s gift back in its box letting it stare at her mockingly on the coffee table of her living room. It was stupid for her to even sit here and actually think about it.  Immunity?  luxuries?  The idea was greedy selfish and everything else a hunter should strive to stray from. Conversing with a demon of all things. Any hunter would be after her if they ever found out. What if her dad found out?  â€œItâ€™s none of his business anywayâ€ she tells herself. Raising her beer to her lips. This wasnâ€™t something sheâ€™d bother him with. To be honest she didnâ€™t want to see him at all.  Y/n jumps slightly hearing something upstairs. She places the beer down carefully before bending slowly getting a shotgun she had under the couch. It wasnâ€™t every day that she had personal visitors especially not with how she kept moving about. She went up the stairs carefully trying her best to step lightly but move fast enough to not let the wood creak too much under her weight. She can hear the flicker of a lighter clicking in her room. She pokes her head in with the gun close to her.   A man probably in his 30s dark blue suit his hair slicked back neatly as he took a drag of his cigarette. He smiles immediately as he looks her over. â€œA L/n as I live and breathe- well yâ€™know as close as I can get to it right?â€  â€Who are you?â€ She pumps the gun a round ready.  â€Easy honey Iâ€™m a friend of Crowleyâ€™s so to speak. Nameâ€™s Issac.â€ He leans against the wall. He glances at the window seal seeing the salt lined up only a part of it disturbed clearly done from the inside. â€œI couldnâ€™t help but notice it. I mean hunters are cautious by nature. Every nook and cranny was covered in salt except this window.â€ He tilts his head at her smirking. â€œAnd in the bedroom no less. Câ€™mon doll I knew Crowleyâ€™s been working an angle with you but I wouldnâ€™t think heâ€™d get you so riled up.â€  Her grip on the gun tightened as she glanced at the salt. â€œHe hasnâ€™t.â€  "Really?â€ He squints. â€œI mean from what I heard hell from what I saw. Almost felt like I was supposed to turn away or something. It was like some ridiculous attempt at an affair.â€  â€œWhat is it with you demons and spying?â€  â€œI donâ€™t know. Probably gotta do with our nature. Common excuse you hear with these folk y'know? Hunters and demons go a long way. Prey and predator. That thin line constantly being played with like some kind of schoolgirlâ€™s jump rope. Though we still got the upper hand ya like to fight back.â€ He briefly frowns as he brings the cigarette back to his lips. â€œAlways fighting back.â€  â€œWhat are you going on about?â€  â€I just sayinâ€™ I know my onions.â€  â€What?â€ She didnâ€™t like him. Not like this in the temp home she managed to get her hands on in this town. Dealing with demons was unsettling in general. No matter who they were or what meat suit they decided to wear.  â€Iâ€™ma be honest here with you L/n I donâ€™t like him. I donâ€™t like the smirk on his stupid face or his voice always complaining questioning one thing after another and you-â€œ Issac points. â€œYouâ€™ve been his latest obsession and to be honest the second I heard your name-â€œ  Y/n shifts as he takes his time to look her over. Her finger was ready on the trigger. She knew salt wouldnâ€™t kill a demon but a part of her hoped it would hurt him enough. Maybe even inspire a few rounds to go off.  â€œYour popsâ€  â€What about him.â€ She demands quickly.  â€œHe was quite the hunter but he really never knew how to keep that nose of his in his own business. One time he managed to trap me left me to rot forâ€¦.fuck months I think?â€ A laugh erupted from his throat as he shakes his head. â€œCan you imagine that? Itâ€™s like a rat outsmarting a cat leaving â€˜em in a small confined cage. Itâ€™s just not natural.â€  â€Do you have a point here?â€ Her jaw flexed slightly.   â€œAs I said I hate him. And seeing that you are who you are he canâ€™t have you so I got a counteroffer. You wonâ€™t know it and I doubt Crowley would have explained it but we got our own ranks within ranks. I happen to be a higher rank than him so any â€˜protectionâ€™ he offered you would be more guaranteed.â€  â€How do I know if youâ€™re lying or not?â€  â€You donâ€™t but thatâ€™s half the fun isnâ€™t it?â€ Issac taps his cigarette the ash falling into the pot of a plant she had. â€œThat bastard has been a pain since he first arrived. Heâ€™s like a dog doing extra spins to see if his master gives him another treat. Tryna make himself a favorite look Lilith I got the moon for you.â€  â€The moon?â€  â€œNot as impressive as it sounds I promise you. â€˜Sides Iâ€™ll get my bossâ€™s favor in a snap. You just gotta play nice for me.â€œ He smirks. "And help me get rid of that demon of course. Though to find something that can actually get the job done not the easiest thing to come by.â€  â€œYou wanna get rid of Crowley?â€ She looks him over. â€œFor good?â€  â€œYeahâ€ Issac scoffs. â€œCanâ€™t have him rat me out. Even if he lets me have it heâ€™ll find a way to benefit from it. Fucking parasite.â€  â€œHave what?â€  â€The colt Y/n I know you have it. Your dad took it then placed it â€˜Somewhere safeâ€™. Took me a while but what better place than a hunter always on the move? It doesnâ€™t stay in one area youâ€™re not actively in the hunter business so thereâ€™s less of a chance of a supernatural encounter. It all clicks. Now be a doll and hand it over.â€  She could play dumb. She should play dumb but she had to take into consideration he might already know where. Especially since he admitted to stalking there was no telling how long. â€œOver my dead body.â€  â€œyâ€™knowâ€ Issac sighs. â€œI was absolutely baffled when he told me his idea. Getting a dame to lure in anyone willing to trade for a measly ten years of whatever the hell they ask for. I thought to myself â€˜Why doesnâ€™t this idiot just posses a nice lookinâ€™ chick and do the same?â€™ I know a handful of demons who play with different meat suits to get targets.â€ He nods his head to her the action sending her back into the wall making her drop the shotgun. His lips twitched up slightly wetting his bottom lip as he watched her try to regain the breath that was knocked out of her.  â€œBut it wasnâ€™t just about that. It was the fact that you were human. Selling the idea to them. But youâ€™re a hunter you can think on your feet. Youâ€™d most likely get recognized by other hunters which will set them at ease from suspicion faster and the cherry on top?â€ Issac walks over to her watching her use the nightstand for support as she leans her side on the bed. â€œYouâ€™re a fucking L/n. Thatâ€™s exciting for me at least. The second I heard you were his daughter. I could hardly focus sweetheart.â€  It was rather hypocritical of him to use force when he advised Crowley to do otherwise for favor. Hunters may be human but with what they do and the self-inflicted suffering they put themselves through he couldnâ€™t help but place them as an entirely different species of their own. He pushed her to the bed by her neck pushing his body weight on her slightly. Her hands instinctively gripped his wrist wanting him to let go. His own breath hitched at the sight. He loved it when they squirmed. Though the defiance on her face was clear.  â€œYouâ€™re gonna do it or are you gonna bitch some more?â€ She managed to get out despite the pain of being tossed around.  â€œHuh guess the apple doesnâ€™t fall far from the tree does it? Always havinâ€™ something to say despite being completely backed into a corner. Do you know how many deals he cost me?â€œ His grip tightens leaning in closer. His eyes closed momentarily as the smells flooded in. She took the moment to stretch her foot out to the cup she had on the nightstand knocking it over to spill onto his side.  Issac yells in pain buckling down as the steam erupts from his suit. Y/n forces herself to crawl further up the bed once his grip loosens rolling to the other side to create enough distance for her to think of something.  His groans slowly turn into laughter. "Oh you little-â€ Issac couldnâ€™t smell her father on her. Only a lingering emotional touch enough to know sheâ€™s thought of him but it wasnâ€™t enough to prove he was around. "Hereâ€™s the thing. I am jealous. I know he was close but how close was Crowley to you to get his smell on you?â€  Her eyes narrowed at him. She really was cornered the shotgun was on the other side and so was the door. All she had was a window and not enough salt to close it. Even if she could sheâ€™d be trapped in here with him unless she jumps. The second floor isnâ€™t so bad but the flowers planted below had a brick lining. Jumping on a whim before he could get to her might make for a bad landing.  He forced himself to stand though the holy water still stained his suit. â€œHe was real insistent on it being you. He couldâ€™ve gotten any greedy chick willing to jump at the deal but loyalty is something you canâ€™t always buy. The second thereâ€™s a higher bidder sheâ€™d up and leave. And you wonâ€™t say yes you wonâ€™t give me the gun so what the fuck?â€  This was just a talk she realized. This was his idea of talking. Throwing her around like a rag doll because he was jealous strangling her because he remembered her father. If this was just a talk what was she supposed to expect further down the line with him?  â€œPlus thereâ€™s also your old man right?â€ Issac smirks as her look changes. â€œThere you are. Yâ€™know I can find him again easily make sure heâ€™s red and blue for you before I take my time to really send him off. Or we can make a deal.â€  On one hand she was glad to hear he was alive despite his ways. â€œYou say that like I care. Havenâ€™t been on the best of terms sinceâ€¦ever? It was a great try though. A for effort.â€  What was better? Being in the hands of a demon or death?  â€œSo in conclusion Fuck you.â€ She decides.  He huffs raising his brows in surprise. He nods accepting her answer as he smiles to himself.  â€œOkayâ€ he shrugs. A wave of his hand sent her through the window the glass breaking from the impact. He sighs as he walks over. Eyes trailing over the new injuries she gained her body arched over the plants.   â€œWhat a world.â€           Everyone hates an errand run. There wasnâ€™t much to do but wait for a small delivery to be made. Lilith being stuck in Hell made her reliant on the demons that were out of the gates. Being a woman of deals herself she preferred to use crossroads demons. Though the irony of sending them together to run it didnâ€™t fly over their heads. Sharing subtle glances as Crowley made small talk.   Feeling bored as the time passes Issac moves looking at the abandoned cars around them tools scattered and Graffiti at almost every turn. No doubt proof of the warehouseâ€™s new use as someoneâ€™s hang-out spot.  Eventually a set of other demons came with a chest setting it down and leaving it to them to complete their part.  â€œFinallyâ€ Crowley sighs looking over the chest curiously. â€œWhat do you think it is needing it so badly even if sheâ€™s not up here to get it herself?â€  â€œItâ€™s none of our business is what it is. Weâ€™re not opening it.â€ Issac said bluntly.  â€œNever said we would I just figured if weâ€™re gonna wait for something that long weâ€™d be granted a small note of information or something.â€  â€œYou ever heard of the colt Crowley?â€ He asked out of the blue. â€œNasty little peashooter that can shut down almost any creature a hunter could possibly deal with.â€  â€œI thought that was a nice fairytale hunters liked to go on about when things get desperate.â€ Crowley grabs onto one handle of the chest as Issac picks up the other. Taking the chest to a giant symbol written off in blood on the floor. An entire ritual set up. Both being well versed and educated in more complex magical situations they needed to be the ones to do it.  Crowley never really like doing work like this but better for Lilith than another demon. Crowley had his fair share of bottom-feeding in his past life and he wasnâ€™t willing to take it in this one.  â€œWhatâ€™s the point of creating a gun that only had a handful of rounds? Clearly he had the intention to use it for one troubling thing. Even if the gun was around thereâ€™d hardly be enough bullets for a hunter to make proper use of it in a world crawling with creatures.â€  â€œMaybe it was more so meant for us. Yâ€™know to be haunted by the idea that hunters would have something to go against things like us or hell bigger if there even is such a thing.â€ Issac grunts as they put it down. The candles around them light up automatically. They immediately stopped moving to their positions. Holding their hands up mid-chest muttering the needed words. The chest burned up in flames leaving nothing but a scorch mark behind. â€œHowâ€™s your hunter situation?â€  â€Silent. Though Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™ll be an answer soon.â€  â€Yeah?â€ Issac smiles a bit too contently for Crowleyâ€™s liking. â€œDiamond necklace wasnâ€™t it? Iâ€™m telling ya girls love jewelry. Course huntersâ€™ such as Y/n have an adequate taste yâ€™know?â€ He pulls out the Colt. It didnâ€™t take long for him to find it in her house. Placing it under floorboards was a commendable choice but the bedroom was typical. He watched as Crowley shifted in place more serious though a frown clear on his features. Issac couldnâ€™t decide whether to shoot him in his smart mouth or his heart. The irony of shooting a demonâ€™s â€˜heartâ€™ would only provide him a laugh rather than actual satisfaction.  â€œSeems like I struck a nerve.â€ Crowley hums at the sight. â€œColt Iâ€™m guessing?â€  â€No shit.â€ Issac pulled the trigger.  It was nothing like he thought it would be. There was a loud bang but Crowley only stumbled slightly from the impact. There was no show of anything else no proof the gun being anything but a gun. For a moment Issac thought he felt it but it was his own body jolting at an unfamiliar sensation. He only had a brief moment left to look down and see the bright lights beaming through his veins.  Crowleyâ€™s usual smile returned easily when Issac collapsed. The view of Y/n standing there knife in hand finally in the clothes expected to be seen on a hunter. A grey undershirt her flannel as red as her favorite lipstick heâ€™s always seen her wear. Jeans worn out most likely for repeated wear rather than the use of an aesthetic. Combat boots to endure proper footing if needed in a fight.  In all honesty the sight had been more of a turn-on than her usual dress-ups.  â€œThis must be what damsels feel like when their hero prevails-â€œ  â€Did you know?â€ She didnâ€™t waste time on asking.  â€Knooow?â€  â€About him!â€ She gestured towards the corpse. â€œThe stalking knowledge about the deal-!â€  â€I told you I did my research on you. Issacâ€™s been on my radar for longer than I care to remember. I knew he was going to make a move sooner or later. Though I wasnâ€™t lying I do want that deal settled and your skill set. This was just an added convince.â€  â€œHe threw me out the fucking window of my house!â€  â€My condolences.â€ Crowley paused for a moment. â€œThe colt was an added surprise that wasnâ€™t the real thing I take?â€  â€It was.â€  â€But you did know it had regular bullets yes?â€  She shrugs.  â€And you let him shoot it?!â€ She took pleasure in his offense. Watching him examine where the bullet had hit him.  â€It was an added convenience.â€ She smiles.  â€œMy suitâ€ He huffs.  â€My condolences.â€ She glances at the body again. â€œDo you have to report all that?â€  â€To who?â€  â€Lilith.â€  â€Ahâ€ Crowley simply straightened out his suit. â€œA little betrayal story would go well. I could say he wanted to take her personal delivery case for himself. Add in my attempts with you- only that worth mentioning of course. But I still need that contract sealed beforehand.â€  â€œWhy? Whatâ€™s the point of even mentioning me in all this?â€  â€You want immunity donâ€™t you? This is our ticket in. Iâ€™m shown as a loyal demon youâ€™re shown as an asset and we have ourselves a proper start to a successful system. Soâ€¦.is there a deal?â€  â€What about the colt?â€  â€Iâ€™ll convince her to let me have it stored away for safe keeping though youâ€™d have to hand over the actual bullets it came with. And that knife-â€œ  â€You take it and you can forget it.â€ She steps back instinctively.  â€Fineâ€ He sighs. â€œHard bargain but Iâ€™m willing if it lets you sleep at night. But I do prefer you leave it on the floor or elsewhere before approaching.â€   â€œWhy? Do I have to shake your hand or something?â€  â€œNot exactly.â€ Crowley smiles. â€œListen carefullyâ€ he moves to her. â€œThis deal is binding. From this moment onward you will be under my employment. You will do whatever I ask of you. There will be no refusal when I demand something of you. Except for the little list of conditions you decided upon beforehand. Good enough?â€  She nodded hesitantly. Even now it felt wrong.  His hand tightened across the back of her hip as he leaned in close to her. His lips brush against hers at first before quickly locking their lips together. It started out with a quick peck but soon turned into a slow steady rhythm. For a brief moment she gripped his suit pulling him close before pulling away.  â€Congratulations.â€ Crowley licks his lips taking in the taste of her. â€œYou made it past survival.â€
ALT Todayâ€™s poem of the day punched me in the gut and stole my wallet

post_body: Cas needs a win (or some PTOs really) In â€œThe Futureâ€ thereâ€™s a really interesting line that Iâ€™ve overlooked in the past but thatâ€™s actually pretty telling. Cas tells Dean the following:  â€œAnd I just wantedâ€¦ I needed to come back here with a win for you. For myselfâ€.  The â€œfor myselfâ€ is quite an important addition because I think that Cas has a tendency to hide his own personal desires needs and ambitions behind Dean and the importance he places on his relationship with him ( famous examples such as â€œIâ€™m doing this for you Dean. Iâ€™m doing this because of youâ€ â€œI gave everything for you. And this is what you give to me.â€ â€œI cared about the whole world because of youâ€ come to mind).  Now of course in and of itself this is definitely not a negative thing quite the opposite since Dean has indeed been a key factor in Casâ€™ internal and external upheaval. What Iâ€™m trying to say is that this is the most obvious excuse for doing/wanting certain things and it allows Cas to get sort of a free pass instead of explicitly owning his wants and needs. By the way Cas is not shifting the weight of what he thinks are his responsibilities intentionally on Dean but I think he sort of lies to himself and uses the â€œIâ€™m doing this for X reason but certainly not for myselfâ€ card as a coping mechanism against his complicated relationship with power and more importantly with powerlessness.  <!-- more --> So when he says that he needs a win for Dean and then honestly adds that he needs the win for himself too Cas is actually showing growth and vulnerability. Of course this is something that Cas can only share with Dean and Dean only. When Kelvin praises him for his betrayal (â€œCommitting to Joshuaâ€™s plan putting angelkind above the Winchesters. I mean your reputation in Heaven is â€“â€) Cas is super quick to add that heâ€™s NOT doing it for his reputation but heâ€™s doing it for the Winchesters. Which is 100% true but what Cas is obviously omitting here is that heâ€™s doing it because he needs a win. And he needs it badly. But why?  Iâ€™m gonna come out here and say it: I donâ€™t see Cas as a strategist. Like not at all. And if he is I think heâ€™s a very very bad one. Here Iâ€™ve said it. I think Cas is on the exact opposite end of what constitutes a good strategist because heâ€™s a reckless son of a bitch. Heâ€™s exactly what strategists prepare for: heâ€™s the unpredictable the wild card that can turn the fate of a battle in a matter of seconds and the good thing about that is exactly that you donâ€™t know what heâ€™ll do. He doesnâ€™t even know what heâ€™ll do. As a matter of fact Iâ€™ve alwasy found funny when in â€œThe Endâ€ Cas calls 2014!Deanâ€™s plan â€œinsouciantâ€ or â€œrecklessâ€. Because these are the exact same adjectives Iâ€™d use to descrive Casâ€™ plans or Cas in general for that matter.   Having said that war is in Casâ€™ DNA or whatever in his grace perhaps. Therefore Cas is a wavelength of celestial intent that thrives on winning battles and fighting enemies. But thereâ€™s also a streak of ambition and hubris in Cas in that heâ€™s the BAMF that goes against archangels tries to find God by himself and doesnâ€™t shy away from The Darkness herself. One might say he has delusions of grandeur or perhaps heâ€™s a badass with a death wish.   Iâ€™d say all of the above. Because to me one of Casâ€™ defining traits is that he keeps trying. Heâ€™s always ready to raise the stakes and regardless of what he says he does have an inner confidence in himself a secret voice that tells him that he can win. Perhaps this is what makes him so charming to people his aura of badass tormented self-assurance.   In s12 Casâ€™ confidence has taken a real blow heâ€™s scraping the bottom of the barrel. Reasoning in terms of +1 win/-1 fail the season opens with a fat giant -1 for Cas since he wasnâ€™t able to keep Sam safe aka he failed at the one thing Dean asked of him. He gets Dean back though so Iâ€™ll count it as +1 for win. All in all things seem to be okayish.   But theyâ€™re not a-ah! Another -1 is on the horizon as we are reminded that Lucifer is still on the loose and Cas feels guilty over it and yada yada the usual: I have to fix it because itâ€™s my responsibility. So far Casâ€™s still not winning.  I gotta hand it to him Cas showed real maturity when he admitted he could stall Lucifer for 3 minutes. Old Cas wouldâ€™ve just gone in there guns a-blazing no risk assessment and wing it. Iâ€™ll give him a +1 for personal win. However they donâ€™t catch Lucifer and everyone and I mean everyone disagrees with Dean when he calls their little fight a win(â€œWell we didnâ€™t catch Lucifer but we did save the crowd so Iâ€™m gonna call that a win). I agree with Dean but Iâ€™m the only one so Iâ€™m going to give a grand total of 0 because consensus wasnâ€™t reached.  Things escalate quickly from here on: -1 because Kelly escapes on Casâ€™ watch -1 because Dean and Sam get kidnapped and Cas canâ€™t find them -1 because he canâ€™t even solve a vamp case +1 because no Winchester dies but also - a fuckton of cosmic consequences as he kills Billie.   So to sum it up: Casâ€™s still NOT winning. Like at all.  We could hardly call "Lily Sunder has Some Regretsâ€ a win. The episode ends on a hopeful note but Cas is totally pretending and performing for Deanâ€™s sake (â€œLetâ€™s drink and hope we can find a better wayâ€ is such a glaring â€œhe wouldnâ€™t fucking say thatâ€ for Cas that to me itâ€™s clear that heâ€™s just putting up a front for the brothersâ€™ benefit).  Things go from bad to worse in â€œStuck in the Middle with Youâ€ which opens with a bleeding Cas who canâ€™t even walk properly and heâ€™s assisted by Mary while we hear this song in the background:  So come on baby walk with a winner  come on girl walk with a winner  hey girl come on swing along with me thereâ€™ so much to see  great big world for you and me  I love some good irony. All the more so since we know this time Cas is undoubtedly close to dying for realsies.   Cas dying: letâ€™s talk about it. I think it really stung for Cas that he was about to die at the hands of Ramiel skewered like a fish by the lance of Michael (of all angels!) suffering horribly and possibly forced to watch his family get killed in front of his eyes while he canâ€™t do nothing but keep decaying and dying. Love confession aside for a moment this was a low blow in all its possible meanings for poor Castiel. I think that even though he made it out that barn alive something inside of him was really hurt and broken by the modality of the events as they unfolded. He an angel who had fought archangels and won who just managed to confront Lucifer was harpooned like a whale by a Prince of Hell and forced to die in a way that totally incapacitated his ability to protect his family (he couldnâ€™t even self-sacrifice Casâ€™ favorite dish cause he was already SO done for). He hit rock bottom in terms of powerlessness.  So when in â€œSomewhere Between Heaven and Hellâ€ along comes Kelvin I think what truly seduces Cas is not the promise to reunite with and be forgiven by his own family but the promise of power: â€œI donâ€™t. Look I know youâ€™re working with the Winchesters. Sam and Dean â€“ their hearts are in the right place but wouldnâ€™t it be better to have us waiting in the proverbial wings? All the power of Heaven behind you?â€. I think Cas really wants that power he needs it because he needs a win.   Under this light fetus!Jack lending Cas his power to kill another Prince of Hell in lieu of the one who almost got him killed is something way more interesting than the usual â€œhe got brainwashed for the nth timeâ€. Yes true however Cas saying â€œ Iâ€™ve been so lost. Iâ€™m not lost anymore. And I know now that this child must be born with all of his power."is so much more revealing of his character if we consider that Cas finally got his win (heâ€™s not lost anymore) thanks to a borrowed power (he had Jackâ€™s power behind him in the proverbial wings as Kelvin would say) borrowing power from other angels/souls being a thing that Cas does quite frequently on Supernatural lol.  Cas gains his confidence back to the point that heâ€™s back to being reckless and insoucinat with it. While at the beginning of the season he was smart enough to be real and say he could only stall Lucifer for 3 minutes now that heâ€™s got his big win heâ€™s so engrossed with it that he stupidly goes to Apocalypse World armed with a stupid angel blade thinking he can take Lucifer.   Cas needed a win sure but what he truly truly needed were some fucking PTOs from constantly being on the battlefield. Because at the end of the day he sort of got his win but he also eventually got himself dead so what was the point?  I know that on the surface this view might seem to cast a bit of a dark shadow on Casâ€™ personality but I find him so much more interesting when heâ€™s not portrayed as a puppy cute little doggie doing things just because he loves Dean. Of course he does lol but heâ€™s so much more than that and a lot of his character has clearly to do with power and how it corrupts and entices people or well beings in general that I think itâ€™s worth exploring.

post_body: I see a lot of people aligning their favorite characters/plotlines/ships/etc to Taylor Swift but not a lot to Debut so here are some rapid fire multifandom debut thougts:  Shouldâ€™ve Said No doesnâ€™t have to be about cheating. It can also be about saying yes to angel possession. (Specifically I want to say the Casifer arc) Jamie Tartt would be a debut girlie (gn). Especially in his LCA era/the first half of season two. I know this man was streaming The Outside on repeat. Danny hadnâ€™t reactioned and Jack had noticed. What if one of 'em falls off the rails or something?â€  â€œThey deal with their own.â€  â€œRightâ€¦ Sam you still have Lenoreâ€™s number?â€  â€œYeahâ€  Dean nods to him and steps back out of earshot. post_body: Darwinâ€™s Theory Summary: In an attempt to climb ranks Crowley contracts an ex-hunter to aid in his ambition but manages to go through more than he bargained for  Word count: 9.7k  Rating: Teens and up  Warnings: descriptions of violence  Triggers: none  Characters: Crowley Y/n mentions of Lilith Oc Issac  Relationships: Reader/Crowley Crowley/OC (3rd person POV)  Tags: lemon Mild injury Reader-Insert  A/n: Iâ€™m thankful @crowleybigbang for letting me participate. Iâ€™ve never actively participated on tumblr before so it was a nice change. The stress I had writing this was unbelievable but as a fanatic Iâ€™d take any excuse to write about my favorites     <!-- more --> Bars were always familiar comforting even but this bar was fancier than the ones Y/n grew up with. A very different crowd and a lot cleaner. She could practically see her face on every surface. The view might have been enjoyable had she not been working.  â€If I looked that good I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d stop looking either.â€  Her eyes shifted to the manâ€™s reflection before finally looking up and locking eyes. She ran her finger around the rim of her glass.  â€Maybeâ€ He clears his throat. â€œItâ€™s the design. Countertopâ€™s made from granite. Makes it durable wonâ€™t scratch easy hard to stain and-â€œ His eyes search hers nervously. "Iâ€™m sorry I just canâ€™t think of an excuse good enough to talk to someone like you.â€  â€œWell Iâ€™ll give you an opening thenâ€ She smiles leaning forward with her hands intertwined as she jokingly whispers. â€œIâ€™ve never really been here before so I only picked what I know. You could help recommend a drink.â€  Immediately he nodded to the bartender hoisting his glass. â€œGet her what Iâ€™m having will you?â€ He smiles at her. â€œYouâ€™ll love it.â€  "I usually just drink Craig"   They turned to the new voice. The accent noticeable rolling off the tongue smoothly nice black suit. His entirety demanded attention. "The old stuff is really the only drink worth taking. 30 years aged at least if you want perfection.â€  â€œYour opinion Iâ€™m sure. My recommendation is more than pleasant for a first drink.â€  â€œYes well you also thought going after a woman with that wedding ring imprint still present was a good idea.â€ He smiles at his drink amused before looking at Y/n. â€œIâ€™d be hesitant to approach him for that if I was you love. Clearly just took it off for the night hoping someone like yourself would come along.â€œ  Y/n gaps at the strangerâ€™s uncalled outing. The married man too embarrassed to come up with a defense decided to stumble away. She didnâ€™t make an effort to call after him she couldnâ€™t afford to. A whole monthâ€™s worth of tracking and taking behavioral notes all flushed down the drain just like that. The only thing working as planned was the free drink the bartender barely managed to place in front of her. Improvising wasnâ€™t a foreign concept but nonetheless she was willing. "Thanks for that.â€ She started softly glancing at him.  â€œNo worries.â€œ He dismissed.
