She moves away swallowing slightly.  â€œShow what you want at the end of the day youâ€™re still a demon.â€  â€œAnd youâ€™re still a hunter.â€ He sat back down. Taping a glass he claimed near him as a waiter passes them. They both paused as the waiter served him the champagne she selected.   â€œEx-hunter.â€ She corrected.  â€Ex-hunterâ€ He echoes. â€œPerhaps you beautified the packaging but that doesnâ€™t really change what you are. You wouldnâ€™t see me any different had I changed vessels either.â€   Crowley took a sip of his glass slightly savoring it. â€œItâ€™s in your nature to be cautious as it is mine to be deceptive however I wasnâ€™t lying when I said I bring you no harm.â€  â€œCourse you donâ€™t not when you want me to be the one to lead sheep into the slaughterhouseâ€ Knowing he needed her was the only insurance she had to rely on. Despite her stubbornness she knew it was a matter of time before his patience ran thin. The entire idea wasâ€¦she couldnâ€™t accept a deal like this right? Under the principles she was raised with? Not after the people sheâ€™s saved from things like him.   â€œI can understand the hesitation I do.â€ Crowley sighs deeply. "Iâ€™ve run the numbers thought of candidates and it all leads back to you darling so Iâ€™ll be back again and again if need be. The only thing you could do as of now is talk to me.â€  â€Iâ€™m not killing or hurting anyone for you.â€ She says almost immediately.  â€œIâ€™m not asking you toâ€ Crowley shrugs.  â€I wonâ€™t let anyone take me to bed if I donâ€™t want to.â€ She rolls her eyes. â€œI mean I do stuff for this job sure. But I donâ€™t actually go that far with any of it.â€  â€Shame but not entirely unreasonable.â€ He looks her over.  â€œYou said Iâ€™d get immunity from other monsters. Demons are no exceptionsâ€ At this point it sounded like she was placing her own terms and conditions.  â€œCanâ€™t say I didnâ€™t see that one coming back yet Iâ€™m not in the best position to grant you full immunity. At least not until I get my own boss on board with the ideaâ€ He picks up the champagne. It was decent but not exactly the kind heâ€™d go for given the chance.  â€You said-â€œ  â€I know what I said and Iâ€™m sure I can. Thereâ€™s just a few things I have to do first before I can fully grant such a thing. Even we have people we need to answer to.â€  â€What like the devil?â€  â€She-devil more like. Hell works like an office there are bosses workers and some that are just considered dispensable.â€ he huffs amused. â€œLilith the first demon in existence was meant to continue his work of corruption so she created a system. Itâ€™s sales darling if anything think of it as us doing a favor. One last big hurrah where the most certainly already dammed can ask for anything indulge themselves in their most craved dreams before their lightâ€™s snuffed out.â€  â€œMy soul-â€œ  â€Would be completely untouchable weâ€™ll add it to your little list of demands. Only as long as youâ€™re employed under me.â€ He says seriously. â€œSo?â€  She looks around. People still very lively enjoying their evenings. â€œIâ€¦Iâ€™ll sleep on it.â€  Crowley doesnâ€™t remember the last time a deal caused him so much frustration let alone a human. Usually the common go-to rule when it came to forced deals with hunters was to use someone or something they cared about as leverage but this particular deal was important. He needed her to willingly surrender to him. It was all he could think about nowadays. Though he didnâ€™t have the patience for it he endures giving her a smile in response. â€œOf course You do that.â€              She couldnâ€™t sleep she didnâ€™t even bother changing. The most effort she made getting home was taking off her heels and placing Crowleyâ€™s gift back in its box letting it stare at her mockingly on the coffee table of her living room. It was stupid for her to even sit here and actually think about it.  Immunity?  luxuries?  The idea was greedy selfish and everything else a hunter should strive to stray from. Conversing with a demon of all things. Any hunter would be after her if they ever found out. What if her dad found out?  â€œItâ€™s none of his business anywayâ€ she tells herself. Raising her beer to her lips. This wasnâ€™t something sheâ€™d bother him with. To be honest she didnâ€™t want to see him at all.  Y/n jumps slightly hearing something upstairs. She places the beer down carefully before bending slowly getting a shotgun she had under the couch. It wasnâ€™t every day that she had personal visitors especially not with how she kept moving about. She went up the stairs carefully trying her best to step lightly but move fast enough to not let the wood creak too much under her weight. She can hear the flicker of a lighter clicking in her room. She pokes her head in with the gun close to her.   A man probably in his 30s dark blue suit his hair slicked back neatly as he took a drag of his cigarette. He smiles immediately as he looks her over. â€œA L/n as I live and breathe- well yâ€™know as close as I can get to it right?â€  â€Who are you?â€ She pumps the gun a round ready.  â€Easy honey Iâ€™m a friend of Crowleyâ€™s so to speak. Nameâ€™s Issac.â€ He leans against the wall. He glances at the window seal seeing the salt lined up only a part of it disturbed clearly done from the inside. â€œI couldnâ€™t help but notice it. I mean hunters are cautious by nature. Every nook and cranny was covered in salt except this window.â€ He tilts his head at her smirking. â€œAnd in the bedroom no less. Câ€™mon doll I knew Crowleyâ€™s been working an angle with you but I wouldnâ€™t think heâ€™d get you so riled up.â€  Her grip on the gun tightened as she glanced at the salt. â€œHe hasnâ€™t.â€  "Really?â€ He squints. â€œI mean from what I heard hell from what I saw. Almost felt like I was supposed to turn away or something. It was like some ridiculous attempt at an affair.â€  â€œWhat is it with you demons and spying?â€  â€œI donâ€™t know. Probably gotta do with our nature. Common excuse you hear with these folk y'know? Hunters and demons go a long way. Prey and predator. That thin line constantly being played with like some kind of schoolgirlâ€™s jump rope. Though we still got the upper hand ya like to fight back.â€ He briefly frowns as he brings the cigarette back to his lips. â€œAlways fighting back.â€  â€œWhat are you going on about?â€  â€I just sayinâ€™ I know my onions.â€  â€What?â€ She didnâ€™t like him. Not like this in the temp home she managed to get her hands on in this town. Dealing with demons was unsettling in general. No matter who they were or what meat suit they decided to wear.  â€Iâ€™ma be honest here with you L/n I donâ€™t like him. I donâ€™t like the smirk on his stupid face or his voice always complaining questioning one thing after another and you-â€œ Issac points. â€œYouâ€™ve been his latest obsession and to be honest the second I heard your name-â€œ  Y/n shifts as he takes his time to look her over. Her finger was ready on the trigger. She knew salt wouldnâ€™t kill a demon but a part of her hoped it would hurt him enough. Maybe even inspire a few rounds to go off.  â€œYour popsâ€  â€What about him.â€ She demands quickly.  â€œHe was quite the hunter but he really never knew how to keep that nose of his in his own business. One time he managed to trap me left me to rot forâ€¦.fuck months I think?â€ A laugh erupted from his throat as he shakes his head. â€œCan you imagine that? Itâ€™s like a rat outsmarting a cat leaving â€˜em in a small confined cage. Itâ€™s just not natural.â€  â€Do you have a point here?â€ Her jaw flexed slightly.   â€œAs I said I hate him. And seeing that you are who you are he canâ€™t have you so I got a counteroffer. You wonâ€™t know it and I doubt Crowley would have explained it but we got our own ranks within ranks. I happen to be a higher rank than him so any â€˜protectionâ€™ he offered you would be more guaranteed.â€  â€How do I know if youâ€™re lying or not?â€  â€You donâ€™t but thatâ€™s half the fun isnâ€™t it?â€ Issac taps his cigarette the ash falling into the pot of a plant she had. â€œThat bastard has been a pain since he first arrived. Heâ€™s like a dog doing extra spins to see if his master gives him another treat. Tryna make himself a favorite look Lilith I got the moon for you.â€  â€The moon?â€  â€œNot as impressive as it sounds I promise you. â€˜Sides Iâ€™ll get my bossâ€™s favor in a snap. You just gotta play nice for me.â€œ He smirks. "And help me get rid of that demon of course. Though to find something that can actually get the job done not the easiest thing to come by.â€  â€œYou wanna get rid of Crowley?â€ She looks him over. â€œFor good?â€  â€œYeahâ€ Issac scoffs. â€œCanâ€™t have him rat me out. Even if he lets me have it heâ€™ll find a way to benefit from it. Fucking parasite.â€  â€œHave what?â€  â€The colt Y/n I know you have it. Your dad took it then placed it â€˜Somewhere safeâ€™. Took me a while but what better place than a hunter always on the move? It doesnâ€™t stay in one area youâ€™re not actively in the hunter business so thereâ€™s less of a chance of a supernatural encounter. It all clicks. Now be a doll and hand it over.â€  She could play dumb. She should play dumb but she had to take into consideration he might already know where. Especially since he admitted to stalking there was no telling how long. â€œOver my dead body.â€  â€œyâ€™knowâ€ Issac sighs. â€œI was absolutely baffled when he told me his idea. Getting a dame to lure in anyone willing to trade for a measly ten years of whatever the hell they ask for. I thought to myself â€˜Why doesnâ€™t this idiot just posses a nice lookinâ€™ chick and do the same?â€™ I know a handful of demons who play with different meat suits to get targets.â€ He nods his head to her the action sending her back into the wall making her drop the shotgun. His lips twitched up slightly wetting his bottom lip as he watched her try to regain the breath that was knocked out of her.  â€œBut it wasnâ€™t just about that. It was the fact that you were human. Selling the idea to them. But youâ€™re a hunter you can think on your feet. Youâ€™d most likely get recognized by other hunters which will set them at ease from suspicion faster and the cherry on top?â€ Issac walks over to her watching her use the nightstand for support as she leans her side on the bed. â€œYouâ€™re a fucking L/n. Thatâ€™s exciting for me at least. The second I heard you were his daughter. I could hardly focus sweetheart.â€  It was rather hypocritical of him to use force when he advised Crowley to do otherwise for favor. Hunters may be human but with what they do and the self-inflicted suffering they put themselves through he couldnâ€™t help but place them as an entirely different species of their own. He pushed her to the bed by her neck pushing his body weight on her slightly. Her hands instinctively gripped his wrist wanting him to let go. His own breath hitched at the sight. He loved it when they squirmed. Though the defiance on her face was clear.  â€œYouâ€™re gonna do it or are you gonna bitch some more?â€ She managed to get out despite the pain of being tossed around.  â€œHuh guess the apple doesnâ€™t fall far from the tree does it? Always havinâ€™ something to say despite being completely backed into a corner. Do you know how many deals he cost me?â€œ His grip tightens leaning in closer. His eyes closed momentarily as the smells flooded in. She took the moment to stretch her foot out to the cup she had on the nightstand knocking it over to spill onto his side.  Issac yells in pain buckling down as the steam erupts from his suit. Y/n forces herself to crawl further up the bed once his grip loosens rolling to the other side to create enough distance for her to think of something.  His groans slowly turn into laughter. "Oh you little-â€ Issac couldnâ€™t smell her father on her. Only a lingering emotional touch enough to know sheâ€™s thought of him but it wasnâ€™t enough to prove he was around. "Hereâ€™s the thing. I am jealous. I know he was close but how close was Crowley to you to get his smell on you?â€  Her eyes narrowed at him. She really was cornered the shotgun was on the other side and so was the door. All she had was a window and not enough salt to close it. Even if she could sheâ€™d be trapped in here with him unless she jumps. The second floor isnâ€™t so bad but the flowers planted below had a brick lining. Jumping on a whim before he could get to her might make for a bad landing.  He forced himself to stand though the holy water still stained his suit. â€œHe was real insistent on it being you. He couldâ€™ve gotten any greedy chick willing to jump at the deal but loyalty is something you canâ€™t always buy. The second thereâ€™s a higher bidder sheâ€™d up and leave. And you wonâ€™t say yes you wonâ€™t give me the gun so what the fuck?â€  This was just a talk she realized. This was his idea of talking. Throwing her around like a rag doll because he was jealous strangling her because he remembered her father. If this was just a talk what was she supposed to expect further down the line with him?  â€œPlus thereâ€™s also your old man right?â€ Issac smirks as her look changes. â€œThere you are. Yâ€™know I can find him again easily make sure heâ€™s red and blue for you before I take my time to really send him off. Or we can make a deal.â€  On one hand she was glad to hear he was alive despite his ways. â€œYou say that like I care. Havenâ€™t been on the best of terms sinceâ€¦ever? It was a great try though. A for effort.â€  What was better? Being in the hands of a demon or death?  â€œSo in conclusion Fuck you.â€ She decides.  He huffs raising his brows in surprise. He nods accepting her answer as he smiles to himself.  â€œOkayâ€ he shrugs. A wave of his hand sent her through the window the glass breaking from the impact. He sighs as he walks over. Eyes trailing over the new injuries she gained her body arched over the plants.   â€œWhat a world.â€           Everyone hates an errand run. There wasnâ€™t much to do but wait for a small delivery to be made. Lilith being stuck in Hell made her reliant on the demons that were out of the gates. Being a woman of deals herself she preferred to use crossroads demons. Though the irony of sending them together to run it didnâ€™t fly over their heads. Sharing subtle glances as Crowley made small talk.   Feeling bored as the time passes Issac moves looking at the abandoned cars around them tools scattered and Graffiti at almost every turn. No doubt proof of the warehouseâ€™s new use as someoneâ€™s hang-out spot.  Eventually a set of other demons came with a chest setting it down and leaving it to them to complete their part.  â€œFinallyâ€ Crowley sighs looking over the chest curiously. â€œWhat do you think it is needing it so badly even if sheâ€™s not up here to get it herself?â€  â€œItâ€™s none of our business is what it is. Weâ€™re not opening it.â€ Issac said bluntly.  â€œNever said we would I just figured if weâ€™re gonna wait for something that long weâ€™d be granted a small note of information or something.â€  â€œYou ever heard of the colt Crowley?â€ He asked out of the blue. â€œNasty little peashooter that can shut down almost any creature a hunter could possibly deal with.â€  â€œI thought that was a nice fairytale hunters liked to go on about when things get desperate.â€ Crowley grabs onto one handle of the chest as Issac picks up the other. Taking the chest to a giant symbol written off in blood on the floor. An entire ritual set up. Both being well versed and educated in more complex magical situations they needed to be the ones to do it.  Crowley never really like doing work like this but better for Lilith than another demon. Crowley had his fair share of bottom-feeding in his past life and he wasnâ€™t willing to take it in this one.  â€œWhatâ€™s the point of creating a gun that only had a handful of rounds? Clearly he had the intention to use it for one troubling thing. Even if the gun was around thereâ€™d hardly be enough bullets for a hunter to make proper use of it in a world crawling with creatures.â€  â€œMaybe it was more so meant for us. Yâ€™know to be haunted by the idea that hunters would have something to go against things like us or hell bigger if there even is such a thing.â€ Issac grunts as they put it down. The candles around them light up automatically. They immediately stopped moving to their positions. Holding their hands up mid-chest muttering the needed words. The chest burned up in flames leaving nothing but a scorch mark behind. â€œHowâ€™s your hunter situation?â€  â€Silent. Though Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™ll be an answer soon.â€  â€Yeah?â€ Issac smiles a bit too contently for Crowleyâ€™s liking. â€œDiamond necklace wasnâ€™t it? Iâ€™m telling ya girls love jewelry. Course huntersâ€™ such as Y/n have an adequate taste yâ€™know?â€ He pulls out the Colt. It didnâ€™t take long for him to find it in her house. Placing it under floorboards was a commendable choice but the bedroom was typical. He watched as Crowley shifted in place more serious though a frown clear on his features. Issac couldnâ€™t decide whether to shoot him in his smart mouth or his heart. The irony of shooting a demonâ€™s â€˜heartâ€™ would only provide him a laugh rather than actual satisfaction.  â€œSeems like I struck a nerve.â€ Crowley hums at the sight. â€œColt Iâ€™m guessing?â€  â€No shit.â€ Issac pulled the trigger.  It was nothing like he thought it would be. There was a loud bang but Crowley only stumbled slightly from the impact. There was no show of anything else no proof the gun being anything but a gun. For a moment Issac thought he felt it but it was his own body jolting at an unfamiliar sensation. He only had a brief moment left to look down and see the bright lights beaming through his veins.  Crowleyâ€™s usual smile returned easily when Issac collapsed. The view of Y/n standing there knife in hand finally in the clothes expected to be seen on a hunter. A grey undershirt her flannel as red as her favorite lipstick heâ€™s always seen her wear. Jeans worn out most likely for repeated wear rather than the use of an aesthetic. Combat boots to endure proper footing if needed in a fight.  In all honesty the sight had been more of a turn-on than her usual dress-ups.  â€œThis must be what damsels feel like when their hero prevails-â€œ  â€Did you know?â€ She didnâ€™t waste time on asking.  â€Knooow?â€  â€About him!â€ She gestured towards the corpse. â€œThe stalking knowledge about the deal-!â€  â€I told you I did my research on you. Issacâ€™s been on my radar for longer than I care to remember. I knew he was going to make a move sooner or later. Though I wasnâ€™t lying I do want that deal settled and your skill set. This was just an added convince.â€  â€œHe threw me out the fucking window of my house!â€  â€My condolences.â€ Crowley paused for a moment. â€œThe colt was an added surprise that wasnâ€™t the real thing I take?â€  â€It was.â€  â€But you did know it had regular bullets yes?â€  She shrugs.  â€And you let him shoot it?!â€ She took pleasure in his offense. Watching him examine where the bullet had hit him.  â€It was an added convenience.â€ She smiles.  â€œMy suitâ€ He huffs.  â€My condolences.â€ She glances at the body again. â€œDo you have to report all that?â€  â€To who?â€  â€Lilith.â€  â€Ahâ€ Crowley simply straightened out his suit. â€œA little betrayal story would go well. I could say he wanted to take her personal delivery case for himself. Add in my attempts with you- only that worth mentioning of course. But I still need that contract sealed beforehand.â€  â€œWhy? Whatâ€™s the point of even mentioning me in all this?â€  â€You want immunity donâ€™t you? This is our ticket in. Iâ€™m shown as a loyal demon youâ€™re shown as an asset and we have ourselves a proper start to a successful system. Soâ€¦.is there a deal?â€  â€What about the colt?â€  â€Iâ€™ll convince her to let me have it stored away for safe keeping though youâ€™d have to hand over the actual bullets it came with. And that knife-â€œ  â€You take it and you can forget it.â€ She steps back instinctively.  â€Fineâ€ He sighs. â€œHard bargain but Iâ€™m willing if it lets you sleep at night. But I do prefer you leave it on the floor or elsewhere before approaching.â€   â€œWhy? Do I have to shake your hand or something?â€  â€œNot exactly.â€ Crowley smiles. â€œListen carefullyâ€ he moves to her. â€œThis deal is binding. From this moment onward you will be under my employment. You will do whatever I ask of you. There will be no refusal when I demand something of you. Except for the little list of conditions you decided upon beforehand. Good enough?â€  She nodded hesitantly. Even now it felt wrong.  His hand tightened across the back of her hip as he leaned in close to her. His lips brush against hers at first before quickly locking their lips together. It started out with a quick peck but soon turned into a slow steady rhythm. For a brief moment she gripped his suit pulling him close before pulling away.  â€Congratulations.â€ Crowley licks his lips taking in the taste of her. â€œYou made it past survival.â€
ALT Todayâ€™s poem of the day punched me in the gut and stole my wallet

secondary_tags: ['cas needs a win'  'castiel'  'character of all time'  'spn'  'spn s12'  'cas studies'  'cas'  'spn meta'  'phd in spn s12'  'destiel and betrayal'  'spn angels'  'spn lines']
post_body: Cas needs a win (or some PTOs really) In â€œThe Futureâ€ thereâ€™s a really interesting line that Iâ€™ve overlooked in the past but thatâ€™s actually pretty telling. Cas tells Dean the following:  â€œAnd I just wantedâ€¦ I needed to come back here with a win for you. For myselfâ€.  The â€œfor myselfâ€ is quite an important addition because I think that Cas has a tendency to hide his own personal desires needs and ambitions behind Dean and the importance he places on his relationship with him ( famous examples such as â€œIâ€™m doing this for you Dean. Iâ€™m doing this because of youâ€ â€œI gave everything for you. And this is what you give to me.â€ â€œI cared about the whole world because of youâ€ come to mind).  Now of course in and of itself this is definitely not a negative thing quite the opposite since Dean has indeed been a key factor in Casâ€™ internal and external upheaval. What Iâ€™m trying to say is that this is the most obvious excuse for doing/wanting certain things and it allows Cas to get sort of a free pass instead of explicitly owning his wants and needs. By the way Cas is not shifting the weight of what he thinks are his responsibilities intentionally on Dean but I think he sort of lies to himself and uses the â€œIâ€™m doing this for X reason but certainly not for myselfâ€ card as a coping mechanism against his complicated relationship with power and more importantly with powerlessness.  <!-- more --> So when he says that he needs a win for Dean and then honestly adds that he needs the win for himself too Cas is actually showing growth and vulnerability. Of course this is something that Cas can only share with Dean and Dean only. When Kelvin praises him for his betrayal (â€œCommitting to Joshuaâ€™s plan putting angelkind above the Winchesters. I mean your reputation in Heaven is â€“â€) Cas is super quick to add that heâ€™s NOT doing it for his reputation but heâ€™s doing it for the Winchesters. Which is 100% true but what Cas is obviously omitting here is that heâ€™s doing it because he needs a win. And he needs it badly. But why?  Iâ€™m gonna come out here and say it: I donâ€™t see Cas as a strategist. Like not at all. And if he is I think heâ€™s a very very bad one. Here Iâ€™ve said it. I think Cas is on the exact opposite end of what constitutes a good strategist because heâ€™s a reckless son of a bitch. Heâ€™s exactly what strategists prepare for: heâ€™s the unpredictable the wild card that can turn the fate of a battle in a matter of seconds and the good thing about that is exactly that you donâ€™t know what heâ€™ll do. He doesnâ€™t even know what heâ€™ll do. As a matter of fact Iâ€™ve alwasy found funny when in â€œThe Endâ€ Cas calls 2014!Deanâ€™s plan â€œinsouciantâ€ or â€œrecklessâ€. Because these are the exact same adjectives Iâ€™d use to descrive Casâ€™ plans or Cas in general for that matter.   Having said that war is in Casâ€™ DNA or whatever in his grace perhaps. Therefore Cas is a wavelength of celestial intent that thrives on winning battles and fighting enemies. But thereâ€™s also a streak of ambition and hubris in Cas in that heâ€™s the BAMF that goes against archangels tries to find God by himself and doesnâ€™t shy away from The Darkness herself. One might say he has delusions of grandeur or perhaps heâ€™s a badass with a death wish.   Iâ€™d say all of the above. Because to me one of Casâ€™ defining traits is that he keeps trying. Heâ€™s always ready to raise the stakes and regardless of what he says he does have an inner confidence in himself a secret voice that tells him that he can win. Perhaps this is what makes him so charming to people his aura of badass tormented self-assurance.   In s12 Casâ€™ confidence has taken a real blow heâ€™s scraping the bottom of the barrel. Reasoning in terms of +1 win/-1 fail the season opens with a fat giant -1 for Cas since he wasnâ€™t able to keep Sam safe aka he failed at the one thing Dean asked of him. He gets Dean back though so Iâ€™ll count it as +1 for win. All in all things seem to be okayish.   But theyâ€™re not a-ah! Another -1 is on the horizon as we are reminded that Lucifer is still on the loose and Cas feels guilty over it and yada yada the usual: I have to fix it because itâ€™s my responsibility. So far Casâ€™s still not winning.  I gotta hand it to him Cas showed real maturity when he admitted he could stall Lucifer for 3 minutes. Old Cas wouldâ€™ve just gone in there guns a-blazing no risk assessment and wing it. Iâ€™ll give him a +1 for personal win. However they donâ€™t catch Lucifer and everyone and I mean everyone disagrees with Dean when he calls their little fight a win(â€œWell we didnâ€™t catch Lucifer but we did save the crowd so Iâ€™m gonna call that a win). I agree with Dean but Iâ€™m the only one so Iâ€™m going to give a grand total of 0 because consensus wasnâ€™t reached.  Things escalate quickly from here on: -1 because Kelly escapes on Casâ€™ watch -1 because Dean and Sam get kidnapped and Cas canâ€™t find them -1 because he canâ€™t even solve a vamp case +1 because no Winchester dies but also - a fuckton of cosmic consequences as he kills Billie.   So to sum it up: Casâ€™s still NOT winning. Like at all.  We could hardly call "Lily Sunder has Some Regretsâ€ a win. The episode ends on a hopeful note but Cas is totally pretending and performing for Deanâ€™s sake (â€œLetâ€™s drink and hope we can find a better wayâ€ is such a glaring â€œhe wouldnâ€™t fucking say thatâ€ for Cas that to me itâ€™s clear that heâ€™s just putting up a front for the brothersâ€™ benefit).  Things go from bad to worse in â€œStuck in the Middle with Youâ€ which opens with a bleeding Cas who canâ€™t even walk properly and heâ€™s assisted by Mary while we hear this song in the background:  So come on baby walk with a winner  come on girl walk with a winner  hey girl come on swing along with me thereâ€™ so much to see  great big world for you and me  I love some good irony. All the more so since we know this time Cas is undoubtedly close to dying for realsies.   Cas dying: letâ€™s talk about it. I think it really stung for Cas that he was about to die at the hands of Ramiel skewered like a fish by the lance of Michael (of all angels!) suffering horribly and possibly forced to watch his family get killed in front of his eyes while he canâ€™t do nothing but keep decaying and dying. Love confession aside for a moment this was a low blow in all its possible meanings for poor Castiel. I think that even though he made it out that barn alive something inside of him was really hurt and broken by the modality of the events as they unfolded. He an angel who had fought archangels and won who just managed to confront Lucifer was harpooned like a whale by a Prince of Hell and forced to die in a way that totally incapacitated his ability to protect his family (he couldnâ€™t even self-sacrifice Casâ€™ favorite dish cause he was already SO done for). He hit rock bottom in terms of powerlessness.  So when in â€œSomewhere Between Heaven and Hellâ€ along comes Kelvin I think what truly seduces Cas is not the promise to reunite with and be forgiven by his own family but the promise of power: â€œI donâ€™t. Look I know youâ€™re working with the Winchesters. Sam and Dean â€“ their hearts are in the right place but wouldnâ€™t it be better to have us waiting in the proverbial wings? All the power of Heaven behind you?â€. I think Cas really wants that power he needs it because he needs a win.   Under this light fetus!Jack lending Cas his power to kill another Prince of Hell in lieu of the one who almost got him killed is something way more interesting than the usual â€œhe got brainwashed for the nth timeâ€. Yes true however Cas saying â€œ Iâ€™ve been so lost. Iâ€™m not lost anymore. And I know now that this child must be born with all of his power."is so much more revealing of his character if we consider that Cas finally got his win (heâ€™s not lost anymore) thanks to a borrowed power (he had Jackâ€™s power behind him in the proverbial wings as Kelvin would say) borrowing power from other angels/souls being a thing that Cas does quite frequently on Supernatural lol.  Cas gains his confidence back to the point that heâ€™s back to being reckless and insoucinat with it. While at the beginning of the season he was smart enough to be real and say he could only stall Lucifer for 3 minutes now that heâ€™s got his big win heâ€™s so engrossed with it that he stupidly goes to Apocalypse World armed with a stupid angel blade thinking he can take Lucifer.   Cas needed a win sure but what he truly truly needed were some fucking PTOs from constantly being on the battlefield. Because at the end of the day he sort of got his win but he also eventually got himself dead so what was the point?  I know that on the surface this view might seem to cast a bit of a dark shadow on Casâ€™ personality but I find him so much more interesting when heâ€™s not portrayed as a puppy cute little doggie doing things just because he loves Dean. Of course he does lol but heâ€™s so much more than that and a lot of his character has clearly to do with power and how it corrupts and entices people or well beings in general that I think itâ€™s worth exploring.

post_body: The vampire wasnâ€™t exactly short but their height difference was exaggerated in the way Samâ€™s chin brushed against his chest when he looked down at him. He stared unblinking and endlessly watching because it was the only thing he could do without snapping completely.  Dean had touched this manâ€”this vampire had felt his skin and known him. There was a year missing from Samâ€™s book a year in which Sam had no idea what Dean had done a year which was left only to his nightmares. Purgatory was pure Dean had said. Purgatory had brought out all that was inside him and let it gush forth. It was a world of simple survival of give and take and struggle and desire. And Dean had spent that year with Benny. With a vampire.  Sam had only his own thoughts to imagine what had happened there and purity was far from the word he would use to describe what those thoughts supplied. The way this vampire looked at Dean was with a hunger as if the fangs would come out and he would launch himself at Samâ€™s brother if only a second more passed. He never did but Sam could never stop staring anticipating the attack because thatâ€™s what monsters do. They attack and feed and hurt and kill. They destroy families and leave carnage in their wake and they try to separate Sam from Dean and keep them away and apart. And Benny was a monsterâ€”of this Sam was sure.  Sam stared down at Benny their chests nearly touching and snarled. Benny returned the favor his second set of teeth poking out from under his lip in a warning in a dare. Donâ€™t try anything he was saying; youâ€™ll regret it.  Sam regretted a lot of things in his life; the laundry list of guilt piled so high by now that it seemed to stretch beyond even the sun. He wouldnâ€™t know where to begin asking forgiveness or retribution or punishment because his sins were endless and still piling ever higher with every sinful breath he poisoned the air with. He had regrets; that wouldnâ€™t be one of them.  A vampireâ€™s skin was cold. Where Benny and he were nearly touching he could feel it mingle with the heat radiating from his own body and with a mild shock Sam realized he shouldnâ€™t be here in such lingering proximity to a monster like this. He should have learned from his mistakes. He was a hunter and hunters shouldnâ€™t linger: you kill the monster you clean off your blade or your gun or your hands and you walk away. You donâ€™t press yourself against it and wonder what your brother felt when he did the same for a year before that. You donâ€™t stare at its fangs and wonder if it ever tasted your brotherâ€™s blood and wonder what your brotherâ€™s blood tastes like if itâ€™s tangy or sweet or sour with decades of sin. And you certainly donâ€™t wonder how far they went if the monster ever whispered in your brotherâ€™s ear or caressed his body in its large meaty hands if they ever fucked and who was on top and who screamed whose name (or if that name was Sam God let it be Sam).  Benny said nothing and did nothing like a predator watching his prey like a prey animal frozen under the watchful eye of his hunter. He merely waited for Sam to make the next move. The world was quiet around them and yet thundered with explosions and questions and desire. Sam wanted to know everything but his mouth was still and uncooperative.  Dean wasnâ€™t here or they would have been broken apart already. Dean was one state over researching a case and conducting interviews and looking at corpses. Sam would have to get back before Dean realized he had gone before he started freaking out. A year apart and nothing changes; a year apart and everything changes.  Dean wasnâ€™t here but Benny was. Benny would tell Sam anything he wanted to know and he would do it in a delicious slow drawl sucking on each word like it was rich sweet chocolate a contented smile upon his lips as he tore Samâ€™s world apart like clean wet slice of a machete to a neck. Sam only had to ask and Benny would provideâ€”itâ€™s that Southern hospitality maybe or possibly something more malicious and spiteful.  But Samâ€™s mouth didnâ€™t work. He didnâ€™t want to know not really and yet he did. A year apart and everything was different. Dean was different; Sam could feel it could feel the danger rolling off of him and the raw feral energy coiled inside of him like he was always ready to strike. He walked around restless waiting for something waiting for someone. He looked at his phone and put it away and pulled it back out and looked at it and put it away again. Sam wasnâ€™t part of Purgatory. He was apart and away from Dean and Dean was in Purgatory and Benny was in Purgatory too. And theyâ€™d been together and heâ€™d been here. And Benny was more of a brother to Dean than Sam ever was.  Sam wondered if Benny could smell Dean on him or if theyâ€™d been apart and away for so long that the scent had died on his clothes and on his skin. He wondered if there was anything left of Dean on him or if he was a stranger now and Dean had left him behind. He wondered if were he a vampire too he would be able to smell Dean on Benny.  He needed to know and he couldnâ€™t ask. He couldnâ€™t know what happened and he couldnâ€™t live not knowing. Did they touch did they kiss did they do all the things Sam couldnâ€™t while he was stuck here and they were in Purgatory togetherâ€”did Dean think of him when he fucked Benny? Did Benny make the same noises did Benny sound like him when he cried out? Did Dean imagine it or did he ignore it? Did Dean even care? Did he ever care? Was Benny more of a brother to Dean than Sam had ever been?  Sam grabbed Bennyâ€™s face and held it still as he bent down and kissed him. He trailed his tongue along the vampireâ€™s lips and the fangs nicked his skin and he bled into both their mouths and Sam tasted Dean there distinct under the tang of blood and the sweat of the monster.  And Sam knew everything and instantly achingly he wanted nothing more than to forget.

On The Mountain: Dean Winchester x Reader Tagging: @kmc1989 @district447 @cosmic-psychickitty @volumesofforgottenlore @spaghettificationandpretzels  Companion piece to You Me & Tennessee  The nights that Dean stays with you are always full of passion of tenderness and of love. For the longest time he tries to deny thatâ€™s what it is but when heâ€™s inside you looking into your eyes kissing your lips he canâ€™t pretend anymore.  <!-- more --> Itâ€™s a problem he struggles to reconcile when heâ€™s away because attachments are dangerous in his profession they can get a person killed. Thatâ€™s why he stays away for as long as possible why he doesnâ€™t call doesnâ€™t text. He tries to forget you but youâ€™re there always in his dreams in his heart.  When he finds himself back in Tennessee he tries to ignore the pull he feels in his chest the ache that only seems to grow with every passing day until it overwhelms him and he ends up back in your bed again.  â€œYou should probably leave.â€ You always say when he turns up on your doorstep.  â€œI probably should.â€ He agrees but he stays for a beer and then dinner and before he knows it itâ€™s three days later and heâ€™s watching you sleep on the pillow alongside him wondering how heâ€™s such a lucky son of a bitch.  â€œItâ€™s the mountain.â€ You laugh when he tells you he doesnâ€™t know where the time has gone but he knows itâ€™s you itâ€™s always you.  â€œYou should stay in Gatlinburg with her.â€ Sam tells him when they catch up a week later in Memphis. â€œItâ€™s clear she makes you happy. You always come back with a smile.â€  â€œWe both know what happens to the things that make us happy.â€ Dean responds as he throws his bag onto the motel room bed and Sam he canâ€™t argue with that.  Itâ€™s as he lies there in the darkness that night listening to the sound of Samâ€™s rhythmic breathing he closes his eyes and imagines heâ€™s back with you in a cottage on the mountain falling in love all over again.  Love Dean? Donâ€™t miss any of his stories by joining the taglist here.  Interested in supporting me? Join my Patreon for Bonus Content!  Like My Work? - Why Not Buy Me A Coffee

S9 E13 The Purge   â€œYou told that waitress the other day you were 29.â€  When ever the boys are in a rough patch the monster of the week is always a parallel. This time very loosely but here we have siblings on opposite sides of their nature and one controlling the other. And Sam telling Dean that his plays are usually selfish in the end was needed and true. And like I know theyâ€™re laying the groundwork for the finale but it needed to by said.  (Also hey Donna. Forgot how much of a great character she was from jump.)

Unexplainable | Happy Days Unexplainable Masterlist  Dean Winchester X OC  (This is unedited sorry for the lowercase)   Word Count: 2.7k  tears fill my eyes as i sit next to my grandmother holding her hand in mine. She looks at me with a pang of sadness as she watches the tears stream down my face.  â€œel donâ€™t be sad. Itâ€™s my time. no one can change that. not even me.â€ she says squeezing my hand. â€œYou have so much potential with your witchcraft. you are the most powerful witch i have ever met and you are even more powerful than me. and you know how i am so you know thatâ€™s a high compliment.â€ she says smiling at me. I laugh a little tears still coming down my face.     <!-- more --> â€œYou are still my little precious granddaughter but the woman you have become amazes me. even when your fate was revealed in front of you you fought with everything in you to survive. You are the strongest individual I have ever met. youâ€™ve made me proud belle.â€ a tear comes down her face. â€œNow let me talk to your brother.â€ she says squeezing my hand. I nod and get up heading for the door where my dad and brother were waiting. I nod to Trey for him to go in. He sits next to her as she smiles at him.  â€œShe loves you a lot.â€ my dad says putting his hands on my shoulders. I turned to my dad to see him staring at us with the same amount of sadness I had. We embrace each other in a hug as I feel his tears fall onto my shoulders. my breath hitches as the liquid steals.  I see my mom behind him hurt across her face. I look at her sympathetically. Even if we had fought just days before I knew we would go back to how we were before. we would just avoid the subject. like we always do.  I pull away from my dad and he wipes the tears away from his checks. He always hated being vulnerable around me. When his father died when I was ten that was the first time I ever saw him cry. The second was when I told him and my mom that Lucifer was after me and that I needed to leave for a while. The third time is now.  he moves away from me into the room grandma was in. Trey comes out and gives me a look. â€œCan we go to that diner that she always took us to. she wants a milkshake.â€ he says trying to mask his emotions.  â€œyeah iâ€™ll go get my keys.â€ I nod as we both head to the door. We walk outside and Trey suddenly stops as we get close to the car. I turned around looking at him confused. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong?â€  Trey breaks down almost immediately tears start streaming down his face. I rushed over to him and brought him into a hug. â€œoh bubba.â€ I say tears welling up again.  â€œI donâ€™t want to lose her.â€ he says hugging me tight. We hugged each other in the middle of my grandmotherâ€™s yard outside of little rock arkansas.  â€œItâ€™s going to be okay bubba.â€ I say pulling away from him staring at him in his tear filled eyes. â€œNow letâ€™s get her that milkshake.â€ I say smiling slightly.   When we got back my dad was sitting by my grandma as they laughed together. They always had a really close relationship. sheâ€™s the one that taught him everything there is about being a witch same as my momâ€™s mom did with her. I smile as me and Trey walk in. Trey comes by her bed handing her the milkshake she takes it gladly.  my mom comes up behind me she puts her hand on my shoulders causing me to turn around. she smiles sadly at me before motioning me to step outside and talk to her.  we get outside and she turns to me bringing me in a hug. I sigh hugging her back. There have been a lot of hugs lately.  â€œIâ€™m so glad youâ€™re okay.â€ she mumbles into my hair. I pulled away looking at her confused.  â€œWhat do you mean?â€ she looks down before looking back up to me. She has the same look every time sheâ€™s about to start an argument.  â€œIâ€™m just glad when you came back from being with the winchesterâ€™s you were in one piece.â€ she says crossing her arms over her chest.  â€œof course you would try to argue with me now of all times.â€ I say rolling my eyes looking away from her.  â€œBelle every time you get hung up with those winchesterâ€™s you end up hurt. whether it be emotionally or physically. I donâ€™t understand why you keep going back to them. even if itâ€™s just work.â€ she says raising her voice.  â€œyou and I both know that i can relate to the winchesterâ€™s more than anyone. who was there when we all had been told our fate and that we couldnâ€™t change it but we did. and if it wasnâ€™t for sam freaking winchester i would be used as a magic bag every single day of my miserable life. i owe him everything because of what he did for me and everyone on his earth. he sacrificed his own life. isnâ€™t that more then enough to help them out? we risk our lives everyday why not do it for someone that deserves it?â€ i say full force yelling at her.  â€œhanging out with the winchesters will just put a bigger target on your back.â€ she shouts causing my brother to come out of the house but we both ignore him.  â€œthe target is already there! i canâ€™t get away from it! ever! i will stay been chased especially with all of the archangels still out there alive! and who ever the hell else that can drain my ass till their time is up! so honestly some of the only people that will protect me are those guys.â€ i shake my head as i go toward my brother and the door.  â€œwe are not done here belle anne!â€ my mom shouts at me using my middle name. i roll my eyes.  â€œafter this is all over iâ€™m getting my ass out of dodge and going to be with my friends.â€ i say moving past my mom into the house.  the next week we all stayed with my grandmother. the last few days of her life were happy. joyful. she gave me the rest of her journals for me to read later. all of them containing ways of her advancing in her witchcraft. some of them just have her day to day life. even when she got married and had my dad. i looked forward to reading more on her life.  i was in my bed had just woken up my dad sat next to me running his hands through my hair. i look up at him to see his tear stained checks still red from crying.  â€œhey ellieâ€ he paused for a second. â€œshe passed in her sleep.â€ he said sadly. i shoot up bringing him into a hug. he hugs me back tightly. we stay like that for a second before he pulls back.  â€œlisten i know what your mom thinks about the winchesterâ€™s but i just want you to know that i am all for you helping those boys out. sam especially. and you tell them if they need anything they can call me too.â€ i nod knowing my dad means it. he gets up heading for the door.  â€œi love you kid.â€ he says as he turns around for a second. he leaves me there kind of out of words. i sigh before laying back down as the tears start coming up. sheâ€™s gone. sheâ€™s really gone.   i decide to call dean to fill him in i didnâ€™t call them like i said i would. i kind of got wrapped up in everything.  â€œhey dean.â€ i say sighing into the phone.  â€œhey howâ€™s everything going? you never called.â€  â€œyeah kind of got wrapped up in everything. my grandmaâ€¦ sheâ€™s was sick and i raced down as soon as i heard. she um she died in her sleep last night.â€  â€œoh iâ€™m really sorry to hear that belle.â€  â€œuh itâ€™s fine. iâ€™m gonna be here for a couple of weeks. the whole funeral and making sure my brother and dad are good before i head out.â€  â€œhey you donâ€™t have to come back. you can stay there as long as you need.â€  â€œthanks dean but i think that my grandma would have wanted me to keep doing what iâ€™m doing. which is helping you both with all thatâ€™s going on in this world.â€  â€œokay i get it. well call me when youâ€™re planning to come back.â€  â€œokay i will. tell sam i said hi.â€  we exchange our goodbyes before i close the phone. i sigh going into the kitchen to grab a snack. as i enter the kitchen my brother is sitting on the counter reading through some book he found that was grandmaâ€™s. i open the fridge and get a canister of watermelon out. i shut the fridge and go over to him and sit up on the counter.  â€œwhat are you reading?â€ i say motioning to the book.  â€œitâ€™s one of grandmaâ€™s journals itâ€™s when you were born. it sounds like she thought you were going to be the natural witch. the chosen one. she talks about how michaelâ€™s sword is supposed to be the person you marry. itâ€™s weird.â€ he says flipping to the next page.  â€œdean? how heâ€™s not even into me. he has a girlfriend and she has a kid. theyâ€™re his family.â€ i say taking a bite of the watermelon.  â€œwell itâ€™s either him or luciferâ€™s vessel.â€ i stare at the journal in his hands. how did she know all of this.  â€œso sam or dean could be the person iâ€™m supposed to spend my life with and she never mentioned it?â€  â€œlike i said she wasnâ€™t one hundred percent sure. she talks like she knew of the legend. she never told us before so why keep it to herself.â€  â€œi guess she didnâ€™t know if i was or not. just a theory. that makes sense to why she told me what she told me about them. how i should help them and stuff like that.â€  â€œshe knew that you would end up with one of them. my bets are on dean. he has a cool car.â€ i roll my eyes.  â€œof course you would say that.â€ i jump off of the counter and turn to him. â€œlike before iâ€™m not gonna let fate control my life. right now thereâ€™s obviously no feeling between either of the boys and me. so maybe grandma was wrong.â€ just then my dad walks into the kitchen opening the fridge to get a drink out.  â€œwhat are your kids talking about?â€ he asks turning to us as he leans up beside the fridge on the counter.  â€œnothing.â€ i say not wanting dad to join the conversation.  â€œjust how grandma thought el is supposed to end up with one of the winchesterâ€™s.â€ i hit trey obviously not wanting my dad to know.  â€œwell that woman was never wrong. my bet is on dean he seems like your type plus how he reacted when i asked which one of them liked you. that was a clear give away. i mean that sam boy he was giving you the eyes the whole time he was at the house so. could be either of them.â€ he says before taking a sip of his coke.  â€œyou are both crazy.â€ i say pointing at both of them. i throw the left over watermelon i had in the trash which was practically none. â€œiâ€™m going back to my room.â€ go to my room and shut the door. why does my fate always have to be put in front of me.  the funeral was the next week that part was sad. the party after which was put into place via my grandmaâ€™s plans was very fun and light hearted. everyone was telling great stories about her. bobby had stopped by right now he was talking to my dad.  when bobby was done with his conversation with my dad i went up to him and hugged him. â€œthanks for coming.â€ i say before pulling away from him and smiling.  â€œi wouldnâ€™t miss it kid. sam and dean would have come but theyâ€™ve been kind of preoccupied recently. you know with sam being soulless and everything-â€ i cut him off quickly.  â€œwait wait sam doesnâ€™t have a soul?â€ i say confused since when has this been a thing.  â€œdean didnâ€™t call you? i mean he figured out that you knew sam was alive during that year but i thought that he would get over himself and tell you. you and sam are pretty close now.â€ i shake my head. i canâ€™t believe dean didnâ€™t call me. he must be really mad.  â€œno he didnâ€™t. he must be really pissed off at me.â€ i sigh looking away. â€œdo y'all know how to get it back?â€  â€œweâ€™re working on it.â€ i look back up at him and smile.  â€œitâ€™s fine listen i have to make the rounds but iâ€™m glad you came. iâ€™ll probably call dean later try to get him to not be mad at me forever.â€ i say and he nods as i turn and go off to greet someone else.  â€œso you want to tell me something?â€ i say anger dripping from my voice.  â€œbobby told you.â€ he scoffs. â€œyou shouldnâ€™t care that much. you had been with him for a year and didnâ€™t see that we was acting completely different.â€  â€œi did dean but i just thought it was hell. he was trapped in luciferâ€™s cage even if it wasnâ€™t for long doesnâ€™t mean he didnâ€™t live through it. hell time is different then ours. you should know that hell changes a person.â€ i shout into the phone probably waking up my brother who was asleep next door.  â€œyeah well what happened to you been able to sense things when they are wrong. you probably didnâ€™t care since he was flirting with you twenty four seven. you didnâ€™t think that the real sam would have been a little less sexual with you.â€  â€œdean! we were with each other for months. and i donâ€™t necessarily think that iâ€™m that hard to flirt with unless you think otherwise.â€ i pause for a second and deanâ€™s side of the line was silent. â€œlisten i donâ€™t want to fight with you dean. i just thought that maybe you could stop being mad at me. or at least act like you arenâ€™t. because when i come back i donâ€™t want it to be like this.â€  â€œwhy are you even coming back?â€ dean says hatefully. i canâ€™t believe he just said that.  â€œbecause you guys are my friends and no matter how hard you try to be mad at me constantly iâ€™m still going to be there for you and sam. even my grandmother wanted me to along with my dad. sorry dean you arenâ€™t going to get rid of me that easily. we lived through the apocalypse together where nothing was supposed to end in our favor but it did. and since sam went to hell for us for me. i thought i should repay the favor as much as i can. which means helping y'all with your cases and everything that is going on. now do you have an idea of how youâ€™re going to get his soul back or not?â€ my southern accent was coming out like it always did when i was mad.  â€œiâ€™m going to talk to death. see if he can do anything cas canâ€™t because itâ€™ll be to risky so iâ€™m going for the next best thing.â€  â€œokay when should i be there.â€  â€œiâ€™ll call you before i do it. so by the time it should be done youâ€™ll probably be here.â€  â€œokay.â€  â€œokay.â€  â€œbye dean.â€  â€œbye belle.â€ i hang up the phone and stare out the window into the sky. the moon and stars were out and they were beautiful.

post_body: Destiel Pride - 15/ Healing touch We arrived in the bunker later that same day. Dean was in an unusual mood not a bad one when heâ€™s grumpy and doesnâ€™t say a word. He actually talked a lot commented on anything heâ€™d hear on the radio or see on the road. It seemed like he was trying to keep things casual but I sensed he was a bit nervous. I didnâ€™t understand why. It was just a kiss he and I shared.  <!-- more --> As we were standing outside the large abandoned power plant Sam called our host for her to opened the bunker door for us.  â€œPassword!â€ We could hear her from the other side. Dean tensed again.  â€œUh- Liv youâ€™re seriously gonna ask me everytime I come here?â€ Sam sighed rolling his eyes. But Liv didnâ€™t open until he spoke again. â€œJeez- â€˜Mellonâ€™.â€  The door to the airlock opened and we just had the time to catch a glimpse of her figure who was already coming gown the stairs of the bunkerâ€™s crowâ€™s nest.  â€œItâ€™s elvish for â€˜friendâ€™ Sammy I know the nerd that you are appreciates the reference!â€  I had come to this old underground bunker a few times when Liv and I were looking for Dean but it was my hunterâ€™s first time here and I could see he was fairly impressed as we stepped in the long library room. Sam dropped his bag on a table obviously also familiar with the place and sat on a chair as Liv hopped to sit on a table. I was more comfortable just standing and Dean did the same keeping his distance.  â€œSo did you dig up anything new?â€ Sam asked our host.  â€œI knew youâ€™d ask of course I did my homework!â€ Liv turned to face the youngest Winchester sitting cross-legged on the table. She seemed in a good mood. â€œSince we found out last time that this Mark of Cain is demon-related I made a couple phone calls. Well summoning calls whatever.â€  â€œSummoning? Liv tell me you didnâ€™t-â€  â€œWhat? Sam we agreed weâ€™d look into any solution to- help Dean so I dug up solutions. So yes: I called Crowley.â€  Dean sighed crossing his arms. â€œAnd here we go.â€ I had heard that Livâ€™s methods during the Apocalypse didnâ€™t always fall right with Dean so I knew this was precisely the reason why he was reticent to work with the witch again. That or their past relationship. Surely both. â€œSo your sly pet wasnâ€™t enough youâ€™re working with Crowley now?â€  Liv didnâ€™t seem to appreciate his remark. â€œBarbâ€™s not my pet heâ€™s my friend.â€ She climbed down the table and went to grab her pack of smokes on one of the shelves and lit one with just the use of her fire-weilding powers. â€œAnd Crowleyâ€™s been helpful. He told me a few interesting things about that Mark.â€  â€œSuch as?â€ I asked eager to get to the bottom of this for Deanâ€™s sake.  Liv turned to me that same old determined look on her face when sheâ€™s confident about what sheâ€™s doing. We had faced our share of fights and talks together I trusted her. â€œSuch as- this Mark being sort of a binding spell. It might be demonic itâ€™s still witchcraft. So kinda my department.â€ She grinned giving Dean a glimpse exhaling some smoke.  â€œA binding spell?â€ Sam asked.  â€œYeah more or less. Normally a binding spell is used to connect oneâ€™s wielder with its targetâ€™s powers like- like Lucifer had the Horsemen on a leash. Here itâ€™s a bit more tricky. The Mark binds its host with- their inner-self? Think of a hula hoop but you sway and it throws you off the hook. Wait- no forget the hoop that was stupid metaphor. Hmm-â€ Liv was thinking out loud her fingers tapping on her cigarette that made sparks as she was looking for another idea the gears on her very quick-witted mind almost visible. â€œBooze. You know- people drink to loosen their inhibitions but when they drink too much they can get a little- extra.â€ The Winchesters and I were all a little lost and she noticed. â€œThe Mark taps into innerâ€¦ emotions andâ€¦ unleashes some others.â€ She brought her cig back to her lips. â€œDean- anything new on that department lately?â€  I turned to look at him his arms still crossed over his crossed and noticed he clenched his jaw. I could sense this was uncomfortable.  â€œHm- thereâ€™s been the angels.â€ I stepped in knowing Dean wouldnâ€™t answer her. â€œWe got attacked by a squad last week andâ€¦ Dean took care of them.â€  â€œA squad? Thatâ€™s what- 4 5 angels?â€ She whistled impressed. â€œOkey- so a little extra violence. Wonâ€™t say Iâ€™m surprised.â€  â€œAnd what is that supposed to mean?â€ He barked back. She didnâ€™t appreciate.   â€œThat means- that what Crowley told me was right. The Markâ€™s gonnaâ€¦ Well Iâ€™ve never seen anyone walking around without one but most likely itâ€™s gonna eat your soul.â€ That finished to sink the tense atmosphere in the room. â€œIt- Itâ€™s of demonic nature I wonâ€™t do you the offense to witchsplain to you what demons do to a soul. For whatever reason Heaven gave you this Iâ€™d say itâ€™s some kind of twisted punishment.â€  â€œA punishment?â€ Sam asked.  â€œYeah. Crowleyâ€™s still pretty grateful to me since I cleared the way of an annoying archangel for him making him King of Hell but upstairs? Raphael must be pretty wrathful he lost his big brother.â€  â€œMichaelâ€™s gone so Heaven punishes his Swordâ€¦â€ He mumbled turning to me for confirmation.  â€œItâ€™s a- plausible theory.â€ I replied well-aware that my former superiors were never short on new twists to manipulate humans especially the Winchesters. Especially Dean.  â€œGreatâ€¦ Well thatâ€™s just peachy.â€ Dean grunted as he started pacing the room. I hated to see him like that disoriented when heâ€™d usually always be so fierce so determined into whatever plan weâ€™d have. Most of all I felt guilty being helpless to help him as much as I should. I thought heâ€™d deserve a better angel. â€œAny place I can get a beer down here?â€  â€œI- Iâ€™ll show you the way to the kitchen.â€ Sam stood up giving our host a glimpse that said heâ€™d handle his brother for now.  Liv finished smoking her cigarette and I just kept standing here.  â€œHow you doinâ€™ Collins?â€ She finally broke the silence calling me again by that old nickname. I wasnâ€™t sure how to reply to her. To what extent I should reply to her.  â€œIâ€™m fine.â€  She chuckled not hiding her sarcasm. â€œYeah. Sure everybodyâ€™s fine. What about your angel toolbox? Still missing a couple things?â€   â€œHm- yes. Itâ€™s gradually coming back butâ€¦â€  â€œBut what?â€  â€œI- I got most of my strength back. And I can feel my vessel can regenerate again if heâ€™s hurt.â€  â€œAnd your wings?â€  â€œNot yet. Most of allâ€¦ I still canâ€™t use my restorative abilities. Iâ€¦ Even with my strength I feel useless if we have to go on hunts.â€ I confessed looking down. I knew heâ€™d refuse but a part of me wanted Dean to stay in that bunker even with Liv around so that heâ€™d be safe. If anything were to happen to him I still hadnâ€™t gained back my healing touch.  â€œCasâ€¦ You donâ€™t need your glowing miracle-maker thingy to be useful. Just- you stay here with Dean. We canâ€™t have him go berserk again itâ€™s too riskyâ€¦â€ I saw her thinking again a fierce look on her face. â€œIâ€™ll call Barb weâ€™ll find some angels see what more we can learn. You guys stay here.â€  â€œAngels?â€ I frowned surprised that my witch friend would propose to leave the bunker to us. â€œLiv I thought you were avoiding them since the Apocalypse.â€  â€œI was.â€ She replied and I noticed something weary in her tone. â€œBut they decided to mess with Dean. Looks like Iâ€™m gonna fly at them again.â€  _______  Masterpost with the Prompts List

She couldnâ€™t fall asleep even at eight years old she was worried about school and what her friends were doing.   Dakoda was startled when she saw light flickering over her closed eyelids the brightness from her lamp fading and dimming before getting brighter once more Dakodaâ€™s eyes shot open and she stared at the flickering lights in confusion before she heard her motherâ€™s footsteps in the hall and the sound of her voice but couldnâ€™t make out what was being said. The young child shivered slightly as she looked over at her open window something she didnâ€™t remember she had done her small legs draped over the side of her bed as she slid off. She walked over to her window and reached up with her small hands to close it silently not wanting to get in trouble for being awake since it was late in the evening.   The sudden scream from her mother caused Dakoda to flinch and jump spinning around quickly as she jerked her headphones off her head â€œMommy?â€ Dakoda called out with fear tainting her tone she set her walkman and headphones down and walked out to the hallway just in time to see her father Javier running into her baby brotherâ€™s nursery as he called for her mother who had fallen unsettlingly quiet in the night air. Dakoda slowly crept along the wall to the doorway of her baby brotherâ€™s nursery and peeked her head in slightly â€œDad?â€ she called out softly as he slowly turned his head towards the ceiling which in turn made Dakoda look up as well.   The sight of Lana Hernandez pinned to the ceiling with a bloody gash slashed across her abdomen filled Dakodaâ€™s sight just before her mother burst into flames the six-year-old screamed for her mother and tried to run over only to be stopped by Javier who had snatched up baby Damien from his crib.   â€œTake your brother and run!â€ Javier commanded the six-year-old girl with a nudge towards the door Dakoda did as she was told and cradled her baby brother to her chest as she ran quickly to the door and down the stairs to the main entrance. Dakoda ran outside the house and turned to look at the nursery window as she walked onto the lawn she wasnâ€™t given much time to look as Javier ran over and scooped up his children quickly as he ran towards where his parked car sat on the curb. Several emergency vehicles pulled up more than what their small town in Texas seemed to have. Dakoda kept a tight grip on her baby brother whom she still held in her small arms as Javier hadnâ€™t taken him from her just yet he stared in numb shock at the house they had just been living in he lost his wife and his home in the same night.      A week after the fire     A SLEEK BLACK 1967 Chevrolet Impala had rolled into town the news of the mysterious fire had spread and caught the attention of one John Winchester with his boys Dean and Sam. The vehicle parked in front of one of the few motels that sat in the small town sitting towards the edge of town. The car parked alongside another sleek black vehicle a 1979 Ford Mustang that belonged to Javier Hernandez the small family of three didnâ€™t have anywhere else to turn to so theyâ€™d been staying in the motel for the past week.   The now seven-year-old Dakoda peered out of the motel window her birthday had been a day prior but she hadnâ€™t celebrated her father hadnâ€™t even brought it up. The loss of the matriarch loomed over the small family the absence being felt stronger the more time passed by. Dakoda was left in charge of her baby brother Javier having been running around as he searched for answers. Javier hadnâ€™t gotten in contact with John Winchester soon after the man had already heard about the fire the fires that killed their wives being done the same way wasnâ€™t a coincidence.   Dakoda watched out of the motel room at the two young boys that stood beside their father as her own father spoke with them she ducked out of the window when the taller of the boys looked towards her. Footsteps were coming to the motel door before it opened to reveal her father leading the other trio inside Dakoda locked gazes with the older of the two boys dark brown meeting light green.   â€œBoys this is Dakoda and Damien.â€ John spoke first gesturing to the six-year-old with the infant gripped in her arms â€œDakoda these are my sons. This is Deanâ€ John gestured to the green-eyed boy â€œand this is Sam.â€ he finished as he gestured to the smaller boy. Dakoda gave a shy smile she hadnâ€™t spoken since her mom died and she couldnâ€™t find anything she could say to the boys. The two fathers continued speaking and stepped away from the four children Dakoda laid Damien into a crib Javier had bought while they stayed in the motel room. Dakoda watched as Dean directed Sam to one of the motel beds and made the younger boy take a nap since he was starting to doze off while standing.   Dakoda walked back over to the window and peered out her deep brown eyes holding a sadness that seemed unusual for a child to have but was natural since she lost her mother. Dean stepped up beside Dakoda and leaned against the wall beside the window.   â€œI lost my mom too.â€ Dean spoke after a long moment of silence his words breaking the ice between them â€œIt was a while ago but I still miss her.â€  â€œI miss my mom too.â€ Dakoda whispered the first words sheâ€™d spoken in a week and they had been said to the green-eyed boy she had just met.      Now - October 30th 2005     The smooth purring rumble of two classic vehicles raced down the long stretch of highway music blaring out of the windows of the lead car as it raced passed the other quickly. As the two vehicles approached an apartment building they slowed as the music was shut off and silence filled the air.   DAKODA HERNANDEZ stepped out of her 1979 Ford Mustang with a taunting smirk on her lips her gaze fixed on the 1967 Chevrolet Impala that pulled up beside her. She waited for the owner to step out before leaping onto his back the man releasing a resounding â€˜oof!â€™ at the sudden presence of her added weight on his back.   â€œTold you I would win Dean shouldâ€™ve listened.â€ Dakoda taunted lightly flicking the back of Deanâ€™s ear as he carried her closer to the apartment building where their brothers lived.  â€œYeah yeah Koda. Maybe I let you win.â€ Dean responded he hoisted her up his back to readjust his grip slightly his hands gripping the backs of her thighs comfortably.   â€œYou wouldnâ€™t youâ€™d know Iâ€™d kick your ass.â€ Dakoda grinned as she leaned her chin on the green-eyed hunterâ€™s shoulder â€œAre you even sure Damien and Sam will say yes Dean?â€ she asked after the fun had slightly died down.   â€œIâ€™m sure Kody. I know for sure Damien will say yes youâ€™re his big sister. Weâ€™ll have to see about Sam.â€ Dean replied his tone sounding hopeful at first but then becoming skeptical at the mention of Sam. The two approached the side of the building where the alleyway was standing just beneath the fire escape as Dakoda slid off Deanâ€™s back. She watched as he jumped up and grabbed the bottom of the ladder before dragging it back down so they could climb onto it.  â€œYou ready?â€ Dean asked raising his eyebrow at her with a small smile on his lips â€œReady as I can be.â€ Dakoda responded.        a/n - the prologue ahhhh!! itâ€™s finally up and I hope you like it! poor Koda. comment and let me know what you think! love you!     taglist - @dianawinchester03 @quarterhorse19  ( comment if you wish to be tagged )        Â© nesnejwritings  all rights reserved

post_body: Today while visiting the bunker Charlie notices the controversial manners in which the older residents bookmark their books. The first offender she catches is Sam who dog ears a spell book heâ€™d been reading. Charlie appalled asks why he would do that and Sam tells her that he always just made due with what they had which since they were often in a car was usually nothing. She rants to Dean about his brotherâ€™s book care habits who tells her that he tends to just leave books open where heâ€™s at pointing to a weathered ancient-looking tome which is currently lying pages down on the kitchen counter inches away from a pile of crumbs and definitely not helping the already deteriorating binding. She then decides to confront Cas. A being thatâ€™s had so much life experience must appreciate the efficiency and safety of a simple bookmark right? Cas quietly listens as Charlie lays out the damages that must have been inflicted on the Men of Letters collection. When she asks for his opinion he confidently tells her that heâ€™s never damaged a book. Nor had he inserted any sort of marking he simply commits his current page and line to memory before putting it away. Charlie letâ€™s her head fall against the table glad that although strange this method doesnâ€™t harm the pages. She finally visits Jack whoâ€™s been in their room most of the day. They end up working together to craft a cup full of personalized bookmarks to keep in the library.

post_body: **The Japanese Urban Legend of the Kunkune: An Exploration of Cultural Fear and Mystery**     Urban legends are a fascinating aspect of cultural folklore often reflecting the fears values and creative imaginations of the societies that birth them. One such chilling tale from Japan is the legend of the Kunkune a spectral entity that has captured the collective imagination and invoked a sense of dread among those who hear its story. This essay explores the origins characteristics and cultural significance of the Kunkune.     The Kunkune often depicted as a ghostly waving figure is said to appear in rural areas of Japan particularly in expansive rice fields. The name â€œKunkuneâ€ itself is derived from the Japanese onomatopoeia â€œkunkunâ€ which mimics the sound of something swaying or waving. This eerie figure is typically described as a white humanoid shape that oscillates in a hypnotic almost trance-inducing manner. Witnesses claim that the Kunkune can be seen from a distance often in the shimmering heat haze of summer adding an otherworldly quality to its already unsettling presence.     According to the legend the Kunkune is not just a benign apparition but a dangerous entity. Those who stare at it for too long or try to approach it are said to experience severe psychological distress madness or even death. The exact nature of the Kunkuneâ€™s malevolence varies among different retellings but the common thread is that it brings misfortune to those who dare to engage with it. This aspect of the legend serves as a cautionary tale warning individuals to respect the unknown and maintain a safe distance from things that are beyond human comprehension.     The cultural significance of the Kunkune lies in its embodiment of the fear of the unknown and the unseen. Japan has a rich tradition of ghost stories and supernatural folklore often rooted in Shinto and Buddhist beliefs that emphasize the presence of spirits and the thin veil between the physical and spiritual worlds. The Kunkune legend taps into these deeply ingrained cultural narratives reminding people of the potential dangers that lurk in liminal spacesâ€”those areas that exist on the boundaries of the known world such as remote rice fields or the edges of human habitation.     Furthermore the Kunkune can be seen as a reflection of modern anxieties. In an increasingly urbanized and technologically advanced society the legend evokes a sense of nostalgia and fear associated with rural landscapes and traditional ways of life. It serves as a metaphor for the disconnection between modernity and nature highlighting the mysterious and often unsettling aspects of the natural world that remain beyond human control and understanding.     In conclusion the Japanese urban legend of the Kunkune is a compelling example of how folklore can encapsulate cultural fears and societal values. Through its eerie narrative and haunting imagery the Kunkune serves as a reminder of the enduring power of the unknown and the importance of respecting the boundaries between the seen and unseen. As with many urban legends the story of the Kunkune continues to evolve captivating new generations and preserving a unique aspect of Japanese cultural heritage.
