If I tell all that to the public America descends into chaos and I lose my position as the President.â€  â€œSoâ€¦ youâ€™ll lie.â€  â€œPoliticians lie Amara.â€ Chuck snapped putting his suit jacket on and beginning the last finishing touches to his hair. â€œIâ€™m a politician. I lie. Itâ€™s how people like me get by in this train wreck of a country!â€   â€œAnd Iâ€™m one of the only civilians that arenâ€™t left in the dark.â€ Amara muttered dejected. â€œFine Chuck. But know that if this goes downhill I warned you.â€ Amara turned on her high heel leaving the room promptly.  Chuck rubbed his forehead smoothing out the creases but he didnâ€™t have time to worry over an argument with his sister. He put on his cuff links checked that every strand of his hair was perfectly set then stepped out of his room and met his bodyguards.   â€œCarlson.â€ He muttered to one of the guards who nodded back.  â€œMr President.â€ Carlson replied curtly looking forward with an earpiece attached to a wire that disappeared down the front of his suit jacket.  Time to lie again.  â€œAlright every agent involved has to be on the clock and alert yâ€™hear?â€ Director Singer informed all of us. Weâ€™d gotten word from our contacts undercover in crime rings that the syndicate dubbed â€˜Hellâ€™ was going to make their move on the British consulate. Tonight at a meeting in the British Embassy. It was Agent Lafitte Agent Garrison (who had been taken off suspension) and S. Winchesterâ€™s job to secure the perimeter.   As for Dean and I weâ€™d been assigned a full sweep of the building with some MI6 agents on the case to protect the British consulate: Agent Mick Davies and Agent Arthur Ketch. Neither you nor Dean looked forward to be meeting with the Brits but hey it was your job.  â€œYou twoâ€ Director Singer gestured between the two of you â€œeverything needs to go smoothly with these MI6 agents. I donâ€™t want any reports to come back from their supervisor. Winchester Iâ€™m lookinâ€™ at you.â€ He pointedly stared at Dean who returned the glare with a deceivingly innocent expression. â€œTheyâ€™ll meet you in T minus five minutes.â€  Beat.  â€œWhatâ€™s everyone waiting for? Go go go!â€  Everyone split off and you and Dean were left alone and he shot you a sideways smile. â€œSoâ€¦ Sam knows.â€  â€œYep.â€ You nodded sighing. â€œAndrÃ©a knows as well.â€  â€œDamn.â€ Dean whistled lowly folding his arms and giving you a sideways look. At least it wasnâ€™t the usual searing looks that had your mind going places. It was more muted probably from the previous dayâ€™s intense release(s) of the day before.   You didnâ€™t know whether to call it a mistake or the best damn night of your life. You had to admit relinquishing control letting Dean put you under him and hearing him talk dirty with that deep voice into your ear was heaven and hell on earth. But when he rolled you over and set you above him you felt almost powerful.  So you didnâ€™t know what to think. All you knew is that you and Dean Winchester in the same room was a recipe for disaster. Because it always ended in hardcore sex.  Or even hardcore making out. Anything with the term hardcore would do.  â€œYou the FBI associates?â€ Two men walked up to the two of you. One short and frankly dressed in the least stylish suit youâ€™d seen. He gave you the impression of an extremely off brand Patrick Dempsey. He put his hand out to Dean with a polite smile eyes scanning the both of you. â€œMick Davies MI6.â€  â€œDean Winchester FBI.â€ Dean replied shaking Mickâ€™s hand and with the small flinch in Mickâ€™s expression Dean had pulled out the â€˜hell of a gripâ€™ move due to the inflation in testosterone.  Daviesâ€™ associate however was taller and he looked like he permanently had a bad smell under his nose. That is until he saw you. That was when he put on a rather â€˜pretentious dickâ€™ smile and extended his hand to you. â€œArthur Ketch.â€ His eyes had a glint in them that you didnâ€™t trust. â€œMI6.â€  â€œNice to meet you.â€ You said curtly then cleared your throat. â€œOur work is to protect the Consulate. Our agents are securing a perimeter as we speak. We need airtight security and airtight security detail. That means no distractions and all eyes on any suspicious figures in the room.â€  Dean had a feeling the â€˜no distractionsâ€™ bit was very aimed at him. Knowing you it probably was.  â€œWe have it covered darling.â€ Ketch flashed you what he thought must have been a charming smile but instead looked constipated. â€œYou hang tight.â€  â€œIâ€™m not â€˜hanging tightâ€™.â€ You responded with a hint of frost to your words. Who were you kidding? That frost was as strong as a tequila shot. â€œIâ€™m doing my job. Do yours as well.â€ You walked off adjusting the straps of your FBI vest going to Director Singer to check if the perimeter was secure.  One thing. Can one thing in your life go right?  â€œHarvelle what do you mean by â€˜the files are scatteredâ€™?â€ You hissed into your phone trying to watch the room but also dealing with a problem back at the office.  â€˜Thatâ€™s the literal term.â€™ Jo almost winced as she seemed to be collecting all the files. â€˜Somebody broke into the office and searched through.â€™  â€œOk.â€ You took a breath so you wouldnâ€™t spontaneously combust and fantasise about Dean taking care of you again. â€œRight. Hereâ€™s what you need to do. Sort the files get Tran to help and run all the collected files and its contents through our database. If anyoneâ€™s taken anything we know itâ€™s a class one priority. You report to me tell me whatâ€™s missing. Any evidence thatâ€™s been tampered with report to me. Got it?â€  â€˜Yeah.â€™  â€œNow I have a Consulate to watch. Bye.â€  â€˜Bye.â€™ Harvelle squeaked and cut the call. You sighed rubbing your forehead. Nope. Nothing could go right.  Dean walked through the halls radio up to his mouth as he gave orders and updates on the situation. He passed a large group of people and as he did a very discreet movement with made. Using a sharpened pocketknife with one clean flick of the knife they cut the side of Deanâ€™s bulletproof vest. If by chance he made one wrong move he was exposed.  While Consulate Sutherland of Britain was shaking hands with the mayor of Washington Vince Gray you were approached by a lady asking for the bathroom. She seemed innocent enough then you saw it. White suit slicked back salt and pepper hair raising a pistol.  Asmodeus.  The lady was a distraction.  You quickly cuffed her and handed her over to Agent Lafitte running but you didnâ€™t think youâ€™d get there fast enough. â€œGET DOWN!â€  Dean saw your sprinting and he got there before you diving to tackle the Consulate and mayor down but his cut vest ripped and the bullet that was fired with a deafening bang struck him in the side.  Your steps faltered for a moment especially as you saw the supposed â€˜distractionâ€™ raise a small-duty detonator. You snapped the fastenings on the metal table flipping it. You heard her make the cry â€œFor Azazel!â€ before a much smaller blast than the one at the Presidentâ€™s speech ripped through the building pushing you back and replacing all sense of sound with high white noise in your ear.  It was deafening blocking out all sound but your eyes were in full working order. Asmodeus raised his gun again and that prompted you to quickly flip the table in front of you just as the bullets flew making dents in the metal from your side. Reaching for your handgun you cocked it and flipped the safety Dean saying something that you couldnâ€™t make out through the ringing in your ears instead popping up from behind the table to fire a shot before ducking back down.  â€œSweetheart.â€ You could make out from under the ringing alone with Deanâ€™s hand clutching his side compressing the blood flow.  You couldnâ€™t hear a thing looking blank even as you kept shooting at irregular intervals only able to remain up for a short amount of time which sent your aim off kilter a bit. Didnâ€™t help that Asmodeus was surprisingly agile for a man that seemed to be older.   You fired a quick and precise shot having regained your bearings a bit hitting the gun from a diagonal and sending it skidding which forced Asmodeus to run. You could have run after him. However as youâ€™d recovered you nodded to Dean. â€œYeah?â€  â€œThe mole.â€ Dean panted holding his hand to his side. â€œProbably compromised our position. You need to go get â€˜em sweetheart.â€ He grunted unable to move much. You were torn between staying and leaving but he chuckled. â€œI can see the cogs. Go. Now.â€  Your jobâ€™s duty was right there with the rapidly retreating figure of Asmodeus. But it was also with protecting your colleague so you took off your jacket gesturing for Sam to move in on Asmodeus and begin chase while Benny Cas Meg and Ruby headed to secure a tighter perimeter.  Rolling up your sleeves you took a look at Dean gently removing his hands and checking for his signs of consciousness. â€œYouâ€™re gonna have to keep talking ok?â€ You paused and then chuckled. â€œAs if you had any trouble with that before.â€  The comment got a laugh and a shake of Deanâ€™s head huffing. â€œSmartass.â€ He coughed slightly. â€œIâ€™ll fuck that attitude out of you when mâ€™healed up.â€  â€œTrust me counting on it.â€ You grinned. Even if you werenâ€™t sure if that would happen again. You pressed your hand firmly over the wound quickly calling for medical backup and checking it over. â€œNo major arteries. But this needs to be checked out Dean. Iâ€™m not leaving you.â€  â€œYes you are.â€ Dean insisted reaching up to tuck a strand of hair behind your ear. â€œYouâ€™re better kickinâ€™ ass instead of checkinâ€™ on me.â€  â€œAre you sure?â€  â€œYes.â€  â€œDouble sure?â€  â€œDouble yes.â€  â€œDean.â€  â€œIâ€™m not hearing this.â€ He lightly shoved your shoulder. â€œGo on get.â€  â€œClassy.â€ You sighed replacing the clip of your gun and cocking the barrel. But you conceded sighing. â€œFine. Fine. Iâ€™m going.â€  â€œGood girl.â€ Dean murmured cradling your jaw. â€œGive â€˜em hell darlinâ€™.â€ You nodded then ran after Asmodeus leaving Dean alone as he saw paramedics pull up outside.   â€œSon of a bitch.â€ He grunted looking at the scarlet on his fingers.  In the meantime you sprinted down where you thought Asmodeus went but found nothing. Nothing except a dragged trail of red which you followed.   The streaks of red on the stone floor ended at feet. Which were obviously connected to legs and then hips and a torso and aâ€¦ neck. Oh God.  The guy youâ€™d found was deader than dead. His throat was slit deep and almost surgically blood dripping steadily into a puddle on the ground.   And over the cleverly painted mural above the poor dead civilian were words painted in blood. Hasty and hurried words.   I WARNED YOU.  NEXT UP: â€œMy baby.â€ Your mom whispered sitting beside you in your hospital bed smoothing back your hair. â€œGod look at you.â€  You rolled your eyes prepared for the worst. After all nothing more or less could be expected of your traditional mother other than and personal comments to your appearance.   â€œSpit it out.â€ You groaned. â€œI look like hell.â€ You felt like youâ€™d combust. Youâ€™d do it. Fragile chine be damned.  Like comment or reblog! Iâ€™d love to hear your feedback. Comment if you want to be added to the taglist. post_body: **The Japanese Urban Legend of the Kunkune: An Exploration of Cultural Fear and Mystery**     Urban legends are a fascinating aspect of cultural folklore often reflecting the fears values and creative imaginations of the societies that birth them. One such chilling tale from Japan is the legend of the Kunkune a spectral entity that has captured the collective imagination and invoked a sense of dread among those who hear its story. This essay explores the origins characteristics and cultural significance of the Kunkune.     The Kunkune often depicted as a ghostly waving figure is said to appear in rural areas of Japan particularly in expansive rice fields. The name â€œKunkuneâ€ itself is derived from the Japanese onomatopoeia â€œkunkunâ€ which mimics the sound of something swaying or waving. This eerie figure is typically described as a white humanoid shape that oscillates in a hypnotic almost trance-inducing manner. Witnesses claim that the Kunkune can be seen from a distance often in the shimmering heat haze of summer adding an otherworldly quality to its already unsettling presence.     According to the legend the Kunkune is not just a benign apparition but a dangerous entity. Those who stare at it for too long or try to approach it are said to experience severe psychological distress madness or even death. The exact nature of the Kunkuneâ€™s malevolence varies among different retellings but the common thread is that it brings misfortune to those who dare to engage with it. This aspect of the legend serves as a cautionary tale warning individuals to respect the unknown and maintain a safe distance from things that are beyond human comprehension.     The cultural significance of the Kunkune lies in its embodiment of the fear of the unknown and the unseen. Japan has a rich tradition of ghost stories and supernatural folklore often rooted in Shinto and Buddhist beliefs that emphasize the presence of spirits and the thin veil between the physical and spiritual worlds. The Kunkune legend taps into these deeply ingrained cultural narratives reminding people of the potential dangers that lurk in liminal spacesâ€”those areas that exist on the boundaries of the known world such as remote rice fields or the edges of human habitation.     Furthermore the Kunkune can be seen as a reflection of modern anxieties. In an increasingly urbanized and technologically advanced society the legend evokes a sense of nostalgia and fear associated with rural landscapes and traditional ways of life. It serves as a metaphor for the disconnection between modernity and nature highlighting the mysterious and often unsettling aspects of the natural world that remain beyond human control and understanding.     In conclusion the Japanese urban legend of the Kunkune is a compelling example of how folklore can encapsulate cultural fears and societal values. Through its eerie narrative and haunting imagery the Kunkune serves as a reminder of the enduring power of the unknown and the importance of respecting the boundaries between the seen and unseen. As with many urban legends the story of the Kunkune continues to evolve captivating new generations and preserving a unique aspect of Japanese cultural heritage.

One of the things that I kind of miss as the showâ€™s lore develops into the era of bunkers and international secret societies is the fragmented nature of knowledge in the huntingâ€¦ well I was going to say community but I think Iâ€™ll go with field. People pass knowledge along family lines by blood or choice; they donâ€™t trust strangers to fact-check it. None of the Winchesters knows that vampires are real before season 1 and they donâ€™t think to ask Bobby about the werewolf â€œcureâ€ until it fails on Madison. Bobby doesnâ€™t trust Steve Wandellâ€™s friends to care that Sam was possessed when Meg used him to kill Steve. Ellen doesnâ€™t trust most of her customer base to not be hunting psychics. Isaac assumes on minimal grounds that Bobby Sam and Dean are at fault for a devilâ€™s gate opening. Walt and Roy try to kill Sam for freeing Lucifer but they donâ€™t tryâ€“ in fact outright refuseâ€“ to learn how it happened. Hunters arenâ€™t a single group; theyâ€™re more like dozens of small paramilitaries that donâ€™t really know one anotherâ€™s agendas.  And when hunters do trust outside colleagues itâ€™s likelier than not to go sideways. Gordon Walker tries to kill Sam (although in fairness to Gordon Sam himself later wonders if a permanent death might be for the best). Travis (does he get a last name? I canâ€™t remember) not only tries to kill a rugaru who hasnâ€™t yet killed any humans; his own aggression catalyzes Jack Montgomeryâ€™s transformation and nearly gets both brothers killed. Sam asks Martin to do recon on Benny and Martin winds up taking an innocent hostage so that he can trap Benny himself. Helpful or at least well-meaning hunters like Bobby Jo and Garth are until some point in the Carver era exceptions rather than the rule.  (Of course if you pay attention to the single worst arc episode of the series which is â€œThe Heroesâ€™ Journeyâ€ Garth turns out to be the biggest psycho of them all cheerfully â€œGarthingâ€ a whole club of people without attempting to separate the innocent from the guilty. But since thatâ€™s easily the worst episode Andrew Dabb ever wrote and it drops another continuity error approximately every three seconds Iâ€™m electing to ignore it.)  Iâ€™m not sure exactly when the change starts. Itâ€™s creeping rather than sudden. Maybe it starts as far back as season 4â€™s â€œIn the Beginningâ€ when Samuel tests Deanâ€™s bona fides by asking him about vampiresâ€“ which â€œDead Manâ€™s Bloodâ€ made clear you can hunt a long time without encountering. Maybe inheriting Bobbyâ€™s contacts list has something to do with it. Maybe once you call a friendly tech friend like Charlie a hunter you forget what cold-blooded sons of bitches this showâ€™s regular hunters have usually been. You can see the difference in season 9â€™s â€œDevil May Careâ€ where Tracy makes snide comments about Samâ€™s past but puts it aside to work their case and season 11â€™s â€œThe Chittersâ€ where Sam and Dean have a low-drama teamup with CÃ©sar and Jesse. Then you have season 12â€™s â€œCelebrating the Life of Asa Foxâ€ where dozens of hunters gather for a wake in a late hunterâ€™s momâ€™s house and one guy actually fanboys over Samâ€™s possession by Lucifer. Some of these experiences are tense but they arenâ€™t downright threatening nor are the other hunters all useless against higher-tier opponents.  So what changed? Iâ€™d say that maybe the apocalypse and Leviathan killed off the dangerously ignorant and/or belligerent hunters but Walt and Roy show back up in season 12 so that seems doubtful. I might also say that the Winchesters have simply earned the trust and respect of their fellow hunters but LOL no. Remember Deanâ€™s friend Rudy and Maryâ€™s stooge that Ramiel kills?  Iâ€™m left with no good Watsonian explanation. I can give Doylist explanations sure: Maybe the writers wanted Mary to have associates outside of Sam and Dean; maybe some executive thought that a show about two rejects wouldnâ€™t attract the advertisers they wanted; maybe later-seasons showrunners wanted an excuse for more characters to share a room. Unfortunately Doylist explanations donâ€™t interest me much. They might if I could be a fly on the wall of the writersâ€™ room but Iâ€™m watching the final product and thatâ€™s where I want to find the sense.  (As a final note Iâ€™m still slightly doped up from a minor surgery earlier today so please forgive any egregious typos or jumps in topics.)

post_body: Breaking Free: Chapter 2: In the Shadows of Lies Pairings: AU! Mechanic Dean x Reader  Chapter Summary: Andrew isnâ€™t happy with Y/N and Dean sees something he wished he didnâ€™t.  Warnings: Mentions of domestic assault physical abuse threatening panic angst.  Series Masterlist here!! & Main masterlist here!  <!-- more --> The next morning I woke up feeling surprisingly refreshed despite the drama of the previous day. There was a faint glimmer of hope in my heart perhaps sparked by Dean the man Iâ€™d met. Yet I couldnâ€™t ignore the reality: I hardly knew him.   Why was I so eager to see him again?  My plans were clear: get my car fixed leave town with whatever money I had left avoid Andrew and his lies and start fresh. Oddly the thought of not seeing Dean after my car was fixed stung a bit why was I going to miss him?  After getting ready I headed to the bank and withdrew my remaining money closed my account and opened a new one to prevent Andrew from accessing my funds again. It was a small victory but it felt like progress.  Next stop was the coffee shop I went to every morning trying to get back into my routine before I left for good. Sitting at the bar I ordered breakfast trying to ignore the curious glances I recieved. Why did they look at me like they knew something? Did Andrew spread lies here too?  The waitress came by and instead of greeting me normally she stood by the counter her eyes narrowing down at me.  â€œListenâ€¦ I donâ€™t know what you heard about me but..â€  She quickly cut me short leaning closer to me. â€œListen people arenâ€™t comfortable with you being here. From what we heard from Andrew itâ€™s best if you donâ€™t come back.  My heart raced ears blocked and I struggled to breathe as the panic rose. "With all due respect you donâ€™t have the full story.â€ I managed to say quietly.  She chuckled softly â€œWe all know Andrew. Heâ€™s the friendliest guy around.â€  I nodded looking away. â€œAnd what have you heard about me?â€  â€œWe heard you used him got tired of playing second fiddle acted out for attention. Issues with drinking violenceâ€¦ then you took his money and disappeared. Now youâ€™re back to torment him.â€  I froze tears welling up. Why was Andrew spreading these lies to isolate me? â€œThatâ€™s not true at all. He hurt me. I could take off my makeup and show you. Andrew is not a nice guy and even though he seems like it he has darkness inside of him.â€  She rolled her eyes and scoffedâ€œLook Iâ€™m not trying to cause a scene but I think itâ€™s best if you just leave.â€  Nodding I got up from my seat and left. I couldnâ€™t handle the fact that he was right nobody was ever going to believe me.   Back at the motel I saw Deanâ€™s truck outside and my heart stopped momentarily. I quickly wiped my eyes and tried to compose myself before walking closer he didnâ€™t need to see me cry. He probably wouldnâ€™t even care nobody cared they just wanted me gone.  Has Dean heard these rumours?  He smiled warmly until I stepped closer noticing the redness in my eyes. â€œY/N? You okay?â€   â€œYeah Iâ€™m fine.â€ I replied unconvincingly. His lingering gaze suggested he saw through my facade but I pushed my head down eyes focusing on my boots.   â€œUh so your carâ€™s ready. Four new tiresâ€ he said trying to distract me.  â€œThank you. How much?â€ I questioned trying to hide the anxiety at whatever number he was about to drop.  Dean hesitated a small shy smile spreading on his lips. â€œInstead of payment I was wondering if I could I get your number?â€  My breath caught in my throat as i stared up at him â€œWhat?â€  His cheeks flushed with embarrassment a nervous smile playing at his lips. â€œSorry that was forward. I meant I donâ€™t need you to pay me back. I just thought maybe we could grab some dinner sometime?â€  I urged myself to respond but no words came out. My mouth opened but before I could speak Andrewâ€™s voice cut through causing me to flinch. He approached angrily distrupting the moment. â€œY/N can I speak with you?â€  I faced Dean smiling nervously. â€œI-Iâ€™m sorry I have to go..â€  Dean looked puzzled but stayed put watching cautiously as Andrew closed in on me. Fear gripped me. I wanted to hide behind Dean but I couldnâ€™t burden a stranger with my troubles.  Andrew closed the distance flashing his fake smile and standing beside Dean and I. â€œAndrew Wilson nice to meet you.â€  â€œUh Dean Winchester. Nice to meet you too.â€  Andrew stopped a wide grin spreading across his face as he tried to win Deanâ€™s favour. â€œWinchester like Winchester mechanics?â€  Dean nodded in response.   â€œWow small world. I was going to call John for an interview tomorrow. How cool is that?â€  I knew Andrew was trying to manipulate Dean and he seemed to sense it too. â€œAnyways I need to talk to Y/N for a minute. Afterward she can settle the bill with you.â€  Dean glanced at me noticing my fear and perhaps the bruises beneath my makeup. He nodded and settled back in his truck keeping an eye on us. He couldnâ€™t ignore the tight grip of Andrewâ€™s hand on my arm or the tremors of fear coursing through my body.   He wished he could intervine to punch Andrew and pull me from the scene but he knew it wasnâ€™t his fight-at least not yet. He barely knew me; stepping in now might complicate things further.  But as Andrew led me forcefully toward the motel room Deanâ€™s cheeks burned with anger and worry. He sensed trouble brewing a sinking feeling that something was very wrong.  Stepping out of his truck Dean leaned against the wall the sound of screaming filling his ears and shattering his heart.  Andrewâ€™s voice was furious accusing me of lying and staining his reputation. He advanced on me aggressively trapping me against the wall. The punch he aimed at the wall beside me made tears well up-I knew he intended to hurt me again.  â€œYouâ€™re a fucking bitch.â€ Andrew spat his face twisted with rage. â€œTelling your stupid fucking lies. Tomorrow youâ€™re going back and telling everybody you were drunk and you lied.â€  â€œN-No.â€ I stammered fear gripping me as he pressed closer his hand on my cheek. â€œIâ€™m not going to.â€  He laughed bitterly his eyes threatening. â€œYou will or Iâ€™ll drag you there myself. I can make your life hell believe me.â€  â€œGet off me Andrew!â€ I pleaded desperation creeping into my voice.  He laughed again his hand tightening on my face. Panic overwhelmed me-I had to act. Summoning all my courage I slapped him hard across the face pushing him away before bolting for the door.  I grasped the doorknob but Andrewâ€™s grip on my arm yanked me brutally to the ground. He dragged me back pinning me down. In that moment of terror all I could do was scream praying that Dean might hear from outside.  â€œPlease! Help me please!â€ I screamed but Andrewâ€™s hand clamped over my mouth his voice commanding me to shut up.  The door swung open and Andrew quickly scrambled off me casually leaning against the wall as if nothing had happened while I remained laying on the ground tears streaming down my face.  â€œGet away from her now!â€ Deanâ€™s voice rang out sharply.  Andrew scoffed stepping closer. â€œThis isnâ€™t what it looks like. She attacked me. Look at my face she hit me this is what she does!â€  Dean stood silent his gaze piercing through Andrew before settling on me. His heart sank seeing me in this state-crying shaking my face flushed with fear. He knew the truth of what had happened.  â€œYou need to leave.â€ Dean ordered.  With a dismissive laugh Andrew turned towards the door pausing just above me. â€œIâ€™ll see you soon Y/N. Remember what I said.â€  As Andrew exited a wave of relief washed over me though the fear still gripped me tight making me unable to move still shaking and sobbing uncontrollably.  Dean crouched down beside me his touch on my shoulder making me flinch. â€œAre you alright sweetheart?â€  I shook my head hiding my face in my hands mortified by the whole scene. I was sure Dean would regret asking me out now maybe he even believed Andrewâ€™s lies.  He shifted his hand to my back helping me sit up and then did something unexpectedâ€”he pulled me onto his arms wrapping me in a protective hug.  I sobbed into his neck gradually calming down as Dean reassured me that everything was okay now that Andrew was gone.  When I finally mustered the courage to meet Deanâ€™s eyes I found only gentleness and understanding in his gaze.  Dean stood up helping me to my feet. â€œYou going to be okay?â€  I nodded wiping my tears away but when Dean noticed my bruises now that the makeup was faded his face fell.  He gently touched my cheek his voice filled with concern. â€œDid he do this to you?â€ Dean asked softly.  I swallowed hard avoiding his gaze afraid of what he might think of me. But Dean nodded knowingly and drew me into a light hug. â€œIâ€™m sorry you went through that.â€  I shrugged fighting back tears. â€œItâ€™s alright. I should have known better than to irritate him.â€  â€œFrom what I saw you werenâ€™t provoking him at all. You were just trying to move on and he clearly has some issues to sort outâ€ Dean reassured me firmly.  I stayed silent unsure of how to respond. Opening up about Andrew before had only led to pain. Would it be the same with Dean?  Dean rubbed his neck awkwardly as we walked back to his truck grabbing some papers from the seat.  â€œUm I know this is probably bad timing but I still donâ€™t want you to pay for the tires. And Iâ€™d still like to take you out to dinnerâ€ Dean said sincerely.  Despite the situation I couldnâ€™t help but laugh softly at his persistence. â€œDean why do you want to take me out after everything youâ€™ve heard about me?â€  He turned to face me muscles flexing as he crossed his arms. â€œBecause none of it seems true to me. You seem kind funny and beautiful. I donâ€™t believe Andrewâ€™s lies and Iâ€™d like to get to know you better.â€  I was stunned by his sincerity feeling a flutter in my chest at his words. Without overthinking it I closed the distance between us my hands resting on his chest.  Dean looked surprised his eyes fluttering shut as I leaned up to kiss him. It was a moment of relief and hope feeling a connection I hadnâ€™t expected.  When we pulled apart his shy smile left me breathless. â€œUm so is that a yes to dinner?â€ Dean asked cheeks tinted pink.  I giggled softly nodding as I took the papers from him to jot down my number. â€œDefinitely yes.â€  Dean grinned broadly. â€œGreat. Iâ€™ll call you and we can figure out the details okay?â€  â€œSounds perfect. Thank you Dean for everythingâ€ I said gratefully.  He nodded and winked at me sending my heart racing. In that moment I knew Dean was special. He had already begun to change my life and I wanted to do the same for him.  Deanâ€™s POV  I couldnâ€™t get that kiss out of my head. It was incredible especially after everything Andrew put you through. You initiated it and it made my head spin and my heart race. I barely knew you but I knew I wanted to protect you. This whole situation was insane but maybe it was the good kind of crazy.  I parked my truck in the shopâ€™s lot instantly spotting my dad marching over his anger obvious.   Great another problem.  As I stepped out he came closer until he was right in front of me swinging a punch that caught me off guard.  â€œWhat the hell Dad?â€ I protested stumbling back against the truck.  â€œDonâ€™t â€˜what the hell Dadâ€™ meâ€ he snapped. â€œAndrew Wilson just called. Winchester Mechanics had an interview lined up but he claims you caused a scene with his ex-girlfriend at the motel. I told you to stay away from her!â€  Anger simmered inside me. â€œDad if you had seen what Andrew was doing to her you wouldâ€™ve done the same. She was covered in bruises and Andrewâ€™s lying about her.â€  â€œItâ€™s not our damn business! Are you willing to risk our shop over some girl?â€  I rolled my eyes leaning back against the truck. â€œYou donâ€™t understand. You should have seen her.â€  He scoffed and pushed me against the truck inches from my face. â€œYou better hope Andrew reschedules that interview. All this fuss over a girl is ridiculous.â€  He walked away leaving me to wipe the blood from my lip. I didnâ€™t care about the interview or Andrewâ€™s games. All that mattered was making sure Andrew never laid a hand on you again.  Thank you for reading I hope you enjoyed it! Chapter 3 coming soon stay tuned! The Vampire Diaries Ep. 2x04 Memory Lane  not a good episode title not creative enough.  we begin in my absolute favorite place to begin an episode: a dream sequence. i love dream sequences. i truly think they are teh pinnacle of the television world and i would love nothing more than to see dream sequences all the time. i am obsessed with them. stefanâ€™s dream sequence is not one of the all time greats but it is a very good entry into the genre. stefanâ€™s worst nightmare is damon and elena together. stefanâ€™s other worst nightmare is damon and elena together. stefanâ€™s other other worst nightmare is relating to katherine on anything. she wants him back badly and sheâ€™ll use his worst nightmares to get it. this begs the question: did katherine give stefan this dream or his own subconscious?  then he wakes up and the nightmare continues because katherine is in bed with stefan. he initially is sweet to her because he thinks sheâ€™s elena but he realizes his mistake fairly quickly. katherine is much stronger than stefan due to her advanced age (and human blood habit). sheâ€™s also convinced that she can get stefan to fall in love with her. the shadows are seducing the not-shadows! (because of course damon is still trying to seduce elena even though he fucking murdered her brother three episodes ago.)  jenna is having a barbecue! because damon wants to get to know nawm he suggested it to ht who suggested it to jenna who said yeah thatâ€™s a good idea. we also learn from nawm that werewolves donâ€™t automatically change. they have to trigger the curse. nawm triggered it and he is convinced that tyler will not. he refuses to tell tyler what triggers the curse which is really infuriating because tyler deserves to have information about his own fucking life. heâ€™s not a toddler so he should be trusted with all the information about the consequences of his actions not shoved into a little corner like a child. however nawm is insistent that â€˜itâ€™s better for you if i donâ€™t tell you.â€™ this smells like bullshit.  <!-- more --> back at the salvatore house katherine is reading stefanâ€™s journal. heâ€™s giving her blood. katherine read that he doesnâ€™t drink human blood. they talk about werewolves. katherine knows quite a lot about werewolves from her past. we learn that damon had a boyfriend in the past too and he was a werewolf. katherine says 'they werewolves mostly exist now in books and really bad moviesâ€™ which is a dig on the teen wolf movie since the show had yet to premier. katherine then brings up the most interesting question she could at this point. why did stefan keep the picture of katherine? from a show perspective itâ€™s to prove that katherine is also played by nina dobrev and to prompt elena to run away giving us the drama of the first mid-season break. katherine says 'you came back here to fall in love with me all over again didnâ€™t you?â€™ which is a compelling question. stefan then says 'what is it about you that makes me still care?â€™ as he kisses katherine. i wrote in my notes 'i need to get a spray bottle and start spraying him.â€™ luckily he was acting and he vamp tranqs her then locks her in the cell downstairs.  then we do torture! stefan wants to know why elena came back and he doesnâ€™t believe it was about him. in the past this werewolf guy says 'because youâ€™re the rope in the salvatore brothersâ€™ tug of warâ€™ which was immediately burned into my brian and i donâ€™t totally remember the context. anyway she reveals that she is a vampire and knows he is a werewolf. 'you think i would move into a town without knowing my enemies.â€™ she is threatening this man which seems fair to be completely honest.  at the gilbert house jenna continues her campaign to be my favorite character by insisting that damon keep away from elena. she also says 'i have no secrets only dirty shameâ€™ which is a great line. i then wrote 'heâ€™s so fucking awkward.â€™ i no longer remember who this is a reference to but it could apply to any of the men in this scene. a great damon/nawm exchange: nawm: 'iâ€™ve heard great things about youâ€™ damon: 'thatâ€™s weird cause iâ€™m a dick.â€™  caroline and elena are very interesting here. elenaâ€™s asking caroline whatâ€™s up with her and caroline seems to be trying to convince elena to break up with stefan. she does do it somewhat subtlely though which is a bit of a surprise. caroline: 'god! i cannot stop eating. stefan says itâ€™s a great way to sublimate the cravings. itâ€™s horrible just fighting the urge for blood every minute of every day.â€™ elena: 'i know that stefan really hates that part of himself.â€™ caroline: 'yeah and he hates that youâ€™re a constant temptation.â€™ elena: 'he said that?â€™ caroline: 'the desire to rip out your jugular every time heâ€™s with you? trust me itâ€™s there. itâ€™s why i had to break up with matt.â€™ first off caroline doesnâ€™t directly lie which is a nice touch. she never answers elenaâ€™s question just pulls herself in to make a comparison. the reason this conversation is so effective is that caroline is making elena do the imaginative work. secondly caroline you did not break up with matt. he broke up with you. the problems you and matt have are fundamentally different than the problems stefan and elena have though linked. elenaâ€™s knowledge of stefanâ€™s true self gives her an advantage that matt doesnâ€™t have in making a relationship work.  meanwhile stefan is also defending his relationship. he claims that he doesnâ€™t pretend to be anything when heâ€™s with elena which is such a blatant lie i laughed out loud. he absolutely pretends to be a real boy with elena not necessarily for her but for himself. he wants to be human and elena gives him a safe place to have that fantasy. stefan claims not to love katherine and to have never loved her. katherine disagrees. it is unclear to me whoâ€™s right. i donâ€™t have enough information to make a call but i will say that both of them are claiming the thing that supports their own worldview and disregarding other interpretations. in the flashback stefan touches katherine with gloves on and i wrote in my notes: 'if he took his gloves off i would lose my mind. you hate to see it but itâ€™s also quite p&p pride & prejudice.â€™ this was a distressing moment. katherine then goes into her room and damon is there with his stupid cute hair. katherine didnâ€™t compel stefan to love her. she says that she only compelled him after he found out what she was. once again i donâ€™t trust that statement but i also donâ€™t necessarily disbelieve her. iâ€™m reserving judgment.  in the present at the gilbert house everyone is eating 'cobbler.â€™ however their 'cobblerâ€™ is quite clearly not a cobbler but a pie. damon is making boyfriends left and right as he now has a considerable amount of chemistry with nawm. jenna roasts damon again (and herself) 'youâ€™ve never dated you; iâ€™ve dated many yous.â€™ damon is going to stab nawm.  katherine tells stefan 'love. hate. such a fine line. i can waitâ€™ which is an excellent point and you hate to see it. lockwood of the past struck a deal to save katherine. she needs everyone to believe that she died in the fire. she then kills werewolf man because she is so fucking evil.  at the gilbert house nawm and damon continue to flirt throwing around terms like 'lone wolfâ€™ and 'lady killer.â€™ caroline is visibly upset and wants to leave the party. however she doesnâ€™t want to go find stefan. caroline is working for katherine.  stefan says that since he and damon didnâ€™t die to keep katherine safe they died for nothing. katherine says 'you died for love.â€™ while this is true iâ€™m a bit uncertain about the veracity of that love for both of them (especially stefan). neither damon nor stefan knows who katherine truly is. damon knows sheâ€™s a vampire but he doesnâ€™t really know her. sheâ€™s been compelling both of them fairly regularly and clearly hasnâ€™t been honest about her past. if the boys do love katherine at this point they donâ€™t love her. they love an idea of her. and katherine may have been happy with that and she may want that back but i think that love would never be sustainable in the long run.  in the present damon is threatening nawm. nawm does not want to fight because he came here to help his family. he wants to rise above the blood feud. nawm and ht agree to watch a game next week and damon says 'letâ€™s not catch that game next weekâ€™ to ht in a scene full of tension. jenna is standing right there the whole time. iâ€™m so sorry jenna.  caroline is preventing elena from making it to stefanâ€™s and elena eventually leaves caroline alone which is not a good idea because she is upset and has killed people before. everythingâ€™s fine though.  damon stabs nawm when he could have just been normal about things.  stefanâ€™s going a little feral. katherine threatens to kill everyone elena loves unless stefan gets rid of her. katherine then reveals that she is resistant to vervain after decades of poison training. katherine stabs stefan in the leg. then katherine and elena meet. we get a fascinating exchange that i cannot wait to learn more about. elena: 'how do we look exactly alike?â€™ katherine: 'youâ€™re asking the wrong questions.â€™  meanwhile nawm tells tyler how to activate the curse. if you kill a person the werewolf curse falls on you. this brings up a question: what would have happened if caroline died in the car crash? tyler needs this information in case of a dire accident! (the conversation they had leading up to this revelation was gold. tyler: 'how was that barbecue?â€™ nawm: 'not great. are you still pissed?â€™ tyler: 'are you still keeping secrets?â€™ nawm: 'yep.â€™ tyler: 'then iâ€™m still pissed.â€™)  elena and stefan go on a date to the only bar in town where elena admits that caroline has a point re the whole vampire thing. elena forgives caroline because 'you were just being a good friend in your own way.â€™ the two lovebirds need to break up. stefanâ€™s never going to do it so they have to make elena do it. katherine doesnâ€™t want to kill elena. she would have killed elena when john was dying if she wanted to. elena would be dead a hundred times over if katherine wanted it. stefan needs to stop letting katherine convince him that she wants elena dead. elena asks stefan 'why are you giving her so much power over our situation?â€™ stefan says 'she wants us to fight.â€™ damon and caroline both overheard the break up. damon talks to katherine afterward and says heâ€™d die again. 'been there done that least this time itâ€™ll be worth it.â€™  however it wasnâ€™t a real breakup thank goddess. stefan claims 'i donâ€™t do jealous not with you not anymore.â€™ which is an awfully nice thought but iâ€™m sure that it is not entirely true. stefan will be jealous of damon for any reason whenever and he would certainly be jealous if damon started flirting with elena. you can repress your emotions as much as you want stefan but it wonâ€™t make you stop feeling them. katherine has leverage over caroline and is making caroline do her dirty work. stefan and elena need to keep up the act to keep katherine off their scent.  stefan says toward the end of the episode that katherine is incapable of love. is she? we get hints that she is capable of love. when she pauses by herself to remember kissing damon and stefanâ€™s dying bodies it certainly seems like love. thereâ€™s no one there for her to act for so her only reason to behave as she does is that she is genuinely emotional. this points to katherine feeling genuine love. however obsession and love are two very different things. katherine doesnâ€™t seem to care about stefan about his happiness and his life. she wants how he makes her feel rather than his well-being. katherine does not love stefan she is attached to him. he matters to her because she likes the way he makes her feel. under stefanâ€™s gaze she feels important and valuable. i also think that some part of her is excited by playing him off of damon and controlling him. i do believe that katherine genuinely cared about stefan in some way. i donâ€™t think that those feelings are love.

post_body: so iâ€™ve gotten into supernatural

Supernatural Ep. 6x12 Like a Virgin  look i understand why dean wouldnâ€™t want to tell sam what happened over the past year. even beyond the wall thing dean doesnâ€™t want to acknowledge his own failures over the past year. he doesnâ€™t want to acknowledge all teh ways he failed with lisa and ben or the ways he failed sam. he wants to forget what has happened to him and move on. from deanâ€™s perspective all telling sam about the actions of his soulless self will do is bring samâ€™s pity on deanâ€™s situation. and he is not prepared for pity.  should sam be blamed for the actions of his soulless self? well thatâ€™s the question at the heart of so much vampire media. and i still donâ€™t know the answer to it. in supernatural specifically i donâ€™t think that sam should take any blame. other than being played by jared padalecki and having the right memories soulless sam is very different from souled sam. they are so different as to be two different people. soulless sam certainly considered them to be two people. i understand why sam is having so much trouble with his past actions though. sam is a guilt machine (like all winchesters) and this is a big load of guilt he can force himself to shoulder.

Rewatching Caged Heat and I have a question.  Sam tried to give Meg the demon blade to hold off the hellhounds and she tells him to keep it so they can kill Crowley with it. THEN she kisses Cas to steal his angel blade and relays that sheâ€™s unsure if it will kill the hellhounds.  I ask this more from a fan fic writerâ€™s POV than a viewer but:  If angels are generally more powerful than demons isnâ€™t the angel blade more powerful than the demon blade?  Or: Wouldnâ€™t the angel blade be able to kill both Crowley and the hellhounds?

post_body: â€œPlease?â€  Jess looked up from the book she was reading. Standing in the doorway with his stupid puppy dog eyes.  She acted like she was bothered throwing her book on the nightstand. In actuality she was just as happy to do so. â€œFine.â€  Sam excitedly climbed onto the bed with her. Lying between her legs arms wrapped around her waist head resting on her stomach.  â€œX marks the spotâ€ she said quietly tracing her finger across his upper back. â€œA circle and a dot. Four big boulders and one tiny rock. Spiders crawling up your back. Crack an egg down your head. Tight squeeze cool breeze now you have the tinglies.â€  Sam shivered lightly on top of her. Jess giggled continuing to play with him as he closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep.

post_body: Bunker Board Games SYNOPSIS: Youâ€™ve been stuck too long in the Bunker with Dean - and when he finds some old board games he takes it to a whole other level.  WORD COUNT: 774  PAIRING: Reader x Dean  INCLUDES: You x Dean  CHARACTERS: Dean Reader  FANDOM: Supernatural     Stuck in this bunker for what felt like an eternity youâ€™d lost count of the days. Itâ€™d become a routine of research training and occasional bickering with Dean Winchester over who left the last drop of coffee in the pot. But today something different happened.  Dean burst into the main room holding a dusty cardboard box excitedly. â€œGuess what I found buried under a pile of old lore books? Board games!â€  <!-- more --> You look up from the ancient text youâ€™d been reading eyebrows raised in surprise. â€œBoard games? Seriously?â€  Dean grins his eyes twinkling mischievously. â€œYeah seriously. Figured we could use a break from all this doom and gloom.â€  He set the box down on the table and started rummaging through it. â€œLetâ€™s seeâ€¦ Monopoly Scrabble Clueâ€¦ ah here we go! Twister!â€  You laugh at the idea of playing Twister in the confines of the bunker. â€œYou sure thatâ€™s a good idea Dean? We might end up knocking over half the furniture.â€  Dean shrugs nonchalantly. â€œEh itâ€™ll be fun. Plus itâ€™s good exercise.â€  With a playful eye-roll you agree to indulge his idea of fun. You start with Scrabble and as Dean places down word after word that score suspiciously high you canâ€™t help but notice how his eyes light up. His charisma is infectious and despite being stuck underground his presence makes it feel a little less suffocating.  As the afternoon wore on you move on to Monopoly where Deanâ€™s ruthless business tactics are surprisingly effective against you attempts to build a property empire. You catch yourself admiring his blatant cheats finding his competitive spirit oddly endearing.  Hours pass in a blur of laughter banter and surprisingly intense gaming sessions. Somewhere between debates over house rules and raiding the monopoly manâ€™s bank the atmosphere shifts. Thereâ€™s a charged energy between you a lingering tension that neither of you acknowledges outright.  When you finally tire of Monopoly Dean suggests a break. He fetches a couple of beers from the fridge and you settle on the couch shoulders brushing as you sip in companionable silence. The bunker feels warmer suddenly the walls less confining with Dean so close beside you.  â€œYou knowâ€ Dean begins his voice lower than usual â€œthis isnâ€™t exactly how I imagined spending days trapped underground.â€  You raise an eyebrow a smirk on your lips. â€œOh and how did you imagine it Dean?â€  He meets your gaze his green eyes darkening slightly with something unreadable. â€œMaybe a bit moreâ€¦ action-packedâ€ he teases his tone laced with a hint of flirtation.  You chuckle softly feeling a warmth spread through you at his implication. â€œWell who says our day canâ€™t get more exciting?â€  Deanâ€™s smile turns into a knowing grin as he leans closer his breath mingling with yours. â€œI like the way you think.â€  Before you can fully process his words his lips are on yours a gentle yet firm kiss that sends a thrill through your body. His hands find their way to your waist pulling you closer as if heâ€™s been waiting for this moment as eagerly as you had.  The kiss deepens becoming more urgent and passionate fueled by the tension that had been building between you for days. Deanâ€™s lips are warm and inviting his touch confident yet tender. Itâ€™s as if youâ€™d both been holding back waiting for the right moment to let go of your cares.  You tangle your fingers in his hair as you deepen the kiss savoring the taste of him. The world outside the bunker fades away leaving only the sensation of Deanâ€™s lips on yours and the steady beat of his heart against your chest.  When you finally pull apart breathless and flushed Dean rests his forehead against yours; his hands still resting gently on your waist. â€œWowâ€ he murmurs his voice hoarse with emotion.  â€œYeahâ€ You manage to reply your own voice quieted by the action that was slowly fading.  You sit in comfortable silence for a while basking in the afterglow of the kiss. The weight of the world felt lighter somehow as if this unexpected connection had given you both a reprieve from the darkness that surrounded your lives.  â€œIâ€™m glad we found those board gamesâ€ Dean finally says breaking the silence with a hint of a smirk.  â€œMe too.â€ You reply.  Dean leans in again pressing a soft kiss to your temple. â€œWho knew being stuck in a bunker could be this much fun?â€  As you settle back into the couch fingers intertwined and hearts racing you realize that maybe being stuck in this bunker isnâ€™t so bad after allâ€”especially if it means sharing moments like this with Dean Winchester.

post_body: Male. Late 20s. No ID -CH 5 - Soulmates and Other Rare Bonds Summary: Youâ€™re a writer but in your free time you volunteer at the local hospital and thatâ€™s how you met him. A very beautiful man found alone and dying in an abandoned warehouse. After being asked to sit with him and see if your presence causes him to wake or at least respond you do but that choice may change you in ways you could never have imagined.   Characters: Dean Winchester Sam Winchester Bobby Singer Marla (OFC) You/Reader   Warnings: hospital stay mentions of death both in the hospital setting and the readerâ€™s past show level violence/ gore angst fluff. Expect more/ new warnings as each chapter requires.   Chapter Warnings: Reader learns more about the supernatural world   A/N: this whole fic came from this one image  Word Count: 1733  Divider and Cover Image by me  Masterlist | Series Masterlist  Once we arrived at his property I wasnâ€™t surprised by the look of it â€œhe lives in a junkyard?â€ I asked â€œIâ€™m not so surprised by that.â€  Dean laughed as he shut the car off â€œSalvage yardâ€ he corrected and rushed to open the door and help me stand out of the car; when our hands connected I felt a rush and then was hit with some more visions.  <!-- more --> Bobby playing catch with two boys several images â€“ like snapshots â€“ I couldnâ€™t figure those out.  Then I could see Bobby yelling â€œYou stupid ass! What did you do?â€ he grabbed Deanâ€™s lapels and shook him â€œWhat did you do?!â€ he shouted. â€œYou made a deal â€“ for Sam didnâ€™t you?â€  My head was spinning â€“ â€˜what the hell did that mean?!â€™  Dean apparently got hit with visions of his own because he jerked from me and grabbed his head â€œoh fuck! What was that?â€  â€œWhat? What happened?â€  â€œI â€“ I sawâ€ his eyes went from angry to completely soft â€œI saw what you did the night you lost your familyâ€ he whispered.  I was terrified to touch him and yet I just wanted to hug him â€“ that confused me because I wasnâ€™t sure who the hug was meant to comfort at that moment but I didnâ€™t have enough time to think about it too long because the door swung open startling a squeak from me.  â€œWhat are you doinâ€™ here kiddo?â€ Bobby asked when his eyes landed on me.  Dean kept a bit of distance between him and I â€œwe got attacked.â€  â€œWell get yer asses inside thenâ€ Bobby barked as he wheeled back to give us room to come inside.  â€˜Why is he in a wheelchair?â€™ I wondered.   Dean grabbed my bags and one of his â€œI can carry my own bagsâ€ I offered.  â€œI got it get inside where itâ€™s safe.â€  I complied because I had a feeling there was no point in arguing with him â€“ inside was no less crowded than outside but it was books something I was at least a little more familiar with.  We caught Bobby up on the day â€“ minus the details of the visions and he said heâ€™d make a couple calls because it â€œsounds bigger than the normal demon chasing a Winchester activity.â€  While he was gone I spilled the tea on what Iâ€™d seen and began to ask Dean what the hell was happening â€“ to say I was unprepared for our conversation is the understatement of the year.  I was sitting there in utter shock at the news Dean had heaped upon me.  â€œDid you break her?â€ Bobbyâ€™s voice snapped me out of my bubble.  â€œIâ€™m not drunk enough for thisâ€ I grumbled as I stood up and began pacing the room. â€œFirst you tell me the man who murdered my family wasnâ€™t just some crazy dude now youâ€™re telling me that demons are real and are after me?!â€  â€œNo they are most likely after me but you got caught in the middle.â€  â€œOk fine but what about these creepy visions?!â€  Bobbyâ€™s head snapped to my direction â€œwhat visions?â€  I recounted to him about some of what Iâ€™d seen since touching Deanâ€™s hand and the more I spoke the paler Bobby appeared.  â€œBobby? Are you ok man?â€ Dean asked.  â€œShe canâ€™t be like Sam could she?â€  â€œI donâ€™t think soâ€ Dean shrugged and glanced at me.  â€œIt wouldnâ€™t fit the pattern her ma and pa were killed by a Rougarou.â€  â€œHow the fuck do you know that?â€  Bobby hung his head â€œhow do you think I knew you were in the hospital darlin?â€  â€œI thought you stopped in to volunteer thatâ€™s what the nurse told me.â€  â€œWell yeah monster hunters canâ€™t exactly tell everyone their business.â€  â€œHow did I not know this before?â€  â€œYouâ€™d already lost a lot of blood and your mind was trying to shut down due to the trauma.â€  I glanced at Dean â€œdonâ€™t look at me like that.â€  â€œLike what?â€  â€œLike youâ€™re sorry for me. Like Iâ€™m just another poor sap to be pitiedâ€ I snapped.  â€œI donâ€™t. I donâ€™t think youâ€™re someone to be pitied. Youâ€™re one of the strongest people Iâ€™ve ever met.â€    â€œYou two gonna quit actin like a married couple and work on this demon issue or what?â€  I was shocked at Bobbyâ€™s words but in that moment I figured he was right demons seemed like a much bigger problem than whatever Dean and I had going between us.  â€œHow do we fix this? How do we keep Dean safe?â€ I asked Bobby.  Dean scoffed â€œWEâ€ he paused making a little circular motion with his pointer for emphasis â€œdonâ€™t do anything to keep Dean safe. The point of bringing you here was to keep you safeâ€ he reminded us.  â€œThatâ€™s your viewpoint Sirâ€ I quipped causing Bobby to groan and wheel off into another room.  â€œThis isnâ€™t a joke Y/N.â€  â€œI know and somehow it feels like you think your life is a joke. I did not get your car out of impound and spend days living through flashes of your life to be tossed aside. Iâ€™m in this now.â€  â€œIâ€™m not gonna get you to stand down am I?â€  â€œI will when you do. Dean thereâ€™s something beyond me here. Someway I have got to understand this. If weâ€™re having visions of each otherâ€™s pasts and thereâ€™s demons behind it donâ€™t you think I deserve to know more and to help stop it?!â€  â€œStay hereâ€ he scrubbed his hand down his face â€œI need a minute to think and I gotta call Sammyâ€ he huffed and trudged out the front door.  When he didnâ€™t return for more than 15 minutes I started to worry â€œBobby?â€ I called out.  â€œYes darlin?â€  â€œShould I be worried he hasnâ€™t returned?â€  â€œNah heâ€™s a hot head sometimesâ€ Bobby chuckled â€œletâ€™s start dinner and you can catch me up on your life and how you came to be with Dean.â€  â€œIâ€™m not â€œwith Deanâ€ Bobbyâ€ I argued.  â€œLetâ€™s get dinner started and then the three of us need to talkâ€ Bobby remarked as he began pulling items from the fridge and cabinets.   â€œWhat are we cooking?â€ I asked as I lined the items heâ€™d already given me on the counter next to the stove.  â€œMy famous chili.â€  I snorted a laugh â€œfamous or infamous?â€  At least that got a laugh from him as he pulled a pan out and began browning some ground beef.  â€œI can help ya knowâ€ i scoffed and he scooted back and set about working on opening cans and mixing some spices - like it was a true secret and he didnâ€™t want me to know.   Once dinner was ready and we were settled around the table to eat Bobby brought up a completely new idea.  â€œWhat do you two know about twin flames?â€™  â€œUh what?â€ Dean finally responded after several silent beats.  Bobby left the table wheeling into a room off the living-room; returning with a blue and gold leather book that read Soulmates and Other Rare Bonds â€“ a curious title to say the least.  An hour later with a full belly and a mind full of new ideas I had a realization â€“ Bobby was right Dean was scared and Iâ€™d met the man of my dreams.  I figured life would sneak up on me with love someday but finding your â€œtwin flameâ€ â€“ the person you literally share a mental link and a part of your soul with; well thatâ€™s something special no matter how you look at it.  Of course Dean practically ran out the door when Bobby finished explaining; and backing the whole thing up with the fancy blue book â€“ but I knew â€“ I had no doubts of the truth because of all that Iâ€™d learned of Dean from our link.  The idea of connecting to him terrified and exhilarated me at the same time; when I finally got the courage to step outside to find him I felt lighter than I had in many years. I already knew Dean would reject the idea because he wouldnâ€™t deem himself worthy of such adoration love or even compassion. I wasnâ€™t even sure how I knew it but I knew it to be a fact â€“ the same as saying the sky appears blue to most humans or that the ocean is mostly unexplored by humankind.  The sight of him standing next to his Baby as the sun sunk into the background made my heart skip several beats â€“ I know this will sound clichÃ© but he was so handsome he took my breath away and I literally had to remind myself to take a breath.  â€œCan we talk?â€  â€œAbout what?â€  â€œAnything? I get that this is big news and Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™s no way to prove it scientifically but well I would like to get to know you. I want to help you find your brother and I just have this urge to get to know you â€“ anyone whoâ€™s important to you is worth knowing.â€  â€œIâ€™m so notâ€ he scoffed â€œyou have no idea who I am or what Iâ€™ve done in my past.â€  â€œI donâ€™t care. I still want to know you.â€  He glared at me but just stood there with his arms crossed over his chest leaned against his car looking like sex on bowed legsâ€“ so I did the only thing I could think of in that moment; I marched up to him and kissed him.  It wasnâ€™t some magical moment the movies portray where I saw fireworks behind my eyelids my foot popped up and I suddenly believed in love at first sight or whatever.  No this moment was emotions it was raw and real â€“ his lips were slightly scratchy and his scruff tickled but it felt right â€“ good even. This was what I was missing! As Dean got lost in the moment his hands came down to my hips tugging my body slightly closer to his. I realized then that I didnâ€™t want fairy tales and magical kisses no I wanted passion and raw emotion â€“ just what Dean had to offer. We were a match â€“ both hurting in our own ways always searching for some form of relief but somehow his touch offered a measure of that as his warmth seeped into my body.  â€œWhy would you do that?â€ his voice came out even deeper and raspy.  â€œBecause we both needed itâ€ I replied. post_body: â€œPlease?â€  Jess looked up from the book she was reading. Standing in the doorway with his stupid puppy dog eyes.  She acted like she was bothered throwing her book on the nightstand. In actuality she was just as happy to do so. â€œFine.â€  Sam excitedly climbed onto the bed with her. Lying between her legs arms wrapped around her waist head resting on her stomach.  â€œX marks the spotâ€ she said quietly tracing her finger across his upper back. â€œA circle and a dot. Four big boulders and one tiny rock. Spiders crawling up your back. Crack an egg down your head. Tight squeeze cool breeze now you have the tinglies.â€  Sam shivered lightly on top of her. Jess giggled continuing to play with him as he closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep.

post_body: Bunker Board Games SYNOPSIS: Youâ€™ve been stuck too long in the Bunker with Dean - and when he finds some old board games he takes it to a whole other level.  WORD COUNT: 774  PAIRING: Reader x Dean  INCLUDES: You x Dean  CHARACTERS: Dean Reader  FANDOM: Supernatural     Stuck in this bunker for what felt like an eternity youâ€™d lost count of the days. Itâ€™d become a routine of research training and occasional bickering with Dean Winchester over who left the last drop of coffee in the pot. But today something different happened.  Dean burst into the main room holding a dusty cardboard box excitedly. â€œGuess what I found buried under a pile of old lore books? Board games!â€  <!-- more --> You look up from the ancient text youâ€™d been reading eyebrows raised in surprise. â€œBoard games? Seriously?â€  Dean grins his eyes twinkling mischievously. â€œYeah seriously. Figured we could use a break from all this doom and gloom.â€  He set the box down on the table and started rummaging through it. â€œLetâ€™s seeâ€¦ Monopoly Scrabble Clueâ€¦ ah here we go! Twister!â€  You laugh at the idea of playing Twister in the confines of the bunker. â€œYou sure thatâ€™s a good idea Dean? We might end up knocking over half the furniture.â€  Dean shrugs nonchalantly. â€œEh itâ€™ll be fun. Plus itâ€™s good exercise.â€  With a playful eye-roll you agree to indulge his idea of fun. You start with Scrabble and as Dean places down word after word that score suspiciously high you canâ€™t help but notice how his eyes light up. His charisma is infectious and despite being stuck underground his presence makes it feel a little less suffocating.  As the afternoon wore on you move on to Monopoly where Deanâ€™s ruthless business tactics are surprisingly effective against you attempts to build a property empire. You catch yourself admiring his blatant cheats finding his competitive spirit oddly endearing.  Hours pass in a blur of laughter banter and surprisingly intense gaming sessions. Somewhere between debates over house rules and raiding the monopoly manâ€™s bank the atmosphere shifts. Thereâ€™s a charged energy between you a lingering tension that neither of you acknowledges outright.  When you finally tire of Monopoly Dean suggests a break. He fetches a couple of beers from the fridge and you settle on the couch shoulders brushing as you sip in companionable silence. The bunker feels warmer suddenly the walls less confining with Dean so close beside you.  â€œYou knowâ€ Dean begins his voice lower than usual â€œthis isnâ€™t exactly how I imagined spending days trapped underground.â€  You raise an eyebrow a smirk on your lips. â€œOh and how did you imagine it Dean?â€  He meets your gaze his green eyes darkening slightly with something unreadable. â€œMaybe a bit moreâ€¦ action-packedâ€ he teases his tone laced with a hint of flirtation.  You chuckle softly feeling a warmth spread through you at his implication. â€œWell who says our day canâ€™t get more exciting?â€  Deanâ€™s smile turns into a knowing grin as he leans closer his breath mingling with yours. â€œI like the way you think.â€  Before you can fully process his words his lips are on yours a gentle yet firm kiss that sends a thrill through your body. His hands find their way to your waist pulling you closer as if heâ€™s been waiting for this moment as eagerly as you had.  The kiss deepens becoming more urgent and passionate fueled by the tension that had been building between you for days. Deanâ€™s lips are warm and inviting his touch confident yet tender. Itâ€™s as if youâ€™d both been holding back waiting for the right moment to let go of your cares.  You tangle your fingers in his hair as you deepen the kiss savoring the taste of him. The world outside the bunker fades away leaving only the sensation of Deanâ€™s lips on yours and the steady beat of his heart against your chest.  When you finally pull apart breathless and flushed Dean rests his forehead against yours; his hands still resting gently on your waist. â€œWowâ€ he murmurs his voice hoarse with emotion.  â€œYeahâ€ You manage to reply your own voice quieted by the action that was slowly fading.  You sit in comfortable silence for a while basking in the afterglow of the kiss. The weight of the world felt lighter somehow as if this unexpected connection had given you both a reprieve from the darkness that surrounded your lives.  â€œIâ€™m glad we found those board gamesâ€ Dean finally says breaking the silence with a hint of a smirk.  â€œMe too.â€ You reply.  Dean leans in again pressing a soft kiss to your temple. â€œWho knew being stuck in a bunker could be this much fun?â€  As you settle back into the couch fingers intertwined and hearts racing you realize that maybe being stuck in this bunker isnâ€™t so bad after allâ€”especially if it means sharing moments like this with Dean Winchester.

post_body: Male. Late 20s. No ID -CH 5 - Soulmates and Other Rare Bonds Summary: Youâ€™re a writer but in your free time you volunteer at the local hospital and thatâ€™s how you met him. A very beautiful man found alone and dying in an abandoned warehouse. After being asked to sit with him and see if your presence causes him to wake or at least respond you do but that choice may change you in ways you could never have imagined.   Characters: Dean Winchester Sam Winchester Bobby Singer Marla (OFC) You/Reader   Warnings: hospital stay mentions of death both in the hospital setting and the readerâ€™s past show level violence/ gore angst fluff. Expect more/ new warnings as each chapter requires.   Chapter Warnings: Reader learns more about the supernatural world   A/N: this whole fic came from this one image  Word Count: 1733  Divider and Cover Image by me  Masterlist | Series Masterlist  Once we arrived at his property I wasnâ€™t surprised by the look of it â€œhe lives in a junkyard?â€ I asked â€œIâ€™m not so surprised by that.â€  Dean laughed as he shut the car off â€œSalvage yardâ€ he corrected and rushed to open the door and help me stand out of the car; when our hands connected I felt a rush and then was hit with some more visions.  <!-- more --> Bobby playing catch with two boys several images â€“ like snapshots â€“ I couldnâ€™t figure those out.  Then I could see Bobby yelling â€œYou stupid ass! What did you do?â€ he grabbed Deanâ€™s lapels and shook him â€œWhat did you do?!â€ he shouted. â€œYou made a deal â€“ for Sam didnâ€™t you?â€  My head was spinning â€“ â€˜what the hell did that mean?!â€™  Dean apparently got hit with visions of his own because he jerked from me and grabbed his head â€œoh fuck! What was that?â€  â€œWhat? What happened?â€  â€œI â€“ I sawâ€ his eyes went from angry to completely soft â€œI saw what you did the night you lost your familyâ€ he whispered.  I was terrified to touch him and yet I just wanted to hug him â€“ that confused me because I wasnâ€™t sure who the hug was meant to comfort at that moment but I didnâ€™t have enough time to think about it too long because the door swung open startling a squeak from me.  â€œWhat are you doinâ€™ here kiddo?â€ Bobby asked when his eyes landed on me.  Dean kept a bit of distance between him and I â€œwe got attacked.â€  â€œWell get yer asses inside thenâ€ Bobby barked as he wheeled back to give us room to come inside.  â€˜Why is he in a wheelchair?â€™ I wondered.   Dean grabbed my bags and one of his â€œI can carry my own bagsâ€ I offered.  â€œI got it get inside where itâ€™s safe.â€  I complied because I had a feeling there was no point in arguing with him â€“ inside was no less crowded than outside but it was books something I was at least a little more familiar with.  We caught Bobby up on the day â€“ minus the details of the visions and he said heâ€™d make a couple calls because it â€œsounds bigger than the normal demon chasing a Winchester activity.â€  While he was gone I spilled the tea on what Iâ€™d seen and began to ask Dean what the hell was happening â€“ to say I was unprepared for our conversation is the understatement of the year.  I was sitting there in utter shock at the news Dean had heaped upon me.  â€œDid you break her?â€ Bobbyâ€™s voice snapped me out of my bubble.  â€œIâ€™m not drunk enough for thisâ€ I grumbled as I stood up and began pacing the room. â€œFirst you tell me the man who murdered my family wasnâ€™t just some crazy dude now youâ€™re telling me that demons are real and are after me?!â€  â€œNo they are most likely after me but you got caught in the middle.â€  â€œOk fine but what about these creepy visions?!â€  Bobbyâ€™s head snapped to my direction â€œwhat visions?â€  I recounted to him about some of what Iâ€™d seen since touching Deanâ€™s hand and the more I spoke the paler Bobby appeared.  â€œBobby? Are you ok man?â€ Dean asked.  â€œShe canâ€™t be like Sam could she?â€  â€œI donâ€™t think soâ€ Dean shrugged and glanced at me.  â€œIt wouldnâ€™t fit the pattern her ma and pa were killed by a Rougarou.â€  â€œHow the fuck do you know that?â€  Bobby hung his head â€œhow do you think I knew you were in the hospital darlin?â€  â€œI thought you stopped in to volunteer thatâ€™s what the nurse told me.â€  â€œWell yeah monster hunters canâ€™t exactly tell everyone their business.â€  â€œHow did I not know this before?â€  â€œYouâ€™d already lost a lot of blood and your mind was trying to shut down due to the trauma.â€  I glanced at Dean â€œdonâ€™t look at me like that.â€  â€œLike what?â€  â€œLike youâ€™re sorry for me. Like Iâ€™m just another poor sap to be pitiedâ€ I snapped.  â€œI donâ€™t. I donâ€™t think youâ€™re someone to be pitied. Youâ€™re one of the strongest people Iâ€™ve ever met.â€    â€œYou two gonna quit actin like a married couple and work on this demon issue or what?â€  I was shocked at Bobbyâ€™s words but in that moment I figured he was right demons seemed like a much bigger problem than whatever Dean and I had going between us.  â€œHow do we fix this? How do we keep Dean safe?â€ I asked Bobby.  Dean scoffed â€œWEâ€ he paused making a little circular motion with his pointer for emphasis â€œdonâ€™t do anything to keep Dean safe. The point of bringing you here was to keep you safeâ€ he reminded us.  â€œThatâ€™s your viewpoint Sirâ€ I quipped causing Bobby to groan and wheel off into another room.  â€œThis isnâ€™t a joke Y/N.â€  â€œI know and somehow it feels like you think your life is a joke. I did not get your car out of impound and spend days living through flashes of your life to be tossed aside. Iâ€™m in this now.â€  â€œIâ€™m not gonna get you to stand down am I?â€  â€œI will when you do. Dean thereâ€™s something beyond me here. Someway I have got to understand this. If weâ€™re having visions of each otherâ€™s pasts and thereâ€™s demons behind it donâ€™t you think I deserve to know more and to help stop it?!â€  â€œStay hereâ€ he scrubbed his hand down his face â€œI need a minute to think and I gotta call Sammyâ€ he huffed and trudged out the front door.  When he didnâ€™t return for more than 15 minutes I started to worry â€œBobby?â€ I called out.  â€œYes darlin?â€  â€œShould I be worried he hasnâ€™t returned?â€  â€œNah heâ€™s a hot head sometimesâ€ Bobby chuckled â€œletâ€™s start dinner and you can catch me up on your life and how you came to be with Dean.â€  â€œIâ€™m not â€œwith Deanâ€ Bobbyâ€ I argued.  â€œLetâ€™s get dinner started and then the three of us need to talkâ€ Bobby remarked as he began pulling items from the fridge and cabinets.   â€œWhat are we cooking?â€ I asked as I lined the items heâ€™d already given me on the counter next to the stove.  â€œMy famous chili.â€  I snorted a laugh â€œfamous or infamous?â€  At least that got a laugh from him as he pulled a pan out and began browning some ground beef.  â€œI can help ya knowâ€ i scoffed and he scooted back and set about working on opening cans and mixing some spices - like it was a true secret and he didnâ€™t want me to know.   Once dinner was ready and we were settled around the table to eat Bobby brought up a completely new idea.  â€œWhat do you two know about twin flames?â€™  â€œUh what?â€ Dean finally responded after several silent beats.  Bobby left the table wheeling into a room off the living-room; returning with a blue and gold leather book that read Soulmates and Other Rare Bonds â€“ a curious title to say the least.  An hour later with a full belly and a mind full of new ideas I had a realization â€“ Bobby was right Dean was scared and Iâ€™d met the man of my dreams.  I figured life would sneak up on me with love someday but finding your â€œtwin flameâ€ â€“ the person you literally share a mental link and a part of your soul with; well thatâ€™s something special no matter how you look at it.  Of course Dean practically ran out the door when Bobby finished explaining; and backing the whole thing up with the fancy blue book â€“ but I knew â€“ I had no doubts of the truth because of all that Iâ€™d learned of Dean from our link.  The idea of connecting to him terrified and exhilarated me at the same time; when I finally got the courage to step outside to find him I felt lighter than I had in many years. I already knew Dean would reject the idea because he wouldnâ€™t deem himself worthy of such adoration love or even compassion. I wasnâ€™t even sure how I knew it but I knew it to be a fact â€“ the same as saying the sky appears blue to most humans or that the ocean is mostly unexplored by humankind.  The sight of him standing next to his Baby as the sun sunk into the background made my heart skip several beats â€“ I know this will sound clichÃ© but he was so handsome he took my breath away and I literally had to remind myself to take a breath.  â€œCan we talk?â€  â€œAbout what?â€  â€œAnything? I get that this is big news and Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™s no way to prove it scientifically but well I would like to get to know you. I want to help you find your brother and I just have this urge to get to know you â€“ anyone whoâ€™s important to you is worth knowing.â€  â€œIâ€™m so notâ€ he scoffed â€œyou have no idea who I am or what Iâ€™ve done in my past.â€  â€œI donâ€™t care. I still want to know you.â€  He glared at me but just stood there with his arms crossed over his chest leaned against his car looking like sex on bowed legsâ€“ so I did the only thing I could think of in that moment; I marched up to him and kissed him.  It wasnâ€™t some magical moment the movies portray where I saw fireworks behind my eyelids my foot popped up and I suddenly believed in love at first sight or whatever.  No this moment was emotions it was raw and real â€“ his lips were slightly scratchy and his scruff tickled but it felt right â€“ good even. This was what I was missing! As Dean got lost in the moment his hands came down to my hips tugging my body slightly closer to his. I realized then that I didnâ€™t want fairy tales and magical kisses no I wanted passion and raw emotion â€“ just what Dean had to offer. We were a match â€“ both hurting in our own ways always searching for some form of relief but somehow his touch offered a measure of that as his warmth seeped into my body.  â€œWhy would you do that?â€ his voice came out even deeper and raspy.  â€œBecause we both needed itâ€ I replied. post_body: young!sam coping with wanting his dad to pay attention to them but itâ€™s just dean and him stuck in a random town where the kids talk about some local legend  Ten-year-old Sam hunched over the dusty library table nose practically buried in a thick book titled â€œMythical Creatures of the Midwest.â€ He scribbled furiously in a worn notebook his brow furrowed in concentration.  â€œStill donâ€™t think this whole â€˜Demon Goatâ€™ thing is a bunch of hooey?â€ Deanâ€™s voice laced with bored amusement drifted in from behind him.  Sam slammed the book shut the sudden noise making Dean jump. â€œNo Dean! It says here it leaves footprints with a cleft hoof and a birdâ€™s claw!â€  Dean who was sprawled lazily on a nearby chair flipped a page of a tattered comic book with a dismissive snort. â€œBig whoop. Probably just some oversized possum scaring the locals.â€  Sam scowled. â€œDad takes all these things seriously Dean. Why canâ€™t you?â€  â€œLook Sammyâ€ Dean said sitting up a little straighter â€œDadâ€™s got the experience. He knows things and heâ€™s seen them before but I bet heâ€™d think weâ€™re a bunch of idiots for this. Thereâ€™s no point in getting our hopes up on finding some winged demon goat. I donâ€™t even think theyâ€™re real.â€  Samâ€™s shoulders slumped. He understood Deanâ€™s logic but something about the legend of the Demon Goat the mystery of it all sparked a thrill in him. He longed to be a part of his dadâ€™s world not forgotten in some random town and some random backwoods motel.  â€œMaybe notâ€ Sam mumbled more to himself than Dean. â€œBut wouldnâ€™t it be cool if there was something out there? This would be my first hunt. Maybe Dad would come back and help usâ€”help me.â€  Deanâ€™s playful facade faltered for a moment. He looked at Sam a flicker of worry crossing his features.  â€œYeah it wouldâ€ he finally admitted his voice softer than usual. â€œBut right now our job is to stick with what Dadâ€™s instructed us.
