Breaking Free: Chapter 3- Finding Light Pairings: AU! Mechanic Dean x Reader  Chapter Summary: Dean and Y/N have their first date and Dean shows who he really is.  Series Masterlist here!! & Main masterlist here!  <!-- more --> I woke up and glanced at the clock a frown creasing my face when I saw it was almost noon.   There was a time when Iâ€™d rise early whip up breakfast for Andrew and I followed by a job and enjoying coffee at the diner. I used to think that our relationship was so normal. You know like those housewives on TV who seemed so content. But that was just among the surface.  I didnâ€™t realize how unnatural our relationship was-the yelling the screaming the constant bullying. Now that Iâ€™m finally out of it I see those things for what they were: toxic.  It wasnâ€™t normal for my fiance to explode if dinner wasnâ€™t ready to check my texts and calls every night or to be upset and physically punish me when I had an idea of my own. It took me months to realize that these werenâ€™t normal relationship dynamics; they were signs of something deeply unhealthy.   What scares me the most is that Andrew was my only experience with relationships and now with Dean showing interest I wasnâ€™t sure how I should behave around him. Is it okay to feel this strongly about him so soon? Will he think less of me because I donâ€™t know what a real healthy relationship is?  As if fate was responding my phone rang on the nightstand displaying an unknown number. I hesitated briefly before answering and holding it to my ear.  â€œHello?â€  â€œHey sweetheart itâ€™s Dean.â€  Instantly my worries melted away. There was something about him something magical almost because just hearing his voice made me feel better.  â€œHey Dean whatâ€™s up?â€  â€œI was just wondering if we are still on for tonight? Instead of dinner I thought maybe I could take you somewhere.â€  A rush of questions and insecurities flooded my mind. Maybe he didnâ€™t want to be seen with me after yesterday or maybe he wanted to cancel but didnâ€™t know how to tell me.â€œ  "Y/N? You there?â€  â€œOh sorry yeah if thatâ€™s what you want to do. I mean obviously its your decision.â€  There was a pause and anxiety started to creep in. Had I said the wrong thing?   He chuckled into the phone â€œUh Iâ€™m glad your thinking of me Y/N but this is our date. I just wanted to bring you somewhere special. You can have an opinion you know?â€ His laugh was reassuring and I giggled in return.   Of course he was a gentleman on top of everything else.  â€œI think that sounds amazing. What time should I be ready for?â€  â€œHow does 5:30 sound?â€  I smiled to myself â€œSounds good. See you later Dean.â€  With that I hung up and placed my phone back on the nightstand. A sigh of contentment escaped me as I thought about tonight. Perhaps this would be the night things changed for me.   Dean seemed like a genuinely nice guy he hadnâ€™t judged me during the incident with Andrew. Maybe he was different from other men.  But as I thought about tonight my nerves started getting the better of me. What would I wear? Dean hadnâ€™t specified if it was a fancy or casual outing. Not getting a clear instruction always made me anxious-Iâ€™ve made that mistake before.  i grabbed my phone and started typing a message then hesitated deleted it and finally sent it. He responded almost immediately.  I smiled to myself as I read through the messages repeatedly. It was tempting to remain in bed reading them but I knew I had to get up and start my day before my date later tonight.  As I made my way to my suitcase I frowned realizing I had fewer clothes than expected; half of my stuff was still at Andrewâ€™s place and I had no intention of going back there.  Unfortunately I had to go shopping. I threw on my coat grabbed my purse and headed out sitting in the car debating where to go. There was a nearby clothing store but what if Andrew had talked to the staff and made things awkward there? There was another option out of town but it was quite a distance.  My phone rang and I couldnâ€™t help but laugh seeing Deanâ€™s name. I answered quickly. â€œCanâ€™t stay away huh?â€  He chuckled deeply. â€œYou caught me. Missed you already! But I might need to push our date back an hour. Got stuck at work until 5:30 now instead of 4. Is it okay if I pick you up at 6:30?â€œ  â€œNo worries thatâ€™s fineâ€ I replied.  â€œWhat are you up to today?â€ He questioned with a smile I could hear.  I debated whether to be vague or share. Part of me wanted to tell him about my day; strangely he seemed genuinely interested. â€œJust going shopping. Turns out I need more clothes than I thought.â€  â€œWell have fun! Where are you headed?â€  â€œProbably the next town over. I know there are a few shops there.â€  He paused for a moment and my heart skipped a beat. â€œOh thatâ€™s quite a journey. You must really like those storesâ€ he teased.  I nervously giggled playing with my coat zipper. â€œNot really. Andrew has stirred up a lot of drama around here and I prefer to avoid it.â€  He sighed audibly his concern evident even through the phone. "Sweetheart stay right there. Iâ€™ll bring something to help you out.â€  I chuckled softly biting my lip. â€œOkay. Iâ€™ll wait here.â€  Twenty minutes passed before I spotted Deanâ€™s truck pulling in a young girl sitting in the passenger seat. Dean smiled at me as he got out and opened the girlâ€™s door.  â€œY/N this is Claire. Sheâ€™s a good family friendâ€ Dean introduced.  I extended my hand nervously. â€œItâ€™s nice to meet you.â€  Claire smiled back shaking my hand. â€œYou too. So Dean brought me here to go shopping with you said people in this town were being assholes to you?â€  I felt embarrassed glancing at Dean who looked apologetic for his improvised plan. â€œUh yeah.â€  â€œWell donâ€™t worry. People dislike me more than they could dislike you and I also do enjoy shopping so letâ€™s goâ€ Claire said with a reassuring smile.  I laughed silently thanking Dean for sending her my way. After Dean left Claire hopped into my car her manner friendly.  â€œDean is crazy about you itâ€™s hilariousâ€ Claire remarked.  â€œReally?â€ I asked surprised.  She chuckled. â€œI didnâ€™t even have a chance to say yes. He was already at my door pulling me into the truck saying he needed a huge favor.â€  â€œOhâ€¦â€  Claire frowned slightly. â€œNot that hanging out with you is a favour. He told me you didnâ€™t have many friends here and people werenâ€™t treating you right. He thought we might get along so here I am. I donâ€™t have many friends here either so it works out.â€  I nodded touched by Deanâ€™s thoughtfulness but also feeling a pang of insecurity. It was sweet of him yet I couldnâ€™t shake the feeling of being a charity case.  â€œEarth to Y/N?â€ Claireâ€™s voice snapped me back to reality.  I managed a sad smile. â€œSorry I justâ€¦ I hope this doesnâ€™t seem pathetic. Like Dean had to beg you to be friends with me.â€  Claire shook her head laughing lightly. â€œEven if it does he had good intentions. Maybe weâ€™ll become great friends because of this or maybe not. Either way letâ€™s make the most of today.â€  I nodded in agreement as we arrived at the store. Claireâ€™s easy confidence helped ease my nerves and I found myself enjoying her company. She didnâ€™t treat me like a charity case; instead she was sassy and genuine.  As we browsed through clothes Claire asked â€œSo what are you planning on wearing tonight?â€  I shrugged. â€œDean said something comfortable and casual.â€  â€œAre you planning onâ€¦ you know tonight?â€ Claire asked bluntly with a smirk. As much as he annoys me and gets on my nerves heâ€™s kind protective and wouldnâ€™t harm a fly. It all depends on what youâ€™re comfortable with.â€  She offered me a couple of shirts but they didnâ€™t quite fit my style. Dean had said to be comfortable but I also wanted to impress him. The last times he saw me I wasnâ€™t looking my best.  Claire returned with armfuls of clothes a wide grin on her face. â€œChanging rooms letâ€™s do this!â€  Following her to the back I stepped into a dressing room as she handed me various outfits. They werenâ€™t my usual choices but surprisingly cute.  I tried on the burgundy leggings a white tank top and a jacket Claire gave me. When I looked in the mirror I was surprisedâ€”I felt beautiful for once. The leggings fit my curves nicely and the top showed off my shape. I knew Dean would be surprised; heâ€™s only seen me in baggy clothes before.  Stepping out I found Claire waiting her jaw dropping in awe. I couldnâ€™t help but laugh at her reaction. â€œWowww. Girl Dean wonâ€™t know what hit him.â€  After paying and grabbing a quick lunch I dropped Claire off at her house. Before she left she asked for my number which made me feel valued. It seemed like things were finally looking up.  Back at the motel I checked the timeâ€”it was already 5:30 just an hour before Dean would pick me up.  I was feeling even more nervous now. Dean was coming soon and I was wearing something a bit more revealing. It was scary but I had a feeling Dean would like it. I couldnâ€™t wait. He looked even better than I remembered if that was possible.  His eyes scanned me from head to toe and he let out a low whistle before meeting my eyes with a smile. â€œWowâ€¦ Y/N you look stunning.â€  Blushing wildly I fiddled with my hands trying to hide my flustered grin that probably made me look like a teenagerâ€”but he noticed and it only made him smile wider. You really didnâ€™t have to get me flowers.â€  He shrugged his smile turning a bit shy. â€œI know but I thought they might brighten up the motel room a bit.â€  I leaned in and kissed his cheek chuckling softly as his cheeks turned red and he looked bashful. Which car is yours?â€ I asked.  He pointed to the black car and my jaw dropped. It was the most amazing car Iâ€™d ever seen. I didnâ€™t know much about cars but when I was a kid my dad had taught me a thing or two especially about this one.  â€œOh my god. No way. A â€˜67 Chevy Impala? Those are a rare breed.â€  He froze staring back at me in awe clearly surprised that I recognized the car and its classic status.  â€œWhoa a girl after my heart. You know a lot about cars?â€ he asked.  I shook my head and chuckled. â€œNo my dad was the car enthusiast. He collected them. We had a calendar of classic cars and this Chevy was featured in May. He drove for a while asking about my life-where I came from how many siblings I had. It was clear he was avoiding talking about Andrew and I was grateful for that. Family disagreement nothing major.â€  I narrowed my eyes and sighed feeling a connection. â€œLook at both of us the weirdos with bruises.â€  He chuckled softly and placed his hand on my leg squeezing gently. My heart skipped a beat and I felt a rush of emotions like a teenager again.  It took a while to reach the lake Dean wanted to bring me to and as soon as did nerves flooded back. This was real-the first date. The night that could shape our relationship. It was more nerve-wracking than I remembered.  He got out of the car and went to the back pulling out a blanket a bottle of wine and a cooler. I couldnâ€™t help but smile as my heart warmed; he had put so much thought into our first date and it meant a lot. Then it hit meâ€”he must have heard the rumors around town. He believed them.  I dropped my head feeling my heart sink. I had thought he of all people wouldnâ€™t believe those things about me. But clearly he was uneasy about drinking afraid the rumours were true.  He sighed and placed his hand on my leg. â€œI didnâ€™t mean anything by itâ€¦ itâ€™s justâ€¦â€  â€œYou heard the rumors about my drinking problem and now youâ€™re worried about meâ€ I finished for him.  His eyes widened and he put the bottle down leaning closer. â€œNo! No not at all! I justâ€¦â€  He sighed heavily brushing his hair back in frustration. â€œSometimes rumours are spread and sometimes thereâ€™s truth to them even if itâ€™s exaggerated. I just needed to check to make sure you werenâ€™t at risk or uncomfortable with drinking.â€  He frowned removing his hand from my leg clearly feeling guilty. I wasnâ€™t angry at himâ€”I was frustrated with Andrew and those stupid rumors. I just wanted to be myself without judgment.  Turning towards him I grabbed the wine and popped the cork taking a sip to ease the tension. He smirked and nodded taking the bottle from me and joining in.  I sighed and moved closer. â€œOkay before our date really gets going letâ€™s clear the air. No more doubts about me. Tell me what youâ€™ve heard and Iâ€™ll tell you if itâ€™s true. Whether you believe it or not is up to you.â€  He nodded turning to face me. After a moment of thought he spoke up. â€œOne thing I heard was that you used him and then left but I already know thatâ€™s not true.â€  â€œHow do you know thatâ€™s not true?â€  â€œBecause I was at that motel that day. I saw what he was doing and the look on his face. Also if you had used him and taken his money you wouldnâ€™t have come in without a tow truck that day.â€  I smiled and nodded. â€œGood detective work. What else?â€  He sighed and handed me the bottle. â€œThat you have a drinking problem and get violent when youâ€™re under the influence.â€  â€œOkay. I donâ€™t have a drinking problem. Andrew did. We went to parties had a few drinks and when I stood up to him because of the liquid courage he blamed it on that. Also I only hit him onceâ€”the day at the motel. That part was true.â€  He nodded his hand returning to my leg in a comforting gesture.  â€œWhat else?â€ I asked handing him back the bottle. But after that I went home. My neighbor apparently told her husband I was the one hitting on the guy from the bar and he told Andrew. When I got home Andrew was furious and drunk. So I got even angrier threatened to leave and told him Iâ€™d expose him for who he really was. Thatâ€™s when he snappedâ€¦ I donâ€™t remember much after thatâ€”it happened so fastâ€”but I remember the pain of his fists over and over again. I remember seeing the blood on his hands and the smile on his face. I thought â€˜Iâ€™m going to die tonight. My fiancÃ© is going to kill me.â€™ And honestly at that moment I was okay with it. The pain he caused me was unbearable.â€  My head hung low as I sobbed quietly the weight of the memories crushing me. Dean pulled me onto his lap wrapping his arms around me protectively. â€œItâ€™s okay. Heâ€™s not going to hurt you anymore. I wonâ€™t let himâ€ he whispered soothingly.  I sighed and looked up Deanâ€™s thumbs gently wiping away my tears.  â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€ I choked out.  His brow furrowed in confusion. â€œSorry for what sweetheart?â€  â€œFor ruining our date. I shouldnâ€™t have talked about that.â€  He shook his head holding me tighter. â€œDonâ€™t apologize. You didnâ€™t ruin anything. In fact youâ€™ve made me feel even closer to you. I appreciate you telling me. It couldnâ€™t have been easy.â€  I shook my head resting against his shoulder my arms holding him close. A weight lifted off my shouldersâ€”I wasnâ€™t alone in this anymore. Someone finally believed me.  He kissed my forehead and smiled softly. â€œNow letâ€™s sit down and talk some more. Weâ€™ll still have a great night okay?â€  I nodded leaning in slowly to press my lips against his. Each kiss felt like the first and with each one I felt myself falling even deeper in love.  It was only our first date but I knewâ€”I was falling hard.  Thank you for reading I hope you enjoyed it! Chapter 4 coming soon stay tuned!  Like comment and reblog feedback is my fuel ğŸ’•

post_body: Dean Winchester x Reader   Witch Hunt   Summary: Y/N arrives at Deans motel. Sheâ€™s only there to help with a hunt since Samâ€™s at Stanford and Johnâ€™s working his own case.  Rating: PG-13 A/N: Iâ€™ve been wanting to write something for Dean for a while! Hereâ€™s a short little drabble. I hope you enjoy it! Donâ€™t forget to comment and/or reblog! And my requests are open!   â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£  <!-- more -->The air was ice cold as Y/n stepped out of her SUV. She ignored the cold as she slid her duffel bag over her shoulder. She glanced at the sign of the motel. It glowed against the dark night sky. She walked towards the rows of rooms searching for the one Dean was staying in. After she walked by a few doors she finally found the one she was looking for.    Room 118.   She gently knocked on the door not wanting to disturb the rooms near Deanâ€™s. Despite the late hour she knew he would still be up. Probably researching for the case he had called her in to help on. He hadnâ€™t given her many details over the phone. He didnâ€™t know much yet. Only that he was dealing with a witch and that he hadnâ€™t been able to find a pattern between the victims yet.    Dean quickly answered the door. He gave her a tired smile as he opened the door for her. Y/n stepped inside the small motel room. She instantly spotted the books Dean had spread out on his bed. She tossed her duffel bag on the empty bed and turned to Dean.    â€œThanks for comingâ€ Dean said stuffing his hands on the pockets of his jeans. He had been desperate whenever heâ€™d called her. Heâ€™d been working this case for days yet he hadnâ€™t been able to find anything other than hex bags. No connection between the victims and no apparent motive. The whole thing was giving him a headache. Without Sam or John available he had turned to an old friend.    â€œItâ€™s not like youâ€™ve never helped me out with a tough caseâ€ Y/n replied crossing her arms over her chest.   The two talked of recent cases. After a while of catching up they finally began working on the case. Despite being a rather capable hunter Y/n kept missing the obvious. She had never noticed the way Dean looked at her whenever she wasnâ€™t paying attention. She never thought twice about why Dean had chosen her to help him. He had plenty of other people to call. It would stay like this. Y/n oblivious to the crush Dean had on her all while she harboured her own.      â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£â–£  A/N: Thanks for reading! Donâ€™t forget to reblog! Also do you like this font? Iâ€™m trying to decide between using this one (chat) and regular. Let me know which one you prefer! Requests are also open.

SERIES MASTERLIST  A WINDOW SLIDES open and breaks the silence of the apartment briefly followed by soft curses from a womanâ€™s voice and a light sound that seemed like a hand connecting with someoneâ€™s head. The two figures slide into the apartment smoothly and gently close it behind them they make their way silently through the apartment and look around at the decorations that lightly lined the walls.   The feminine figure stops and gestures for the masculine figure to stop but then she gestures for him to continue another figure leaps out and grabs his shoulder which causes a small brawl to break out. Another figure leaps out and grabs the feminine intruder and causes their own fight. Itâ€™s Dakoda and Dean who are the intruders each one quickly manages to pin their attackers to the floor.   â€œHey baby brother.â€ Dakoda greeted Damien with a grin on her lips her hands gripping his wrists â€œYou didnâ€™t really think youâ€™d win that fight did ya?â€ she asked but had spoken too soon as Damien managed to grab her left wrist and wrap his leg around her calf before switching their positions with a grunt flying from her lips at the same time that Sam had done the same to Dean.   â€œOkay get the fuck off.â€ Dakoda grumbled and shoved her baby brother off and stood up herself she stood beside Dean as they faced Damien and Sam who also now stood side by side.   â€œWhat the hell are you guys doing here?â€ Sam asked his eyes switching between Dakoda and Dean â€œWell I was looking for a beer.â€ Dean replied sarcastically Dakoda swatted his arm lightly with an eye roll.  â€œWhat the hell are you doing here guys seriously?â€ Damien spoke up beside Sam his arms crossed over his chest as he stared at his big sister and Dean.   â€œOkay. All right. We gotta talk.â€ Dean told them holding his hands up slightly as he got a bit serious â€œUh the phone?â€ Sam asked incredulity in his tone as he looked at his older brother.   â€œIf Iâ€™d'a called would you have picked up?â€ Dean asked sending his younger brother a pointed look. Before Dakoda could open her mouth to speak the light flickered on and enveloped the room Dakoda blinked to accommodate the sudden brightness and she looked towards the source which was a blonde woman wearing short shorts and a cropped Smurfs shirt.   <!-- more --> â€œSam? Damien?â€ the blonde woman questioned as she looked at the four people standing in the hallway â€œJess. Hey. Dean Dakoda this is my girlfriend Jessica.â€ Sam introduces as he goes to stand beside Jessica his arm wrapping lightly around her waist. Dakoda and Dean both check her out appreciate Dakoda is more subtle than Dean is as her gaze goes up and down Jessica slightly.   â€œYour brother Dean? And your sister Dakoda?â€ Jessica asked Sam and Damien as she connected the dots she gave both Dean and Dakoda a smile.   â€œOh I love the Smurfs. You know I gotta tell you. You are completely out of my brotherâ€™s league.â€ Dean comments as he moves closer to stand near them Dakoda rolls her eyes in mock exasperation grabs the back of his jacket collar and drags Dean back to stand beside her.   â€œJust let me put something on.â€ Jessica goes to turn and leave to get other clothes only to be stopped by Deanâ€™s voice â€œNo no no I wouldnâ€™t dream of it. Seriously.â€ his comment earns him a smack to the back of his head which makes him let out a small yelp and turn a glare at Dakoda who smiles innocently. Dean looks back over at Sam as his hand drops from his head after rubbing at it his expression getting more serious â€œAnyway I gotta borrow your boyfriend and friend here talk about some private family business.â€ he tells Jessica as he looks at Sam and Damien â€œBut uh it was nice meeting you.â€ he finished Dakoda giving a soft smile from beside him.  â€œNo whatever you two want to say you can say it in front of her.â€ Sam tells both Dean and Dakoda his arm gently tugging Jessica closer to his side. Dakoda locks eyes with Dean and gives him a shrug he rolls his eyes slightly before looking at Sam Jessica and Damien head-on â€œOkay. Um Dad and Javier havenâ€™t been home in a few days.â€ Dean tells them Dakoda gives Damien a pointed look before letting her gaze drift to Sam.   â€œSo theyâ€™re working overtime on a Miller time shift. Theyâ€™ll come stumbling in sooner or later.â€ Sam told them his gaze stoney as he looked at them. Dakoda sighed heavily and crossed her arms over her chest nudging Deanâ€™s arm subtly.   â€œDad and Javier are on a hunting trip and they havenâ€™t been home in a few days.â€ Dean told Sam and Damien Dakoda eyed her little brotherâ€™s reaction and saw the way his face fell slightly and nodded.   â€œJess excuse us. We have to go outside.â€ Sam told Jessica quickly he left the room with Jessica and Damien so the two could get dressed. Dakoda and Dean walked to the front door to wait for them they occupied themselves by playing rock paper scissors. Dakoda glared at Dean after they got scissors again at the same time this had happened five times now and neither one refused to relent on using scissors. As Dakoda opens her mouth to give a mouthy comment Damien and Sam emerge and lead Dakoda and Dean out of the apartment.         Dakoda and Damien walked ahead of Dean and Sam hushed whispers came from Dakoda towards Damien as she explained the last hunt their dad had been on with John since Damien was more willing to listen than Sam seemed to be.   â€œI mean come on. You canâ€™t just break in middle of the night and expect me to hit the road with you.â€ Sam told Dean as they emerged from the stairwell a few feet behind Dakoda and Damien â€œYouâ€™re not hearing me Sammy. Dad and Javier are missing. I need you to help me find them.â€ Dean told Sam his tone exasperated as the four of them walked towards where Dean and Dakoda had parked their cars.   â€œYou remember the poltergeist in Amherst? Or the devilâ€™s gates in Clifton? They were missing then too. Theyâ€™re always missing and theyâ€™re always fine.â€ Sam told them as they came to a stop Dakoda now stood beside Dean as she looked at Sam â€œNot this time Sammy itâ€™s serious.â€ Dakoda spoke up pleading with him to listen to them â€œNot for this long. Now are you gonna come with us or not?â€ Dean continued from beside her his hand subconsciously grasping herâ€™s between them which Dakoda held onto immediately.   â€œIâ€™m not.â€ Sam told them seeming firm on his decision despite the importance in Dean and Dakodaâ€™s expressions Damien appeared to agree with Sam as he stood beside the taller Winchester â€œWhy not?â€ Dean and Dakoda asked at the same time seeming upset at their decision.   â€œI swore I was done hunting. For good.â€ Sam told them â€œIâ€™m done too Koda hunting isnâ€™t for me.â€ Damien said in agreement. Dakoda sighed heavily and ran a hand through her hair Dean continued speaking to Sam as the Hernandez woman continued walking towards the parking lot with Damien following behind. She could hear the Winchester brothers speaking to each other seemingly having a heated discussion.   Dakoda turned and looked at Damien as they walked he was listening intently to Dean and Sam argue lightly before he locked eyes with his big sister who gave him a pleading look that seemed to finally convince him just as Dean convinced Sam. Dakoda smiled and she went to Dean shoving her hand into his front left pocket to pull out the Impalaâ€™s keys and darting towards the Impala before Dean could stop her. Dean darted after her and hastily tugged the keys from her grasp as they reached the trunk he gave her a playful glare as he opened the trunk himself to show Sam and Damien what John and Javier had been hunting just before they disappeared.   â€œAll right letâ€™s see where the hell did I put that thing?â€ Dean muttered to himself after he opened the spare-tire compartment that was the arsenal his hands digging through the clutter before Dakoda slapped his hands away lightly and grabbed a voice recorder he had been looking for.   â€œSo when Dad and Javier left why didnâ€™t you two go with them?â€ Sam asked watching them curiously with Damien standing beside him with his own curious expression â€œWe were working our own gig. This uh voodoo thing down in New Orleans.â€ Dean told them â€œThey let you two go on a hunting trip by yourselves?â€ Damien asked after as he stared at Dean and Dakoda.   â€œDude weâ€™re twenty-six.â€ Dakoda scoffed she placed the voice recorder in Deanâ€™s hand just as he lifted up a folder from the trunk.  â€œAll right here we go-â€ Dean begins going over the case with Sam and Damien as Dakoda fiddles with the items within the trunk ignoring Dean when he smacks at her hands. Dakoda focuses back in as Dean presses play on the voice recorder she had handed to him which had Johnâ€™s voice â€œDeanâ€¦something big is starting to happenâ€¦I need to try and figure out whatâ€™s going on. It mayâ€¦ Be very careful Dean. Weâ€™re all in danger.â€ Johnâ€™s voice came through the recording being a tad scratchy with something just beneath his voice which Sam caught.   â€œYou know thereâ€™s EVP on that?â€ Sam asked Dean and Dakoda causing the latter to smirk subtly â€œNot bad Sammy. Kinda like riding a bike isnâ€™t it?â€ Dean asked Sam shook his head slightly and looks away briefly. Dakoda snatched the recorder from Deanâ€™s hand and held it out of his reach when he went to take it back â€œAll right. I slowed the message down I ran it through a gold wave took out the hiss and this is what I got.â€ Dakoda told Damien and Sam as she held the voice recorder out this time and hit the play button â€œI can never go home.â€ a feminine voice rang through before Dakoda ended the recording she placed it back in Deanâ€™s hands before he tosses it back into the compartment. He puts the shotgun down and closes the compartment door before shutting the trunk leaning against it afterward.   â€œNever go home.â€ Damien and Sam mumbled at the same time thinking over the words heavily â€œYou know in almost two years weâ€™ve never bothered never asked you for a thing.â€ Dean tells them his arm automatically curling around his best friendâ€™s shoulders as the two looked at Damien and Sam who turned to each other and started whispering amongst themselves.   â€œAll right weâ€™ll go. Weâ€™ll go with you to look for them.â€ Sam said as he turned back to the older two â€œBut we have to get back first thing Monday. Just wait here.â€ Sam told them he went to turn but Deanâ€™s voice cut in â€œWhatâ€™s first thing Monday?â€ Dean asked staring at his brother. Dakoda gave her baby brother a smile and nod before she walked to her car she slid into the front seat to wait.         The four hunters had stopped at a gas station so Dean and Dakoda could fuel up Damien and Sam stayed in the vehicles and had their passenger doors open as they talked about their siblings. Dakoda and Dean walked out of the convenience store with bags of junk food in their hands they walked to their own cars to set their stuff down. Dakoda had already asked her baby brother if he wanted anything so she had a cheese Danish in hand for him she tossed it to him as she walked to the gas pump. She dumped the items in her arms into the small backseat shoving passed Damien to do so and to mess with him. Dakoda walks to the driverâ€™s side of the Impala just as Dean gets in she crouches beside his door and looks as Sam digs through Deanâ€™s cassette tape collection.   â€œI swear man youâ€™ve gotta update your cassette tape collection.â€ Sam told Dean as he rifled through the box on his lap â€œWhy?â€ Dean questioned he looked at Dakoda and flicked her forehead which she quickly slapped at his hand at in response.   â€œWell for one theyâ€™re cassette tapes. And twoâ€ Sam holds up a few cassette tapes â€œBlack Sabbath? Motorhead? Metallica?â€ he questioned as he held up each tape with the band. Dakoda leaned into the car and gave Sam a flick on his hand â€œWatch your mouth Sammy.â€ she snarked with a slight grin on her lips. She leans back and out of the window crouching beside the car once more.   â€œItâ€™s the greatest hits of mullet rock.â€ Sam told them giving Dakoda his signature bitch face for flicking him the tape labeled â€˜Metallicaâ€™ is taken from his hand by Dean.   â€œWell house rules Sammy.â€ Dean starts sliding the tape into place â€œDriver picks the music shotgun shuts his cakehole.â€ he grins as the music fills the car he starts the engine a second after and gives Dakoda a nod. Dakoda leaves the side of the car and walks to her Mustang on the other side of the pumps.         THE PURR of the classic Mustang pulls closer as Dakoda parks beside the Impala just before the bridge where a section was blocked off by police tape. Dakoda reaches over and pops open her glove compartment pulling out a box with fake IDs inside that range from reporters to the FBI. She pulls out two US marshall ids and hands one to Damien who gives her a bitch face but takes it anyway they step out and walk to the front of the Mustang to wait for Dean and Sam. Dakoda and Dean take the lead as they walk over to the police officers who are standing beside the latest victimsâ€™ car.   â€œYou fellas had another one like this just last month didnâ€™t you?â€ Dean asked as he reached them Dakoda standing beside him as she pulled her badge from her pocket.   â€œAnd who are you?â€ The officer asked them slightly turning his body in their direction as he looked at them. Dakoda and Dean both flashed their badges at the same time quickly tucking them away after a moment.  â€œFederal Marshalls.â€ Dean introduced gesturing to him and Dakoda and then to Damien and Sam â€œYou four are a little young to be federal marshalls arenâ€™t you?â€ the officer asked them as he scrutinized them slightly.   â€œThanks thatâ€™s awfully kind of you.â€ Dean laughed slightly as he walked over to the car gazing at it questioningly Dakoda followed closely behind as she knelt down slightly to look through the windows but didnâ€™t see anything that quite stood out just yet.   â€œYou did have another one just like this correct?â€ Dean asked looking over the roof of the car at the officer Dakoda lifted her head up to gaze at the office questioningly â€œYeah thatâ€™s right about a mile up the road. Thereâ€™ve been others before that.â€ the officer responded getting back on task and focusing on the topic at hand.   â€œSo this victim you knew him?â€ Sam questioned as he stepped up on the other side of Dean Dakoda listened as the two Winchester boys questioned the officer as she inspected the car to see if she could find anything but nothing popped out or grabbed her attention so she wandered back over to Deanâ€™s side to listen to the rest of what the officer had to say.   â€œSo whatâ€™s the theory?â€ Sam asked shoving his hands into the pockets of his jacket â€œHonestly we donâ€™t know. Serial murder? Kidnapping ring?â€ the officer responded genuine confusion on his face. Dakoda couldnâ€™t hold back the slight scoff that fell from her lips but sucked in a sharp breath when Damien jabbed her in the ribs she glared at the little brother subtly.  â€œWell that is exactly the kind of crack police work Iâ€™d expect out of you guys.â€ Dean remarked seeming to agree with whatever Dakoda had been thinking he held back a slight grunt when Samâ€™s foot stomps on his â€œThank you for your time.â€ Sam thanked the officer before the four began walking away. Dakoda and Dean lifted their hands and slapped the back of Sam and Damienâ€™s heads at the same time quickly causing them to wince and cradle the backs of their heads.   â€œYou dick what was that for?â€ Damien hissed out at his sister who only glared lightly â€œWhyâ€™d you jab me in the ribs?â€ she hissed back they walked a few paces behind Dean and Sam â€œYou donâ€™t have to act like that towards them Koda.â€ Damien tells her scolding his sister about her behavior.   â€œOh please Damien they donâ€™t know whatâ€™s going on. All we have are Dean and Sam in order to find Dad and hunt whatever did this down.â€ Dakoda told him giving him a pointed look. She feels someone smack her arm and looks to see the Sheriff and two FBI agents walking onto the bridge she swats Damienâ€™s arm to get him to look before all four pass the three officials with Dean muttering â€œAgent Mulder Agent Scully.â€ as they passed them.         Dakoda walked alongside Dean while Damien and Sam walked behind them Dakoda spots a girl with flyers in her hands and she smacks Deanâ€™s chest to grab his attention.  â€œThink thatâ€™s her?â€ Dakoda asked she pointed the young woman out to Sam and Damien as well while Dean nodded with a shrug. All four of them walked over and Dean took the lead in questioning the young woman.  â€œYou must be Amy.â€ Dean started standing a few feet in front of the woman Dakoda watched as â€˜Amyâ€™ nodded.  â€œYea.â€ Amy confirmed as she gripped onto the flyers in her hands as she looked at the group of four in front of her â€œYeah Troy told us about you weâ€™re his uncles. Iâ€™m Dean this is Sammy.â€ Dean introduced himself and Sam before gesturing to Dakoda and Damien â€œThis is my girlfriend Dakoda and her little brother Damien.â€ Dean finished wrapping an arm around Dakoda for the cover.   â€œHe never mentioned you.â€ Amy told them with a confused expression she started walking away from them to the entrance of the diner.  â€œUh well thatâ€™s Troy I guess. Weâ€™re not around much weâ€™re up in Modesto.â€ Dean told her following after Amy with the other three.   â€œSo weâ€™re looking for him too and weâ€™re kinda asking around.â€ Sam spoke up from Deanâ€™s other side they watched as another young woman walked up and placed a hand on Amyâ€™s arm. Dakoda looks to Dean and leans in to whisper into his ear â€œStay here Damien and I are going to the library.â€ she whispered she wanted to get a head start on the research and she thought it would be weird if four people were questioning one girl. Dean gave her a nod and squeezed her arm before she stepped away and grabbed Damienâ€™s arm the siblings walked away from the Winchesters to make their way back to the Mustang.   Dakoda and Damien get to the library twenty minutes later Damien making his way inside first while Dakoda stands by her car to wait for Dean and Sam and smokes one of her cigarettes. As Dakoda is waiting her mind races with possibilities of what they were hunting and what her dad had been hunting.   Dakoda had gone through two cigarettes by the time Dean and Sam finally pulled up parking behind her Mustang. She watched as Dean and Sam walked up heading over to her and she explained that Damien had been inside. Dean proceeded to tease her for â€œbeing lazyâ€ to which she smacked him across the back of the head as they walked into the library Sam rolling his eyes at the two best friends. Dakoda snagged a rolling chair for her and Dean and plopped down into the seat beside her brother at the computer he was sitting at.  â€œFind anything kid?â€ Dakoda asked Damien who shook his head with a â€˜noâ€™ falling from his lips as his brows furrowed in frustration â€œNothing yet but it feels like weâ€™re missing something. What did you and Dean find out Sam?â€ Damien asked the youngest Winchester who had taken a seat at a computer a few seats down.   â€œThereâ€™s apparently a local legend about a woman who was murdered on Cenntenial Amy told us about it.â€ Sam told Damien watching Dean who was sitting in front of the computer. Deanâ€™s fingers flew across the keyboard as he typed â€˜Female Murder Hitchhikingâ€™ and clicked â€˜GOâ€™ but came up with zero results so he replaced the word â€˜Hitchhikingâ€™ with â€˜Centennial Highwayâ€™ which had the same response.   â€œLet me try.â€ Sam told Dean as he reached out only to get his hands smacked by his brother Dakoda watched them in amusement before Sam shoved Deanâ€™s chair away and took over at the computer. Deanâ€™s chair smacks into Dakodaâ€™s and she lets out a small huff and grabs the handles of his chair to keep him from rolling away â€œYouâ€™re such a control freak.â€ Dean complains as he smacks Samâ€™s shoulder but rolls back over. Dakoda rolls over and peers over Samâ€™s other shoulder and Damien stands up to take a look as well.  â€œSo angry spirits are born out of violent deaths right?â€ Sam asked as he typed into the search bar â€œYeah.â€ Dean and Dakoda spoke at the same time barely looking at each other when they did.  â€œWell maybe itâ€™s not murder.â€ Sam murmured as he replaced the word â€˜murderâ€™ with the word â€˜suicideâ€™ he hit the GO button and the four of them watched as articles popped up but Sam only clicked the one that was the most relevant.   A local womanâ€™s drowning death was ruled a suicide the county Sheriffâ€™s Department said earlier today. Constance Welch 24 of 4636 Breckenridge Road leapt off Sylvania Bridge at mile 33 of Centennial Highway and subsequently drowned last night.  Deputy J. Pierce told reporters that hours before her death Ms. Welch logged a call with 911 emergency services. In a panicked tone Ms. Welch described how she found her two young children 5 and 6 in the bathtub after leaving them alone for several minutes. She reported that their complex-â€¦  What happened to my children was a terrible accident. And it must have been too much for my wife. Our babies were gone and Constance just couldnâ€™t bear itâ€œ said husband Joseph Welch. "Now I ask that you all please respect my privacy during this trying time.â€  At the time of the childrenâ€™s death and Ms. Welchâ€™s subsequent suicide Mr. Welch was at the Frontier auto salvage yard where he works the graveyard shift as associate manager.  â€œConnie might have been quiet but she was the sweetest most caring girl I ever knewâ€ said Deanna Kripke a neighbor. â€œShe just doted on those children.â€  â€œThis was 1981. Constance Welch twenty-four years old jumps off Sylvania Bridge drowns in the riverâ€ Sam told them as he read through the article Dakodaâ€™s brows furrowed slightly in thought â€œDoes it say why she did it?â€ she asked leaning closer to gaze at the article and taking a look at the picture of Constance.   â€œYeah.â€ Sam confirmed Deanâ€™s head cocks to the side and he frowns â€œWhat?â€ he asked leaning back slightly.   â€œAn hour before they found her she calls 911. Apparently her two little kids are in the bathtub. She leaves them alone for one minute and when she comes back they arenâ€™t breathing. Both die.â€ Sam explains to the other three Damien hums in thought and leans back on his heels with his hands shoved into his pockets. Dean and Dakoda look at each other with raised eyebrows and shrug â€œHm. Dean hummed once before he focused back when Sam began speaking.   â€œ"â€˜Our babies were gone and Constance just couldnâ€™t bear itâ€™ said husband Joseph Welch.â€œâ€ Sam read from the article the mouse point landing on a picture that looked familiar to the four hunters.   â€œThat bridge look familiar to you?â€ Dean asked as he pointed at the picture Dakoda leaned in and gave Dean a look which confirmed it did.         The four hunters found themselves back at the bridge long after the sun went down to ensure the police wouldnâ€™t be there to catch them. Dakoda walked towards the middle part of the bridge with Damien beside her sheâ€™s absentmindedly listening to Dean and Sam talk as the inspect the bridge where they suspect Constance took her â€˜swan diveâ€™ over the side of it after the death of her children.   â€œSo you think Dad and Javier would have been here?â€ Sam asked as he took beside the railing of the bridge glancing towards Dean. Dakoda and Damien tried not to eavesdrop on the Winchester conversation but they had nothing else to do.  â€œWell theyâ€™re chasing the same story and weâ€™re chasing them.â€ Dean told his brother as he continued walking along the bridge he glanced over at Dakoda who was acting like she wasnâ€™t listening. Sam followed after Dean and caught up with him â€œSo now what?â€ the youngest Winchester asked as the two walked side by side. Dakoda and Damien kept their distance but followed after the other set of siblings.  â€œNow we keep digging until we find him might take a while.â€ Dean told Sam walking a few feet ahead of Sam who had stopped.   â€œDean I told you. I gotta get back by Mondayâ€“â€ Sam started staring at his older brother as he reminded him he wasnâ€™t staying. Dakoda looked at Damien and saw the same look on her brotherâ€™s face and felt her shoulders slump slightly as she realized she would have to say goodbye to her baby brother again.   â€œDamien-â€ Dakoda started but was cut off by her brother â€œKoda you know Iâ€™m not meant for hunting I gotta go back to college.â€ Damien told Dakoda looking at his sister who had a vaguely hurt look in her eyes that she quickly covered up.   â€œYeah I forgot. Youâ€™re really serious about this arenâ€™t you? You think youâ€™re going to just become some lawyer? Marry your girl?â€ Dean questioned as he looked at Sam having turned around to look at his baby brother. Dakoda listened to the Winchesters and sighed â€˜Here we goâ€™ she thought as she realized it was just going to escalate and turn into an argument.   â€œMaybe. Why not?â€ Sam asked tilting his head slightly â€œDoes Jessica know the truth about you? I mean does she know the things youâ€™ve done?â€ Dean asked watching as his younger brother stepped closer. Dakoda rolled her eyes and went to step forward only for Damien to place a hand on her arm and shake his head â€œNo and sheâ€™s never going to know. About either of us.â€ Sam told Dean referring to both him and Damien.   â€œWell thatâ€™s healthy. You can pretend all you want Sammy. But sooner or later youâ€™re going to have to face up to who you really are.â€ Dean told Sam turning around and walking along the bridge some more â€œAnd whoâ€™s that?â€ Sam asked following after Dean. Dakoda and Damien follow after them and close in a little to step in in case it escalates further than necessary.  â€œYouâ€™re one of us.â€ Dean told Sam over his shoulder as he kept walking only for Sam to rush to stand in front of him making him stop in his tracks â€œNo Iâ€™m not like you. This is not going to be my life.â€ Sam told Dean standing in front of his older brother and slightly towering over him. Dakoda made her way closer and stood slightly behind Dean staying close in case they went physical.   â€œYou have a responsibility toâ€“â€ Dean is cut off by Sam â€œTo Dad and Javier? To their crusade? If it werenâ€™t for pictures I wouldnâ€™t even know what Mom looks like. And what difference would it make? Even if we do find the thing that killed her Momâ€™s gone. And she isnâ€™t coming back.â€ Sam ranted Dakoda felt her blood boil slightly but understood she watched as Dean quickly snagged Samâ€™s collar and pushed him up against the side of the bridge. Dakoda shot into action wrapping an arm around Deanâ€™s waist and digging her heels into the concrete as she pushed Dean off of his brother while Damien went to Samâ€™s side â€œThatâ€™s enough Dean. Thatâ€™s enough!â€ Dakoda murmured to Dean as she held onto him he struggled slightly but calmed down. Dakoda had her body positioned in front of Dean and she glanced to the side only to freeze at the sight of a woman standing on top of the railing.   â€œDean..â€ Dakoda patted Deanâ€™s chest but he doesnâ€™t look at her she reached up without taking her gaze off the woman gripping his chin slightly and turned his head for him so he would look where she was. Dakoda feels Damien and Sam come up behind her to stand as they all looked at Constance who looked back at them before she placed one foot in front of her and leapt from the railing.   â€œShit!â€ Dakoda shouts as all four hunters run over to the railing quickly looking over the edge but not seeing anything â€œWhereâ€™d she go?â€ Dean questioned as he looked into the river below but not seeing anything.   â€œI donâ€™t know.â€ Damien murmured before Sam could open his mouth and before the youngest Winchester could speak at all the sound of the impalaâ€™s engine started and the headlights flicked on. The four of them looked over and stared at the Impala as it revs its engine â€œWhat the fuck?â€ Dean asked shock filling his gaze.  â€œWhoâ€™s driving your car?â€ Sam asked his brother Dean simply pulled his keys out from his front pocket and jingled them. Dakoda gapes at the keys before staring at the car she shares a glance with Damien before the Impala abruptly lurches forward which sends the four of them spinning around and sprinting away. They arenâ€™t fast enough to outrun the speed of the car Damien thinks quickly and dives to the left of the Impala while it continues forward and Dakoda dives off the bridge with Dean and Sam. Dakoda gripped Deanâ€™s jacket as they headed down into the river shouts coming from their mouths as they went.     Sam had managed to catch himself on a part of the railing and hang from it he looked below him at the river as he tried to pinpoint where Dean and Dakoda might have landed. He heard movement and looked up to see Damien standing on the bridge still â€œYou okay Sam?â€ Damien asked reaching down to where Sam was to help him up.   â€œDean? Dakoda?â€ Sam and Damien called out for their siblings once their feet were planted back on the bridgeâ€™s concrete. There was some splashing below and they looked to see Dakoda and Dean crawling from the river covered in mud.   â€œWhat?â€ Dakoda and Dean asked in sync clearly annoyed by the mud that covered their bodies â€œHey! You guys alright?â€ Sam called down to them worried for them while always trying not to laugh.   â€œSuper.â€ â€œAwesome.â€ Dakoda and Dean individually told Sam Dean lifted his hand and gave an A-okay symbol with his index finger and thumb while Dakoda gave a thumbs-up. Dakoda put her head down and groaned she slowly crawled away from the river and flicked mud off her arms and legs with a disgusted grimace. It took the two of them five minutes to trudge their way back up to the bridge grumbling under their breaths about the mud and the upholstery of their cars. Dakoda splits from Dean when they finally make it onto the concrete and asphalt of the bridge Dakoda going to her Mustang while Dean meets up with Sam at the Impala.   â€œShut up Damien.â€ Dakoda grumbled as she walked to the driverâ€™s side Damien only laughed louder at her words â€œDude you smell like shit.â€ he told his sister with a grin.  â€œDick.â€ Dakoda grumbled as she opened the driverâ€™s door â€œSlut.â€ Damien grinned back as he opened the passenger side door Dakoda rolled her eyes fondly as she slid into the seat and grimaced as mud got on the seat and steering wheel.         Dakoda and Damien stood with Dean and Sam as they stood in front of the motel clerkâ€™s desk so they could get two rooms Dakoda desperately needed a shower.   â€œTwo rooms please.â€ Dean requested as he tossed a credit card down the name â€˜Hector Aframianâ€™ written on it. Dakoda rolled her eyes slightly as she realized Dean was using a fraudulent credit card to pay for her room as well but appreciated it and couldnâ€™t judge him because she was no better.  â€œYou guys having a reunion or something?â€ the motel clerk asked as he lifted the card and read the name â€œWhat do you mean?â€ Sam asked the clerk and slightly leaned forward with his head tilted.   â€œI had another guy Burt Aframian. He came and bought out a room for the whole month.â€ â€œthe clerk told them handing the card back. Dakoda eyed the man slightly before Dean took the card back as Sam asked what room number. A few minutes later they found themselves outside the right room with Dakoda and Dean playing lookout and Sam and Damien working on picking the lock Damien was mostly observing Sam as he picked the lock.   The door swings open and Sam stands up walking in with Damien beside him as they look around the cluster-filled room. Two beds sat to their left with a group of newspaper clippings on the wall opposite the window and door the youngest Winchester and Hernandez reach out and snag Dean by the shoulder and Dakoda by the back collar of her mud-covered jacket yanking them both inside the motel room quickly.   â€œTell me again why I couldnâ€™t grab another room?â€ Dakoda questioned Dean as the group of four searched around the motel room â€œBecause itâ€™s safer this way and itâ€™s not the first time weâ€™ve all shared a motel room.â€ Dean told her with a shrug he reached over and turned a lamp on with a half-eaten rotting hamburger beside it. Dean lifted the hamburger up and sniffed it recoiling instantly at the smell and receiving a light smack on the shoulder from Dakoda â€œPut it down.â€ she scolded like he was a child he rolled his eyes â€œI wasnâ€™t going to eat it.â€ he told her with a scoff.   â€œI donâ€™t think theyâ€™ve been here for a couple of days at least.â€ Dean told Sam and Damien as he pointed at the half-eaten burger he had just sniffed Dakoda nodded in agreement as she stood beside Dean and looked around the room. There were some tell-tale marks of her and Damienâ€™s father having been with John so it was still obvious that Javier was still hunting with John.   â€œSalt cats-eye shellsâ€¦they were worried. Trying to keep something from coming in.â€ Sam told the other three hunters as he picked up a pinch of the salt and crushed cats-eye shells he looked to Dean who was now looking at the wall of papers and newspaper clippings.   â€œWhat have you got there?â€ Sam asked as he stepped up beside Dean and Dakoda Damien was standing by the window and peeking out through the curtains for a second before stepping away to look around.   â€œCentennial Highway Victims.â€ Dean responded Sam leaned over and inspected the clippings that date back to 1987 â€œI donâ€™t get it. I mean different men different jobsâ€“â€ Sam stared at the clippings before he crossed the room â€œâ€“ages ethnicities. Thereâ€™s always a connection right? What do these guys have in common?â€ Dean continues looking over the wall of papers. Dakoda walked around the room a bit and gazed at another wall with more paper clippings her hand reaching out to turn a lamp on so she could see better. She felt Sam come up beside her and take a look at the clippings.   â€œDad and Javier figured it out.â€ Sam spoke up grazing one of the clippings with his fingertips â€œWhat do you mean?â€™ Dean asked turning to look at where Sam and Dakoda were standing.   â€œHe found the same article we did. Constance Welch. Sheâ€™s a woman in white.â€ Sam explained looking over the clippings and glancing at Dean.   â€œSon of a bitch.â€â€ You sly dogs.â€ Dakoda and Dean murmured at the same time as the case started to make sense and piece itself together.   â€œAll right so if weâ€™re dealing with a woman in white Dad and Javier would have found the corpse and destroyed it.â€ Dean turns to Sam as he speaks his gaze flickering to Damien briefly. Dakoda tunes out of the conversation and wanders back to the other wall her mind going over the details of the case and what they could do next potentially especially if John and Javier hadnâ€™t destroyed the corpse or what could be keeping the spirit here if they had.   Dakoda tunes back in when she sees Dean heading to the bathroom and she darts over smacking the back of his head as she passes with a laugh falling from her lips.  â€œToo slow pretty boy.â€ Dakoda calls through the bathroom door once sheâ€™s closed it behind her â€œCome on pretty girl.â€ Dean complains on the other side of the wood. Dakoda heard a distinct thump and knew Dean had thunked his head on the door â€œDonâ€™t pout Dean I wonâ€™t be long.â€ she told him. It took Dakoda twenty minutes to get all the mud off her clothes and skin she had to persuade Dean to grab her duffle from her car since he had to get his own anyway. She emerged from the bathroom with fresh clothes and her skin rubbed raw where the mud had stuck to the hardest. She gave a teasing grin to Dean who flipped her off as he walked past her into the bathroom to get cleaned off himself.      â€œWell donâ€™t you look pretty?â€ Dakoda teasingly asked Dean when he reemerged from the bathroom half an hour later she received a mocking glare from him which only made her laugh.   â€œHey man Iâ€™m starving. Weâ€™re gonna grab a little something to eat in that diner down the street.â€ Dean told Sam referring to himself and Dakoda since Damine was just gonna stay with Sam in the motel room. â€œYou want anything?â€ he asked his little brother. Dakoda had already stepped outside and had pulled her cigarette pack and lighter out glancing at the Marlboro packaging before she slid one out. She tucked the small box back into her jacket pocket and cupped one hand around the front of the cigarette as she lit the end taking a long drag as she tucked her lighter back into her pocket with the pack. Dakoda looked back to the door and saw Dean come out sliding his jacket onto his other shoulder as he walked down the steps. They begin to walk to the cars but they glance to their right their gaze landing on the police car and the police officers standing with the motel clerk. Dakoda cursed under her breath and looked at Dean â€œCall Sam and Damien.â€ she muttered Dean turned away and called Samâ€™s phone.   â€œDude five-oh. Take off.â€ Dean spoke into the phone once Sam picked up â€œUh they kinda spotted me. Go find Dad and Javier.â€ Dean responded to what Sam had said while Dakoda kept her eyes off the cops to not add suspicion she acted casual as she smoked her cigarette but she wasnâ€™t happy about it being interrupted. Dakoda hears Dean hang up as the deputies approach she plastered on a fake smile alongside Dean as they look at the cops.   â€œProblem. Officers?â€ Dean asked switching his gaze between the two briefly before landing on the one on the right his badge read â€˜Jaffeâ€™.  â€œWhereâ€™re your partners?â€ Deputy Jaffe questioned keeping his gaze fixed on Dean but glancing at Dakoda.  â€œPartners? What partners?â€ Dean asked plastering feigned confusion on his face. Dakoda internally rolled her eyes and groaned she knew they were going to be arrested. Jaffe looks over his shoulders and jams his thumb in the direction of the motel room dragging his gaze back to Dean and Dakoda. Dakoda felt Dean fidget slightly and she grasped his hand in her free one slightly keeping her gaze on the officer.   â€œSo fake US Marshals. Fake credit cards. You got anything thatâ€™s real?â€ Jaffe asked his hands grasping his belt as he stared the two down.   â€œMy boobs.â€ â€œMy ass.â€ Dean and Dakoda spoke a grin appearing on Deanâ€™s face. Dakoda quickly flicked her cigarette bud to the ground and stomped on it before she was manhandled against the hood of the car closest to her and Dean. Deanâ€™s face appears beside her as his shoulder touches hers she gives him a slight glare as theyâ€™re held against the hood and cuffs are slapped on their wrists by Jaffe who had an extra pair.         Several hours passed and night had fallen Dakoda hadnâ€™t been told much and was being held on the same charges as Dean from the little she had been told by the arresting officer. She had refused to speak not knowing exactly what Dean had said and wanting to keep whatever cover story he had going.   Dakoda looked up from the metal table when she heard a commotion outside the room she was being kept in seeing officers sprint passed in a rush. Her brows furrowed in confusion before she heard scraping at the window behind her she looked over her shoulder to see a grinning Dean forcing the window open and climbing in. She stifled a laugh when he fell onto the ground below the window.  â€œDid it hurt?â€ Dakoda cooed teasingly she watched as Dean stood up and shot her a glare but there was a teasing glint in his eyes â€œI can leave you here ya know?â€ Dean feigned backing up back towards the window. Dakoda narrowed her eyes and jerked her hands against the cuffs â€œDonâ€™t you dare pretty boy.â€ she grumbled. Dean laughed softly and moved back to her he glanced at the door as he began picking the lock on the cuffs.   â€œI would never pretty girl.â€ Dean told her with a teasing grin on his lips finally popping the lock on the cuffs. He tossed the cuffs onto the table before making his way back to the window he bends his knees slightly to give Dakoda a boost up despite not really needing it due to being five foot nine but appreciating it nonetheless. The two slip out of the police station and hurry away on foot finding a phone booth once they deem it safe since their cell phones got confiscated by the cops. Dakoda stands on the outside of the phone booth keeping her eyes out in case they get spotted. She couldnâ€™t hear much of what was said on the phone only hearing Deanâ€™s side. Her attention was snagged when Dean frantically called Samâ€™s name slamming the phone back in place in the phone booth.   â€œDean what happened? Whereâ€™s Sam and Damien?â€ Dakoda asked as she watched him leave the phone booth â€œThat Constance bitch showed up the phone cut out. Both of them are in my car.â€ Dean told her the two leaving the booth quickly.   â€œOkay letâ€™s get back to the motel and get my car and we can go to Constanceâ€™s house. That has to be where they would take her.â€ Dakoda told Dean she grasped his hand tightly before releasing it. The two quickly ran to the motel and got into Dakodaâ€™s mustang speeding out of the parking lot immediately Dakoda breaking several speed laws to get to the house.      Dakoda and Dean pulled up and leaped from the vehicle as soon as the engine was cut running over to where they saw the Impala sitting in front of the seemingly abandoned house. The two pull their guns from the back of the waistbands and take aim at the front driver-side window where they can see Constance sitting in Samâ€™s lap with her hand digging into Samâ€™s chest Damien is slumped in the passenger seat. Dakoda and Dean begin firing purposely aiming so none of the bullets hit Damien Constance flickers and glares at Dean and Dakoda before vanishing from sight.   â€œIâ€™m taking you home.â€ Sam muttered before putting the car in drive and lurching forward as he crashed into the front of the house Dakoda and Dean immediately running inside after the Impala. Dakoda racing to the passenger side and ripping the door open â€œDamien!â€ she called out and gently cupped his head in her hands he groaned softly as he woke up and she breathed out with a relieved grin.   â€œHey kiddo you okay?â€ Dakoda asked checking him over briefly before focusing on the small gash on his forehead â€œJesus she really did a number on you.â€ she muttered under her breath. Dakoda helps Damien from the car and keeps a steadying hand on his shoulder but he gives her a look so she backs off but canâ€™t help but linger closely to make sure nothing else was wrong. Dean and Sam come to their side and all four of them look behind them to see Constance with a large picture frame in her hands.   Constance glares at them and tosses the frame down before a bureau slides towards them Dakoda tackling Damien out of the way so they didnâ€™t get hit but Dean and Sam got pinned against the side of the Impala by the bureau. Dakoda keeps her eyes on Constance as she stands back up the lights begin to flicker overhead and they all glance around. Constance looks terrified as she looks around water begins to pour from the top of the stairs and Constance looks up to the top of the staircase. A boy and girl stand at the top of the stairs their hands linked as they stare down at their mother.   â€œYouâ€™ve come home to us mommy.â€ the kids speak in perfect unison Constance stared at them with a distraught expression but doesnâ€™t speak. The two kids vanish before they reappear behind her hugging her as she screamed in anguish and flickered slightly before the three of them melt into the floor.   Dakoda walks over to Dean and Sam helping them shove the bureau away from the legs before she walks back to Damien and grasps his arm at the bicep.   â€œSo this is where she drowned her kids.â€ Dean said with a â€˜huhâ€™ expression looking around slightly. Sam nods at Deanâ€™s words and absently rubs at his chest where Constance had dug her nails into.   â€œThatâ€™s why she could never go home. She was too scared to face them.â€ Sam told the three of them â€œYou found her weak spot. Nice work Sammy.â€ Dean complimented smacking Sam on the chest where the injury sat causing Sam to laugh through the pain. Dakoda smacked Deanâ€™s arm slightly as she walked back over Damien had told her he was fine.   â€œYea I wish I could say the same to you. What were you two thinking shooting Casper in the face you freaks?â€ Sam asked looking between Dakoda and Dean.   â€œSaved your ass didnâ€™t we?â€ Dakoda asked a hand propped on her hip as she looked at Sam with a â€˜duhâ€™ expression. She looks to her right and sees Dean lean down to inspect his car biting back a grin.   â€œIâ€™ll tell you one thing. If you screwed up my car?â€ Dean twisted to look at Sam while still bent down â€œIâ€™ll kill you.â€ Dean threatened his little brother who only laughed. Dakoda placed a hand over her mouth and laughed behind her palm she yelped when she felt Deanâ€™s hand smack against her calf.         THE SOFT RUMBLING PURR of Dakodaâ€™s Mustang approached the apartment building she had picked Damien up from a few days prior having to say goodbye to her baby brother already. She pulled behind Deanâ€™s car and stepped out after cutting the engine hearing Damien grab his bag from the small backseat due to the rustling she heard. She walked to the front of the Mustang and looked at Damien with a disappointed expression but had a twinkle of pride glinting in her eyes.   â€œCall me if you find them Kody. Promise me.â€ Damien told Dakoda as he stepped over to stand in front of her â€œI promise kid.â€ Dakoda told him causing him to roll his eyes at the nickname.   â€œIâ€™m not a kid anymore.â€ Damien complained with no real bite in his tone she smiled sadly before the two siblings hugged.   â€œIâ€™m proud of you kiddo. Now go before I drag your ass back inot the car.â€ Dakoda playfully smack Damienâ€™s shoulder before the younger of the two walked away with a mock salute. She watched him go before she looked at Dean who had just finished his own goodbyes with Sam she gave the green-eyed man a forlorn look before she went back to the driverâ€™s seat of the Mustang.      Dakoda followed the Impala keeping an eye on the brake lights before she happened to glance at the watch on her wrist and felt her heart drop as she realized it had stopped working and was frozen. She stomped on her brakes and flipped her car around hearing Dean do the same thing as they both raced back to the apartment complex quickly.  Dakoda and Dean leapt from their respective vehicles as soon as they parked both making a mad dash towards the front of the apartment complex. They scaled the stairs quickly up to the right floor and sprint to Sam and Damienâ€™s apartment door Dakoda lifts her leg and kicks the door in due to having gotten there first racing in due to the smoke they could both smell. Dakoda breaks for Damienâ€™s room but doesnâ€™t see him and knows he mustâ€™ve gone to Samâ€™s. She sprinted back through the apartment and barreled into Samâ€™s room where Dean was dragging Sam away from the bed that had a burning body on the ceiling above it. Dakoda looked on in shock as flashbacks flooded her mind but she heard Damien yelp and snapped back into the moment racing forward and dragging her own brother from the apartment like Dean had done to Sam.   It took five minutes for emergency services to flood the area and begin tackling the fire Dakoda stayed by Damienâ€™s side as he was checked out by the paramedics due to the minor burn he received on his forearm. She knew she was acting like a â€˜mother-henâ€™ but she couldnâ€™t help it she felt like she almost lost him and couldnâ€™t think about anything else on top of the flashbacks that kept plaguing her mind form having to watch her own mother burst into flames on the ceiling. Dakoda placed a hand on Damienâ€™s shoulder and the two walked over to where Dean and Sam were standing at the Impalaâ€™s trunk she watched as Sam inspected a shotgun before tossing it inot the open trunk with a resounding thud.   â€œWe got work to do.â€           a/n - AHHHH ITS CHAPTER ONE AND FINALLY FINISHED!!! I hope you enjoyed reading this as much as I enjoyed writing it. Let me know what you think in the comments.     taglist - @dianawinchester03 @quarterhorse19   ( comment if you wish to be tagged )
