post_body: Breaking Free: Chapter 4-The Path Ahead Pairings: AU! Mechanic Dean x Reader  Chapter Summary: Life keeps beating Y/N down But Dean is there to pick her up.  Series Masterlist here!! & Main masterlist here!  A/N: So some people might not like that itâ€™s moving a little fast but when you know you know.. Plus who doesnâ€™t believe in fate?  <!-- more --> Itâ€™s been a few days since our first date and each day I found myself falling deeper in love. The entire night replayed in my mind like a movie.   I remembered Deanâ€™s gentle touch as he fed me strawberries our laughter filling the air when one fell. He spoke about his family and his love for working on cars. He shared stories of his little brother Sam and his late mother. There were tears shed and comfort exchanged and of course-the lingering kisses.  Nothing intimate happened on our first date it wasnâ€™t that I didnâ€™t want to-believe me I did-but I wanted to make sure everything between us was right genuine not just a spur of the moment thing.   Plus Andrew was the only one Iâ€™ve been with and I wasnâ€™t ready for that big of a step. I wasnâ€™t even sure if I was staying yetâ€¦  But when Dean touched me it was unlike anything Iâ€™d experienced before. It was tender fulfilling and it felt like he truly cared.  The next morning he called me for coffee setting a routine that helped me ease back into going out again. Despite the townâ€™s gossip and judgmental glances Dean remained unfazed and eventually I stopped caring too.  Claire and I hung out shortly after our date bonding over lunch and swapping stories. She was a refreshing friend in this town one who didnâ€™t judge or buy into rumors.  I knew I had to make a decision soon-whether to stay in this town or leave. I didnâ€™t want to leave him but finding a job here was difficult and my money was running out.  I hadnâ€™t told Dean about my thoughts of leaving. I didnâ€™t want to burden him and honestly I hadnâ€™t expected to develop such strong feelings for him so quickly. But I knew I needed to have a serious conversation with him about my future despite how much I dreaded the idea of losing something like this.  I pulled out my laptop scanning through job listings again. Most seemed tied to Andrew or businesses featured on his news channel-places unlikely to hire me.  With a sigh I closed the laptop and dialed Deanâ€™s number. It had only been a few hours since we last spoke But I already missed him and his voice had a way of comforting me.  Dean picked up after the first ring. â€œHey sweetheart.â€  â€œHey Dean. Howâ€™s work going?â€ I asked trying to sound cheerful.  â€œBusy. There was an accident so iâ€™m working on two very expensive cars. Itâ€™s a bit intimidating.â€ he replied with a chuckle.  â€œYouâ€™re the best mechanic they could haveâ€ I reassured him laying my phone on my chest closing my eyes to savor his voice a moment longer.  â€œThanks. Howâ€™s your day?â€  I hesitated. Dean could always tell when something was bothering me. â€œItâ€™sâ€¦ okay.â€  â€œWhatâ€™s going on sweetheart?â€ he asked gently.  I sighed rubbing my forehead. â€œItâ€™sâ€¦ nothing. Just trying to figure out my next steps.â€  Dean knew I was hiding something. â€œNext steps towards what? Is there anything I can do to help?â€  I let out a nervous giggle. â€œNot unless you can offer me a job and a place to stay.â€  There was a pause on the other end of the line that made my heart skip a beat. â€œI was actually thinkingâ€¦ maybe I can help with that.â€  â€œWhat do you mean?â€ I asked my curiosity piqued.  â€œWell weâ€™re looking for a secretary at the office and I could talk to my dad about it. Andâ€¦ I have a downstairs unit in my place that you could rent if youâ€™d likeâ€ Dean offered sincerely.  I was taken aback by his generosity. â€œDean as much as I appreciate thatâ€”â€  â€œYouâ€™re not asking. Iâ€™m offeringâ€ he interrupted firmly.  I thought about the rumors swirling around town about me especially those involving Andrew. It felt wrong to accept Deanâ€™s help like I was being tested or setting myself up for future criticism.  â€œUmâ€¦ Maybe we could start with the job first and then weâ€™ll seeâ€ I replied cautiously. â€œI donâ€™t want to ask too much of you.â€  Dean chuckled softly. â€œIf thatâ€™s what youâ€™re comfortable with sweetheart. How about you come by the site in about an hour and Iâ€™ll talk to John?â€  â€œOkay that works for me. Thanks Deanâ€ I said gratefully.  After saying our goodbyes I felt a rush of nerves. Not only was Dean trying to get me a job at his workplace but I would also be meeting his father John Winchester.  From what Iâ€™d heard John was an intimidating figureâ€”intimidating yet fair. I hoped I made a good impression especially since I knew Deanâ€™s job and possibly our future together were at stake.  I pulled into the parking lot and spotted Dean working underneath a car. I couldnâ€™t resist sneaking up and playfully tickling his leg causing him to startle and bump his head on the car.  I covered my mouth trying to suppress a laugh but it was too late. Dean rolled out from under the car a wide grin spreading across his face. â€œOh Iâ€™m so going to get you back for that sweetheart.â€  I giggled helping him up. â€œIâ€™m so sorry.â€  He laughed deep and hugged me â€œItâ€™s alright. Letâ€™s go inside. Iâ€™ll introduce you to my dadâ€ Dean said the nerves evident in his voice.  Little did I know Dean was as nervous as I was if not more. He knew his father had reservations about me especially after losing the interview because of our initial encounter.  Dean knocked on the office door and John Winchesterâ€™s sharp eyes instantly fixated on me. His expression tightened his gaze scrutinizing Dean. I sensed there was something Dean hadnâ€™t told me but I wasnâ€™t sure what.  â€œDad I wanted you to meet Y/N L/N. Y/N this is my dad and the owner of Winchester Mechanics John Winchester.â€  I offered a polite smile stepping forward to shake Johnâ€™s hand. He chuckled under his breath his handshake gruff. He leaned back against his desk arms crossed his eyes returning to Dean. â€œWas there something you needed to talk about Dean?â€ John asked his tone cool.  Dean swallowed nervously his gaze dropping slightly. â€œUh yeah. Y/N is looking for a job and I was wondering if you still had that opening for a secretary.â€  John smiled faintly shaking his head. I knew at that moment I wanted to earth to open up and swallow me whole anything to get out of this situation.  â€œDean could you give Y/n and me a moment alone?â€ Deanâ€™s eyes widened as he turned towards me. I nodded quickly and he exited the room leaving me alone with his father whose stare could have cut through steel.  â€œYouâ€™ll have to excuse my son. Sometimes he acts without thinkingâ€ John said circling his desk and gesturing for me to sit. He sighed the tension in the room thickening around me.  â€œListen Y/N. You seem nice and Iâ€™m sure you mean well. But I donâ€™t think youâ€™re the right fit for this place.â€  â€œMay I ask why?â€ I whispered.  He sighed again settling back into his chair. â€œIâ€™m aware of the rumours surrounding you what Andrew and the townsfolk say. Itâ€™s not my place to judge but I canâ€™t risk our business over someone we barely know. Dean doesnâ€™t know you either. Why should we jeopardize everything over a girl who left a relationship unhappy? How is that fair to us?â€  Embarrassment flushed my cheeks tears threatening in my eyes. He was right. I wasnâ€™t worth the trouble. This was Andrewâ€™s town not mine. I nodded in surrender and rose from my seat. â€œI understand.â€  John stood beside me his hand lightly touching my arm. â€œIâ€™m not trying to be harsh Y/N. But Dean doesnâ€™t need this. He doesnâ€™t need to worry about a girl he just met. He shouldnâ€™t have to endure a town looking down on him because of your history. But heâ€™s too stubborn to see it.â€  I nodded again wiping away stray tears. â€œI know. Iâ€™ll make it clear to him Sir.â€  Before he could respond I hurried out of the office passing Dean on my way to the car. He caught my arm concern etched on his face. â€œWhat happened? Where are you going?â€  â€œThanks for trying Dean. But this was a mistake. I shouldnâ€™t have involved you.â€  Confusion furrowed his brow but when he saw my tears anger flashed across his features. â€œWhat did my dad say?â€  â€œNothing that wasnâ€™t true. Iâ€™m sorry. I have to goâ€¦ Iâ€™ll call you later.â€  Starting my car I sped away from the parking lot. When Dean was out of sight tears poured down my cheeks. I felt humiliated foolish and undeserving. How could I have thought things would ever be normal here? Why did I think a relationship with someone as wonderful as Dean could work when I was the townâ€™s most despised?  Deanâ€™s POV  I stormed into my dadâ€™s office seething with anger. He met my glare with a stern expression. â€œWhat the hell did you say to her?â€  He stepped closer his voice low. â€œWatch your tone Dean. I told her the truthâ€”that having her around is costing us already. She didnâ€™t have to leave she didnâ€™t have to listen but she did. She knows sheâ€™s causing problems I donâ€™t understand why you canâ€™t see that.â€  I scoffed and backed up. â€œMaybe because Iâ€™m the only one in this damn town who sees any good in her. Maybe I gave her a chance and when she showed her true colours I realized what a great person she is. Did it ever occur to you that Andrew might be the problem?â€  He shook his head anger simmering. Crossing his arms he leaned against the wall. â€œThat doesnâ€™t matter Dean. Our business is everything. To survive we need to be on the right side.â€  â€œAnd aligning with a guy who beats women is the right side?â€  â€œWatch your mouth. Andrew has influence. What happens at home is not our concern.â€  I scoffed again stepping towards the door. â€œYouâ€™re unbelievable. What if it were Mom in her position? Would you have treated her the same way?â€  â€œDonâ€™t you dare compare her to your mother.â€ His voice boomed on the walls.   â€œSwear to god what? Youâ€™ll hit me? Yeah because everybody in this town thinks with their fists. Go ahead prove me right dad.â€  He stepped closer eyes glaring on me firsts clenched. â€œDean Iâ€™m warning you.â€  I moved closer unable to hold back my fury and hurt. â€œIf it were Mom youâ€™d do the exact same thing.â€  Before I could react he grabbed my shirt slamming me against the wall. Pain shot through my back as his grip tightened around my throat.  â€œYour mother would never be in that situation. Y/N was foolish to get involved and youâ€™re even more foolish for defending her.â€  â€œIâ€™m falling in love with her why canâ€™t you support that!â€ I shouted watching his expression darken.  â€œYouâ€™re an idiot. You donâ€™t love her.â€  Pushing him away I rushed for the door. â€œI think I do and you wonâ€™t stop me from being with her. I care about her more than I care about Winchester Mechanics and youâ€™d do the same if it were Mom.â€  Back to me  I locked myself in the motel room collapsing against the wall as sobs racked my body. How could I have thought Iâ€™d find peace here? John was right. Dean was risking too much by being with me and he hardly knew me. I couldnâ€™t take away his future his passion for cars all because of my tangled history with Andrew.  Thatâ€™s why I decided to leave. I packed hastily preparing to depart and sort things out elsewhere. I couldnâ€™t stay shouldnâ€™t have stayed.  My phone rang displaying Deanâ€™s name. I hesitated knowing he wouldnâ€™t stop until I answered.  His messages flooded in each one a plea to talk. My heart raced. He was coming here? Panic surged. I couldnâ€™t face him couldnâ€™t bear to watch his heart break as I told him I was leaving for good. I had to go before he arrived.  I finished packing tossing everything into the car. As I closed the trunk I saw Deanâ€™s truck pulling in. He must have raced here.   He hurried over pain and worry spread across on his face. â€œSweetheartâ€¦â€  I avoided his eyes â€œDean donâ€™t. Itâ€™s okay. I have to go.â€  He glanced at the empty room behind me panic in his eyes. â€œGo where?â€  I sighed turning to face him struggling to contain my tears. â€œIâ€™m leaving town.â€  The words felt like a knife in his gut. â€œWhy are you leaving?â€  â€œI donâ€™t belong here Dean. Iâ€™m an outcast. Your dad was right. Itâ€™s not fair for me to jeopardize your future when you hardly know me.â€  He scoffed gently reaching for my arm. â€œI do know you. I donâ€™t understand why everyone keeps saying this. It hasnâ€™t been long but I know you. I know about your broken leg when you were five from falling off a horse. I know youâ€™re scared of dogs and hate the dark. I know youâ€™ve always dreamed of going to New York and seeing Times Square. I know the way your nose crinkles when youâ€™re lost in thought and how you tilt your head. And I know you donâ€™t want to leave because you havenâ€™t looked away from me this whole time.â€  I slowly met his gaze tears welling in my eyes. â€œWhat am I supposed to do?â€  â€œStay with me. Iâ€™ll take care of you. Iâ€™ll help you.â€  I stepped back arms wrapped around myself. â€œDean if I stay Iâ€™m putting your future at risk.â€  He moved closer his hands reaching out. â€œFuck my future! Why does everyone care so much about my future? A job isnâ€™t everything. Itâ€™s you.â€  My heart skipped a beat his words hanging in the air. â€œWhat did you say?â€  He sighed closing the distance between us. â€œItâ€™s you. Youâ€™re my future. It hasnâ€™t been long but I feel it. I know you feel it too. And Iâ€™ve only seen someone move this fast once beforeâ€”my dad and my mom. I want what they have and I know I can have it with you. Pleaseâ€¦ just stay with me. Iâ€™ll take care of you.â€  I couldnâ€™t hold back anymore. I leaned into him kissing him softly before pulling away finding the courage to speak my heart. â€œI think I might love you Dean.â€  A smile broke across his face and he kissed my forehead gently. â€œI think I love you too Y/N.â€  I sighed resting my head against his chest finding peace in his embrace. â€œWhat do we do now? I canâ€™t afford this motel room and I donâ€™t have a job.â€  â€œWellâ€¦ since the job didnâ€™t work out you could move into the apartment below mine. Orâ€¦ move in with me.â€  â€œDeanâ€¦â€  He grinned looking down at me. â€œHey you said you didnâ€™t want to ask too much of me. Technically itâ€™s just one thing.â€  I smiled through my tears nodding. â€œYouâ€™re right Detective Winchester. Are you sure?â€  â€œMore sure than anything. Itâ€™s up to youâ€”you can take the apartment or with me. Either way works for me.â€  â€œI want to live with you.â€  His eyes widened joy lighting up his face. â€œReally?â€  â€œLike you said my future is with you. We might as well start now even though I think we are absolutely crazy.â€  He nodded giving me the address before heading to his truck to meet me there. For the first time in a while I felt hope that things were heading in the right directionâ€”all because of Dean. I prayed that moving in together would work out. Up today s5e8: Changing Channels.  Sam comes home to the boysâ€™ bright sunny apartment to find that Dean has been shirking his research in favor of entertaining a bikini-clad lady. Oh and thereâ€™s a laugh track. What? Rewind. A few days earlier the boys are investigating the death of a man with anger-management problems who seems to have been killed by the Incredible Hulk. Sam suspects the Trickster and suggests trying to convince him to help them stop the apocalypse. When they go to an abandoned warehouse thinking they have a lead on where the Trickster will be they get zapped into a hospital where everyone thinks they are doctors doctors who seem to be caught up in a great deal of personal drama. The boys are stuck on TV making their way through a number of shows including Doctor Sexy Deanâ€™s â€œguilty pleasureâ€ medical drama. They catch the Trickster and he tells them to â€œplay their rolesâ€ before disappearing. With the help of Cas they figure out the Trickster must actually be an angel trap him in holy fire and make him explain himself. Heâ€™s Gabriel and he insists Sam and Dean must play their roles in the apocalypse and that the boys mirror the conflict in Heaven with Dean the faithful son (Michael) and Sam the rebellious one who chaffed under his fatherâ€™s rules (Lucifer). Supernatural Ep. 6x14 Mannequin 3: The Reckoning  after the absolute disappointment of the last episode this one comes in like a breath of fresh air. we have so much introspection from dean! this may be a record for a supernatural episode.  dean goes to lisa and ben because ben likes dean so much that he canâ€™t handle lisa moving on. i understand why ben feels the way he does and i donâ€™t think that he is completely unaware of dean and lisaâ€™s reasoning for their choices. however ben always has seen and always will see dean and samâ€™s life as a good thing. he romanticizes the life on the road saving people hunting things. he is not able to fully conceptualize the ways that that life has hurt sam and dean. ben just canâ€™t see the harsh truths in front of him. lisa meanwhile can only see the negative sides of deanâ€™s life. she understands that itâ€™s important to dean but i think she always thinks of the hunting life as a prison dean willingly chooses to return to like a kind of security. she sees hunting as something negative but comforting because of itâ€™s familiarity. itâ€™s no coincidence that after a year an important milestone in a relationship dean can no longer stay with her. suddenly the fear of the unknown becomes much greater than the fear of the known.  and thatâ€™s why i think lisa and dean couldnâ€™t work out. she is not capable of supporting him in the ways that â€˜regularâ€™ life scare him. she can hold him through the nightmares and support him through reckoning with his past but she canâ€™t see how the present scares him. to lisa this life has always been the goal. this is safe for her and i donâ€™t think it ever truly sunk in for her how terrifying life with her is for dean. dean doesnâ€™t know how to be in a relationship. he doesnâ€™t know how to be a dad. he doesnâ€™t know how to hold down a job. he doesnâ€™t have those skills and they scare him. thatâ€™s not to say heâ€™s not doing a great job because he is. but the fear is overwhelming anyway. if dean really wants to get out of the 'the lifeâ€™ he needs a more robust support network than lisa can provide him.

Sam suspects the Trickster and suggests trying to convince him to help them stop the apocalypse. When they go to an abandoned warehouse thinking they have a lead on where the Trickster will be they get zapped into a hospital where everyone thinks they are doctors doctors who seem to be caught up in a great deal of personal drama. The boys are stuck on TV making their way through a number of shows including Doctor Sexy Deanâ€™s â€œguilty pleasureâ€ medical drama. They catch the Trickster and he tells them to â€œplay their rolesâ€ before disappearing. With the help of Cas they figure out the Trickster must actually be an angel trap him in holy fire and make him explain himself. Heâ€™s Gabriel and he insists Sam and Dean must play their roles in the apocalypse and that the boys mirror the conflict in Heaven with Dean the faithful son (Michael) and Sam the rebellious one who chaffed under his fatherâ€™s rules (Lucifer). post_body: Driving In Cars With Boys - Chapter Six Where There Is Smokeâ€¦  Sam Winchester x Reader  Summary: For four months it was just you and Sam. But now Dean is back and there is something cosmic at work. He canâ€™t know about what happened while he was dead he wonâ€™t understand.  wc: 2.76k  https://archiveofourown.org/works/56409223  Series Masterlist  (its a smutty one you guys)  July 2008. Dean had been dead for two months. Sam had spent most of that time mind numbingly drunk. You had a part time gig at the local bar which covered the price of food and the bottles of whiskey Sam drank. You tried to ignore the money your dad deposited in your bank account. One day you will be able to thank him but not yet.  <!-- more --> You wanted to move on shed the skin you once let envelope you. No more credit card scams. No more endless days on the road. When you found evidence of a hunt you pulled out your phone book and found someone nearby to handle it. You knew deep down under the guilt and grief Sam would need to move on that he wanted to get out once and for all. So you were trying not just for yourself but for him as well. It was foolish really. How long could you have kept pretending before the facade would shatter.   It was late you had just clocked off and were tired from collecting mediocre tips from musty old men. Sam wanted to keep hunting down Lilith and you half expected him to be on the road chasing down a lead again. But no he was sitting on the shitty couch you had poached from an alley to fill space in the dump you were squating in. There wasnâ€™t a glass in his hand but you knew it was somewhere. It was never far.   â€œY/N?â€ he called   â€œHoney Iâ€™m homeâ€ you joked without much energy knowing he probably wouldnâ€™t register it. By the time you stumbled home smelling of stale beer he was usually drunk or asleep.   But he did hear it. And when you dropped your things beside him on the arm of the couch and stood in front of him he mumbled â€œI wish that were real.â€  â€œI am realâ€ you told him stepping closer to smooth the hair from his face. He shook his head solemnly.   â€œNo I wish those words were real.â€  You were confused or at least hoping you were. â€œSam? Youâ€™re not making any sense.â€  â€œI want you to mean themâ€ he murmured his eyes closed to the feeling of your hands in his hair. Was the ache in your chest the feeling of your heart breaking or struggling to repair itself?  â€œHoneyâ€ you murmured back urged on by the fragility of his own voice. He tensed. â€œOr would you prefer I call you Baby? Sweetheart?â€  The last one was teasing - thatâ€™s what Dean called you. Or Princess when you got on his nerves. The expression on Samâ€™s face told you he had not taken it as a joke. You released our hand from his hair with one last brush from his forehead down to the end of the strands. He was letting it grow out a bit those boyish bangs long gone.   He groaned and you realized that he wasnâ€™t as drunk as you thought. In fact he was hardly more than tipsy. His arms wrapped around your waist and slotted you securely between his open legs.   â€œNot â€˜Sweetheartâ€™â€ he said tightly. You nodded suddenly serious.   â€œWhat do you want then love?â€  His head was buried in your dirty work shirt. You had both arms cradling his head to your chest as he leaned against you his legs locking you in. He was holding on like you were his one connection to sanity - one final tether he couldnâ€™t afford to let go of.   It was a bad idea. But you couldnâ€™t manage to say those words out loud when Samâ€™s hands shifted and followed a thrumming path up your back. Slowly they trailed to your shoulder then down your arms where your hair stood on end. He gently undid your twined arms and set them at your sides.   â€œSam?â€  A horrendous silence then the quietest of confessions breathy and close to a groan. â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€  â€œFor what?â€ you asked carefully like approaching an injured animal.   â€œEverything. You name it. The drinking the anger keeping you here when I shouldnâ€™t. All of it.â€  â€œOh Sammy.â€ You shook your head. â€œDonâ€™t apologise.â€  That seemed to aggravate him further because he detached himself from you completely and sat back until he was contorted in the cushions on the couch. Somehow he managed to make his imposing frame seem vulnerable when he hunched like that.   You crawled beside him tucking yourself into his rough angles.   â€œTalk to me. post_body: Coming soonâ€¦..

Itâ€™s probably been said a thousand times but the morning routine scene in supernatural 15x20 really demonstrated to me that Dean was absolutely not okay. Like he looks okay happy music is playing over it and everything but heâ€™s clearly not himself. Dean isnâ€™t always the tidiest guy obviously but he respects his space he loves having somewhere thatâ€™s his his bed his room his kitchen. Because he never had that growing up.   And we see that a lot throughout the series his pride at his memory foam mattress and him glaring at Sam when he left trash on his floor when they first get the bunker but also later on whenever we see his room itâ€™s clean and tidy not a thing out of place (aside from the fact he doesnâ€™t fold his clothes).  But in this scene he wakes up and gets dressed sloppily throwing his clothes on whatever surface is around and thereâ€™s clothing having off the backs of chairs like heâ€™s been doing this for a while. And he makes his bed halfway before just kinda giving up.  Sam is up earlier than him which tracks but then Sam is also the one to make breakfast which again isnâ€™t that weird inherently but thatâ€™s something Dean usually enjoys doing. And then dean is very sloppy with the dishes flinging soapy water on his kitchen counter. Again disrespecting his space.  Heâ€™s a man going through the motions. The happy music and the cute dog and the way heâ€™s doing everything heâ€™s supposed to be doing are a distraction. Because heâ€™s doing it all wrong. Dean Winchester is a shell.  Or maybe Iâ€™m reading too much into it but whatever thatâ€™s what we do here!

Â¡WARNING!: VERY long post ahead!  I was recently asked to do a tutorial for two friends and I figured Iâ€™d share it here! Itâ€™s on how I personally use markers and colored pencils for portraits so if thatâ€™s something youâ€™re interested in then this is for you!  I must preface by saying this is my first tutorial/guide thingy and Iâ€™m no professional but hopefully it helps some! This is only one way of going about it donâ€™t worry if itâ€™s not your way!   Without further ado letâ€™s do this! And remember: Trust the process!!!   <!-- more --> First the angelic (ğŸ˜) reference:  Now we all see tones differently. I also am using the Art Alternatives Portrait Set which is limited in tones. So this wonâ€™t be completely picture accurate- which is okay! Essence over accuracy!  Alright! Here we go!  Step One: the sketch!  Typically I do the sketch in the personâ€™s undertone usually pinks or purples. However for whatever reason I was compelled to try blue on this one and hey- what is art if not random attempts at creating beauty?  And just like the color scheme the sketch isnâ€™t 100% accurate. But again itâ€™s all good!  But anyways the reason I do my sketches in colored pencil is because it doesnâ€™t smudge like graphite does and it actually blends into the marker. I feel itâ€™s smoother and it provides some undertones as you start layering with marker.   Step Two: base tones  This is where you wonder if you just destroyed the entire drawing. I promise you that you didnâ€™t! Basically what I do here is I put pinks down wherever I see pinks in the reference and lay down where the skin is the darkest. I find that it blends better when itâ€™s underneath the base layer.   Step Three: the base layer  Here all you do is throw down the skintone over the entirety of where it goes in this case the face. I typically try to leave out highlights but sometimes the marker bleeds and covers things I didnâ€™t ask it to. In this case that was the eyes. Oh well!   One thing to notice here is how you can still see the colored pencil beneath the sketch. Thatâ€™s a very useful guide for when you begin detailing.   Step 3.5: uh  This isnâ€™t necessarily a marker step itâ€™s just me letting the ink dry and working on other spots with pen and colored pencil. Also I do like to go over the pink areas a few times to make them less stark.   Step Four: beginning detailing   Now black is a tricky color on the face because it can either smudge on everything and turn it gray or work really well. I used a colored pencil here and began going over the blue colored pencil spots and lines that were visible under the marked which started to bring out his face. I also covered the highlight on the nose that had been left alone thus far.   Step Five: THEâ„¢ï¸ details  If thereâ€™s anything Iâ€™ve learned in my five years of drawing itâ€™s that the highlights and darkest points are what really make the piece. Pure white bright highlights (like the ones in the eyes) are awesome but lately I like smudging them out a little bit so that theyâ€™re gentler.   If thereâ€™s anything you want to hit itâ€™s the whites of the eyes with the white gel pen and the pupils + nostrils with the black fineliner.   I have shaky hands but I use them to my advantage in stippling the darkest part of the eyebrows and in the line of the lips with the fineliner- it just adds a little bit more depth :)  Hair is its own thing I just sort of wing it. Black hair especially is not the easiest for me just because I find it difficult to bring out the shades in it. Itâ€™s not done at this step as I was trying to figure out how I was going to finish it.   I will also blend things out with both the skintone marker and a pink colored pencil just to get stuff to be smoother. If youâ€™re going for semi realism/realism like me I highly recommend taking a reddish brown to do some freckles/skin texture with. You canâ€™t see it too much in this picture and I didnâ€™t want to overdo it since Cas/Misha doesnâ€™t have that many freckles as far as I can see but it does make a difference.   Step Six: everything else  I did the jacket in colored pencil as well as the fake id!  If you have any questions let me know Iâ€™m happy to help!  Hope this is a decent guide :)

post_body: Title: Horror High  Pairing: Destiel  Rating: NC-17 (in future chapters)  Warnings: Sex Violence  Summary: John Winchester plants his eldest son at Caspar High in Jacksonville because weird things have been happening there: people disappearing. People reappearing only dead and drained of all their bodily fluids. Cocoons. Itâ€™s up to Dean to figure out whatâ€™s stalking Casparâ€™s halls and deal with it accordingly; but then he meets the New Kidâ€”newer than him even the New-New Kidâ€”Castiel Novak and all his plans get severely derailed. Now Dean has to juggle the supernatural caseâ€”a really hungry jorogumoâ€”and also the fact that heâ€™s very quickly falling in love something that is absolutely forbidden by his dad.  Meanwhile Castiel shoved into the third new school in a year because his adoptive fatherâ€”Chuck Shurleyâ€™sâ€”job has them moving around a lot struggles to fit in at Caspar High not only because heâ€™s the New Kid but because heâ€™s the weird New Kid. Dean seems like a saving grace a harbor in a storm someone who doesnâ€™t judge himâ€”that is until Cas finds out about Deanâ€™s night job. Casâ€™s life just got a whole lot strangerâ€”but that doesnâ€™t stop him from falling for Dean regardless.  Notes: This is my first time writing Destiel OR SPN (though I have written SPN AU in other fandoms) so please bear with me while I get my footing.  Also HH was originally supposed to be like a 10-page one-shot and the next thing I knew it was 79-pages-of-11-pt-Arial-and-counting and I was looking for places to divide it for chapters so. Yeah. This storyline kind of just took over my brain and became a THING.  Top Dean and Bottom Cas which I know is the reverse of how 90% of the fandom writes them but I am tentatively planning a sequel to HH (depending on how well it does or doesnâ€™t go over) that will flip them around so be patient shhhh.  Cas is younger than Dean in this AU by likeâ€¦ six months. Deanâ€™s official birthday is January 24th and I used Jimmy Novakâ€™s birthday for Cas which is July 10th. Since theyâ€™re both in the same grade that makes Cas younger. Just accept it and move on.  I have never been to Jacksonville or Florida so everything contained within this fic is completely fictitious; business names street names school names place names everything except Jacksonville Florida itself. :D  ALSO before anyone corrects me on stuff I am CANADIAN and I know the CANADIAN high school system/curriculum. I really have very little idea of how the US school system/classes work so like. Iâ€™m just making it up as I go. :D;; (Literally how many classes do US high school students have in a day?? Up here itâ€™s FOUR.)  Please excuse my interpretation of jorogumos I took a LOT of liberties.  Chapter Two will be posted next Friday if youâ€™re into that sort of thing. You can also read this HERE on AO3.  HORROR HIGH TUMBLR MASTER POST HERE.  HORROR HIGH Chapter One By Senashenta  Dean Winchester crept up the steps of Caspar High School in Jacksonville Florida and ducked under the line of police tape that marked off the area heading for the little tent that had been erected just to the side of the building near the bushes. The whole scene was theoretically being guarded by the policeâ€”but the officer they had left behind was asleep in his police car out front.  Bang up job Jacksonville P.D.  <!-- more --> That aside Dean was good at his job so sneaking into a crime scene was no big deal for him guarded or not. And this was just your basic body check there wouldnâ€™t be any fighting or anything to wake the cop upâ€”or that was the theory anyway. (Even if there was it wouldnâ€™t be his first time being caught and or arrested either but they would probably just chalk it up to him being a nosy kid regardless.)  This was the first time his Dad had trusted him enough to drop him in a town to take care of a case alone. Of course Sam was in Jacksonville with Dean while their Dad headed to Utah to look into a recent spate of killings there but Sam was pretty much confined to school and the motel on this outing as per their fatherâ€™s orders. Still Dean was going to be keeping a close eye on him: Sam had been known to rabbit in the past and he didnâ€™t want to have to call his Dad and explain that he had lost his little brother (again.)  Now Dean stealthily unzipped the tent flap and stepped inside letting it fall closed behind himself.  What he was confronted with when his eyes adjusted to the darkness wasnâ€™t a body so much as a cocoon an oblong rounded object the size of a person and wrapped in layers and layers of what looked almost like off-white cheesecloth or gauze. Dean leaned down and tapped at it with his fingers. It was soft like silk.  Well that would explain why the police hadnâ€™t taken the body away yet; there was no body per se.  â€œLetâ€™s see whatâ€™s inside you.â€  Dean pulled the buck knife out of the back of his jeans unsheathed it and got to work cutting the cocoon open. The wrapping though soft was tough and sticky hard to slice through but eventually he hacked a seam lengthways along the cocoon at which point he set his knife aside to pull the damned thing open.  Inside was the actual body; male probably and curled in on itself shrivelled and desiccated and dried to a withered husk. At least it didnâ€™t smell. Dean still made a face even as he released the cocoon and picked up his knife tucking it away again before exiting the little tent and heading off down the street making for the motel he and Sam were staying at.  The Seafoam Motel wasnâ€™t exactly high-class but then none of the places they stayed at ever were. But it had walls and a roof good locks on the door it was cheap and nobody asked too many questions about the occupants of the rooms and those were all the important things. The Seafoam Motel ticked all the boxes for a financially strapped Hunterâ€”and for his kids too. Not that you would know it from Samâ€™s complaining.  At least it had wifi the kid would have pitched an absolute fit if it hadnâ€™t.  When he got back to the room the door was predictably locked (good job Sammy) and Dean banged on it a couple of times calling out â€œSammy itâ€™s me open the door!â€  After a moment of silence there was the sound of the chain lock and deadbolt being unlocked and then the door was yanked open. Cas kept telling Dean he really didnâ€™t need to walk him home and Dean kept doing it anyway.  Because aside from his paranoia he really did like Cas and enjoy spending time with him possibly too much reallyâ€”but walking Cas home also got him away from the crappy motel and his annoying little brother for just a little while longer which was always a bonus. He was a Hunter and he had a job to do his dad drilled that into him all the damn time but he was also not-quite eighteen and needed distraction every now-and-then.  â€œYouâ€™re quiet.â€ Dean was always quiet when they were walking down James Street. Cas always tried anyway. â€œWhat are you thinking about?â€  â€œIâ€™m thinking itâ€™s going to rain.â€  Cas glanced up. It was severely overcast with storm clouds overhead and the humidity was through the roof. Dean was probably right. â€œYeah probably.â€ He agreed. â€œHey do you want to walk all the way to my house today? I could introduce you to my Father if heâ€™s in. We could hang out.â€  Dean flashed him a little smile. â€œI canâ€™t. Iâ€™ve gotta get home to Sammy.â€  â€˜Sammyâ€™ was Deanâ€™s younger brother thirteen from what Dean had told him and attending Bedwin Junior High. Bedwin was Casparâ€™s affiliated Junior High so if they were around long enough Sammyâ€”Samâ€”would go to Caspar as well. Dean seemed to feel that they wouldnâ€™t be around that long though which wasâ€¦ disappointing. Upsetting even.  Cas was used to moving around himself and in the beginning he had been young and hadnâ€™t known better he had made friends wherever he went and then inevitably had to leave them behind. When he got a little older he started purposefully avoiding making friends so he wouldnâ€™t have to deal with the pain of losing them.  Now at Caspar he had dropped his guard again and even if his father kept his word and they didnâ€™t move again and he was able to stay friends with Charlie Jody and Garth Deanâ€¦ he and his brother were in the same boat as Cas had been in previously. So Cas had gotten to be friends with Dean without even meaning to gotten close to him developed a huge crush on himâ€”though he never let it showâ€”and Dean could be leaving any day. It was only a matter of time really.  Cas had thought that he had hardened himself to the reality of losing friends considering how heâ€™d grown up but the thought of Dean taking off justâ€¦ put a lump in the pit of his stomach. He really had it bad for the older boy had since Day One probably Charlie was right about that much.  But Dean was funny and smart and so attractive so of courseâ€”  Something heavy slammed into Casâ€™s back right at that moment the blow cushioned only by the fact that he was wearing his backpack and Cas yelped out a startled noise even as he tumbled to the ground landing roughly on the hard pavement.  Whatever had crashed into him was still on top of himâ€”a person he thoughtâ€”and scrabbling at him one hand holding him down by the chest while the other grabbed at his hair and shoved his head to the side. Then they lunged forward and bit into his neckâ€”Cas gave a sharp cryâ€”and abruptly Deanâ€™s voice shouted something unintelligible and he yanked the person off flinging them away.  When Cas looked up the person who had attacked him was standing a few feet away wiping at his mouth and spitting. Dean was between him and Cas and had a huge buck knife in one hand (where had that come from?) holding it at the ready. When the stranger stopped gagging and lunged toward Dean Dean braced himself and full-body tackled the man knife flashingâ€”first silver and then redâ€”as he stabbed it into the man over and over again.  After that onslaught though and despite being stabbed several times the stranger wrenched himself away and took off fleeing into the oncoming storm.  Dean stood where he was for a moment heaving before wiping the knife on his jeans and tucking it into the back of his waistband where Cas assumed it had come from to begin with. Then he hurried back over to Cas and crouched down hands hovering uselessly. â€œShit Cas are you okay?â€  Cas brought one hand up to the side of his neck where he had been bitten wiping there before dropping it again to look almost blankly at the blood on his palm. That was about when it started to rain. Dean reached to help him up and together they got Cas back to his feet. He actually didnâ€™t feel too bad all things considered.  Dean was already checking out his neck ignoring the fact that rain was pouring down on them now. â€œIt doesnâ€™t look too bad. It didnâ€™t get you too deep. Couldâ€™ve ripped your throat out youâ€™re lucky.â€  â€œItâ€”whatâ€”he bit meâ€”andâ€”you stabbed him and he didnâ€™t evenâ€”"  â€œCasâ€ Dean looked him in the eye deadly serious and told him firmly â€œthat was a vampire.â€
