post_body: Title: Horror High  Pairing: Destiel  Rating: NC-17 (in future chapters)  Warnings: Sex Violence  Summary: John Winchester plants his eldest son at Caspar High in Jacksonville because weird things have been happening there: people disappearing. People reappearing only dead and drained of all their bodily fluids. Cocoons. Itâ€™s up to Dean to figure out whatâ€™s stalking Casparâ€™s halls and deal with it accordingly; but then he meets the New Kidâ€”newer than him even the New-New Kidâ€”Castiel Novak and all his plans get severely derailed. Now Dean has to juggle the supernatural caseâ€”a really hungry jorogumoâ€”and also the fact that heâ€™s very quickly falling in love something that is absolutely forbidden by his dad.  Meanwhile Castiel shoved into the third new school in a year because his adoptive fatherâ€”Chuck Shurleyâ€™sâ€”job has them moving around a lot struggles to fit in at Caspar High not only because heâ€™s the New Kid but because heâ€™s the weird New Kid. Dean seems like a saving grace a harbor in a storm someone who doesnâ€™t judge himâ€”that is until Cas finds out about Deanâ€™s night job. Casâ€™s life just got a whole lot strangerâ€”but that doesnâ€™t stop him from falling for Dean regardless.  Notes: This is my first time writing Destiel OR SPN (though I have written SPN AU in other fandoms) so please bear with me while I get my footing.  Also HH was originally supposed to be like a 10-page one-shot and the next thing I knew it was 79-pages-of-11-pt-Arial-and-counting and I was looking for places to divide it for chapters so. Yeah. This storyline kind of just took over my brain and became a THING.  Top Dean and Bottom Cas which I know is the reverse of how 90% of the fandom writes them but I am tentatively planning a sequel to HH (depending on how well it does or doesnâ€™t go over) that will flip them around so be patient shhhh.  Cas is younger than Dean in this AU by likeâ€¦ six months. Deanâ€™s official birthday is January 24th and I used Jimmy Novakâ€™s birthday for Cas which is July 10th. Since theyâ€™re both in the same grade that makes Cas younger. Just accept it and move on.  I have never been to Jacksonville or Florida so everything contained within this fic is completely fictitious; business names street names school names place names everything except Jacksonville Florida itself. :D  ALSO before anyone corrects me on stuff I am CANADIAN and I know the CANADIAN high school system/curriculum. I really have very little idea of how the US school system/classes work so like. Iâ€™m just making it up as I go. :D;; (Literally how many classes do US high school students have in a day?? Up here itâ€™s FOUR.)  Please excuse my interpretation of jorogumos I took a LOT of liberties.  Chapter Two will be posted next Friday if youâ€™re into that sort of thing. You can also read this HERE on AO3.  HORROR HIGH TUMBLR MASTER POST HERE.  HORROR HIGH Chapter One By Senashenta  Dean Winchester crept up the steps of Caspar High School in Jacksonville Florida and ducked under the line of police tape that marked off the area heading for the little tent that had been erected just to the side of the building near the bushes. The whole scene was theoretically being guarded by the policeâ€”but the officer they had left behind was asleep in his police car out front.  Bang up job Jacksonville P.D.  <!-- more --> That aside Dean was good at his job so sneaking into a crime scene was no big deal for him guarded or not. And this was just your basic body check there wouldnâ€™t be any fighting or anything to wake the cop upâ€”or that was the theory anyway. (Even if there was it wouldnâ€™t be his first time being caught and or arrested either but they would probably just chalk it up to him being a nosy kid regardless.)  This was the first time his Dad had trusted him enough to drop him in a town to take care of a case alone. Of course Sam was in Jacksonville with Dean while their Dad headed to Utah to look into a recent spate of killings there but Sam was pretty much confined to school and the motel on this outing as per their fatherâ€™s orders. Still Dean was going to be keeping a close eye on him: Sam had been known to rabbit in the past and he didnâ€™t want to have to call his Dad and explain that he had lost his little brother (again.)  Now Dean stealthily unzipped the tent flap and stepped inside letting it fall closed behind himself.  What he was confronted with when his eyes adjusted to the darkness wasnâ€™t a body so much as a cocoon an oblong rounded object the size of a person and wrapped in layers and layers of what looked almost like off-white cheesecloth or gauze. Dean leaned down and tapped at it with his fingers. It was soft like silk.  Well that would explain why the police hadnâ€™t taken the body away yet; there was no body per se.  â€œLetâ€™s see whatâ€™s inside you.â€  Dean pulled the buck knife out of the back of his jeans unsheathed it and got to work cutting the cocoon open. The wrapping though soft was tough and sticky hard to slice through but eventually he hacked a seam lengthways along the cocoon at which point he set his knife aside to pull the damned thing open.  Inside was the actual body; male probably and curled in on itself shrivelled and desiccated and dried to a withered husk. At least it didnâ€™t smell. Dean still made a face even as he released the cocoon and picked up his knife tucking it away again before exiting the little tent and heading off down the street making for the motel he and Sam were staying at.  The Seafoam Motel wasnâ€™t exactly high-class but then none of the places they stayed at ever were. But it had walls and a roof good locks on the door it was cheap and nobody asked too many questions about the occupants of the rooms and those were all the important things. The Seafoam Motel ticked all the boxes for a financially strapped Hunterâ€”and for his kids too. Not that you would know it from Samâ€™s complaining.  At least it had wifi the kid would have pitched an absolute fit if it hadnâ€™t.  When he got back to the room the door was predictably locked (good job Sammy) and Dean banged on it a couple of times calling out â€œSammy itâ€™s me open the door!â€  After a moment of silence there was the sound of the chain lock and deadbolt being unlocked and then the door was yanked open. Sam stepped aside to let Dean in and then closed and locked the door behind him just like it had been drilled into him so many times in the past. â€œWhatâ€™d you find?â€  â€œCocoon.â€  â€œCome again?â€  â€œCocoon.â€ Dean repeated as he crossed the room pulling his knife out and setting it on the little kitchenette table then dropping into one of the rickety chairs. â€œYou know like the movie? The body was inside it. Wrapped up in this tough stickyâ€¦ I donâ€™t know what. But it sure looked a hell of a lot like a cocoon to me.â€  Sam was already heading for his laptop. â€œThat gives us a place to start at least.â€  â€œOh no no no.â€ Dean headed him off at the pass practically diving over and snatching the computer before Sam could get to it. â€œYouâ€™re not doing research all night we have freaking school in the morning.â€ And then â€œâ€¦I canâ€™t believe I just said that.â€  â€œYeah because you care about school.â€ Sam rolled his eyes and made a grab for the laptop but Dean held it over his head where he couldnâ€™t reach. â€œDean.â€  â€œI care about the girls at school.â€ He informed his brother with a grin then added â€œand itâ€™s nearly two a.m. weâ€™re going to bed. Research tomorrow. Sleep now. Besides I have to check out the school some more anyway just a cocoon isnâ€™t going to give us much.â€  Sam grumbled eventually agreed but still held his hand out for his computer. Dean deposited the laptop safely into his grasp and then started stripping down falling into bed once he was in just his boxers and a t-shirt. â€œGet the lights Sammy.â€  Sam flicked the lights off with a long-suffering sigh.  â€“ â€“  Castiel Novak wasnâ€™t having a great first day at Caspar High. He was relatively used to being the New Kid his fatherâ€™s job had them moving around a lot so he switched schools on a regular basis but the hazing at Caspar was particularly mean spirited he was finding not to mention the building itself was an absolute maze and he had been late for literally all of his morning classes simply because he hadnâ€™t been able to find them and no one had been willing to help him out.  Now he was seated in the cafeteria by himself but surrounded by the rest of the bustling student body unsure what to really do with himself.  This wasnâ€™t his first time being the New Kid. He and his father moved around a lot for his fatherâ€™s job and Caspar High was the third school heâ€™d transferred to since September. It was now January. His father promised that the moving would slow down though; he could see how much it wore on Cas even if the boy never said anything about it. He was going to start travelling for his seminars instead now that he felt Cas was old enough to stay home on his own. So Cas could potentially be at Caspar for a while.  He probably should have been worried about making friends. For most kids his age that would have been top priority but Cas had always been a little different and he thought he was fine on his own if it came down to it especially considering the first impression he was getting of the other students so far. It figured that the High School he was likely to actually graduate from would turn out to be full of nothing but jerks.  He was also possibly a little jaded from all the moving around heâ€™d done in the past.  For the time being he just dug his lunchâ€”a peanut butter and jelly sandwich an apple and a bottle of waterâ€”out of his backpack unwrapped the sandwich and began to pick little pieces of it off and eat them rather than taking proper bites as he usually would. He wasnâ€™t really all that hungry considering there were at least a hundred pairs of eyes on him at the moment.  And thenâ€”  â€œHEY NEW KID!â€  When Cas looked up a basketball was flying at his face and he had no time to duck out of the wayâ€”but at the last possible second hands shot out of nowhere snatching the ball out of the air before it could hit itsâ€™ target. Blue eyes blinked and his head swivelled sideways to take in the stranger that had just saved him from a black eye at the very least.  The guy wasnâ€™t overly tallâ€”probably around Casâ€™s height give or takeâ€”with short tousled brown hair. He was sporting a t-shirt and a flannel button-up under a worn black jean jacket. He was also wearing ripped jeans. But Cas was most taken by his eyes which were a sharp beautiful forest green. As he watched the other boy eyed the kid across the cafeteria who had thrown the ball to begin withâ€”then abruptly pitched it back at the offender. The ball slammed into the other kidâ€™s head sending him flying backward out of his seat and causing laugher to erupt all across the cafeteria.  Then his rescuer just looked down at him for a moment before dropping down to sit next to him straddling the bench. â€œThey tried that on me my first day here too. Same thing happened then. Youâ€™d think theyâ€™d learn.â€  â€œThank you.â€ Cas offered with a blink.  â€œNo problem.â€  â€œIâ€™m Castiel.â€  â€œThatâ€™s a mouthful. Iâ€™m Dean.â€ And then â€œthe fact that youâ€™re wearing a tie right now isnâ€™t going to help your popularity. Alsoâ€ he reached over to physically pull the tie off Casâ€™s neck and dropped it on the table in front of them. Cas allowed it somewhat baffled. â€œYou had it on backwards. Honestly dude just wear t-shirts like the rest of us.â€  â€œI can do that.â€ Cas agreed. He owned t-shirts. He grabbed his tie to stuff it into his backpack. Then he returned to looking at Dean taking in his features and mannerisms. He was exceedingly good-looking Cas decided almost absently. At the same time Dean was looking him over as well seeming to take stock of him gaze alert and analytical. Scrutinizing.  Eventually Cas shifted a little and asked â€œare you new too?â€  â€œNew-ish.â€ Dean shrugged â€œI transferred in two weeks ago.â€  â€œThatâ€™s why youâ€™re nicer thanâ€¦â€ Cas trailed off and glanced around the cafeteria.  â€œLiterally everyone else here?â€ Dean suggested with a laugh.  â€œI didnâ€™t want to say it but yes.â€  â€œIt gets better. After a few days they forget. Theyâ€™re dumb like that the masses.â€  â€œZombies.â€  â€œUhâ€ Dean hesitated but then allowed â€œyeah sure kind of.â€  â€œYou donâ€™t sound very certain Dean.â€  â€œWell Cas I just think zombies are probably different than in the movies.â€  Wait. â€œCas?â€ He called himself â€˜Casâ€™ in his head but no one ever called him that out loud except his father.  Dean gave him a little amused look â€œâ€™Castielâ€™ is a lot.â€  â€œOh. Okay.â€  â€œAs long as itâ€™s fine with you that is.â€  Cas nodded and offered a smile. â€œItâ€™s fine with me.â€  Dean gave him a little grin back. â€œGreat.â€  The rest of lunch hour was spent with Cas actually eating his lunch properly while he talked with Dean and they got to know each other a little. No one else bothered them for the rest of the time they were in the cafeteria and Cas was hoping he would have at least one of his afternoon classes with Dean but when they compared their schedules it sadly wasnâ€™t to be. Cas resigned himself to hazing throughout the day for at least the next week or soâ€”until the rest of the student body moved on.  It was a novelty to talk with someone who overlooked his innate strangeness. Cas was so used to people giving him odd looks that Dean chatting with him as freely as he was now wasâ€¦ almost baffling. Dean seemed like the kind of guy who could be popular have tons of friends easily and instead here he was wasting his time with Cas. It wasâ€¦ weird. Not that Cas was complaining.  When the bell rang to signify the end of lunch hour Cas was mildly disappointed that their conversation had to end. He shifted in his seat a bit before asking tentatively â€œyou could sit with me again tomorrow If you wanted?â€  â€œIâ€™ve already got a spot where I spend lunch hour usually. Not in here.â€ Dean replied casually making Cas wilt a little then; â€œbut you can join me if you want. Meet me by the gym tomorrow at the start of lunch okay?â€  Cas brightened again nodding. â€œOkay.â€  â€œCool.â€ Dean stood up and brushed the nonexistent dust off himself with a grin â€œthen Iâ€™ll see you tomorrow Cas.â€  Cas smiled back. â€œMm see you tomorrow.â€  He didnâ€™t know where Dean was going but he was off to calculus classâ€”assuming he could find it.  â€“ â€“  â€œHey New Kid.â€  Cas was really getting tired of being called that but at least this time there had been no malice behind it. More curiosity if anything. He was seated in calculus having found it with (relative) ease trying to keep his head down and out of trouble when the voice spoke up from in front of him. He reluctantly lifted his head.  The girl in the seat in front of him was twisted around in her chair to face him a wide smile on her face. Her hair was the reddest red that Cas thought it could possibly be. She gave him a little wave. â€œIâ€™m Charlie. Whatâ€™s your name?â€  Cas hesitated before offering â€œCastiel. But just Cas is fine.â€  â€œWow yeah â€˜Castielâ€™ isâ€¦â€  â€œA lot.â€ Cas echoed Deanâ€™s words from earlier in the day. He was starting to relax now that Charlie was turning out to be friendly. He sat up a little straighter. â€œItâ€™s nice to meet you Charlie.â€  â€œNice to meet you too!â€ Charlie glanced around â€œI know most of the population of his school are jerks but calculus is a pretty safe class so you can relax a little. Oh!â€ She gestured to the side at another girl â€œthis is Jodyâ€ and then to the boy sitting in the seat beside Cas â€œand this is Garth. Theyâ€™re cool too.â€  Jody had short brown hair and dark eyes and almost a maternal smile; Garth was tall and lanky kind of goofy looking but gave him a greeting grin that Cas couldnâ€™t help smiling back to. He was definitely feeling more comfortable now in this class at least.  â€œI saw what happened at lunchâ€ Charlie said pulling his attention back to her â€œDean Winchester saved you which likeâ€¦ what was he even doing in the cafeteria? He always vanishes at lunch time. No one knows where he goes. Itâ€™s a mystery.â€ She wiggled her fingers a little â€œhe must like you â€˜cause he usually just keeps to himself or he has since he transferred in anyway.â€  â€œMn he said he was new too.â€  â€œYeah by a couple weeks. No one dares pick on him though heâ€™d kick everyoneâ€™s asses.â€  Cas coughed out a little laugh. â€œI got that impression.â€ Then after a slight hesitation â€œhe said I could sit with him at lunch tomorrow. So.â€  â€œOoh exciting! Youâ€™ll have to tell us where he eats lunch then!â€ Charlie grinned at him then rolled her eyes slightly â€œaaaaaaall the girls have a crush on him. Heâ€™s handsome and mysterious and blah blah blah.â€  â€œYou think heâ€™s over-rated.â€ Jody informed flatly though her expression was amused.  â€œOver-rated?â€ Cas questioned.  â€œCharlie is gay.â€ Garth explained. â€œLike so gay.â€  â€œSo gay.â€ Charlie agreed.  â€œOh.â€ Cas shrugged. It didnâ€™t bother him. â€œIâ€™m not entirely straight myself.â€  Charlie just grinned. â€œSo you donâ€™t think Dean Winchester is over-rated.â€  He cleared his throat and glanced down a little. â€œHeâ€™s not unattractive.â€  â€œYeaaaah thatâ€™s what I thought.â€  â€œI like girls too though I justâ€¦ I like who I like. I donâ€™t care about their gender.â€  â€œThatâ€™s valid.â€ Charlie gave him a reassuring smile then just changed the topic entirely; â€œwhereâ€™d you move from?â€  Cas blinked. â€œWichita Kansas. My Father and I move around a lot for his jobâ€¦ or we did. Now that Iâ€™m older I guess he trusts me to stay home alone so heâ€™s going to start travelling instead. So Iâ€™m stuck here.â€  â€œItâ€™s not so bad here once you settle inâ€ Jody reassured him.  â€œYeahâ€ Charlie nodded â€œand youâ€™ve got us now so itâ€™s not like you have no friends.â€  â€œYou just have weird friends.â€ Garth laughed.  Cas couldnâ€™t help the little grin that crept across his own face. He was actually perfectly okay with having weird friends.  â€“ â€“  In history class after calculus somebody tripped him on his way to his seat and Cas fell flat on his face. The rest of the students laughed. Cas just got back up and continued on pretending nothing had happened. That was the best way to deal with bullies he had learned over his long and sordid history of transferring from school to school. Ignore them until they give up and go away.  Or alternatively have Dean Winchester throw a basketball at their face. That apparently worked too.  In any case after the incident in history the rest of the day passed easily enough until Cas found himself standing outside the school after final bell just taking deep breaths of the fresh air and looking up at the skyâ€”soaking in the fact that he was free at least for the rest of the day.  â€œYou going left or right?â€  Cas blinked at the familiar voice and turned his attention to Dean who had come up beside him while he was distracted with the general out-of-doors. He glanced toward the route he had to take to get home. â€œRight. Why?â€  â€œMe too. Iâ€™ll walk with you.â€  â€œOh. Okay.â€ And then â€œthanks.â€  â€œDonâ€™t gotta thank me. Iâ€™m walking that way anyway.â€ Dean nudged him to get him moving and Cas headed off with the other boy by his side.  â€œNo I meanâ€ Cas waved one hand in an absent sort of gesture â€œI mean for earlier. In the cafeteria. You really didnâ€™t have to do that. And one of the girls I was talking to later said you donâ€™t even usually go in the cafeteria so I justâ€¦ thanks. For going out of your way. I appreciate it.â€  â€œYou were gossiping about me?â€  â€œIâ€”â€ Cas began then clapped his mouth shut again and shook his head in a quick negative. When he spoke up once more it was to mutter â€œof course not.â€  But Dean was already grinning looking overly amused. â€œItâ€™s fine Cas Iâ€™m used to being gossip fodder. What was she saying about me?â€  â€œThat all the girls here think youâ€™re handsome.â€ Cas told him easily but conveniently left out the part where he agreed with them. There was no sense in telling a guy heâ€™d just met that he was already developing a crush on him especially when he might be moving again any day. He really wasnâ€™t sure he trusted his fatherâ€™s promises that they were going to stay put this time. â€œAnd that no one knows where you disappear to at lunch time apparently itâ€™s a big mystery.â€  Dean laughed. â€œWell youâ€™ll know starting tomorrow.â€ He pointed out â€œyouâ€™re still gonna join me right?â€  Cas actually gave him a surprised look. â€œI didnâ€™t think you actuallyâ€”â€  â€œâ€”meant it?â€ Dean finished for him. His smile softened for just a second before returning to his previous jovial expression. â€œMmmâ€¦ I wouldnâ€™t have offered if I didnâ€™t mean it. And besides youâ€™re different from all those other assholes I can tell.â€  â€œI like to think I am anyway.â€ Then â€œyou are too.â€  Dean grinned again. â€œI think weâ€™re going to be friends Cas I really do.â€  Cas offered up a smile of his own â€œIâ€™d like that Dean.â€  They walked together for a few blocks until they got to James Street at which point Cas paused and gestured down it. This was his turn off he had to walk down James to get to King Street where he lived and it wasâ€¦ well the term â€œsketchyâ€ came to mind. James Street was all run-down houses broken fences guard dogs and probably drug dealers. Dean looked down the street giving it a thorough eyeballing before declaringâ€”  â€œNope!â€ He gave Cas a little push toward the street but then followed him falling into step beside him as they headed down James. â€œNo way are you walking down here by yourself dude thatâ€™s just asking to get axe-murdered. Or worse.â€  â€œWorse than axe-murdered?â€  â€œOh trust me there are so many worse things than being axe-murdered.â€  Cas would have to take his word for it. He couldnâ€™t personally think of any but that didnâ€™t mean they didnâ€™t exist. For now he was just going over and over in his head how this guy he had just met was walking him all the way home through a dodgy part of town even though he didnâ€™t have to. His tiny newborn crush on Dean Winchester was probably growing teeth already and it hadnâ€™t even been a day.  â€œWhenâ€™s your birthday?â€  â€œHuh?â€ Cas blinked back to reality at the question and actually had to fumble for a response before managing â€œJuly.â€  â€œJanuary.â€ Dean was paying very close attention to their surroundings while also trying to maintain a conversation and that was obvious. â€œSo Iâ€™m older.â€  â€œOnly by six months.â€ Cas pointed out.  â€œStill counts. Means you have to do what I say.â€ Dean grinned at him fleetingly â€œthoseâ€™re the rules!â€  â€œI donâ€™t like those rules.â€ The younger teen gave a token protest. â€œI think you made those rules up.â€  â€œPossibly but theyâ€™re important.â€  â€œWhy?â€  â€œCould save your life one day.â€  Cas laughed softly at that but Dean didnâ€™t instead falling silent until they were past James Street and out of the sketchy area that Cas had very much walked through unescorted on his way to school that morning. Dean relaxed visibly as soon as they were back to â€œnormalâ€ neighborhoods his steps easier and his shoulder slouching a little where they had been tense and taut only a moment before.  Honestly Cas wasnâ€™t entirely sure what was up with Dean but clearly something was going on inside his head. He would love to have picked Deanâ€™s brain about it but he really didnâ€™t think Dean would be up for sharing. Maybe he had an incident in his past something to do with a neighborhood like James that had him acting like he was now. Cas thought possibly once they got to know each other a little bit more he might ask but for nowâ€¦  â€œI live on King.â€ He gestured down the street in question when they neared it â€œI really can walk from here Iâ€¦ um. But thanks. Again.â€  Deanâ€™s steps slowed to a stop and he glanced around as if checking the surrounding neighborhood before deeming it safe. â€œOkay Cas. Iâ€™ll see you tomorrow right? Be careful walking that way on your way to school in the morning.â€  â€œI will.â€ Cas gave him a little smile â€œthanks Dean. See you tomorrow.â€ Then he turned and headed across the street to King where his father was likely waiting to hear a rundown of his day.  â€“ â€“  Lunch time the next day found Cas nervously waiting outside the gym half expecting Dean not to showâ€”that it had all been an elaborate prank.  Casâ€™s morning had gone alright though everyone seemed to be steering clear now that it had circulated that Dean Winchester was looking out for him. He wasnâ€™t sure what exactly Dean had done to garner his reputation but whatever it was it had been effective.  â€œHey.â€ A hand clapped into his shoulder and when Cas glanced up Dean was standing there â€œcâ€™mon.â€  Cas just stared at him. â€œYou actually came.â€  â€œWell yeahâ€ Dean gave him an odd look then gestured for him to follow and headed into the gym. It was empty right now except for them and Cas trailed after Dean as they walked around the side of the bleachersâ€”and Dean ducked into the back of them then dropped down and settled with his back against the wall. He waved a hand for Cas to join him.  Cas clambered in behind the bleachers as well taking a seat beside Dean and setting his backpack beside him. â€œThis is where you spend lunch?â€  â€œYeah. Itâ€™s private. Quiet usually.â€ Dean shrugged â€œI donâ€™t mind you being here though.â€  Cas blinked at that not quite sure what to say. â€œIâ€”thanks?â€  Dean tossed him a grin. â€œYou donâ€™t have to thank me for everything Cas.â€  But it was the polite thing to do. Cas opened his mouthâ€”then closed it again. After a moment he just shrugged almost awkwardly and dug in his backpack for his lunch unwrapping his sandwich and beginning to eat. He was so severely unused to having friends that this was difficult for himâ€”socializing. He didnâ€™t really know how to do it.  â€œHey whatâ€™s your family like?â€ Cas glanced over when Dean spoke up. The other boy had his head leaned back against the wall his hands laced over his stomach and his eyes were staring off somewhere into the middle-distance.  â€œMy family?â€ Cas swallowed a bite of sandwich and resisted the urge to shrug again. â€œItâ€™s just me and my Father. He adopted me when I was five but I donâ€™t remember anything before then. Itâ€™s always just been the two of us.â€  Dean smiled a little and looked at him. â€œIâ€™ve got me and my Dad and my annoying little brother. But we get by okay.â€  So neither of them had Moms. That was interesting. Cas took another bite of his sandwich and asked â€œhow come you transferred here? Does your Dad move around a lot for work or something?â€  â€œYou could say that.â€ Dean agreed â€œwhat about you?â€  â€œSame.â€ The younger teen nodded in-between bites of food â€œmy Father is a motivational speaker and he does series of seminars all over the place. The last couple months we were in Kansas and Oregon before that. Now weâ€™re here.â€ Another bite of sandwich and he continued a little muffled â€œhe says weâ€™re going to stay here though now that Iâ€™m old enough to stay home on my own. He says heâ€™ll start travelling for his work instead.â€ A shrug â€œI donâ€™t know if I believe him or not.â€  â€œYour Dad lie to you often?â€  Cas sighed. â€œNo itâ€™s justâ€¦ I think itâ€™s a stretch. That heâ€™s suddenly decided all this.â€  â€œMm.â€ Dean seemed sympathetic though Cas wasnâ€™t entirely sure why. â€œSucks that itâ€™s this school that youâ€™d be stuck at after everything.â€  â€œThatâ€™s what I was thinking yesterday.â€ Cas admitted balling up the wrap from his lunch and dropping it back in his bag. Then he hesitated before offering â€œbut then I met you andâ€¦ things got better.â€  Dean grinned again. â€œYeah. I think weâ€™re gonna be good friends Cas.â€  Cas found himself smiling backâ€”and then Dean lifted his arm to run his hand through his hair and Casâ€™s eyes caught on a tear in the cuff of his jacket. He tilted his head curiously. â€œWhat happened to your jacket?â€  â€œHuh?â€ Dean lowered his arm to peer at the rip. He shrugged. â€œI donâ€™t even know honestly half my stuff has holes in it and I never know where they came from.â€  Cas was already digging through his backpack again and this time came up with a spool of black thread and a needle much to Deanâ€™s obvious surprise. He waved one hand toward the older boy â€œtake it off and Iâ€™ll fix it for you.â€  Of all the ways this lunch hour could have gone this was not one Dean would have predicted. He looked at Cas almost blankly for a moment then let his eyes flick down to the other teenâ€™s backpack. It was covered in vibrant patchesâ€”a cartoon PB&J sandwich a pizza box an LGBTQ flag angel wings etc.â€”all obviously hand-sewn on. And oh. So sewing was a thing with Cas. Okay.  Dean pushed away from the wall just enough to shrug out of his jacket and handed it over watching curiously as Cas measured out a length of thread then snapped it off with his teeth threading the needle and knotting the thread a second later. He was obviously practiced at this particular skill. So was Dean but for different reasons.  A few minutes of concentration later and Cas was finished with repairing the rip in his jacket knotting off the thread and snapping it with his teeth again then tucking the needle and thread away before sheepishly handing the jacket back to Dean.  â€œItâ€™s not perfect but itâ€™s much better right?â€ He asked almost shyly.  Dean gave him a genuine grateful smile. â€œThanks Cas. Itâ€™s great.â€  Cas watched him pull his jacket back on smiling himself now. â€œI like to sew. It gives me something to do with my hands when Iâ€™m feelingâ€¦ I donâ€™t know. Antsy I suppose. Like some people play with pencils or fidget toys I have a needle and threadâ€¦â€  Dean was inspecting the newly-sewn spot on his cuff and looked up with a grin â€œI play with knives.â€ He informed Cas only half-joking.  Cas not knowing any better laughed anyway. â€œHey Dean?â€  â€œYeah?â€  â€œThanks forâ€¦ being nice to me. Thanks for this. Forâ€¦ being my friend.â€  Dean almost told him he didnâ€™t need to thank him again. Instead he just smiled almost fond and said â€œyouâ€™re welcome Cas.â€  â€“ â€“  â€œWhat do you mean youâ€™re not going to tell us where Dean Winchester spends lunch hour?â€  This was from Charlie who had one hand clasped to her chest and a positively shocked and scandalized look on her face. The entire thing was an act and Cas knew it even having only known Charlie for two days. â€œCharlie.â€  â€œWhat do you mean youâ€™re not going to tell me where Dean Winchester spends lunch hour?â€  â€œAaaaaand there it is.â€ Jody drawled. Garth chuckled.  Cas just smiled apologetically. â€œItâ€™s kind of a secret. I donâ€™t think he wants people to know.â€  Charlie pouted â€œyou just want him all to yourself thatâ€™s what I think.â€  Cas coughed and glanced down at the same time as Garth commented â€œas if you care. You couldnâ€™t be less interested in Dean Winchester if you tried Charlie.â€  â€œNot true!â€ Charlie insisted â€œhe is indeed a mystery that I am interested in solving! Justâ€¦ not in like a romantic sense. Because ew.â€ Then she paused before adding â€œI mean objectively I can see where you would find him attractive Cas but justâ€¦ no thanks.â€  A soft laugh from Cas faintly embarrassed. â€œSorry Charlie. Iâ€™m still not going to tell you.â€  The girl heaved a suffering sigh. â€œYou disappoint me Castiel Novak.â€  Again. â€œSorry Charlie.â€  â€œYou are not.â€  He wasnâ€™t even a little.  â€“ â€“  It became habit that Cas met Dean outside the gym every day at lunch and they spent lunch hour behind the bleachers talking and laughing and becoming better friends Casâ€™s minor crush on Dean growing into a huge monster of one very quickly.  Dean never had anything to eat at lunch and it hadnâ€™t gone unnoticed by Cas though he had thus far neglected to say anything. But the longer he knew Dean and the more time he spent with the other boy the more it bothered him. He wasnâ€™t bringing anything from home obviously and never bought anything from the cafeteria he just sat through lunch hour watching everyone else eat and going hungry himself scribbling in a battered notebook that he carried in his inside jacket pocket.  And that didnâ€™t sit right with Cas because some days it was obvious Dean was hungry from the way he watched Cas eat out of the corner of his eye. But why he never had food was probably a sensitive subject and Cas didnâ€™t feel he had the right to ask.  He could however do something about it.  So the next time Dean plunked himself down on the ground behind the gym bleachers at lunch time Cas sat down next to him then swung his backpack around and fished out not one but two sandwiches each individually wrapped in cling-film. He blinked at Dean and held one out. â€œHere.â€  Dean just stared at him. â€œDude what are you doing?â€  â€œFeeding you.â€ Cas stated matter-of-factly and when Dean didnâ€™t immediately take the offered sandwich he just set it in the older boyâ€™s lap and returned to his bag digging out two apples and setting one next to Deanâ€™s sandwich. This was followed by a pair of bottles of water. Then he shrugged. â€œSomeone has to do it.â€  â€œButâ€”Iâ€”youâ€”this isâ€”â€  Cas could sense where this was going. He headed it off at the pass. â€œItâ€™s not charity if thatâ€™s what youâ€™re worried about. Itâ€™s as easy to make two sandwiches as it is to make one.â€ He was already unwrapping his own sandwich and paused to glance sideways at Dean before taking a bite; â€œweâ€™re friends and friends help each other out right?â€  â€œWe are yeahâ€¦â€ Dean continued looking at him rather oddly while he started to eat like he was having trouble with the idea of someone doing something so nice for him and not wanting anything in return. Eventually though he glanced away as if suddenly shy and carefully picked up his own sandwich unwrapping it and taking a huge bite right off the bat. He was obviously starving. Once that was chewed and swallowed he cleared his throat and offered â€œuhâ€¦ thanks Cas.â€  Cas shrugged again but gave him a smile. â€œAs long as you donâ€™t mind peanut butter and jelly I donâ€™t mind sharing with you.â€  â€œâ€¦I am not eating the apple. Apples belong in pies.â€  The next day Cas started bringing him a fruit cup instead. â€œItâ€™s close to pie.â€  â€œItâ€™s not even.â€  Despite his protests Dean ate it anyway.  â€“ â€“  On top of eating lunch together it had also quickly become habit for Dean to walk Cas homeâ€”mostly because he was very suspicious of James Street and that neighborhood in general and he didnâ€™t want his only friend to be snatched up by some monster or even a common-place serial killer. A life of being a Hunterâ€™s son had made him more than a little paranoid when it came to things like that.  Usually Cas made it outside first and just waited around by one of the retaining walls until Dean emerged from the school a few minutes later at which point they set out. Cas kept telling Dean he really didnâ€™t need to walk him home and Dean kept doing it anyway.  Because aside from his paranoia he really did like Cas and enjoy spending time with him possibly too much reallyâ€”but walking Cas home also got him away from the crappy motel and his annoying little brother for just a little while longer which was always a bonus. He was a Hunter and he had a job to do his dad drilled that into him all the damn time but he was also not-quite eighteen and needed distraction every now-and-then.  â€œYouâ€™re quiet.â€ Dean was always quiet when they were walking down James Street. Cas always tried anyway. â€œWhat are you thinking about?â€  â€œIâ€™m thinking itâ€™s going to rain.â€  Cas glanced up. It was severely overcast with storm clouds overhead and the humidity was through the roof. Dean was probably right. â€œYeah probably.â€ He agreed. â€œHey do you want to walk all the way to my house today? I could introduce you to my Father if heâ€™s in. We could hang out.â€  Dean flashed him a little smile. â€œI canâ€™t. Iâ€™ve gotta get home to Sammy.â€  â€˜Sammyâ€™ was Deanâ€™s younger brother thirteen from what Dean had told him and attending Bedwin Junior High. Bedwin was Casparâ€™s affiliated Junior High so if they were around long enough Sammyâ€”Samâ€”would go to Caspar as well. Dean seemed to feel that they wouldnâ€™t be around that long though which wasâ€¦ disappointing. Upsetting even.  Cas was used to moving around himself and in the beginning he had been young and hadnâ€™t known better he had made friends wherever he went and then inevitably had to leave them behind. When he got a little older he started purposefully avoiding making friends so he wouldnâ€™t have to deal with the pain of losing them.  Now at Caspar he had dropped his guard again and even if his father kept his word and they didnâ€™t move again and he was able to stay friends with Charlie Jody and Garth Deanâ€¦ he and his brother were in the same boat as Cas had been in previously. So Cas had gotten to be friends with Dean without even meaning to gotten close to him developed a huge crush on himâ€”though he never let it showâ€”and Dean could be leaving any day. It was only a matter of time really.  Cas had thought that he had hardened himself to the reality of losing friends considering how heâ€™d grown up but the thought of Dean taking off justâ€¦ put a lump in the pit of his stomach. He really had it bad for the older boy had since Day One probably Charlie was right about that much.  But Dean was funny and smart and so attractive so of courseâ€”  Something heavy slammed into Casâ€™s back right at that moment the blow cushioned only by the fact that he was wearing his backpack and Cas yelped out a startled noise even as he tumbled to the ground landing roughly on the hard pavement.  Whatever had crashed into him was still on top of himâ€”a person he thoughtâ€”and scrabbling at him one hand holding him down by the chest while the other grabbed at his hair and shoved his head to the side. Then they lunged forward and bit into his neckâ€”Cas gave a sharp cryâ€”and abruptly Deanâ€™s voice shouted something unintelligible and he yanked the person off flinging them away.  When Cas looked up the person who had attacked him was standing a few feet away wiping at his mouth and spitting. Dean was between him and Cas and had a huge buck knife in one hand (where had that come from?) holding it at the ready. When the stranger stopped gagging and lunged toward Dean Dean braced himself and full-body tackled the man knife flashingâ€”first silver and then redâ€”as he stabbed it into the man over and over again.  After that onslaught though and despite being stabbed several times the stranger wrenched himself away and took off fleeing into the oncoming storm.  Dean stood where he was for a moment heaving before wiping the knife on his jeans and tucking it into the back of his waistband where Cas assumed it had come from to begin with. Then he hurried back over to Cas and crouched down hands hovering uselessly. â€œShit Cas are you okay?â€  Cas brought one hand up to the side of his neck where he had been bitten wiping there before dropping it again to look almost blankly at the blood on his palm. That was about when it started to rain. Dean reached to help him up and together they got Cas back to his feet. He actually didnâ€™t feel too bad all things considered.  Dean was already checking out his neck ignoring the fact that rain was pouring down on them now. â€œIt doesnâ€™t look too bad. It didnâ€™t get you too deep. Couldâ€™ve ripped your throat out youâ€™re lucky.â€  â€œItâ€”whatâ€”he bit meâ€”andâ€”you stabbed him and he didnâ€™t evenâ€”"  â€œCasâ€ Dean looked him in the eye deadly serious and told him firmly â€œthat was a vampire.â€

in fourth grade which caused me to now be fluent. thanks mom.  â€œda vinci code.â€ welp iâ€™m out. donâ€™t know that. sam flips through the pages i look through them noticing something. i think itâ€™s what? mother of dragons?â€ sam asks looking to bobby for answers.  â€œi wish. it says it a few times here. mother of all.â€  â€œwhat the hell does 'mother of allâ€™ mean?â€ dean asks confused as well as all of us.  â€œi donâ€™t know.â€ bobby says looking down.  â€œi canâ€™t believe this.â€ i say getting up and going to the kitchen.  â€œwhat belle?â€ dean asks concerned.  â€œthis is just too crazy. kitchen back to the living room.  â€œwhat do you mean when you die you go there? youâ€™re not a monster.â€ sam says looking at me confused.  â€œnot personally. but literally i guess i am. the perks of June 13 1995 North - East of Joseph Oregon sitting on the West side of a lone mountain a bright fire illuminates the night a womanâ€™s screams are just out of reach to be heard from the town of Joseph.    â€œRun Lexi!! Take your sister and run!!â€ the woman screams to her son crouched down holding his younger sister in his hands. Lexi turns around only to see his mother being dragged into the burning rubble of their former home as she screams in fear. â€œLexi!! Whereâ€™s your mother?â€ a man yells as the fire grows to the trees. Lexi with tears in his eyes turns to his father â€œShe said to runâ€. Fear fills his fathers eyes as he runs to the burning wreckage screaming â€œLAUREN!!â€. No one was the same after what happened that night.   (Itâ€™s a little inspired by spn if Iâ€™m being honest)

post_body: King of my heart  Pairing: Sam Winchester x reader.   Summary: You the queen have lost the love of your life Sir Sam and vow never to fall in love with anyone again.  Bingo: a reputation song - king of my heart .  Genre: Angst and fluff. Au!Royal - 4782 words  Warnings: Grief (I think thatâ€™s all).  A/N: Iâ€™m not fluent in English so a lot of mistakes can happen.  The crowd gathered in the hall looked at you with every new step you took admiring your elegance and your attire. Your head was held high as you walked down the aisle among nobles and commoners ready to take on your responsibilities as queen.   His father the king had died a few weeks before. An unexpected death as he appeared to be in good health. And as his only daughter you were supposed to take over the throne. You werenâ€™t afraid you had been trained and taught to be the ruler of Arcadia since you were a little girl. No one had any doubts that the kingdom would be ruled by a fair queen and everyone looked forward to the future prosperities in store for the kingdom.   You were ready to be queen but you werenâ€™t ready to go your own way without him. If your fatherâ€™s death was unexpected Sir Samâ€™s was even more so. The memories of your fatherâ€™s wake were filled with moments of honor and respect because he had prepared you for this moment but the memories of Sir Samâ€™s wake were covered in tears and anguish because you expected to spend the rest of your life with him. You wanted him to be your best friend your husband and your king.   You grew up together playing and having fun in the halls of the palace. His father Sir John was head of the guard your fatherâ€™s great friend and confidant. The king knew that Sir John raised his children with honor and modesty and thatâ€™s why he let you be so close to Sam. Sam would never disrespect you.   When you were 13 Sam started writing you love letters and you had already told your father that you were interested in marrying him. You were sure that you would never meet anyone like Sam and your love for each other grew every day. Sam admired you; his gaze was so sweet when he looked at you that everyone in the kingdom knew the feelings you both shared.   When Sir John died bravely defending the king in an attack on the enemy kingdom his eldest son Sir Dean took over the role of chief of the guard after which he appointed his brother as your bodyguard making the two of you even closer.   Suddenly however everything you had came to an end the same night your father died. Sir Sam died a mysterious death his body wasnâ€™t found in its entirety only a few limbs. A horrible death. You couldnâ€™t believe that your love had died in such a brutal way and you swore that when the person responsible for this was found justice would be done.   Here you were about to become queen but without the love of your life by your side.   You sat on the throne. You expected to feel ecstatic as soon as you sat on the throne but you couldnâ€™t have been more indifferent at that moment. Scanning the crowd you came across some familiar faces: Sir Dean and Marquis Castiel who smiled at you and curtsied. Looking at Dean you couldnâ€™t help but think of your brother how proud he would be to be part of your coronation but he wasnâ€™t here he never would be.   The archbishop finally took your crown gently and approached you.   â€œMay I present Y/N Queen of Arcadiaâ€ After saying these words the archbishop finally places the crown on your head and you quickly rise from your throne to receive the honors of those present.   â€œGod save the queen!â€œ Some say.   "Long live the queen!â€ Others exclaim.   That day your reign began but your life ended the night your great love was killed. You would never love again.   You had already been queen for two years and the kingdom was more prosperous than ever.   â€œHow are the preparations for my meeting with Duke Singer?â€ You asked your lady-in-waiting Jody duchess and wife of Duke Singer. They both played important roles in your development as queen you always saw them as second parents. The duchess was just finishing putting the tiara on your head and fastening it with clips.   â€œEverything is in order; the duke is waiting for you in your study."   "Dear Jodyâ€ you said turning back to face her â€œdo you know what this conversation is about? Is there something wrong with the affairs of our kingdom? Another rebellion to the south?â€ You were worried because the enemy army insisted on plundering the crops in the south.   â€œYes I know why but Iâ€™d rather my husband told you. Please donâ€™t be anxious Your Majesty. As for the south the enemy army has already been defeated and the people are receiving all the protection they need."   "That comforts me. I must go and meet Duke Singer nowâ€ Jody bowed slightly in reverence.   Ever since Sir Sam was murdered you had asked Sir Dean not to put anyone in his place so you walked alone through the castle corridors as you would normally do in Samâ€™s company. One of the guards waiting in front of your office door bowed to you and then opened the door where you would meet Duke Singer.   â€œYour Majesty Iâ€™m glad to see you. Youâ€™ve been so busy these past few days."   "The kingdom has been demanding a lot of me lately Your Grace. Sometimes I think I wonâ€™t be able to cope with everything on my own but thank heaven I have faithful companions like you to help me."   "Thatâ€™s what I wanted to talk to you about Your Majestyâ€ You were confused Duke Singer wanted to talk to you about his help in the kingdom? Were you making him work too hard? Or was he thinking of offering his services to someone else? Youâ€™d do anything to stop that from happening â€œThe nobles are charging for aâ€¦ marriage."   "That subject again!â€ You exclaimed as you rolled your eyes and turned to leave the room since you werenâ€™t willing to talk about it again.   â€œYour Majesty please listen! Iâ€™m not asking you to forget your love for Sir Sam God rest his soul you of all people know that i thought of him as a son. I could never ask you to stop loving him that wouldnâ€™t be fair."   "Then why do you insist on asking me to marry someone? Sam would be my husband the king of my heart and of this kingdom no one can ever take his place!"   "Queen think about it imagine how many benefits our kingdom will get if you get married. You know that many kingdoms give up doing business with Arcadia when they find out that an unmarried queen rules it."   "They donâ€™t think I can do it but Iâ€™ve already proved in these two years that I can."   "I know you do but think of your people. If you marry a nobleman from another kingdom we can expand our army. Many people and soldiers have already died in the fighting to the south and many more will die if we do nothing. A marriage could be the key to our problems."   "Are you sure about that Your Grace?"   "I would never ask such a thing of Your Majesty if I didnâ€™t have the purest conviction."   "You know I trust you with my eyes closed Bobby. Iâ€™m willing to consider suitors if it means my people will be safe."      â€Royal Proclamation    For the attention of all subjects of the Kingdom of Arcadia   It is with great honor and respect that we announce that Her Royal Majesty Queen Y/n is seeking suitors for holy matrimony.   At this auspicious time the royal court invites all worthy and noble-hearted gentlemen to come forward as potential consorts for our beloved queen.â€œ   Ever since it was announced that you were looking for a husband the offers had been pouring in. Thousands of princes lords counts and dukes had come forward with the intention of obtaining your hand in marriage but none of them had pleased you enough.   You knew that none of these gentlemen would receive your love since you swore that it belonged to only one man and that man unfortunately could not claim the position as your husband. However you were looking for a man you could at least put up with for the rest of your life. With marriage you would have to fulfill your role as a wife but it sickened you to think of lying with any of these noblemen or even giving them children.   You were about to give up when Lord Gavin introduced himself. His lands were a little far away and he had few plantations but what caught your eye was his extensive mining of iron silver and gold and his vast army that possessed the most innovative weapons.   "I know about your painful broken heart Your Majesty. I wonder why you took a sudden interest in meâ€ Gavin questioned as you walked through the garden.   â€œYou know very well what my motives were for giving you the chance to get to know me better."   "My mines and my army of courseâ€ he said smugly. â€œYou know Your Highness I donâ€™t judge you for wanting a marriage of convenience. I too lost the woman I loved and swore never to love anyone again just like Your Majesty."   "You swear? Tell me more.â€ Youâ€™d like to hear Gavin talk about his grief you were hoping to identify with his story and maybe the two of you could make some big agreements based on your feelings.   â€œThereâ€™s not much to tell. I was only a week away from my wedding to her but she suddenly fell ill and passed away soon after.â€ He sighed as he looked at the horizon your gaze followed his and you imagined Samâ€™s eyes when you saw the mixture of the sea contracting with the green moss that covered the mountains you wondered if Gavin also remembered his beloved as he looked at the scene â€œIâ€™ve never felt so much pain it was as if my soul died along with hers. Since then Iâ€™ve never been close to any other woman but when I saw the proclamation saying that Your Majesty was looking for a husband I remembered how similar your story is to mine and your promise never to love another man again. So I thought we could take advantage of this situation."   "And how exactly do you plan to do that Lord? You know that if we get married weâ€™ll have to take on our responsibilities as husband and wife. And it will be impossible to keep our promisesâ€¦"   "People donâ€™t need to know that we havenâ€™t consummated the marriage."   "But what about the children? Iâ€™m sure weâ€™ll be asked about the generation of an heir.â€ You asked feeling repulsed at the thought of begetting a son from him.   â€œMany kingdoms donâ€™t have legitimate heirs these days. Wouldnâ€™t you like to leave the throne to one of Duke and Duchess Singerâ€™s daughters?â€ You immediately thought of Claire and Alex you imagined that Claire would renounce the throne as eldest daughter because she didnâ€™t like the idea of having that kind of obligation she wanted to be free but Alex might love to be queen. Regardless of which of the two assumed the throne the kingdom would be in good hands.   â€œI think you may be right if you wish Iâ€™ll have our wedding announced and Iâ€™ll make sure it happens as soon as possible."   "Iâ€™m happy with your decision Your Majestyâ€ Gavin smiled debauchedly happy that he had managed to convince her. Everything was going according to plan.   After your conversation with Gavin you decided to take a walk by yourself to enjoy the morning sun and think about your decisions. Of course you werenâ€™t happy about getting married to someone other than Sam but this arrangement would be good for both of you and you wouldnâ€™t have to fulfill your role as wife to Gavin. He would just be your sidekick. As you were walking you were startled and two hands stopped you.   â€œSir Dean you scared me!"   "Forgive me Your Majesty. I didnâ€™t mean to."   "You know thereâ€™s no need for formalities Dean. Weâ€™re friends. What do you want?"   "Are you in love with him Y/n?â€ He asked his voice coming out lower than usual.   â€œNo of course not Dean! You know that my heart is and always will be your brother Samâ€™s."   "Forgive me I donâ€™t want you to think Iâ€™m judging you. Sam would like you to move on for this pain in your heart to go away and for you to finally be happy."   "I would be happy if he were here. Butâ€¦ Iâ€™m marrying Gavin itâ€™ll be a marriage of convenience weâ€™ve agreed not to consummate the marriage and we wonâ€™t have heirs Claire or Alex will take the throne andâ€¦"   "Y/n you donâ€™t have to explain yourself to me."   "I just want you to know that no one will ever take Samâ€™s place heâ€™ll always be the love of my life. It was supposed to be him walking me down the aisle."   "Are you asking for my blessing for this marriage to take place?"   "I feel guilty for saying yes to another man before the crown and God I thought if you agreed I would feel better."   "You know that no matter what I say this pain wonâ€™t go awayâ€¦ but if you want to know what I think about this marriage I think it will be good for the kingdom. I learned about the mines and Lordeâ€™s weaponry. We will have a great advantage against the enemy army and we will be able to free the people from so much suffering. Sam will always be in our hearts but now the kingdom needs the queen to take some actionâ€ You agreed Sir Dean was right.   You looked at yourself in the mirror as you tried to hold back the tears in your eyes. Youâ€™ve always dreamed of seeing yourself in white ready to become a wife. Samâ€™s wife. But it wasnâ€™t him you were going to marry tonight and the tears that insisted on welling up in your eyes werenâ€™t of emotion but of sadness. You walked to the safe where you kept all the love letters Sam had written to you.   â€œMy dear Y/n   Today I was admiring the fine silk that the merchant brought for the making of your next ball gown and I couldnâ€™t help but remember how it looked with the softness of your skin. For a moment I was in a reverie remembering our nocturnal caresses. Your body under mine while my hands explored your entire body. My mouth on your breasts while you grabbed my hair and moaned softly so no one could hear soon my mouth was on yours again as I slowly filled you.   I miss nights like this with you my brother asked for reinforcements on the battle line in the South and for a while I had to abandon my post as your bodyguard but I want you to know that I will be by your side again as soon as possible. And we can enjoy our love.   With love your Samâ€   â€œMy dearly beloved princess   I was thinking about the words we said today and for me saying I love you wasnâ€™t enough. Y/n you are the sun that lights up my darkest days bringing lightness and warmth to my heart. I dream about you every night and I always wish to be with you in my arms to love and care for you.   No one in the world will be able to overcome this overwhelming love I feel for you I know we are not old enough to get married yet but I am looking forward to that day. The only certainty I have in life is having you in marriage and becoming yours forever.   With all the love in the world your Samâ€   You didnâ€™t have time to read a few more letters as you were interrupted by Jodyâ€™s presence.   â€œItâ€™s time your majestyâ€ When the duchess investigated your eyes she knew exactly what was going through your head â€” You need to be brave Y/n. Iâ€™m not saying as your lady-in-waiting take this as mother to daughter advice. The deal you got with Lord Gavin was great you wonâ€™t need to break your promise.   â€œI knowâ€¦ I justâ€ You thought about venting and crying into her lap as you grieved over the loss of Sir Sam but there was no time for that â€” Nothing. Should we go.â€œ   Your legs shook as you walked down the red carpet alongside Duke Singer your heart racing with each new step and each new thought that you would soon be Lord Gavinâ€™s wife. However with the shred of courage you had left you raised your head and continued walking.   "We are gathered here to unite in marriage Queen Y/n of Arcadia and Lord Gavin of Hellcrest. Lord Gavin do you accept Queen Y/n as your lawfully wedded wife?"   "Yes I acceptâ€ He replied smiling. Without explanation that smile gave you goosebumps of fear.   â€œMy queen do you accept Lord Gavin as your lawfully wedded husband?"   Tension was in the air; everyone was eager for your answer. You faced the crowd hoping something would happen so you wouldnâ€™t have to marry Lord Gavin but the only thing that could be heard was the sound of rain hitting the ground. Even the heavens were crying. You took a deep breath looked at the archbishop and then at Gavin and finally looked back at the crowd but something caught your attentionâ€¦ someone.   â€œSamâ€ you said softly. Realizing that you had seen him the tall man ran towards the exit but no one seemed to have seen him because when they held your gaze the gentleman had already disappeared into the fog "SAM!â€ You shouted running down the hall while holding up your dress.   â€œMajesty!â€ Duke Bobby ran up to you holding on tightly â€œWhatâ€™s going on?â€   â€œBobby I saw him. Sam is alive!"   "This is impossible!â€ It was Sir Deanâ€™s turn to exclaim â€œI know this is hard for you Y/n but it was probably just a mirage. My brother hasnâ€™t been with us for two years!"   "Please let me go. I swear I saw him. Heâ€™s hereâ€ You tried your best to push away the arms that held you struggling tirelessly against them. These gentlemen should know that nothing can hold a woman in love. You finally managed to escape and ran as fast as you could to try and catch up to your loved one.   The rain and fog obscured your vision but you continued running in the direction where you thought you saw Sam go. Because of the wet ground you slipped but when you were about to fall two strong arms caught you. When you looked down you realized that if he hadnâ€™t restrained you you would have fallen into a huge cliff. You finally looked up and your stomach dropped when you saw Samâ€™s face looking down at you with concern.   â€œI got youâ€ he said as he pulled you closer.   â€œSam my love youâ€™re alive!â€ Your hands went to his face brushing away the wet strands that covered his face. Samâ€™s smile soon appeared on his lips.   â€œIâ€™m right here my princessâ€¦ I mean my queenâ€ Samâ€™s lips quickly met yours his grip tightened on your hair as you lost yourself even more in that kiss. Your hands snaked all over his body to make sure you werenâ€™t dreaming the kiss was long and when it ended you could barely breathe â€œCome on we have to go."   "What? Go where?â€ You looked back and a half dozen men holding torches and swords towards you â€œWhatâ€™s going on?"   "We have to go; I need to keep you safe. Weâ€™ll talk laterâ€ So you started running your feet hurt from the tight shoes but you blindly trusted Sam.   â€œCome on come in!â€ Marquis Castiel was waiting for you two near a carriage â€œQuickly quicklyâ€ You entered the carriage and the door soon closed Marquis Castiel sat down next to the coachman and the vehicle began to move quickly.   You finally had a minute to take a deep breath Sam left you to himself and started placing kisses on your head.   â€œIâ€™m sorry for staying so long for so long and making you believe that I had died. You donâ€™t know how painful it was for me too having to stay away from my loved one for two years."   "Why did you do that Sam?"   "Because I saw who killed your father. It was all Gavinâ€™s big plan. On the night of the kingâ€™s death I saw Gavin attacking him and throwing poison into his mouth it took seconds for your father to die. When I drew my sword to kill Gavin and avenge the kingâ€™s death his henchmen attacked me. There were many of them and there was no other knight around. Until Gavin saw you walking along your balcony and pointed a gun in your direction he said I should go with him or else he would shoot you. He kept me imprisoned for a few days hoping that I would give out any secret information about our kingdom but I certainly didnâ€™t.   "If you managed to escape why didnâ€™t you come back to our home and tell me what was happening?â€ You were confused by so much information.   â€œLord Gavinâ€™s men were already infiltrated in your palace; I couldnâ€™t put your security at risk. I donâ€™t know why it took him so long to put the plan into action but it gave me time to think about how I would stop him. After many weeks of travel I managed to reach the kingdom of Hellcrest and talk to King Crowley. I discovered that Gavinâ€™s rank had been demoted from prince to lord and he had lost the right to the throne because he was against the laws of the kingdom."   The carriage was moving a lot and you got even tighter in Samâ€™s grip.   "The army that insisted on attacking Southern Arcadia was commanded by Gavin. And it began to spread among the nobles that the Queen of Arcadia should soon find a husband. Until the proclamation was published that you were willing to marry. His plan was to marry you and kill you the same way he killed your father on your wedding night."   "He knew exactly how to manipulate me telling me about the woman he had lost that he would never fall in love again and about marriage of convenience. He knew exactly what I needed to hear that I was reluctant about marriage so he proposed a marriage of convenienceâ€ You looked into Samâ€™s eyes â€œSam I never got over you. I promised to never love another manâ€¦"   "I know Y/n. I was aware of everything you were going through during those two years. Dean told me everything."   "He knew?â€ Sam casually. Dean had nicely mentioned it to you â€œSo him giving the wedding his blessing was part of your plan?"   "Yes. I told all my discoveries to King Crowley who was disappointed with his sonâ€™s new attitudes so he made himself available to help. I came to Arcadia along with Hellcrestâ€™s army to stop Gavin."   "Whatâ€™s going on in the palace right now?"   "King Crowleyâ€™s soldiers are fighting Gavinâ€™s men."   "Sam I canâ€™t let my people be in danger! We need to go back there. I canâ€™t run away while people die."   "My queen I assure you that everything is under control. Gavin must already be dead or imprisoned and his men must have already surrendered. Everything is fine I promise."   "So now we can live our love?"   "I now pronounce you man and wife!â€ Samâ€™s lips brushed against his with delicacy and passion. Married.  â€œI will always be yours my queenâ€ Sam said as he looked into her eyes.  â€œYou will forever be the king of my heart.â€

post_body: Breaking Free: Chapter 5- Falling Into You Pairings: AU! Mechanic Dean x Reader  Chapter Summary: First day of living with Dean everything is going perfect.  Warnings: SMUT! Watch yourself only 18+  Series Masterlist here!! & Main masterlist here!  <!-- more --> Today was my first day living with Dean and I felt both excited and nervous.   After he helped me settle in and showed me around his cozy apartmentâ€”a place that was quickly starting to feel like homeâ€”he had to go back to work. It wasnâ€™t a big place but it had two bedrooms and a nice balcony with a view of the town. The walls were a calming grey colour decorated with art and photos that made it feel warm and inviting.  Even though I was happy to be with Dean I couldnâ€™t shake the fear from past relationships. I was used to feeling like I always messed up or disappointed my partner. This fear made me worry that I might do something to upset Dean or ruin our relationship especially since it was so early.  Deep down I knew Dean was differentâ€”he was kind patient and understandingâ€”but old fears still haunted me.  I spent the day searching job opportunities in the town over it was a little bit of a drive but I knew if I wanted to stay here I needed to have a source of income.  I checked the time and my heart pounded in my chest Dean was due to come home in an hour and panic set in as I realized I hadnâ€™t even started dinnerâ€”a routine Andrew used to expect every night. But with Dean it was different. I wasnâ€™t sure what he liked or disliked which only added to my anxiety.  I grabbed my phone and dialed his number the ringing making my nerves worse until he finally answered.  â€œHey sweetheart how are you doing?â€ Deanâ€™s voice was strong comfort.  â€œIâ€™m good. Iâ€™m so sorry I forgot to ask what you wanted for dinner tonightâ€ I admitted guiltily.  Dean chuckled softly. â€œYou donâ€™t need to make anything. Itâ€™s been a long day so I can pick something up for us on the way home.â€  â€œOh okay. As long as youâ€™re sure youâ€™re okay with thatâ€¦â€ I hesitated needing reassurance.  Dean paused his tone gentle yet firm. â€œAs long as we are okay with that Y/N. Are you okay with that?â€  His concern touched me and I smiled biting my lip. â€œYeah I am. I canâ€™t wait to see you.â€  â€œSame here sweetheart. See you soon.â€  I hung up and headed to the bedroom to grab some clothes eager to shower. Supernaturalâ€™s My Bloody Valentine  but itâ€™s high school drama  Imagine this:   Itâ€™s valentineâ€™s day and Samâ€™s baffled that his usually flirty charming and outgoing big brother is suddenly so closed off about it. Whatâ€™s more interesting though is the amount of ugly breakups happening around school just days before Valentineâ€™s.   Dean finding it suspicious takes the investigation as an excuse to bottle up some repressed feelings about the day. Whateverâ€™s going on itâ€™s about to go down today  <!-- more --> So the investigation begins as the two brother try to find the source of these nasty love quarrels. Just remember who can still kick your asses in this doll face.â€     Sam was still giggling on the floor trying to catch his breath from laughing too hard. He wiped away the tears from his eyes and tried to get himself together. â€œSeriously man youâ€™re like a Ken Doll come to life.â€     The creaking of the front door opening caused them all to freeze in place eye wide with fear when in walked their fathers F/N L/N and John Winchester. I recently started watching supernatural again and couldnâ€™t help myself anyway ENJOY!!! ğŸ’•âœ¨      It was an unusually slow night at the bar with only a handful of patrons scattered about nursing their drinks and chatting quietly. As the door swung open the barâ€™s calm atmosphere was shattered and my gaze was drawn to the trio like a magnet. The two men their suits a stark contrast to the casual attire of the other patrons exuded an air of confidence and authority. The taller man with his long hair and chiseled features seemed to embody the phrase â€œtall dark and handsomeâ€ while his companion sporting a Tex-turned-crew cut appeared more rugged and rough around the edges. The young woman dressed in a fitted dress that accentuated her curves trailed behind them with an air of quiet compliance. As they approached the bar their eyes scanned the room with an unspoken understanding as if they were on a mission.     My gave warm and welcoming smile before I asked â€œWhat can I get ya?â€ My hands moved on their own quickly whipping up a tequila shot and pushing it forward to the shorter man. His smirk was a mixture of amusement and mischief and I felt a shiver run down my spine as our eyes met.     â€œIâ€™ll take a whiskey on the rocks.â€ He shot me a quick wink before slamming the empty shot glass down on its rim. I nodded grabbing a cup and filling it with ice before looking to the taller one.     As I poured the whiskey with a gentle flourish I turned to him with a sly smile my fingers drumming a tantalizing rhythm on the counter. â€œAnd what about you?â€ I purred my voice husky as I raised an eyebrow my free hand resting suggestively on my hip hoping my tight fitted clothes would draw him in closer. He gave me a slight uncomfortable look before glancing at their female companion who stood between them not exactly paying attention to me. I kept my flirtatious smile up but deep own I was hurt and taken aback by the look he gave me. Something was off with this one it only seemed to make me want him more. Iâ€™ll just have to up my game.     With a courteous tone â€œIâ€™ll just have a draftâ€ his eyebrows arching slightly as he did so his lips compressing into a subtle line. My eyes locked onto his my mind whirling with tantalizing thoughts as I looked him over again. I couldnâ€™t help but bite my lip my thoughts conjuring up images of him in a different light â€“ one that left me trembling with anticipation and my heart racing with excitement. My hand reached under the bar slightly bent over knowing my breast will definitely catch his interest. With a quick pull slightly bouncing I pop the bottle cap off and placed it in front of him. His gaze averted me before he turned around once more scanning the bar. I hid my frown turning to the petite woman but before my lips even parted she spoke up.       â€œIâ€™ll take a shot whatever you preferâ€ she said her voice as smooth as honey yet devoid of any warmth or flirtation. Her words hung in the air and I noticed her gaze linger on me waiting for a response. Without thinking I crafted a buttery nipple and slid it across the bar to her. Dean rolled his eyes at Bobbyâ€™s comment trying to play it cool despite the embarrassment. Just remember who can still kick your asses in this doll face.â€     Sam was still giggling on the floor trying to catch his breath from laughing too hard. He wiped away the tears from his eyes and tried to get himself together. â€œSeriously man youâ€™re like a Ken Doll come to life.â€     The creaking of the front door opening caused them all to freeze in place eye wide with fear when in walked their fathers F/N L/N and John Winchester.     Their fathers stood in the doorway staring at the spectacle before them. There was silence in the room as both men took in the scene before them.
